Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience using design systems.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Master's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science or a related field.
  • Experience in designing usable web-based interfaces, with experience in HTML.
  • Knowledge of JavaScript for rapid prototyping purposes, and excellent visual design sense.
  • Excellent leadership, communication and teamwork skills.


About The Job

Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. The job of an Interaction Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In an Interaction Designer role, you’ll take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the world—from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. Achieving this goal requires collaboration with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.

As an Interaction Designer, you will help to define experiences for strategic Google Cloud initiatives. We aim to enable people and organizations around the world to use the same robust infrastructure that powers Google’s own products.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

Responsibilities
  • Gain a deep understanding of Google Cloud Platform products, technologies, user motivations, market opportunities and competition.
  • Work with Product Management, Engineering and other Design teams to define the user experience for new and existing Google Compute Engine and Google Cloud Functions features.
  • Translate complex technical and business requirements into usable and powerful products. Create designs, including user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes, and communicate design intent to both internal and external teams.
  • Work with Researchers, Product Managers and Engineers in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
  • Communicate design vision, rationalize and justify decisions and advocate for users’ needs.

At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

Please include URLs for an online portfolio in addition to your resume in English. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered.

  • Excellent leadership, communication and teamwork skills.

Opieka nad sprawnym funkcjonowaniem biura i wsparcie procesów administracyjnych w naszym warszawskim biurze.

Wynagrodzenie
wynagrodzenie uzależnione od doświadczenia (UoP) lub (B2B)

Biuro j-labs (Warszawa, Aleja Armii Ludowej)

Twoje zadania
  • opieka nad recepcją
  • obsługa połączeń telefonicznych oraz ogólnych skrzynek mailowych
  • zarządzanie korespondencją przychodzącą i wychodzącą oraz przesyłkami kurierskimi
  • kontrola i nadzór nad zaopatrzeniem
  • odpowiedzialność za sprawne funkcjonowanie biura
  • udzielanie odpowiedzi na zapytania administracyjne
  • pierwsza linia kontaktu – wsparcie backoffice oddziału warszawskiego
  • współpraca z dostawcami usług
  • koordynacja i wsparcie w organizacji firmowych eventów, współpraca z firmą cateringową
  • pomoc przy organizacji eventów dla pracowników oddziału warszawskiego
Oczekujemy
  • dobrej organizacji czasu pracy
  • dokładności, rzetelności, zaangażowania w realizowane zadania
  • komunikatywności
  • łatwości w nawiązywaniu kontaktów
  • nastawienia na poszukiwanie rozwiązań i wsparcia biznesu
  • mile widziane zainteresowanie branżą HR
  • dobrej znajomości języka angielskiego
Dlaczego warto?
  • dostajesz dużą samodzielność i odpowiedzialność w codziennej pracy
  • możesz brać udział w wewnętrznych workshopach technicznych i “miękkich”
  • działamy zgodnie z ideą rekrutacji relacyjnej i dbamy o dobry candidate experience – stawiamy na wysoką jakość!
  • dajemy przestrzeń do proponowania i wdrażania pomysłów i inicjatyw
  • mamy elastyczny czas pracy i częściową pracę zdalną
  • o pozostałych fajnych rzeczach jakie robimy, przeczytasz na innych zakładkach naszej strony!
Ty wybierasz jak współpracujemy

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. We offer a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA has more than 65,000+ employees worldwide.

For our Warsaw-based Direct Marketing team, we are currently searching for a responsible and creative

Project Coordinator

Responsibilites
  • maintaining effective working relationships with clients
  • coordinating works of internal and external subcontractors (direct mail, internet projects, telemarketing and others)
  • skillful management of many projects at the same time, within the established time frames
  • meeting tight deadlines, following internal procedures, preparing reports.

Requirements
  • Master’s/Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent)
  • highly developed organizational skills
  • being a good team player;
  • IT literate i.e. MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel
  • good knowledge of English
  • attention to detail
  • previous experience in marketing department will be an asset

We Offer
  • stable employment based on an employment contract;
  • development opportunities at work for an international organization that is a market leader in services for the pharmaceutical sector
  • positive work environment;
  • attractive benefits package.

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

  • meeting tight deadlines, following internal procedures, preparing reports.

Requirements
  • Master’s/Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent)
  • highly developed organizational skills
  • being a good team player;
  • IT literate i.e. MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel
  • good knowledge of English
  • attention to detail
  • previous experience in marketing department will be an asset

We Offer
  • stable employment based on an employment contract;
  • development opportunities at work for an international organization that is a market leader in services for the pharmaceutical sector
  • positive work environment;
  • attractive benefits package.

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

General information

Organisation Egis is a major international group in the construction engineering and mobility services sectors whose unique global service range encompasses infrastructure consulting, engineering and operation. Through our capacity for innovation, we respond to the climate emergency and to the greatest challenges of our time by offering solutions and acknowledged know-how in the areas of transportation and mobility, sustainable city construction, buildings, water, the environment and energy. https://www.egis-group.com

Position description Job title
European Office Manager
Contract type
Permanent contract

Job Description

The position’s holder is responsible towards compliance with the three Codes of Ethics, Integrity and Human Resources Management Code, internal rules, all local regulations and Health & Safety rules that apply in for the BU MENS (Maintenance, Exploitation & News Services) activities.

For the perimeter of Easytrip Transport Services, you are responsible of all matters regarding office management across Europe. You ensure the smooth running of our offices on a day-to-day basis and manage functionally a team of office supervisors based in our different sites.

Your main responsibilities is to ensure that our office supervisors manage the following operations in an efficient way and as per the procedures of Easytrip. For Poland, you will directly be in charge of these activities with the support of the local office supervisor, liaising with staff, suppliers and clients.

  • implementing and maintaining procedures/office administrative systems through our local offices:
    • definition & deployment of common practices, all internal processes related to office management (administrative procedures, inventory control);
    • ensuring that health and safety policies are up to date
    • Defining and sustaining company culture, norms and standards
  • In line with management, implement all the administrative activities that facilitate the smooth running for all local offices :
    • finding local suppliers or correspondents for business requirement;
    • organizing meetings, company events or conferences;
    • dealing with correspondence, complaints and queries;
    • booking transport and accommodation, ordering stationery and furniture;
  • ensure the quality performance control to maintain the ISO standard
    • Liaison and support of performance management: collect, write down operational processes to prepare for ISO certification;
    • Internal efficiency including process design, management and coordination;
  • manage local Office Supervisors and ensure they handle with administrative processes
  • regular reporting / updates to Chief Finance Officer.
  • manage office budgets; management and control of local offices cost;
  • coordinate interactions with our network of bookkeepers or local administrations (business, tax and fiscal authorities namely), initiating and following-up on any needed request to local authorities and law firms for the purpose of the proper governance and operations of Easytrip across Europe
  • Support to business :
  • control and manage the proper and consistent contract documents in all countries;
  • support to Credit control activities (amicable settlement, arbitration, lawsuit, liquidations…)

    • Only for Poland sites, ensure an administrative support to the HR Business Partner (based in another site in Europe) :
  • supervise payrolls & preparing employee contracts;
  • keep personnel records up to date (holidays,...) ;
  • sourcetalents & arranging job interviews ;
  • induction programmes for new employees;
  • point of contact...

    • Profile

    • Bachelor degree in administration or legal
      3 years’ related experience
    • Confidentiality and discretion
    • Communication skills
    • Customer service oriented
    • Organizational skills
    • Detail-oriented, organized and accurate
    • In depth working knowledge of office applications, especially MS Excel (pivot tables)
    • Englishlanguage : verbal and written
    • other desirable languages: French or other European language skills would be also appreciated

    Position localisation Job location
    Europe, Poland
    City
    Warsaw

    Candidate Criteria Minimum Level Of Education Required

    4-Bachelor of Arts / Bachelor of Science

    Minimum Level Of Experience Required

    2-5 years
    Languages

    • English (4- Advanced)
    • Polish (6- Native language)

We have new opportunity for Nurses!

Our Medication Delivery Solutions Business Unit (syringes, needles, cannulas) is looking for Clinical Specialist.


As Clinical Specialist you will be responsible for kujawsko-pomorskie, wielkopolskie, lubuskie, zachodniopomorskie, pomorskie and warmińsko-mazurskie voivodships.


As Clinical Specialist you will:


  • Support sales team in sales process/promotion of selected products in accordance with applicable sales and marketing strategy
  • Build business relationships within hospital accounts with key clinicians and opinion leaders
  • Attend meetings, conferences, and exhibitions to promote company image and selected range of products
  • Promote and deliver effective and efficient product training and application to the training and educational functions within hospitals and relevant professional bodies and associations


We expect that you have:


  • Nursing education is a must (at least bachelor)
  • At least 5 years of nursing background (essential), preferably in hospital or outpatient clinic
  • Experience in medical devices sector as Sales Representative - preferably
  • Experience in running training and education programs/seminars
  • An understanding of the Health Care Industry, key drivers and influencer
  • Basic understanding of tendering process on the hospital level
  • Fluency in English (spoken and written), Polish as mother tongue
  • High ethical values
  • Prepared for frequent travel (90%) within Poland
  • Driving license
  • MS Office literate, able to work with web based and mobile applications


You can look forward to working in an international company, first-in-class in its business area, great benefit package (e.g. health insurance, medical care, lunch vouchers, sport /entertainment bonus), friendly work environment and healthy oriented culture (healthy food, sport activities, participation in pro-health actions and events, charity initiatives). You might expect to work in new, modern offices in the city center developed to work and live healthy lives and competitive compensation and motivation system as it is a great opportunity for professional growth - challenging and rewarding work with a dynamic, international team.


Interested in a career with BD, but this position doesn’t fit your skills and experience? Join our external EMEA Talent Community here: emea.jobs.bd.com

Please be informed that we have moved our services to remote work until further notice. Both recruitment and onboarding processes will be managed remotely.


About us:

Telemedico is one of the global leaders in telemedicine business, working with the biggest global insurance and assistance companies. Currently operating in 7 languages, Telemedico is planning to expand rapidly into new geographies and product lines and has an ambition to become #1 global telemedicine provider.



Your role

The main goal of this role is to help in scaling product development and ensure that the technology is operating as intended and evolving in lockstep with the business. To do this you need to be able to partner with business stakeholders to understand their business objectives and develop a technology strategy to support those goals.



Your team

You will look after a team of 20+ members (back-end developers, front-end developers, mobile developers, QA team and PM team). Part of your team operates remotely on a daily basis (of course at the moment the whole company does).

Tech stack: /PHP Symfony, Bitbucket, Jira; mobile: iOS, Android.



Your responsibilities:

  • developing technical aspects of the company’s strategy to ensure alignment with its business goals,
  • working collaboratively with product and engineering teams on the development of new products, enhancements and redesigns,
  • ensuring coordinated, responsive IT delivery mechanism to meet business and customers needs,
  • leading and managing the whole IT function.



Your expertise:

  • a Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer information systems or related field of study,
  • expertise in software development practices, including agile and devops,
  • proven track record in building and leading engaged and high performing technical teams,
  • hands-on experience with complex project management,
  • experience of working in a relevant role for a SaaS company is highly desirable,
  • fluent Polish and English speaker.



You profile:

  • reliable and self-motivated,
  • strong leadership skills,
  • able to manage and drive multiple projects,
  • flexible and adaptable.



Why us?

  • You will contribute to revolutionizing the medical services industry.
  • You will cooperate with entrepreneurs and executives with proven professional track record.
  • You will participate in development opportunities within rapid growth of the company.
  • You will have salary based on experience and achieved KPIs.
  • You will have unlimited access to consultations with Telemedi.co doctors.

Please be informed that we have moved our services to remote work until further notice. Both recruitment and onboarding processes will be managed remotely.

About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. Founded in 2011 and with over 4 million clients, Kraken is one of the world's largest, most successful bitcoin exchanges and we're growing faster than ever. Our range of successful products are playing an important role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We attract people who constantly push themselves to think differently and chart exciting new paths in a rapidly growing industry. Kraken is a diverse group of dreamers and doers who see value in being radically transparent. Let's change the way the world thinks about money! Join the revolution!

About Kraken

Kraken is one of the largest and most successful bitcoin exchanges in the world and we’re growing faster than ever. We’re looking for people who constantly push themselves to think differently and chart exciting new paths in a rapidly growing industry. Kraken is a diverse group of dreamers and doers, we truly believe our success depends on having both in spades. Join us and the movement to change the way the world thinks about money.

Learn More About Us

Read our reviews on Glassdoor

Follow us on Twitter

Catch up on our blog

About The Role

Kraken is expanding our rapidly growing compliance team comprised of talented and motivated individuals. We are looking for a capable compliance associate to join the team of motivated financial/technology professionals and work with our teams worldwide, and be part of the expert global compliance group.

Kraken is looking for an experienced Compliance EDD Associate with the demonstrated ability to conduct customer risk assessments and monitoring of high-risk customers. The ideal candidate will possess excellent oral and written communication skills. They should have experience with international know your customer (KYC) requirements, customer onboarding, and customer risk assessments.

The ideal candidate will be self-motivated with a strong background in international compliance standards. The candidate should be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and be able to communicate effectively between multiple teams in the organization.

Committed to the values of teamwork, integrity, and innovation.

What You'll Do
  • Represent the company as a professional AML/CTF compliance expert with all parties, internal and external
  • Act as a subject matter expert (SME) and provide support for Client Engagement teams on Compliance related issues
  • Manage various inboxes and provide timely responses to all stakeholders
  • Consistently make appropriate decisions regarding potential sanctions and watchlist matches with accurate documentation of analysis and escalation to appropriate parties when necessary
  • Perform due diligence/enhanced due diligence on customers, partners, vendors as required
  • Develop and maintain periodic reports for various business functions
  • Communicate effectively to coordinate cross-functional projects
  • Identify and develop workflow efficiencies
  • Draft policies/procedure updates, when/if required
  • Respond to customer complaints, when/if required
  • Respond to 314(b) inquiries, when/if required

Who You Are
  • Four-year degree or equivalent experience
  • 1-3 years’ experience in a compliance role at a financial institution or equivalent
  • CAMS certification preferred
  • Extensive knowledge of AML high risk entity types and required documentation
  • Knowledge of international know your customer requirements
  • Familiar with international sanctions and/or various government watchlists
  • The ability to act independently in analyzing a customer’s risk and capably and effectively research compliance regulations
  • Excellent analytical/problem solving, verbal and written communication, and organization skills
  • The ability to balance competing priorities on a daily basis
  • Proficient in Microsoft excel
  • Attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills
  • Ability to take ownership of work product and consistently deliver results
  • Adaptability to global business needs
  • Ability to work in a rapidly changing regulatory environment
We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique backgrounds and experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives.

Check out all our open roles at https://jobs.lever.co/kraken. We’re excited to see what you’re made of.

Join us as a Data Scientist

  • You’ll be identifying and working with large, complex data sets to solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed
  • We’ll look to you to actively participate in the data community to identify and deliver opportunities to support the bank’s strategic direction through better use of data
  • This is an opportunity to achieve excellent exposure in an challenging role and to make a real impact with your work

What you'll do

As a Data Scientist, you’ll be evaluating and improving business processes and products using scientific rigor and statistical methods. You’ll be supporting and collaborating with multi-disciplinary teams of data engineers and analysts on a wide range of business problems including the prevention of financial crime, understanding customer interactions with the bank and the management of credit risk.

You’ll also be:

  • Developing and deepening your knowledge of data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for product development
  • Communicating effectively across the functions and franchises to make business recommendations, gaining business buy-in to solutions tailored to customers need
  • Conducting analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification in collaboration with business stakeholders
  • Iteratively building and prototyping data analysis pipelines to provide insights that will ultimately lead to production deployment
  • Identifying new methods, tools, techniques and opportunities to deliver business value via cost reduction, income generation or improved customer experience through the application of data science

The skills you'll need

To succeed in this role, you’ll need evidence of previous project implementation and work experience gained in data analysis related field as part of a multidisciplinary team. Additionally, you’ll hold a degree in a quantitative discipline or have evidence of equivalent practical experience.

You’ll also demonstrate:

  • Experience with statistical software, database languages, big data technologies and cloud environments
  • Experience articulating and translating business questions and using statistical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data
  • The ability to demonstrate leadership, self-direction and a willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills and the ability to adapt the communication style to a specific audience
  • Extensive relevant work experience, including expertise with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models and sampling methods

  • We’ll look to you to actively participate in the data community to identify and deliver opportunities to support the bank’s strategic direction through better use of data

  • Extensive relevant work experience, including expertise with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models and sampling methods

Background

The OSCE has a comprehensive approach to security that encompasses politico-military, economic and environmental, and human aspects. It therefore addresses a wide range of security-related concerns, including arms control, confidence- and security-building measures, human rights, national minorities, democratization, policing strategies, counter-terrorism and economic and environmental activities. All 57 participating States enjoy equal status, and decisions are taken by consensus on a politically, but not legally binding basis.

The Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR) is the principal institution of the OSCE responsible for the human dimension. ODIHR is active throughout the OSCE area in the fields of election observation, democratic institutions and processes, human rights, tolerance and non-discrimination, and Roma and Sinti issues. ODIHR's assistance projects and other activities are implemented in participating States in accordance with ODIHR's mandate.

The Information Technology Unit provides support to ODIHR in the field of Information and Communication Technology, including information systems for technical programmes and management. It is responsible for planning, developing and implementing an ICT strategy, for setting and enforcing common ICT standards and for supporting local ICT serves and their users.

Tasks And Responsibilities

Under the direct supervision of the Second Deputy Director, the incumbent performs the following functions:
  • Managing the IT Infrastructure operations (systems, LAN/WAN, Helpdesk), business application systems, telecommunications, systems security, systems administration, user support for about 200 staff members, and limited systems support and development;
  • Preparing budgets, projections for ICT spending and ICT and Business Applications strategy and policies; monitoring the budget and procurement requirements of the Unit to ensure optimal planning and use of financial resources;
  • Managing hardware and software standards, planning capacity, evaluating and selecting the most appropriate and cost-effective hardware and networking infrastructure;
  • Providing recommendations for the development and management of business applications, information, resources, and technology to support the organization’s strategic goals and priorities;
  • Providing ICT guidance and support for ODIHRs field activities, observation missions, conferences, projects and tools for external customers, Coordinate together with the business units the design, implementation and continuous development of IT-tools and methodologies necessary to support the implementation of their mandate;
  • Making presentations to higher level management on ICT strategy, budget and related activities and advising and assisting Senior Management on the application of Information Technology services as a cost effective tool;
  • Providing leadership and managing the staff of the Unit to ensure the timely delivery of outputs and the availability of the right skills and competencies; monitoring staff performance and carry out performance appraisals, managing the continuous update and skills training for staff, particularly in relation to new ICT technologies and Applications developments, coordinating related work assignments and resource allocation;
  • Performing other duties as assigned.
For more detailed information on the structure and work of the OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights, please see https://www.osce.org/odihr.

Necessary Qualifications
  • First-level university degree in Computer Science or equivalent course of study; formal certification in ITIL and Project Management;
  • A minimum of six years of progressively responsible professional experience in the ICT area; managerial and versatile technical experience; experience of working for an international corporation or organization.
  • Excellent knowledge of English with highly-developed presentation and writing skills is essential; working knowledge of other OSCE languages is an asset;
  • Ability to work with people with different national, religious or cultural backgrounds.
  • Demonstrated gender awareness and sensitivity, and an ability to integrate a gender perspective into tasks and activities.

For our EMEA Global Sourcing Team we are currently looking for a Travel&Expense Administrator.


Location: Warsaw, Poland

 


The role is required to globally support corporate program improvement projects that enhance efficiencies, improve compliance, and provide savings opportunities. It includes also the support of administration of Corporate Programs (Travel Expenses and P-Card program), while building positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


Main Responsibilities:
• Contact with internal customers to provide assistance in issue resolution,
• Maintenance of platforms by data entry and management,
• Preparation of monthly and ad-hoc reporting and compliance analysis of the data,
• Providing ongoing training to internal stakeholders about proper ways of working,
• Direct low dollar PO and Non-PO spend to P-cards through stakeholder engagement & training,
• Identify opportunities to improve usage and spend through corporate travel platform,
• Negotiate with key hotels for best rates in high traveled to cities.


The Individual:
• University degree or proven track of relevant experience,
• Preferred: 3-5 years of experience on travel and expense processes in a multi-country environment
• Very good written and verbal communication in English (min. B2)
• Good organizational skills, with a "can-do" attitude
• Computer and data entry skills (Microsoft Office)
• Knowledge of Concur and Egencia platforms would be an asset
• Good view at handling complexity, problem solving and working close to deadlines
• Excellent communication and analytical skills
• Customer Service Focus and Process Orientation
• Flexible to take on new challenges


We offer:
• Possibility to grow and gain knowledge in the Global Sourcing Operations area in stable, multinational environment,
• Competitive benefits package (Medicover, Multisport and more),
• Home Office policy,
• Company meetings and events every few months,
• Fruits and massages in the office

Twoje zadania:


  • Implementacja automatycznych testów funkcjonalnych (java, JUnit, Selenium)
  • Implementacja automatycznych testów API (java, Spock, SoapUI)
  • Automatyzacja tworzenia danych testowych
  • Tworzenie i utrzymanie przypadków testowych dotyczących zakresu testów automatycznych
  • Monitorowanie wykonania testów automatycznych, raportowanie wyników przeprowadzonych testów


Nasze oczekiwania:


  • Minimum 2 lata doświadczenia w pracy na podobnym stanowisku
  • Doświadczenie w automatyzacji testów funkcjonalnych oraz znajomość dobrych praktyk programowania testów
  • Znajomość języków programowania i bibliotek: java, Selenium, JUnit, SQL
  • Znajomość narzędzi Jira, SoapUI/Postman, znajomość systemu kontroli wersji GIT. Mile widziana znajomość Jenkinsa na poziomie umożliwiającym tworzenie i uruchamianie jobów związanych z testami automatcznymi
  • Doświadczenie w sporządzaniu dokumentacji testowej (przypadki testowe, raporty z testów)
  • Samodzielność, bardzo dobra organizacji czasu pracy, nastawienie na cel i jakość
  • Komunikatywność i umiejętność pracy w zespole
  • Umiejętności analitycznego myślenia
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie umożliwiającym czytanie dokumentacji technicznej


Twoje korzyści:


  • Zatrudnienie w oparciu o umowę o pracę lub B2B
  • Możliwość zdobywania wiedzy od najlepszych specjalistów IT
  • Dużą samodzielność w działaniu
  • Udział w projektach Generali w roli Testera Automatyzującego
  • Pracę z nowymi technologiami, wpływ na strategię i standardy automatyzacji testów w organizacji
  • Pakiet benefitów (prywatna opieka medyczna, grupowe ubezpieczenie na życie, zniżki na produkty Generali)
  • Program „Bądź w Formie z Generali” – karty sportowe
  • Lekcje języka angielskiego bezpłatne i na miejscu
  • Podnoszenie kompetencji poprzez udział w szkoleniach

Francuski – Warszawa

wspieranie użytkowników laptopów i drukarek (koordynowanie dostaw, zwrotów, sprawdzanie statusu naprawy)

WARSZAWA

Wynagrodzenie: około 4600 zł brutto

umowa o pracę

Praca w godzinach 8-18 od poniedziałku do piątku (dowolne 8 godzin – pełen etat)

NIE WYMAGAMY DOŚWIADCZENIA

Benefity i system motywacyjny, kursy, kartę Multisportu

whole_unnormalized_body:
We seek outstanding, highly motivated candidates interested in developing their PhD in the area of data science oriented modern optimization - theory and solution methods.

We Offer
  • three years PhD program hosted by excellent research institution;
  • secondments in renowned academic and industrial partner institutions;
  • generous ESR salaries;
  • ESR individual carrier development plan;
  • scientific quality assessment by appropriate dissemination of individual research results (conferences, schools, workshops, journal papers);
The Project - TraDE-OPT (MSCA-ITN Project) - Features
  • research program focused on data science oriented modern optimization, exploitation of data structure, decomposition and parallelization strategies, randomized and incremental strategies;
  • innovative training program giving a solid mathematical background in optimization and data driven modelling;
  • hands-on experience in real-world challenges and software thanks to close integration of industrial partners (Designers(PL), GOM(DE)).
The Work To Be Carried Out In The Framework Of The Optimization Group At Systems Research Institute, Polish Academy Of Sciences With
  • worldwide acknowledged scientific achievements, strong interests in real-world applications;
  • friendly and collaborative atmosphere for the fulfilment of research goals;
  • location in Warsaw, a dynamic and vibrant city which offers aboundant 24h opportunities for leisure time, culture, music, restaurants, etc;
Company Name: Systems Research Institute, Polish Academy of Sciences

whole_unnormalized_body:
Company Description

At EcoVadis, we envision a global marketplace where sustainability intelligence influences every business decision – improving economies, people's lives and the planet we all depend on. EcoVadis counts industry leaders like Johnson & Johnson, L’Oréal, Nestlé, and Michelin, among the 55,000+ businesses on its network.

With an ambitious, purposeful mission to provide the world's most trusted business sustainability ratings, EcoVadis is driven by a diverse team sharing the core values of commitment, customer-focus, courage, integrity, kindness and happiness.

EcoVadis offers you exciting career opportunities in an innovative and dynamic environment. We are looking for passionate team players from a variety of disciplines – from CSR and sustainability experts to customer engagement and engineering talents – to join us to make a real impact on the environmental and social practices of companies worldwide.

Join us!

Job Description

To fuel our expansion and drive deep relationships with our customers, we are seeking an experienced UX Copywriter & Content Strategist to join our Product Management team. This role will be responsible for managing, copywriting and proofing product content, working closely with designers and engineering teams to deliver the best customer experience.

What You Will Be Doing
  • Write, coordinate and proofread all product content (including platform copy, translactional emails, product documentation and guidance, release notes, demos & training materials…)
  • Partner with UX designers, product managers, functional teams and internal business stakeholders to define user experience for new/updated features and functionality
  • Help develop interactions with customers to better understand user needs and feed the roadmap with customers insights
  • Define content requirements and strategy to support product adoption
  • Standardize product messaging to ensure content accuracy, consistency and excellence
  • Create referential for wording
  • Check all content to identify and correct any spelling grammar, punctuation, styling and consistency errors
  • Develop and maintain a strong knowledge and understanding of our product and available documentation
  • Work closely with localization and translation coordinators
Qualifications
  • Bachelor or Masters degree in English, Marketing, Communications.
  • A minimum of 3 years of experience as an editor for digital content.
  • You are an English native or bilingual English (additional languages a significant plus).
  • You have excellent written and editorial skills.
  • You are a stickler for perfect grammar and have meticulous attention to detail.
  • You are able to provide accessible, easy-to-understand, actionable and shareable content for end users.
  • You are comfortable running multiple projects from brief level through to completion.
  • You have a sensibility for design and user experience.
  • You are a digital native, comfortable with tools and channels used for B2B.
  • You are a self-starter and independent, while still able to excel when working with others across functional teams.

Additional Information

Beginning: ASAP

Location: Warsaw, Poland - Rondo ONZ, Spektrum Tower,

In Return For Your Expertise And Energy, We Offer
  • Challenge, opportunities to exchange skills within multinational Team
  • Ability to work in an autonomous way and in an environment where your ideas are valued
  • Casual and very friendly atmosphere
  • Competitive salary aligned with experience
  • Training
  • Flexi-time and home office
  • Benefits (covered or co-financed): Health care, Multisport card, Life insurance,
  • French and Polish classes
For more information about EcoVadis please visit our site: www.ecovadis.com

EcoVadis does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected category.

whole_unnormalized_body:
As a global provider of drug development solutions, our work is serious business. But that doesn't mean you can't have fun while you do it. With our vision to be the partner of choice in drug development, we hire only the best and brightest in the industry. Are you one of them?

The Role
  • Become familiar with ICON's SOPs/WPs, ICH GCP guidelines, appropriate regulations, ICON systems and the principles of and assist with investigator recruitment
  • Maintain timelines and ensure accuracy and completeness of data entered into ICON systems
  • Serve as the primary in-house contact for sites and investigators participating in studies
  • Conduct and completes remote site management activities, with support as needed, according to applicable SOPS and the Study Monitoring Plan.
  • To contact Clinical sites for specific requests (e.g. enrolment updates, missing documentation, data entry timeliness, data query follow-up, CDA finding follow-up, and action Item resolution or other sponsor specific CRA tasks.
  • Take responsibility for project tasks and sees these tasks through to successful completion, with support.
  • Maintain a professional interpersonal relationship with study team, sites, and Sponsors
  • Participate in QA Audits as needed.
  • Regularly attend and gives to project specific and departmental meetings
  • Ability and willingness to travel as needed (drive and fly)
  • Maintain Sponsor and patient confidentiality
  • Other duties as assigned

What You Need
  • Minimum Bachelor's degree in a life science
  • At least 12 months of a CTA/Clinical Trial Assistant or similar role experience within the clinical/pharmaceutical industry
  • Understanding of ICH GCP Compliance
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills
  • A phenomenal teammate

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Environmental Services Staffing & Recruiting

whole_unnormalized_body:
About JLL

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

We’re a Fortune 500 company. We work across 80 countries, in 280 different offices, with a team of over 77,000 individuals. And we look after a property portfolio of over 4bn square feet, all on behalf of our clients.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

What This Job Involves

The role is part of a JLL team working closely with one of our most dynamic & fast-growing Clients from the online retail industry. JLL partners with the Client to deliver a wide range of corporate real estate services.

We are seeking a Workplace Coordinator based in Berlin (Germany) or Warsaw (Poland) to provide exceptional and proactive assistance to one of the Client’s key Global Real Estate and Facilities (GREF) Operations in DACH (German, Switzerland, and Austria). The person in this role will work closely with the GREF team in DACH, and alongside the Area Manager to supply assistance on various activities. Typical scope will range from coordinating cross functional work & communication within the team, enhanced with data analysis supporting execution of actions related to the development of the portfolio. This is a wide ranging Real Estate and Facilities role with room for intense collaboration with several stakeholders within the wider GREF team e.g. Portfolio Planning, Space and Occupancy, Transactions, Design and Construction, IFM, EHS and local clients business contacts. The role within the defined scope is anticipated to last approximately 12-18 months while supporting the successful delivery during the current high activity and expanding area. The role is integral to managing the delivery of projects and actions for the existing managed portfolio.

The person in this role needs to be flexible and open to managing a variety of issues, tasks and relationships, as well as identifying the need for changes in priorities. The critical skills include the ability to coordinate activities & communicate effectively, a natural drive to take action, Ownership as well as ability to analyse data to identify risks that require management.

The role is positioned alongside our on-site delivery team in Berlin, delivering a wider range of facility management, occupancy and project management services, and will be reporting into a senior member of the facility management team.

Key Responsibilities Include-
  • Drive and Support the DACH stakeholder teams in communication and collaboration in daily operations.
  • Provide support to the DACH region, which includes taking minutes at meetings, collecting and distributing tasks agreed in meetings and driving communication within the team.
  • Support the DACH region with respect to any activity required for the management of the portfolio – in particular with respect to reviewing data & reports related to oversight over fit out projects, real estate transactions and occupancy management.
  • Supporting collection of data & information needed to complete the Quarterly Portfolio Review.
  • Collaborate closely with analytical and operational teams to obtain data and develop reports required to maintain control over the portfolio.
  • Tracking of action plans to ensure teams involved in managing the portfolio and delivered projects are meeting deadlines. Proactively flag if any risks are foreseen. Monitor risks closely and support the relevant teams in resolving it (whether project or process related).
  • Develop and maintain effective working relationships across the regional team to coordinate activities efficiently.
  • Support coordination between various departments/teams to obtain holistic views and inputs about the managed portfolio, enhance team collaboration and dialogue, and support development of best practice within the supported teams.
  • Propose solutions aimed at improving the management of the portfolio, particularly in the data & analytics area.
  • Ownership of selected elements of the Area Managers scope of work during the 3 months sabbatical in 2020 – being the “Conductor of the Orchestra”
  • Relationship management with key stakeholders (internal and external) at all levels.
  • Deliver & support other ad hoc projects and developments as and when needed.
Sound like you? To apply you need to have-
  • A Bachelor’s degree with a focus in Real Estate, Economics or Finance desired.
  • Minimum of 4-7 years’ experience in real estate or related discipline.
  • Strong communication skills (English mandatory, German will be a benefit).
  • Proficient in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Outstanding analytical ability, attention to detail and a comprehension to understand the end-to-end process.
  • Ability to translate ad hoc activities into regular processes, track record of establishing and documenting processes is a benefit.
  • Ability to manage multiple work assignments simultaneously, manage multiple or conflicting priorities, and handle a high-pressure working environment.
  • Ability to anticipate and pre-empt the requirements and risks coming out of daily portfolio activities and overall service delivery.
  • Outstanding client relationship management skills with great client focus.
  • Candidate should demonstrate personal impact and gravitas, with high velocity & speed of response and a proactive, 'can-do' attitude and commitment to taking ownership.
  • Ability to deliver tasks with minimal supervision, being a self-starter with the skill to plan and execute autonomously.
  • Deliver solution-oriented communications.
  • Quick learner with willingness to develop and ability to effectively move into taking responsibility of managing activities with limited hands-on experience.
JLL Privacy Notice

Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.

For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .

For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .

Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

job_description_details.Industry: Commercial Real Estate Facilities Services Real Estate

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

Alcon is the global leader in eye care, dedicated to helping people see brilliantly. With our 70-plus-year heritage, we are the largest eye care device company in the world – with complementary businesses in Surgical and Vision Care. Being a truly global company, we work in over 70 countries and serve patients in more than 140 countries.

Alcon Global Services (AGS) is a dynamic team providing critical shared-services support to the Alcon organization worldwide – in areas like Finance, IT, HR, Quality, and more. Our objective in AGS is simple – ensuring the satisfaction of our internal clients and contributing to an outstanding experience for Alcon’s customers worldwide.

Globally, we share a bond - seeing better enhances our quality of life. This is your chance to make contributions to a leading company that you can be proud of every day and help make a positive impact that can benefit yourself, your loved ones, your community and our world!

Join Alcon and help the world See Brilliantly!

The Business Planning & Analysis Manager is responsible for the management and co-ordination of the company’s budgeting and forecasting process and for driving a strong discipline on financial management and investment decisions within the business. The environment is within our new shared service centre in Warsaw and we are keen for the successful candidate to develop into a true Business Partner across the centre with the EMEA markets.

How You Will Make a Difference
  • Support the development and evaluation of new business opportunities for the Business Unit and providing guidance and insight into significant business transactions including but not limited to pricing, tenders, discounts and Key Account Management deals to ensure business objectives are achieved
  • Partner with the business to ensure timely and accurate completion of all operational forecasts and budgets
  • Actively manage the P&L to maximize results and drive operating income performance
  • Work with the business to execute strategies to maintain adequate expenditure and investment controls for the country
  • Provision of financial education to business partners accuracy of the P&L and Balance Sheet
  • Ensure critical business processes are well documented and communicated to facilitate effective and efficient execution
  • Work with the Business Unit to ensure there is consistent focus on compliance with Corporate and local policies and procedures, laws and regulations
What We Can Offer You
  • Be part of a world class Finance team who drives business success
  • Work with people who are passionate of delivering outcomes and culture of simplification and ownership
  • Truly international environment and daily interactions with colleagues from all over the world
  • Ability to cross skill and grow or move (horizontally/vertically) within the organization
  • Attractive benefits package (private medical care, group insurance, lunch card, transportation allowance, pension plan, Multisport/cultural card, free Alcon products for you and your significant other
  • Permanent employment contract, attractive base salary and annual bonus
  • Flexible hours and remote work possibilities
  • Brand new office in Marynarska 15, Warsaw, with a lot of facilities inside
Skills For Success

Minimum requirements
  • Graduation from Finance
  • Proficiency in English
  • 4-5 years of experience in Finance Planning & Analysis
  • Aspiration to become a financial business partner, you might be looking to develop this area and this opportunity would provide that
  • Business acumen
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, fact-based reasoning and strong process orientation
  • High customer orientation
  • Ability to builds trust and collaborate seamlessly across functions/countries
Division
ALCON

Business Unit
NON-NVS AL FINANCE & CONTROL

Country
Poland

Work Location
Warszawa

Company/Legal Entity

Alcon Polska Sp. z o.o.

Functional Area
Audit & Finance

Job Type
Full Time

Employment Type
Regular

Shift Work
No

With our 70-plus-year heritage, we are the largest eye care device company in the world – with complementary businesses in Surgical and Vision Care. Being a truly global company, we work in over 70 countries and serve patients in more than 140 countries.

Alcon Global Services (AGS) is a dynamic team providing critical shared-services support to the Alcon organization worldwide – in areas like Finance, IT, HR, Quality, and more. Our objective in AGS is simple – ensuring the satisfaction of our internal clients and contributing to an outstanding experience for Alcon’s customers worldwide.

Globally, we share a bond - seeing better enhances our quality of life. This is your chance to make contributions to a leading company that you can be proud of every day and help make a positive impact that can benefit yourself, your loved ones, your community and our world!

Join Alcon and help the world See Brilliantly!

The Business Planning & Analysis Manager is responsible for the management and co-ordination of the company’s budgeting and forecasting process and for driving a strong discipline on financial management and investment decisions within the business. The environment is within our new shared service centre in Warsaw and we are keen for the successful candidate to develop into a true Business Partner across the centre with the EMEA markets.

How You Will Make a Difference
  • Support the development and evaluation of new business opportunities for the Business Unit and providing guidance and insight into significant business transactions including but not limited to pricing, tenders, discounts and Key Account Management deals to ensure business objectives are achieved
  • Partner with the business to ensure timely and accurate completion of all operational forecasts and budgets
  • Actively manage the P&L to maximize results and drive operating income performance
  • Work with the business to execute strategies to maintain adequate expenditure and investment controls for the country
  • Provision of financial education to business partners accuracy of the P&L and Balance Sheet
  • Ensure critical business processes are well documented and communicated to facilitate effective and efficient execution
  • Work with the Business Unit to ensure there is consistent focus on compliance with Corporate and local policies and procedures, laws and regulations
What We Can Offer You
  • Be part of a world class Finance team who drives business success
  • Work with people who are passionate of delivering outcomes and culture of simplification and ownership
  • Truly international environment and daily interactions with colleagues from all over the world
  • Ability to cross skill and grow or move (horizontally/vertically) within the organization
  • Attractive benefits package (private medical care, group insurance, lunch card, transportation allowance, pension plan, Multisport/cultural card, free Alcon products for you and your significant other
  • Permanent employment contract, attractive base salary and annual bonus
  • Flexible hours and remote work possibilities
  • Brand new office in Marynarska 15, Warsaw, with a lot of facilities inside
Skills For Success

Minimum requirements
  • Graduation from Finance
  • Proficiency in English
  • 4-5 years of experience in Finance Planning & Analysis
  • Aspiration to become a financial business partner, you might be looking to develop this area and this opportunity would provide that
  • Business acumen
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, fact-based reasoning and strong process orientation
  • High customer orientation
  • Ability to builds trust and collaborate seamlessly across functions/countries
Division
ALCON

Business Unit
NON-NVS AL FINANCE & CONTROL

Country
Poland

Work Location
Warszawa

Company/Legal Entity

Alcon Polska Sp. z o.o.

Functional Area
Audit & Finance

Job Type
Full Time

Employment Type
Regular

Shift Work

Position Purpose & Summary

Comprehensive coordination of processes connected with railway transportation; execution of purchase/sales contracts.

Principal Accountabilities

60% Coordination of the import process (schedules, contact with customs agency & customers, division of delivery between the customers taking into account their schedule and possibilities), ensuring the purchase and sale were executed timely, on contract, and in the proper fashion.

20% Entering data into the system (nomination, weights, including correction of the wrong statuses of the LDC’s)

10% Creating accruals / entering invoices for services into the system

10% Resolving issues, answers questions and sends documents to routine internal and external contacts related to loading, unloading, contract requirements, rejected products, location and timing of the product, and other questions/concerns communicated by standard internal or external contacts.

Qualifications

Minimum Required Qualifications
  • Min. Bachelor’s degree, communicative English
  • Experience in logistic & transportation area; knowledge of Microsoft Office
  • To be able to work under pressure, communicative, decisive, analytical thinking
  • Independence and responsibility in fulfillment daily duties

Preferred Qualifications
  • Master’s degree in Logistics
  • Experience in logistics process / Supply Chain
  • Russian (as the second language).
We offer
  • Life insurance
  • Private medical care for the employee and his/her family members
  • Multisport Card
  • Meal voucher

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook is seeking a strong sales and marketing professional to help build and sell Facebook’s advertising solutions. This role will establish and expand relationships with new clients, and continue to cultivate and grow relationships with strategic clients. With proven understanding of both online and traditional media, this role will align with an Account Manager and counterparts within the Sales organization, to develop industry-specific marketing relationships and drive revenue by negotiating and optimizing complex opportunities with strategic clients. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in selling cross-network marketing solutions to multichannel advertisers. Having experience managing both brand and performance based campaigns, expertise in brand and performance based advertising products, and ability to leverage data and analytics to improve performance for digital campaigns is required. Client Partners must have strong consultative sales and analytical skills; thrive in a collaborative and innovative environment, and have a passion for Facebook. Success in this position will require a proven ability to reach and influence executive level customers, ecosystem partners (PMD's and Agencies), close new business, and provide holistic marketing solutions.

Responsibilities
  • Serve as an industry thought leader in social media and digital advertising in order to drive vertical and client success leveraging Facebook’s ongoing product and technology developments
  • Develop and actively manage short and long term account plans based on client brand and direct response marketing objectives
  • Accurately and effectively manage sales pipeline in order to prioritize business opportunities and resources
  • Develop and broaden high-level collaborative relationships, including understanding and identifying contacts that manage multiple budget, (brand, DR etc.) and close large deals with up to 40 major customers
  • Create and present needs-based solutions and high quality answers to RFPs
  • Reach and exceed sales quotas while contributing to overall vertical and team goals
  • Create and deliver consultative sales presentations using industry knowledge, market trends, and Facebook marketing solutions
  • Exhibit executive presence and confidence in presenting Facebook to C-suite executives
  • Partner with other vertical teams on structuring and executing operational and strategic initiatives - developing work plans, synthesizing market related data, leading analysis and defining the overall business approach
  • Methodic coordination & communication across the various entities (PMD, agency, direct client teams)
Minimum Qualification
  • Marketing, Brand Advertising, Direct Response, Media Sales and/or Online Advertising experience
  • Proven track record of successfully reaching and exceeding sales revenue goals through consultative sell
  • Fluency in English and native/professional proficiency in Russian

Preferred Qualification
  • Experience in a fast-paced startup, sales, and/or online advertising environment strongly preferred

Date: Feb 20, 2020

The Project Manager Role purpose is to manage customer projects and secure those project goals, time and budget are in agreement with the internal/external customer expectation.

Responsibilities & Tasks
  • Manage the day-to-day operational and tactical aspects of projects being a lead in project executions after contract signing and a key participant in team and clients meetings,
  • Review high-level deliverables across projects and management of scope and mitigates risk across projects,
  • Analyze profitability, revenue, margins, bill rates and utilization across projects,
  • Identify sales opportunities across projects,
  • Possess a thorough understanding of our service offerings, technical preferences, and technical direction,
  • Implement engagement review and quality assurance procedures in accordance with our methodology to ensure profitable and successful execution of goals and customer satisfaction,
  • Report the project progress and activities to the Steering group and relevant Stakeholders.


Position Qualifications
  • Minimum 3-5 years of proven experience in Project Management,
  • Practical knowledge gained in IT/Telecom Project Management as an asset,
  • Experience with Project Management tools and applications,
  • Fluency in English,
  • Polish speaker as mandatory,
  • Financial and business understanding,
  • Sales and business development, negotiation and argumentation skills,
  • Project management skills,
  • Problem solving,
  • Presentation and communication skills,
  • Entrepreneurial & Commercial Thinking,
  • Delivering Results & Meeting Customer Expectations.


What Do We Offer
  • Stable employment on the basis of an employment contract,
  • Work based on developing the latest solutions in the area of mobile technology,
  • Clearly defined career paths, trainings,
  • Rich benefit package (private medical care for employee and his family, life insurance, Ok System, MultiSport, lunch voucher),
  • Work in an international environment based on cooperation,
  • Home office, flexible working hours, laptop and mobile phone,
  • Work - life balance.

If you would like to meet #TeamEricsson in person, let’s also connect offline during our meetups (Telco Camp by Ericsson in Kraków and in Łódź) or at other events.

As a Master Data Analyst you will be an essential part the Global IT MDM team as well as the rest of PANDORAs Master Data Organisation (data- owners and stewards).

Your primary focus will be on one of our most valued company assets, master data. Through close collaboration with the Master Data Solution Architect, Business Analyst and Application/Solution Architects, you will ensure that data is modelled and applied consistently across PANDORA's IT landscapes and according to master data transition plans.
You will be very capable of combining business domain knowledge with the ability to define requirements to our Master Data solutions and work with implementation and maintenance.
In addition you will work with Master Data change management and will facilitate the use of a master data toolbox in our projects and in the application teams.

Key responsibilities:

  • Responsible for closely engaging with stakeholders to ensure that MDI&G team & roadmap are aligned to business requirements,
  • You will lead in the analysis of data, working to improve accuracy, speed of delivery and effectiveness through changes and implementations of processes, systems and more,
  • Ongoing Programs; Data Taskforce/Education/Analysis/Trends/ Process Enhancements/Implementation/Monitoring; Business Connector,

Requirements:

  • 3-5 years proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst,
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques,
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks, Services / API’s),
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using Data Quality and statistical Tools for analyzing datasets (Excel, Aperture Data Studio ect.),
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy,
  • Adept in queries, report writing and presenting findings.

If you possess the required competencies and are ready to join a team of passionate individuals, send us your application.

For more information about our Shared Service Centre go to: PANDORA Shared Services.

Rather than telling you what you can or should do,
we like to say there’s nothing you can’t do!

The controller of your personal data as disclosed in the job application documents is Pandora Jewelry Shared Services Sp. z o.o. with its registered office in Warsaw at the address: ul. Domaniewska 28, 02-672 Warszawa. Your personal data will be processed for the purpose of conducting the recruitment process. Without your separate consent your personal data will not be made available to any recipients of data within the meaning of art. 7 cl. 6 of the Personal Data Protection Act of August 29 of 1997. You have the right to access your data and amend them at any time. You are free to submit your personal data, however if you refuse to do so the purpose, as referred to above cannot be pursued.

We’re JTI, Japan Tobacco International and we believe in freedom. We think that the possibilities are limitless when you’re free to choose. In fact, we’ve spent the last 20 years innovating, creating new and better products for our consumers to choose from. It’s how we’ve grown to be present in 130 countries.

But our business isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen for our business.

That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It’s why 9 out of 10 would recommend us to a friend. And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, six years running.

So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.

Learn more jti.com

Process Improvement Specialist

This is great opportunity to be a part of exciting project and drive transformation in the Company to ensure that internal customers around the world are getting the Best-in-class level of service.

Our offer includes

  • A competitive pay (together with annual bonus) and an attractive benefits package including medical care, Multisport card, life insurance, pension plan
  • Ambitious goal to set up new Global Business Center Complex environment of working with multiple stakeholders
  • On-going development opportunities in a multinational environment that will inspire you to grow professionally and personally
  • Wide variety of projects and tasks, ambitious goals and independence in achieving them
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Modern office in a convenient location

Main areas of responsibility

  • Supporting to baseline the operational performance of the processes in scope for the transition
  • Working directly with markets representatives
  • Identifying any metrics of KPIs gaps
  • Implementation a Quality, Kaizen, LEAN and 6Sigma awareness training in readiness to be shared to the whole GBS organization
  • Implementation of Operational Excellence methodology from improvement opportunity identification
  • Supporting process improvement activities with process owners/markets as deemed appropriate
  • Managing the development of KPIs and monitor target achievements
  • Managing the data collection
  • Providing insight for the root cases that stay in the way of performance improvement
  • Participation in the process design sessions for technical architecture sign off

You as a professional

  • Have un University Degree (Economics, Business Administration, Engineering or Science)
  • Minimum 2-3 years of experience in a multinational company in a similar position
  • Proficient computer skills (MS Office, Advanced Excel)
  • Fluent English (both written and spoken)
  • Good communication skills (written and spoken)
  • Strong level of business understanding
  • Prior experience with big scale project management
  • Strong leadership mindset

If you decide to participate in this recruitment, the administrator of your data will be JTI Polska sp.z o.o. with headquarters in Stary Gostków. Your data will be processed only to support the recruitment process in which you participate. Detailed information on the processing of your data and your rights can be found here.

Opis Stanowiska

Nr referencyjny oferty:

Informacje o Projekcie
  • Branża: ubezpieczeniowa
  • Lokalizacja: Warszawa (Mokotów)
  • Wynagrodzenie: w trakcie ustalania
  • Czas trwania projektu: stała współpraca


Obowiązki
  • Administracja urządzeniami sieciowymi Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, IPS Firepower, Catalyst 3650/3850, Catalyst 6800, Cisco WLC
  • Administracja systemami zarządzania Cisco ISE, Prime Infrastructure
  • Diagnozowanie i rozwiązywanie problemów z obszaru działania sieci
  • Udział opracowywaniu i wdrażaniu strategii rozwoju sieci
  • Udział w projektach wewnętrznych


Wymagania

Wymagania:
  • Wykształcenie wyższe o profilu informatycznym lub pokrewnym
  • Wiedza na poziomie Cisco CCNP lub wyższym
  • Znajomość protokołów routingu dynamicznego (OSPF, BGP)
  • Umiejętność zarządzania przełącznikami i routerami Cisco
  • Umiejętność zarządzania firewallami Cisco, IPS oraz firewallami aplikacyjnymi
  • Znajomość technologii VXLAN, EVPN
  • Znajomość Cisco ISE
  • Znajomość zasad projektowania i działania sieci
  • Znajomość zagadnień z zakresu bezpieczeństwa sieci
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie pozwalającym swobodne komunikowanie się


Mile Widziane
  • Umiejętność zarządzania proxy Forcepoint
  • Znajomość systemów monitoringu Nagios i Solarwinds


Oferujemy

Oferujemy:
  • Współpracę w oparciu o umowę o pracę (lub B2B)
  • Świadczenia dodatkowe: opiekę medyczną, możliwość skorzystania z zajęć sportowych (siłownia, fitness, basen) przystąpienia do grupowego ubezpieczenia na życie, liczne akcje na rzecz naszych pracowników, programy dla rodziny
  • Pełne wprowadzenie do obowiązków - przekażemy Ci naszą wiedzę oraz doświadczenie, abyś mógł/a komfortowo rozpocząć pracę
  • Niepowtarzalną atmosferę: bezpośredni kontakt, pozytywne podejście, wzajemny szacunek

  • Niepowtarzalną atmosferę: bezpośredni kontakt, pozytywne podejście, wzajemny szacunek

whole_unnormalized_body:
Your Responsibilities will be:

  • Perform Vulnerability Research analysis on Huawei Products by:
  • Using different type of Fuzzing technologies
  • Manual / Automate / Assisted Code Auditing
  • Vulnerability Variant Analysis
  • Dynamic Testing
  • Developing custom tools for vulnerability identification
  • Proposing new ideas / methodologies for Vulnerability Research
  • Work together in a team with different skill set
  • Perform internal trainings on specific area of expertise


Our requirements:

·       5+ years Vulnerability Research & Penetration Testing

  • Experienced in *nix system architecture and development
  • Knowledge of one or more scripting languages (Python, Java, GoLang, Ruby, etc.)
  • Deep understanding of Memory Corruption Vulnerabilities (e.g. Stack / Heap Overflow, UAF, Type Confusion, etc)
  • Good understanding of Web Application Vulnerabilities (XSS, CSRF, SSRF, IDOR, RFI, LFI etc)
  • Familiar with IDA Pro, Binary Ninja, Radare2, Frida, AFL, AFL++ and similar software

·       Demonstrated knowledge of vulnerability discovery, vulnerability analysis

·       Fluent written and spoken English

·       Capability to work in a team

·       Open for worldwide short-term travels (10%)

 

Desirable Knowledge/Experience:

  • CVE, Blog Posts, Conference Talks, CTF etc
  • Certification in Penetration Testing (e.g., OSCP)

 

We offer:

  • Attractive salary and social benefits.
  • Employment at global telecommunication leader
  • Interesting and challenging job in international structures
  • Possibility of professional development
  • Good office location - Rondo Daszyńskiego

 

 If you are enthusiastic to shape the Warsaw Research Center together with us, being part of a multicultural team and growing environment, feel free to contact us. Driving future technologies with focus on customer satisfaction is one of our missions. Join us!
