position: New Analyst Programme in Engineering Division - Warsaw (Recent Graduates)
whole_unnormalized_body:
Join us for:

New Analyst Programme (starting in July 2020)

Full time entry-level employment dedicated for Students and Graduates who have minimal work experience and who are able to work on a full time basis in 2020.

 

Application link: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/students/programs/emea/new-analyst.html

 

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

We are a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities and investment management services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. We commit people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow.

 

OUR ENGINEERS DON'T JUST MAKE THINGS - WE MAKE THINGS POSSIBLE

Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. Join our Warsaw Team and learn Java, NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB), messaging (Kafka, RabbitMQ), Spark, Hadoop, high throughput distributed systems, front-end (ReactJS) and many more

 

ROLES

Software Engineering

Transform our business and work across all areas of the firm to design and implement high-quality, scalable and smart solutions. Leveraging both internal and open source services, we design and develop applications capable of building, maintaining, and processing large & complex data sets. Ensuring we have the most up-to-date and actionable information, we constantly strive to boost performance and exceed industry standards in order to meet our clients’ evolving needs. We look for ways to improve our operations and enhance our client offerings through internal and external platforms as we build and expand the capacity for data mining, anomaly detection, and business intelligence.

 

Financial Modelling

We look beyond the numbers and find the trends. As a member of our team, you will extract meaningful information to engineer advice and solutions that have real-world implications for our clients and the firm. This level of expert analysis involves large, at times global, data sets – both structured and unstructured – to build predictive models that are relevant to specific business centers and account for market variables. These quantitative techniques then inform effective and accurate cross-asset trade and portfolio ideas for our clients. In collaboration with your team and others across the firm, you will build and enhance advanced quantitative and analytical methods, utilizing software to design risk modelling systems and develop machine learning algorithms. Specifically, your role will focus on providing APIs to clients helping them generate alpha, risk calculations and business metrics. This valuable information will allow them to build and challenge risk models that identify and quantify market and liquidity risk and modelling vulnerabilities.

 

Infrastructure Engineering

Infrastructure Engineering is a multi-faceted role that allows you to explore data center design, networks, storage, cloud computing, big data, application messaging, databases, communications, market data and software languages. Make things possible for our clients and the firm as you design and build our compute and data infrastructure. You will put your expertise to work in a variety of challenges, from identifying internal hardware needs, to implementing public and private cloud-based solutions to providing seamless, on-demand scaling of our applications. We provide a robust testing platform that involves the best standards, solutions and tools to ensure uninterrupted operation of all of our lines of business. You will have the opportunity to use data mining techniques to identify and react to problems in the firm’s infrastructure and platforms. A role on this team allows you to use your experience to help us transform the future at Goldman Sachs.

 

Cyber Security

Protect our clients and the integrity of our firm around the world in both an advisory and engineering capacity as you develop and propagate our security control strategy. Be on the front line of our operations every day, helping the firm to protect itself & its clients and manage risk. Information security is a top priority and in this role, you will focus on analysis, penetration testing, cryptography and authentication. This defense involves performing security operations to detect, analyze and respond to threat intelligence and incidents – quickly. We do this by leveraging data mining and machine learning techniques to identify malicious activity and cyber risks. Working as a part of a larger team, you will help developers create secure applications, and advise the firm’s network and systems engineers as they build infrastructure. Together, we are helping to secure the future of the firm and our clients - every day.

 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Candidates would be required to work on a wide range of problems, including the designing and developing sophisticated software and systems using proprietary as well as modern web, mobile, and, desktop technologies to:

• Manage, visualize, and analyze massive sets of market and operational data used in our trading risk management, and control functions

• Correctly and efficiently route orders for billions of dollars of securities every day

• Allow the ability to represent, transact in and risk manage all of the firm’s OTC derivative positions

• Distribute computations across tens of thousands of computers

• Make use of functional programming paradigm and big data solutions to develop the firm’s next generation modelling, pricing, and risk management platform

• Contribute to key open source initiatives – e.g. GSCollections, Project Panama

• Build firm’s strategic mobile platform

 

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

We are interested in applicants who possess the following computer science skills:

• Strong fundamentals in distributed systems, databases

• Design and analysis of algorithms

• Implementation of programming languages and run-time systems

job_description_details.Industry: Financial Services Investment Banking Computer & Network Security

whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

AWS Professional Services is a very unique organization. Our customers are most-advanced companies in the world. We build for them world-class, cloud-native IT solutions to solve real business problems and we help them get business outcomes with AWS Cloud. Our projects are unique and often one-of-a-kind solutions that no one ever has done before.

As a Data Lake & Analytics Consultant in our Global Competency Center in Warsaw, you will design and build cloud-native, business-critical applications solving real-world problems of AWS customers. You will take advantage of the global scale, elasticity, automation and high-availability features of the AWS platform. Your projects will focus on customer solutions built with Amazon Elastic Compute (EC2), Amazon Data Pipeline, Glue, Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS), Amazon Elastic Map Reduce (EMR), Amazon Kinesis, and Amazon Redshift. You will work across a range of areas including web and mobile applications, enterprise applications, HPC, IoT, Big Data, and Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning and engage with technical, IT and leadership teams of our customers.

You will collaborate across the whole AWS organization, with other consultants, client teams and partners to deliver proof-of-concept projects, conduct workshops, and complex implementation projects. To be successful you will need to innovate and experiment to solve business challenges and deliver production-ready solutions at global scale.

You Will
  • Collaborate with field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use services such as Amazon Elastic Compute (EC2), Amazon Data Pipeline, Glue, Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS), Amazon Elastic Map Reduce (EMR), Amazon Kinesis, and Amazon Redshift,
  • work with systems engineers, consultants and data scientists to design and build a analytics platform and data lake to support compute heavy data science, dashboarding, and web-facing production tooling,
  • write ETL to consolidate and relate petabytes of data owned by disparate teams,
  • implement best practice data quality assurance mechanisms,
  • help fellow developers develop high-quality code, innovate using the latest (cloud native) technologies and development best practices.
As an Amazonian leader you will demonstrate the Amazon Leadership Principles, coaching and mentoring others on best practices, performance and career development.


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field.
  • 3+ years’ experience of Data Lake/Hadoop platform implementation, including 3+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning Hadoop/Spark implementations.
  • Understanding of Apache Hadoop and the Hadoop ecosystem. Experience with one or more relevant tools (Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, Avro).
  • Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP and NoSQL databases, Data Warehouse design, ETL, BI reporting and Dashboard development.
  • Familiarity with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto).
  • Experience developing software code in one or more programming languages (Java, JavaScript, Python, R etc).
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Willingness and interest to collaborate and work in a team.
  • Strong sense of customer focus, ownership, urgency, and drive.
  • Ability to travel to client locations when needed, up to 50%.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math.
  • Hands on experience delivering large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects.
  • Implementation experience using OLAP databases such as Redshift, Teradata, Netezza, Vertica.
  • Implementation and tuning experience specifically using Amazon Elastic Map Reduce (EMR).
  • Knowledge of basic AWS services (EC2, ELB, RDS, Route53 & S3, Redshift, Kinesis, Glue).
  • Infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting (E.g. shell, Python, Ruby, Powershell).
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau)
  • Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments.
  • Experience using machine learning libraries, such as scikit-learn, caret, mlr, mllib.
  • Use of AWS services in distributed environments with Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, HP, SAP etc.
  • Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.
  • Experience working directly with customers, partners or third-party vendors.
We invest heavily in our team by continuously offering learning opportunities, sharing knowledge internally across all technical teams in AWS, and working on (customer & internal) projects that will broaden and deepen your technical expertise and business acumen.

If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, are eager to deliver results, are deeply technical, highly innovative, and a voracious learner, it is you, who we are looking for.

Apply now!

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Danfoss Business System (DBS) is looking for a Transformation Lead to manage global projects and drive change management initiatives across various Danfoss factories, mainly in Europe. You will be working in a truly multicultural environment with highly, qualified colleagues from all over the world. As Transformation Leader, you will be assigned to a specific project in a Danfoss factory for up to 6 months. You will be leading the activities on-site potentially covering the entire value chain to achieve strong contribution margin improvements. You will provide support and coaching for leaders and systematically spread best practice using Lean and the Six Sigma approach along with other quality/improvement tools.

We operate wherever our companies, partners and customers are, and therefore it is important that you have the flexibility and willingness to travel 100% and to work in all of our factories globally.

Background And Skills

To be considered for this position, you have a Master’s degree in engineering, business or equivalent combined with extensive plant and operational managerial experience from a production/manufacturing setting as well as hands-on experience in implementing change projects. It is essential that you have a commitment to diversity of thought, inclusion and a global/international mindset and experience. You must be able to demonstrate an ability to navigate a large and complex corporate organization whilst maintaining an entrepreneurial spirit. You are a strong team player and an inspirational leader possessing technical credibility and presence, with the ability to quickly gain the confidence of your team, your peers and management. You will exhibit a unique blend of strategic vision, functional excellence and execution success.

Furthermore, We Expect That You
  • Are an effective communicator and consensus builder across key stakeholders
  • Have strong focus on collaboration with a wider network (part of your DNA)
  • Have an instinct for impact and a taste for stretched targets
  • Understand lean and related areas (six sigma, TPM, TPS)
  • Have a mindset of continuously challenging your peers and your self
  • Are fluent in English, both orally and in writing
As a person you are result-driven and your work style is fact-based and well-structured. Your strong and decisive personality, well-developed interpersonal skills and can-do attitude enables you to solve complex problems and create a sustainable impact.

Your Main Responsibilities Is To
  • Secure performance in the plant in terms of safety, quality, delivery and cost
  • Develop and manage manufacturing operations to achieve “Manufacturing Excellence”
  • Provide leadership vision and performance coaching to the operations team to ensure that goals are achieved, and that bench strength is improved to facilitate succession planning
  • Drive and improve results by leveraging lean tools, consulting skills and change management processes
  • Challenge and support factory and divisional management to drive a culture of high performance and continuous improvement
  • Create long term activity roadmaps and lean transformation projects for our factories incl. Kaizen and step change projects
  • We offer you a challenging position where you will be able to utilize your current experience. You will become part of an inspiring work and learning environment with deeply committed and motivated colleagues, and we will give you every opportunity to further develop yourself and advance in your career.
We are Engineering Tomorrow
The world faces growing populations, booming urbanization and rapid climate change. At Danfoss, we engineer ready-to-use solutions to these challenges. We build energy-efficient solutions that reduce food loss and make cities cleaner – using digital technology to make systems smarter and more connected – and we engineer innovative new ways to save energy and transition to clean energy for the good of our climate.

Join Danfoss
Danfoss gives you unique opportunities to put your skills to good use, make an impact and shape an exciting career. We encourage employees to take charge, do extraordinary things and run the business like it was their own. Danfoss is a high-performance technology company. We give you opportunities to learn and grow – both professionally and personally – while still maintaining a healthy work/life balance. Join Danfoss to be part of a world-class team of over 27,000 people in 56 countries that engineer tomorrow and build a better future.

Please watch how Danfoss is engineering tomorrow

For more information about the position, please contact Head of Danfoss Productivity Program Europe, Damjan Novak +49 1723290942. For information regarding the process, please contact Senior Recruiter, Susanne Roy Bredskov +45 5188 8119.

Please apply at your earliest convenience. Once we have found the right candidate, the job ad will be closed/taken down.

Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category. Type of Position
Professional

whole_unnormalized_body:
We are looking for a Coordinating Officer – Operational Implementation Sector, Sea Border Team and Operational Planning Sector, Sea Border Team (three job positions).

﻿Deadline: 13.04.2020


DUTIES:

  • Support the planning, monitoring and coordination of the activities and processes of the Sea Border Team in the respective Sector;
  • Support the qualitative planning, implementation and reporting procedures and tools and systems related to the sea border domain;
  • Participate in the process of overall planning and implementation of Unit/Sector activities in particular contributing to fulfilment of objectives and tasks identified in Programme of Work related to the sea border domain;
  • Analyze and provide recommendations on improvement of organizational management in relation to planning, implementation, monitoring and effective use of resources;
  • Provide comprehensive support to the Head of Sector and to the Team Leader;
  • Provide recommendations and coordinate the planning and implementation of activities within the respective Sector as well as acting as interface with other entities in this regard;
  • Report regularly, identify and timely flag and proactively propose solutions for potential challenges and risks within the field of work;
  • Contribute to the planning and implementation of the programming documents, monitoring and coordinating the implementation of the Sector work plan and conclusions of audit reports;
  • Develop, monitor and analyze key performance indicators related to Sector activities;
  • Collect, analyze, monitor and report on different aspects of the Sector activities including statistics, surveys, organigrams and overviews;
  • Coordinate and support the organization of meetings and conferences;
  • Coordinate and provide contribution in the preparation and regular update and amendment of documents;
  • Promote best practices and knowledge-sharing in the field of air border joint operational activities performed by the deployed Teams, in particular related to air border process facilitation and control services at the Sea Borders;
  • Follow latest developments, technologies, methods and practices in the field of Sector/Unit activities;
  • Perform other tasks and responsibilities assigned by the Team Leader and Head of Sector / Unit.


THE OPERATIONAL RESPONSE DIVISION

The Operational Response Division (ORD) enables the carrying out of flexible, robust and multipurpose operational responses, the operationalising of the Coast Guard functions, Law Enforcement and cross-border crime prevention and detection for the purposes of effective security at EU external borders. The Division also enables responses in the field of return according to common EU standards. It achieves its missions by providing a great variety of operational support to partners in Member States and by bolstering field synergies through cooperation with other agencies, organisations and various networks, on the basis of the outcome of Situational Awareness and Monitoring Division activities and/or upon the request of Member States.


The Operational Response Division consists of the following Units: Field Deployments, Coast Guard and Law Enforcement, and European Centre for Returns. It also includes a Centre of Excellence for Combating Document Fraud and an Operational Division Support Office.

The Role

We are looking for a Recruitment Coordinator who can speak German, based in Warsaw to support our growing, highly respected and well established RPO client - global leader within the Pharma industry and Life Science.

The Recruitment Coordinator is a key member of the recruitment team, responsible for coordination and administrative activities for the hiring process. You will be an ambassador for Korn Ferry, building relationships with both candidates and recruiters.

Key Accountabilities
  • Support the administration and coordination of the recruitment activities in terms of assigned projects across EMEA;
  • Coordinate all elements of candidate interviews and assessments scheduling: sending meeting invites, managing diaries, booking rooms, arranging Video Conferencing, Skype, and candidate travel and expenses;
  • Support with other reasonable administrative activities such as: reporting, printing documentation, preparation of Interview guides, candidate correspondence;
  • Track, update and maintain candidate data in the applicant tracking system (ATS) in real time;
  • Trouble shooting and highlighting day to day issues to your manager.
Skills & Experience
  • Excellent time management, prioritization and organizational skills with attention to details;
  • Eagerness to work in a fast-paced environment whilst ensuring a high work standard;
  • Ability to analyse substantial amounts of information to diagnose problems and recommend appropriate solutions;
  • A very good command of English & German (min. B2);
  • Previous experience in Recruitment/HR related sectors would also be highly advantageous but not essential;
  • Familiarity with MS Office.
Other
  • Work – life balance environment (home office possible, flexible working hours);
  • A clear career path which provides opportunities for learning and growth;
    A truly international company (Polish is not required);
  • Tailor-made training courses;
  • Additional benefits: language classes, multisport card, private medical insurance.

Key Responsibilities:


  • Working alongside with marketing manager, assist in the procurement requirement clarification process.
  • Assistant the procurement manager in supplier sourcing. Source the advertisement/digital/media buying/TV/events/retail POSM/Promoter/After sale service supplier resources in retail market, build supplier resources pool.
  • Schedule and host the procurement committee meeting, prepare the meeting minutes and related meeting reports.
  • Based on the decisions of procurement committee meeting, issue the PO in the system, and send the confirmation to suppler respectively.
  • Fill the purchase data into benchmark database, and do the analysis periodically.


Skills & Experience – Required:


  • Bachelor’s degree in Commercial/Business/Logistics/Legal/Administration etc. or related majors.
  • Work experience in procurement/purchase/media house/advertising agency/customer service /administration / Data analysis role.
  • Financial and IT experience will be a big plus.
  • Able to work independently in a fast paced changing environment.
  • Proficiency in English is a must, Finland language skill will be a big plus.
  • Good MS Office skills.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills with ability to work in a multi-cultural environment.
  • Reliable, responsible and accurate with an attention to details.


We Offer:


  • Growth opportunities in a unique worldwide company.
  • Work in a multicultural, modern environment.
  • Modern office located in a convenient location.
  • Additional non-wage benefits: private medical care, sports card, online benefits platform, employee discounts for Huawei devices, free company parking lot and all necessary tools needed to perform your daily duties.
  • Attractive motivational bonus system.
  • Various team building activities and employee integration events.



Location:

This is a fulltime position at our Polish Headquarter based in Horizon Plaza in Warsaw.


Notice: Applicants must be eligible to work in Poland, Huawei is not able to sponsor any work permit applications.


Positions may be filled on a full-time employee basis in Poland.

PR Manager


Location: Warsaw


FOREO is a wildly innovative brand of 3000+ revolutionaries who opt for bold instead boring

every time. Our Swedish beauty-tech co. is forever hungry for something new—whether it’s

a groundbreaking high-tech beauty product or an unorthodox way to work smarter. If

breaking molds and challenging standards is your thing, check out our jobs page at

foreo.talentlyft.com/#home to see what’s available.


JOB BRIEF


We are looking for a proactive PR Manager to join its team. This key role will drive the campaign and strategy development for all local campaigns including drafting materials, liaison of partners involved, event management and planning, creative direction for PR purposes, media release and story angles and campaign overviews. Alongside the global PR Team, drive annual PR activities such as creative media gifting, press trips, consumer events where necessary and take charge for the PR team to amplify this and roll out locally.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Create and maintain the local media database and regularly reach out to these journalists.
  • Regularly research and draft PR stories with an emphasis on creating regional versions.
  • Identify and pitch local events, sponsorships, partnerships, and stunts for any global campaign in order to regionalize the uptake.
  • Draft regular media releases and communications updates, Interviews, opinion pieces and news stories for local distribution.
  • Adapt all global press kits and each press release to suit different media channels such as travel, lifestyle, beauty, news, design, etc. In addition, adapt local stories to pitch out wider globally.
  • Take responsibility for briefing in assets to drive the PR for each press kit we create.
  • Oversee the brand reputation from a local perspective and instigate new tactics to elevate this
  • Think outside the box and suggest at least one BIG activation, PR story or idea per month that will have the world and media talking about FOREO.
  • Analyze and evaluate any sponsorship, partnership, media spend or events offer.
  • Stay across all industry trends / PR trends/news highlights and update relevant team members.


REQUIREMENTS


  • At least 3-4 years of experience in a similar position.
  • Industrial experience in beauty/skincare is preferred.
  • BA/MA degree in Communications or Journalism.
  • Highly motivated senior account executive who has been working across many clients in a fast-paced environment.
  • A creative, dynamic, forward-thinking person - a solution solver and a doer.
  • Understanding the needs of PR and how to write stories for different media.
  • Proactive, strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Results-driven, but positive attitude.
  • Highly motivated to join a fast-growing company within a multicultural environment.
  • Fluent in Polish and English language, both spoken and written.


WHY FOREO?


  • You will work for a global beauty and wellbeing brand that is the fastest-growing in its industry.
  • You will be encouraged to bring fresh ideas to the table and experiment daily.
  • You will become part of a highly skilled and experienced international team.
  • You will profit from a creative, knowledge-sharing and stimulating environment.
  • You will have the possibility to grow and have the opportunity to take the most optimal roles and responsibilities in a fast-growing environment.



If we raised your interest and you think you might be a perfect match for our company, send

your CV in English.


Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. All applications will be considered under the terms and conditions of confidentiality in accordance with the regulations of personal data protection.


www.foreo.com

Devire Outsourcing IT to forma współpracy dedykowana dla specjalistów z branży IT, oparta na zasadach własnej działalności gospodarczej - B2B, realizująca projekty dla wiodących Klientów prowadzących innowacyjne i nowoczesne projekty.

Obecnie dla naszego Klienta - jednej z największych międzynarodowych firm ubezpieczeniowych - poszukujemy doświadczonego Testera Automatyzującego.

Lokalizacja: Warszawa (Służew)

Zakres Obowiązków
  • Implementacja automatycznych testów funkcjonalnych (java, JUnit, Selenium)
  • Implementacja automatycznych testów API (java, Spock, SoapUI)
  • Automatyzacja tworzenia danych testowych
  • Tworzenie i utrzymanie przypadków testowych dotyczących zakresu testów automatycznych
  • Monitorowanie wykonania testów automatycznych, raportowanie wyników przeprowadzonych testów


Oczekujemy
  • Minimum 2 lata doświadczenia w pracy na podobnym stanowisku
  • Doświadczenie w automatyzacji testów funkcjonalnych oraz znajomość dobrych praktyk programowania testów
  • Znajomość języków programowania i bibliotek: java, Selenium, JUnit, SQL
  • Znajomość narzędzi Jira, SoapUI/Postman, znajomość systemu kontroli wersji GIT. Mile widziana znajomość Jenkinsa na poziomie umożliwiającym tworzenie i uruchamianie jobów związanych z testami automatycznymi
  • Doświadczenie w sporządzaniu dokumentacji testowej (przypadki testowe, raporty z testów)
  • Samodzielność, bardzo dobra organizacji czasu pracy, nastawienie na cel i jakość
  • Komunikatywność i umiejętność pracy w zespole
  • Umiejętności analitycznego myślenia
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie umożliwiającym czytanie dokumentacji technicznej


Oferujemy
  • Zatrudnienie w oparciu o kontrakt B2B (via Devire)
  • Pracę w zgranym zespole scrumowym
  • Stabilną prace w dynamicznej i międzynarodowej firmie ubezpieczeniowej
  • Dużą swobodę decyzyjną w zakresie stosowanych rozwiązań
  • Pakiet benefitów

whole_unnormalized_body:
Dla międzynarodowej firmy z branży sprzętu medycznego poszukujemy osoby, która specjalizuje się w e-commerce. Jeśli szukasz nowych wyzwań - wyślij nam swoją aplikację i porozmawiajmy! 


E-commerce Expert 


Jakie wyzwania na Ciebie czekają?

·         Stworzenie od początku nowoczesnej platformy internetowej we współpracy z zewnętrznymi dostawcami

·         Przygotowanie i wdrożenie strategii marketingowej oraz wirtualnego katalogu produktów

·         Zarządzanie platformą e-commerce

·         Optymalizacja działań internetowych


Zależy nam na:

·         Doświadczeniu we wdrażaniu platformy e-commerce

·         Mile widziane doświadczenie w branży wyrobów medycznych, ale nie jest to warunkiem koniecznym

·         Dobrej znajomości języka angielskiego


Rozwijaj z nami swoje pasje, kompetencje i pozwól się dostrzec – prześlij swoje CV!

Join us as a Team Lead

  • You’ll control the financial ledger through policy setting, control, and risk and systems frameworks
  • We’ll look to you to lead teams to make accurate and timely delivery of monthly, quarterly and annual financial information
  • For someone with great financial control experience, this is a chance to gain excellent exposure as you work with senior stakeholders across the bank

What you'll do

As Financial Control Team Lead, you’ll control the financial ledger to lead to the delivery of the balance sheet and related statutory information. You’ll make sure all accounting assurances control and substantiation per policy, and ensure that impacts of external and internal changes in policy and legislation are fully embedded on time.

In addition, you’ll:

  • Develop analysis and reporting to provide a comprehensive understanding of all provisions booked in NatWest Markets
  • Work with the Local Finance teams in NatWest Markets to make sure that all provisions are consistent with IAS37 requirement
  • Operate and maintain controls for provision reporting process
  • Build strong working relationships with key customers and stakeholders including Senior Finance Managers, Lawyers and Auditors, including delivering ad hoc requests
  • Participate in strategic initiatives including support to onshore teams
  • Assess issues on overall financials, downstream processes and associated communications with different stakeholders
  • Support systems testing, and system and process improvement initiatives
  • Deliver full substantiation and reconciliation of the balance sheet and profit and loss accounts
  • Set and manage internal controls

The skills you'll need

To succeed in this role, you’ll bring extensive experience gained in a financial services or banking environment, and hold an ACA, ACCA, CIMA or equivalent qualification. You’ll have experience of leading the delivery of core financial control and reporting outputs, including ledger close, balance sheet substantiation, and statutory and management reporting.

We’ll also look to you to bring:

  • The ability to build and enhance key relationships at a senior level, and influence and challenge as required
  • Experience of working to tight deadlines and managing key financial deliverables
  • Strong experience of working in an enterprise resource planning environment
  • An astute eye for detail, and excellent problem solving skills

Market

 Insights SpecialistWarsaw, Poland

OUR GROWTH IS POWERED BY PLANTS, OUR FUTURE IS POWERED BY YOU!

At Upfield our purpose is clear: we make people healthier and happier with nutritious and delicious, natural, plant-based products that are good for you, our planet; and with packaging that’s free from plastic. We’ve got iconic brands like Rama, Country Crock, Blue Band and Flora that people all over the world know and love. We’ve been a trusted category leader since 1871 and yet we feel like we’re only just getting started.

Performance, Passion and Care define who we are as a company, how we work every day, and the responsibility we feel toward our Associates, our consumers, our business partners and our world.

We have big ambitions to grow this business and we want to attract the right people – those that love what they do, thrive on responsibility and are looking for career defining opportunities. We work in Insurgent Culture with talented and hungry team, demonstrating Unconditional Delivery Mindset each day. We act like owners - pick up the phone & get it done!

#Upfieldglobal #Upfielders #FMCG #MarketInsights #analytics

Job Purpose

As Market Insights Specialist you will support creating value for our customers by translating the market insights and research into business recommendations and action on the market, as well as leveraging the knowledge and data from local and global trends. Reporting to Category Manager you will work closely with various commercial departments across the organization.

Main Responsibilities
  • Creating reports based on internal and external data (Nielsen, GfK, consumer research) and preparing business recommendations
  • Analysing market trends and searching for brand development opportunities basing on insights
  • Acting as ‘data&insights-related’ point of contact for internal stakeholders and close cross-functional cooperation with various departments (especially Sales and Marketing Team)
  • Supporting CATMAN in Category Management projects conducted with top Retailers on the market

About you!
  • 2-4 years of relevant experience (preferably in FMCG / market analysis department / research agency)
  • University degree (preferred fields - Economics, Management)
  • Excellent analytical skills, comfortable handling large amounts of data, attention to details while keeping overview
  • Excellent communication and natural networking skills
  • Communicative English and fluent polish (both spoken&written)
  • MS Office proficiency
  • knowledge of Nielsen Answers/OneLight would be great advantage

You’ll have to enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and it will take hard work and determination; we will give you the ownership you need to make an impact.

You’ll have to deliver on the commitments you make. And we’ll give you the freedom and flexibility to do your job and build your own career.

At Upfield we want you to bring your ideas, your motivation and desire to succeed! This part of the role is up to you to complete.

We Offer!
  • Attractive salary.
  • Flexible working hours
  • Long-term career opportunities
  • Exciting fast-pieced environment with endless development and learning opportunities
  • Multicultural, dynamic and entrepreneur environment
  • Great atmosphere in team of ‘best in business’ Professionals

About Upfield!

We are the largest plant-based company in the world, and we believe in doing what’s right for our people, our customers and the planet.

We are a highly entrepreneurial fast-paced team running a multi-billion Euro business across 60+ countries with the mind-set of a start-up! We are agile, creative, fast-to-market and obsessed with customers and consumers.

If you want to make an impact where it matters apply now!

Recruitment Process

1st stage – 30 minutes phone call with Talent Advisor

2nd stage – 60 minutes interview with Line Manager

whole_unnormalized_body:
Deloitte Poland

Who We're Looking For

Deloitte’s Debt & Capital Advisory team is seeking an Associate based in Warsaw to support its growing business in Poland and the CEE region. The successful candidate will be expected to have the ability to work across a broad range of debt products and markets and will join a dedicated team focused on raising and restructuring of debt banking and non-banking debt , Structured Finance, Project Finance, Leverage Finance and Alternative Lending space.

This role requires the ability to work in a focused team environment, evidencing strong communication skills and having a very good understanding of financial modelling. The role also requires the individual to have strong written and presentation skills, good organization skills and knowledge and experience in working in transaction-driven environment. This is an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated individual seeking to make a significant impact within a large financial service group by assisting in the continued growth of our dynamic financial advisory business.

We are looking for someone who demonstrates the following personal attributes and qualifications:
  • 1-3 years of relevant (transactional) experience gained within the banking or investment industry with exposure to leveraged finance, debt capital markets, structured finance/securitization, restructuring and/or direct lending, project finance projects,
  • Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills and the ability to translate quantitative analysis to qualitative conclusions,
  • Ability to undertake detailed financial/commercial analysis for inclusion in presentations and client reports,
  • Understanding of banking documentation and legal structuring of debt finance,
  • Excellent analytical skills, including practical knowledge of financial modelling techniques,
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills – in Polish and English,
  • CFA or ACCA qualification completed or in progress – will be an advantage.

Your future role

As an Associate in our Debt & Capital Advisory Team you will provide high-quality and independent debt & capital advice on the wide range of complex and strategic financing challenges our Clients are facing. Your role within this team will be to help Clients achieve their funding and strategic objectives, which will incorporate a wide range of debt engagements including advice on optimal capital structures, raising acquisition financing or growth financing, execution of refinancing processes and the restructuring of existing debt facilities.

As an Associate you will take an active part in capital raising engagements (debt, mezzanine and quasi-equity), and you will be involved in: data analysis, creation of financial models, providing support in structuring transactions and working on transaction documentation. While most of the DCA team’s activity is focused on Poland you should expect some involvement in transactions located in other Central European countries.

Some of your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
  • Taking an active part in all aspects of capital raising engagements (debt, mezzanine and quasi-equity), including in-depth analysis, deal preparation, marketing and deal negotiation,
  • Developing comprehensive financial models,
  • Preparing of information packs, management presentations, financial analysis and Client communications, Industry/company research for both deal origination and transaction analysis.
  • Day-to-day management and coordination of the transactional process with the clients, financing providers, other advisors and stakeholders


What We Offer
  • Competitive salary and social package,
  • Rapid knowledge development thanks to on-the-job trainings related to the area of expertise,
  • Support of the company in gaining additional professional qualifications (ACCA, CFA) and development of skills through a series of Polish and foreign trainings,
  • Continuous professional grow and clear career path,
  • Benefits such as: medical insurance, sports card, participation in various employees sport teams and activities,
  • Free access to: the gym (Calypso Q22), individual physiotherapy services, our network of free bicycles and many more,
  • Friendly work atmosphere and staff parties.


About Deloitte

Deloitte is a variety of people, experience, industries and services we deliver in 150 countries of the world. It is an intellectual challenge, a good starting point for your career, and an excellent opportunity for continuous development and gaining valuable life experiences. What you only must do is to take the first step – press the apply button and send us your CV, go through all the stages of the recruitment process and sign a contract with us. Deloitte is simply your best choice.

About The Team

Debt & Capital Advisory team is an integral part of Deloitte's Financial Advisory practice, providing independent advice and execution on debt market opportunities and conditions, advising on: structuring of new debt issues and refinancing in the bank and debt capital markets, restructuring of under-performing companies (in terms of the capital structures), structuring of acquisition finance for corporates and leveraged buyouts; project finance advisory (including PPP advisory), and asset-based financing. The team works with a full suite of Clients from global Entities to mid-market and smaller private companies.

Our Work Typically Requires Advice On
  • Evaluating business plans for robustness and sensitivity,
  • Capital structure analysis,
  • Financial modelling and debt capacity analysis,
  • Assessing financing products and markets,
  • Managing ongoing relationships with potential funders,
  • Organizing and managing funding competitions,
  • Preparing management presentations and information memoranda,
  • Assessing financing offers and negotiating terms and conditions,
  • Supporting the Client in execution of the debt transactions.

For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.

The Challenges Waiting For You

Testing Services Competency Center at SII - who are we?

Maybe you have heard that we are the biggest test center in Poland. But did you know that we are recognized by the British Testing Magazine and Computer World as top testing service provider?

We have over 60 local and international clients and currently completing more than 100 projects.

Join us!

Referring to the recommendations related to coronavirus on limiting meetings, we are open to conducting online recruitment interviews through video conferences.

Responsibilities
  • Review and comment requirements and technical designs from a test perspective
  • Review and comment test results
  • Designing, implementing and executing test cases by both manual and automated test methods
  • Contribute in defining the overall test plan & approach for the team
  • Work actively with the whole team to secure a high quality of the delivery
  • Gathering and managing test data
  • Monitoring and documenting test results
  • Report, debug and verify defects
  • Recommending appropriate actions for test results


Required Skills
  • Minimum 2 years of testing experience
  • Must have experience in test ERP environment
  • Exposure in lifecycle testing
  • Experience in the usage of test tools
  • Experience in test e-commerce environment
  • Understand test data dependencies for a given context
  • Expert in defining, executing and reporting tests for complex software systems
  • Working with an international, cross-country environment
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus
  • Good English - Read /Write /Speak

Why it's worth to join Sii?:
  • W ork on challenging & fascinating international projects run for hundreds of prestigious customers from various sectors & industries
  • Develop your career thanks to many opportunities facilitated by our Job C hanger application which allows you to change a project, the area of your activity , or a place of work
  • Cooperate with the best experts in talented & passionate teams on most advanced cutting-edge technologies

The Challenges Waiting For You

Testing Services Competency Center at SII - who are we?

Maybe you have heard that we are the biggest test center in Poland. But did you know that we are recognized by the British Testing Magazine and Computer World as top testing service provider?

We have over 60 local and international clients and currently completing more than 100 projects.

Join us!

Referring to the recommendations related to coronavirus on limiting meetings, we are open to conducting online recruitment interviews through video conferences.

Description

Pathways Operations Internship Program

Opportunities available in Poland, Germany and Czech Republic - Please specify your location preferences when applying. Note: Candidates must speak the language of the country to which they apply at a minimum B2 level.

Are you looking to become a big leader in a Fortune 100 company where you can manage people, processes, and technology in one of the leading edge logistics, supply chain, transportation, and fulfilment operations? Could you work in a fast paced environment and would you like to understand what goes on behind delivering an Amazon customer order and ensuring a high quality customer experience? Then this internship may be right for you!

The Pathways Operations Internship is a project-based, educational opportunity intended to prepare driven and ambitious students for the Pathways Program, Amazon’s highly sought after Operations Leadership Development Program. Interns will spend 12 weeks in one of Amazon’s large and complex fulfilment centres in Europe. This is a chance to learn and understand leadership and project execution by working with experienced senior management as well as front line associates in some of the largest fulfilment facilities. You will experience operations strategy and process efficiency concepts come alive, put your analytical skills to test and roll up your sleeves to complete a high-priority project that will deliver significant impact to our business.
Your project will include design of a new process or strategy and require both a deep dive into data as well as implementation and testing of your solution to ensure scalability across our larger network. You will interact with senior leadership based in our headquarters, technology development teams, data warehouse experts and front line associates to think broadly about solutions to the most complex business and operational challenges we face.


Basic Qualifications

Your skills
You are currently enrolled in or a recent graduate of an MBA, PhD (Doctor) or MSc in Logistics/Science/Engineering or similar. If you are equipped with an MBA or MSc, significant previous experience in operational logistics, supply chain, manufacturing, transportation, general management or engineering role is essential. You have strong analytical skills, a sound business judgment and strong oral and written communication. You are fluent in English and fluent at a conversational level in at least one of the following languages French, German, Italian, Spanish, Czech, and Polish.


Preferred Qualifications

Bonus skills
  • Experience setting, monitoring and improving KPIs and other metrics
    • Experience supporting customers internally and externally
    • Knowledge of Lean, Six Sigma and Kaizen techniques an advantage
    About Amazon EU Operations & Customer Service

    At the core of the Amazon experience lies our Fulfilment Centre Network of warehouses. We set up our first European operations in the UK and Germany in 1998. Now we have websites across Europe, including France, Italy, Poland, Prague and Spain where our customers can find and discover virtually everything online.
    We are a company of builders. Of Pioneers. Pioneering is exhilarating. Success is measured against the possible, not the probable. For today’s pioneers, that is exactly why there is no place on Earth they would rather build than Amazon.

    Want to join Amazon?
    Amazon has hundreds of millions of customers who can benefit from diversity of thought. We are a company of builders who bring varying backgrounds, ideas, and points of view to inventing on behalf of our customers. For us, customer-centricity starts with looking at the data.


    Company - Amazon Fulfillment Poland sp.
    Job ID: A1080965

position: Manager of Process and Learning Management
whole_unnormalized_body:
We are now seeking a Manager to join the Global Process and Learning Management team. This opening is office based in our Warsaw office.

 

As a Manager of Process and Learning Management you will be responsible for managing projects, people, and/or products as needed. You are responsible for owning and achieving interim and final deliverables for your assigned projects/programs, according to the time, quality/scope and cost constraints. A given PRA product area typically includes the information systems, processes and training necessary to deliver the product or service to internal and/or external stakeholders. Key responsibilities in this role include:

  • Developing project proposals, presenting proposals to PLM leadership, determining the return on investment, and developing/maintaining project plans
  • Leading process/systems management teams and regularly communicating with key stakeholders for the process or product area
  • Managing organizational and vendor relationships
  • Providing regular reporting on project metrics, status of deliverables and risks/issues with the associated project plan to stakeholders
  • Communicating project specific priorities with team members
  • Leading and participating in portfolio management of Process, Learning or Instructional Design project status reviews
  • Developing product materials and collateral to increase internal and external adoption of systems and processes
  • Ensuring that products are validated and support Quality Assurance during audits and inspection

The Manager of Process and Learning Management will also have Functional Management responsibilities for members of the Process and Learning Management team. As a Functional Manager, you will ensure that employees fulfil responsibilities in accordance with PRA policies, procedures, SOPs, and stakeholder requirements in addition to supporting career development.

 

This role will bring you into contact with just about every part of the global organization – this is a fantastic opportunity to join a great team in a Management level role.



In order to be considered for this opening, we are seeking a candidate with:

 

  • An undergraduate degree in life sciences, business, or information technology from an accredited institution or international equivalent degree
  • A professional Project Management certification (PMI, PMP) would be an advantage
  • Operational experience within a CRO environment is strongly preferred in addition to experience delivering process, system, or learning improvement
  • Demonstrated leadership or management skills
  • Proven verbal, written, and presentation skills with the ability to communicate at multiple levels of the organization
  • Fluent English is required

Together with a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive range of benefits and an excellent working environment.

Country Poland
Location Warszawa
Function Information & Digital Technology
Level Graduate
Appointment Type Fixed Term

GLOBAL GRADUATE PROGRAMME IN IT

This is an unique offer of career development in BAT Information and Digital Technology Hub in Poland (Warsaw office).

If you‘re driven and ambitious, our Global Graduate Programme in Information and Digital Technology will let you achieve your potential and give you the opportunity to become an outstanding leader in a world-class business. After the programme you’ll be prepared for managerial role in areas of Business Analysis, Project Management, Service/App support management.

If you’ve got what it takes, we’ll give you
  • 18-month program to prepare for managerial role after the programme and senior managerial roles in the future
  • a job with real impact on our progressive business
  • world-class leadership training in United Kingdom
  • development in dynamic and multinational environment
  • unique place to work and grow among professionals of our IDT Hub

About You
  • master’s degree in technology or business/economics with passion to IT
  • fresh graduate and/or professional with min. 1 year experience in digital (robotics process automation, web development, mobile applications, digital analytics, e-commerce, CRM/ marketing automation), technology engineering, cyber security
  • Agile/scrum - experience in project management would be a plus
  • ITIL - certification in Services area would be a plus
  • nationally and/or internationally mobile
  • fluent in English (both written & spoken)

It's tough. It's fast-paced and it'll stretch you to the limit. If you have what it takes, no other organization can offer a graduate experience like ours. The only question is are you up to the challenge?

APPLY

We are BAT! Our ambition and appetite for change help us to achieve great results and enables us to transform tobacco industry. Join us and shape your career in a truly progressive business!

British American Tobacco is one of the world’s leading multinational companies, with brands sold in over 200 markets, made in 44 factories in 42 countries.

We are proud that we are consistently among the top 5 companies on the London Stock Exchange.

Our portfolio includes our world-famous Global Drive Brands - Dunhill, Kent, Lucky Strike, Pall Mall and Rothmans - along with many other leading international brands, such as Vogue, Peter Stuyvesant and State Express 555.

Alongside our traditional tobacco business, we are also developing products that offer consumers potentially less risky alternatives to regular cigarettes. Our Next Generation Products are already leading the way in the Industry of vapour and tobacco heating devices. We continue to develop a solid portfolio of consumer solutions which already include well known global brands like Vype, glo and Voke.

Stanowisko ds. Podatków
Warszawa

  • umiejętność wykorzystywania przepisów w praktyce,

  • bardzo dobra znajomość pakietu MS Office.

Oferujemy
  • pracę u największego pracodawcy na rynku przewozów kolejowych,
  • benefity pozapłacowe m.in. zniżka na przejazdy kolejowe, pakiety medyczne i sportowe, dofinansowanie do nauki i szkoleń, dofinansowanie do wczasów,
  • dodatkowy dzień wolny w roku – Dzień Kolejarza 25.11.,
  • narzędzia niezbędne do pracy,
  • pracę w oparciu o umowa o pracę.

EMEA Credit&Collection Expert
  • Big, production and international company with new SSC structures in Warsaw!
  • Experience in AR, knowledge of SAP and advanced English are required
    • About Our Client
    Our client is an international company from the production sector that decided to open its SSC in Warsaw (Włochy district) around 1.5 year ago. Currently they are developing their AR team. The company is known for its open, supportive and international culture. They are offering dynamic environment and opportunity to participate in many interesting and challenging project. If you are interested in joining a company that will allow you to be creative and independent in your role - apply now - this position is for you!

    • Processing overdue trade receivables and outstanding disputes

    • Minimum 3 years of experience in the AR department including experience in credit & collection activities

    • Customer orientation

Description

JOB DESCRIPTION

Syncron is looking for a highly skilled, and motivated self-starter to manage Syncron’s contracts compliance management processes. The role will have the unique responsibility to build and manage the customer contract renewal and expansion process, with focus on recognising and creating business value for Syncron and our customers.

In this role, you will focus on ensuring that our customers, when utilising Syncron services, remain compliant with the service limitations and other value driving contract terms. You will be supporting the sales and customer success organisations to retain existing contracts, increase revenue, and provide a professional and proactive customer experience.

When performing your duties, you will cooperate closely with Sales, Customer Success, Finance and other departments to support discussions to renegotiate or expand the contractual relationships with existing customers.

The position is a new and exciting role in Syncron’s business, and you will have the opportunity to build an important part of Syncron’s future by helping to create and improve upon the processes that we use today.

Given the criticality of this role you will report directly to CFO and with a dotted line to Director Legal.

Responsibilities
  • Monitoring the use of the services vs contract terms and preparing a “Contract Compliance Report” on quarterly basis
  • Presenting to Customer Success Managers available contract expansion or renegotiation scenarios
  • Notifying Customer Success Managers about identified or anticipated non-compliance cases
  • Escalating to customers identified or anticipated non-compliance cases and contract expansion or renegotiation needs
  • Coordinating contract related discussions between Customer Success, Products, Expert Services, Legal teams and providing support during negotiations with customers
  • Support maximisation of revenue generation from the existing contracts database

Requirements
  • Minimum Bachelor’s Degree (economic, management or technical studies) and relevant work experience (minimum 5 years of contract management experience)
  • Attention to detail in managing deadlines, analyzing documents and completing tasks
  • Fluency in using Excel and PowerPoint
  • Ability to see a bigger picture when analyzing detailed issues
  • Focus on providing accurate, high-quality and business-oriented input
  • Creative, solution-oriented mindset, in particular, when faced with challenging issues
  • Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills
  • Proactive, self-motivated and constructive approach to work
  • Proven ability to work in a dynamically changing, global environment
  • Business experience with SaaS and subscription contracts will be a plus

As data controller of your personal data, we are required to provide you with several information to foster your data privacy rights. Please read them here.

whole_unnormalized_body:
This is a divestiture project involving carve-out of IT systems /applications for Finance applications. The selected candidate will have an opportunity to learn about the process of divestiture with IT systems and applications set-up, then work for a newly carved out IT organization.  

 

Requirements:

 

·       Manager with 6yrs+ experience working in a global team

·       Experience of managing global application/services or implementation projects.

·       Experience in any one of the following technologies :

o   Microsoft : .NET, SQL /SQL Server, MS SSAS, MS SSRS, Power BI, MS ProClarity

o   SharePoint

o   Java /J2EE

o   Oracle Hyperion

·       Background in Finance Domain particularly in areas of Accounting, Controlling, Tax, Treasury and managing applications related to these sub-domains

·       Thorough knowledge of IT service management concepts (ITIL).

·       Fluent spoken and written English

·       Strong negotiation, facilitation and consensus building skills

·       Ability to promote a team environment with strong leadership skills

·       At least Bachelor’s Degree in information systems, electrical or mechanical engineering

·       High sense of responsibility and commitment

·       Systematic approach and business-oriented mindset combined with good articulation skills

·       Self-driven personality

·       Background in Finance Domain particularly in areas of Accounting, Controlling, Tax, Treasury and managing applications related to these sub-domains

 

Responsibilities:

·       Solutions: On assignment identifies, proposes, advises and implements existing IS application technology and IS solutions/services, sharing knowledge and guiding others on implementation and operation, using understanding of existing IS application technology and business requirements.

·       Delivery: is involved in the installation, management, maintenance, and optimization of IS solutions/services in regards of application knowledge. Is responsible for operations framework integrating Service Monitoring, Event, Incident, Problem, Change Control, Configuration Management, Service Remediation, and Service Level Agreements

·       Processes: Proactively supports the installation, management, maintenance, and optimization of internal and cross-functional processes related to IS solutions/services.

·       Governance: For assigned tasks, executes all actions in IS processes according to agreed RACIS specification.

·       Strategy: Manages assigned budget effectively and delivers activities within agreed schedules and costs. Participates in the definition of costs and schedules.

·       People leadership and development: Provides leadership to temporary work teams, guiding and monitoring task completion, sharing expert knowledge and advice normally without carrying line responsibility

·       Manage application from its initial planning, development through retirement (decommissioning).

·       Monitor everyday operations of application development team and provide regular feedback.

·       Work with business and IT teams and manage all project requirements.

·       Manage, plan, schedule and control an application or platform build through different stages (including testing and deploying) and environments.

·       Support and monitor efficient work of analysts and application specialists.

·       Collaborate with architects, quality testers, application specialist to achieve quality deliverables.

·       Consider and manage IT controls, regulatory and legal requirements while designing, delivering and running platforms, applications and services

·       Manage budget for one or more global applications and deliver activities within agreed schedules and costs.

·       Review service level reports for internal and external delivery parties and organize service performance meeting.

·       Negotiate release strategy and release scope with vendor and drive vendor performance and contract management.

·       Identify new opportunities for services provided

·       Solutions: On assignment identifies, proposes, advises and implements existing IS application technology and IS solutions/services, sharing knowledge and guiding others on implementation and operation, using understanding of existing IS application technology and business requirements.

·       Delivery: is involved in the installation, management, maintenance, and optimization of IS solutions/services in regards of application knowledge. Is responsible for operations framework integrating Service Monitoring, Event, Incident, Problem, Change Control, Configuration Management, Service Remediation, and Service Level Agreements

·       Processes: Proactively supports the installation, management, maintenance, and optimization of internal and cross-functional processes related to IS solutions/services.

·       Governance: For assigned tasks, executes all actions in IS processes according to agreed RACIS specification.

·       Strategy: Manages assigned budget effectively and delivers activities within agreed schedules and costs. Participates in the definition of costs and schedules.

·       People leadership and development: Provides leadership to temporary work teams, guiding and monitoring task completion, sharing expert knowledge and advice normally without carrying line responsibility

·       Manage application from its initial planning, development through retirement (decommissioning).

·       Monitor everyday operations of application development team and provide regular feedback.

·       Work with business and IT teams and manage all project requirements.

·       Manage, plan, schedule and control an application or platform build through different stages (including testing and deploying) and environments.

·       Support and monitor efficient work of analysts and application specialists.

·       Collaborate with architects, quality testers, application specialist to achieve quality deliverables.

·       Consider and manage IT controls, regulatory and legal requirements while designing, delivering and running platforms, applications and services

·       Manage budget for one or more global applications and deliver activities within agreed schedules and costs.

·       Review service level reports for internal and external delivery parties and organize service performance meeting.

·       Negotiate release strategy and release scope with vendor and drive vendor performance and contract management.

·       Identify new opportunities for services provided

Junior
SysAdmin

Warszawa, Pl. Europejski 1 (Warsaw Spire)

począwszy od fazy koncepcyjnej przez rozwój aż po wprowadzenie produktu na rynek.

w obszarach takich jak: business intelligence, FinTech czy B2B SaaS.
Pełne portfolio naszych spółek dostępne jest na stronie: daftcode.com.

Osoby, która będzie wspierać nasz zespół Adminów w opiece i administrowaniu

odpowiedzialna za utrzymanie ciągłości pracy biura.

  • usług takich jak DHCP, DNS, SMTP, LDAP/AD, RADIUS, NAC
  • rozwiązań MDM
  • sieci na poziomie CCNA
  • protokołów IPSEC, SSLVPN
  • sieci WiFi i metod AAA (802.1x)

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

My name is Michał Dzoga. I am a manager with over 20 years of experience in large multinational organization as well as government sector. I have been working for Intel since 2010. Currently I hold a position of Intel Government & Corporate Affairs Director in charge of Europe Region, in the Programs, Partnerships and Policy Group based in Warsaw. I am looking for a Government Programs Intern who would like to help us implement nation-wide endeavors in Poland and beyond.
In this position, you will have an opportunity to work in a diverse, multinational environment, learn best practices in project management and build invaluable network of contacts with multinational stakeholders for your future career. You will be responsible, among others, for planning and execution of large-scale skills improvement programs related to Artificial Intelligence that go far beyond traditional or current industry approaches.

Intern responsibilities will include:
  • Developing program management and communication skills under supervision of experienced managers
  • Designing, planning and implementing strategic multi-stakeholder programs in the areas of new technologies
  • Mastering stakeholder management with key players in Intel's external ecosystem: government, academia and corporate partners
  • Continuously learning and deep diving into Artificial Intelligence domain (from the concept perspective not engineering angle)

Qualifications
  • excellent organizational skills, ability to implement and track multiple tasks with attention to detail
  • event planning and basic project management skills foundations are welcomed
  • high motivation with good time management skills and ability to take responsibility for certain tasks
  • fluent English written & spoken, minimum advanced level, handles computer well office software (flawless knowledge of PowerPoint, Word and Excel required)
  • strong written/verbal communication skills (ability to put key messages in concise, inclusive form)
  • ability to work well in an international team and business environment (openness, tolerance, empathy)
  • ability to handle confidential information frequently and appropriately
  • preferably 3rd year+ undergraduate of fields related to economy, management, international affairs with internship experience
  • minimum 3 full days of office availability, extension possibility after summer holidays welcomed
  • minimum one year commitment, open to possibility of extension to two or more years

What We Offer:

At Intel, you come to work in a collaborative, supportive environment, where your equally brilliant colleagues will push you to be your best. There's no fear of failure-we know that's how innovation happens. And you'll never be bored.

We offer competitive benefits and pay, opportunities for professional development and the flexibility you need to achieve balance. Intel fosters a collaborative environment allowing the brightest minds in the world to come together to achieve exceptional results.

Besides regular duties you can:
  • Take advantage of various career development activities.
  • Participate in various innovation-focused activities (innovation lab, collaboration events, and patent submissions writing).
  • Have a chance to participate in Intel Great Place to Work program which gathers people who love running, cycling, squash, tennis, cross fit, photography, and many more.
  • Relax during energetic team events (skiing, scuba diving, kayaking, etc.)

Base salary is accompanied with such additional benefits as bonuses, private medical plan, life insurance, lunch coupons, and more.

Inside this Business Group

Global Public Policy (GPP) is responsible for+hartered to devise and execute geo-specific influencing strategies and build local working relationships with policy makers in support of Intel's business strategies.

job_description_details.Industry: Electrical & Electronic Manufacturing Computer Software Semiconductors

whole_unnormalized_body:
Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Our Employees

Are valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to a global mindset.

Position Summary

The SOC Analyst will work collaboratively with other seasoned engineers & analysts in a fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for managing cloud-based security systems on behalf of F5 clients, providing real time mitigation and resolution of security events while keeping all information well documented. The SOC Analyst provides real-time incident management of DDoS or other security attacks targeting F5 clients. An effective analyst will be passionate about security, delivering efficient and outstanding service during critical security events. A passionate approach is a must in order to handle multiple attacks in a short time.

Attractions Of The Job

The F5 Security Operations Centre is the critical core of the F5 Silverline Security Portfolio. The SOC is part of a dynamic and highly technical operations team. Our Analysts assist many top companies across the globe in a variety of industries on infrastructure that is vital to their business operations. You will work side-by-side with some of the best security analysts in the world, using the best security products available, defending against attacks in real-time, analyzing trends in the industry, and developing new protections against a variety of threats and vulnerabilities.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Provide F5 customers with outstanding & rapid reaction to real-time alerts
  • Take proactive and reactive steps to mitigate Layer 4-7 security attacks or threats against F5 clients
  • Engage directly with F5 clients who are under attack via phone, chat, email and/or ticketing systems.
  • Provide real-time guidance to customers on network configuration, security settings and policies, and attack mitigation procedures
  • Document actions taken in Security Information and Event Management systems, knowledge base, or ticketing systems as required
  • Earn trusted advisor status internally and externally
  • Provision new customers or update the provisioning for existing customers
  • Interface with and support cross-functional teams
  • Collaborate with Product Management on requirements and product release activities
  • Identify, define and implement process and procedure improvements
  • Ensures documented processes and procedures are kept up to date

Other Responsibilities
  • Responsible for upholding F5's Business Code of Ethics and for promptly reporting violations of the Code or other company policies.
  • Comply with F5's information security policies and protect information assists from unauthorised access, disclosure, modification, destruction or interference.
  • Responsible for promptly reporting security or potential events or other security risks to F5.
  • Performs other related duties and projects as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Knowledge and proven experience in DDoS Mitigation with the ability to gather, interpret and explain log files from a variety of sources.
  • Demonstrated experience in a technical support role, experience working with Customer Support and Service Management portals, including provisioning, reporting, and configuration.
  • Ability to define, configure, and manage (in real-time and on production networks) security policies protecting against bots, SQL injection, cross-site scripting, RFC compliance, signature protection, web scraping, CSRF, brute force, cookie manipulation, parameter tampering and other Layer 4-7 attacks/vulnerabilities.
  • High degree understanding of HTTP, XML and AJAX
  • Experience in working in an enterprise environment (understanding how web application environments are built)
  • White/black list management
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Experience supporting corporate customers in production environments
  • Must be able to relay technical information to customers with different levels of technical competence
  • Proficiency in Windows OS and Microsoft Office
  • Zendesk CRM or similar ticketing system experience preferred
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet stretch goals
  • Ability to work independently in a results-oriented environment
  • Analytical thinker with strong attention to detail
  • Strong troubleshooting/problem-solving ability; ability to create efficient solutions to complex problems
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to read, write and speak English fluently, including technical concepts and terminology. Fluency in additional languages is desirable
  • Must be able to relay technical information with customers with varying skill levels
  • Experience with F5 hardware, software, and utilities like iRules, iApps, and iControl a plus

Qualifications
  • Experience in the Security Field.
  • Prior SOC or NOC experience.
  • Strong background in customer service and incident management.
  • Ability to excel in a face paced, challenging, technical operations environment with 24x7 shifts.
  • Prior experience in Information Security.
  • Computer Science and/or graduate degree preferred, or equivalent experience.
  • Must be able to communicate fluently in English (written and oral). Multi-lingual a plus.
  • Ability to work shifts.

Physical Demands And Work Environment
  • Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone and read printed material.
  • Working in an environment where work hours are scheduled shifts but your position is a full time position. This role may be required to work outside of core business hours, including holidays.
Work hours are scheduled shifts - employees will be expected to work a shift pattern covering extended business hours.

The successful candidate will be required to have flexibility to travel to the US for 2-4 weeks on boarding and technical training will be required.

The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.

Equal Employment Opportunity

It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.
