Abbott Diagnostics Division is looking for an
Medical Research Coordinator

To Be Based In Any Of The Following Countries

Poland, Romania, Serbia, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Slovenia, Croatia, Greece, Hungary

In this position you will be responsible for managing clinical studies form beginning to completion with respect to Investigator Initiated Studies, Collaborative Studies and some Abbott Sponsored studies for the Medical and Scientific Affairs group.

You verify the needed resources and funding for the study as well as coordinate reagents and instrumentation as needed for study timelines.

Core Job Responsibilities
  • Receive proposals from potential investigators
  • Review proposals with Medical Director
  • Verify resources and funding
  • Initiate agreements
  • Coordinate reagents and instrumentation availability for study timelines
  • Monitor study progress
  • Verify all study related documentation (IIS forms, IRB approvals, Investigator debarment screening, etc.)
  • File documentation and upload to central repository
  • Provide timely reports to Medical Director
Minimum Education

  • Bachelors and/or advanced degree preferred
  • With scientific/clinical background focus preferred

    • Minimum Experience/Training Required
    • At least 6 months clinical study management experience in Academia, Industry or Clinical Setting.
    • Industry experience preferred.

Opis firmy

AUTOHERO to jeden z europejskich liderów sprzedaży samochodów używanych. Nasz marka obecna jest już w aż dziewięciu krajach - Polsce, Niemczech, Austrii, Szwecji, Holandii, Belgii, Francji, Włoszech oraz Hiszpanii. Łącznie w ofercie mamy ponad 2.500 samochodów osobowych. W Polsce nasz flagowy salon sprzedaży znajduje się w hali kultowej fabryki FSO - wszystkie oferowane samochody znajdują się na zadaszonej przestrzeni, co jest ogromnym wyjątkiem w skali europejskiej. Wszystkie nasze samochody są sprawdzone przez niezależnych rzeczoznawców, a każdy klient otrzymuje od nas bezpłatną roczną gwarancję na swój samochód.

Jako pierwsza marka na rynku, oferujemy klientom możliwość zakupu samochodu w pełni online wraz z ekspresową dostawą samochodu pod wskazany adres na terenie całego kraju.

Specjalista ds. obsługi klienta, którego szukamy to pierwsza linia kontaktu z naszymi potencjalnymi klientami. Jest to rola w ramach, której klienci dowiedzą się czym jest Autohero oraz otrzymają wstępne informacje dotyczące oferowanych samochodów. Jako Autohero, oferujemy klientom wyjątkowo atrakcyjne formy finansowania kupowanych samochodów, a Twoim zadaniem będzie również sprzedaż i procesowanie wniosków finansowych w oparciu o atrakcyjny system bonusowy.

Opis stanowiska

Jakie będą Twoje zadania?
  • Obsługa klientów Autohero - w salonie, telefonicznie, mailowo - zgodnie ze standardami firmy
  • Sprzedaż i procesowanie wniosków finansowych i ubezpieczeniowych
  • Obsługa posprzedażowa i badanie satysfakcji klientów
  • Wsparcie zespołu sprzedaży w procesowaniu transakcji sprzedażowych
Co możesz nam zaoferować?
  • Doświadczenie w sprzedaży produktów finansowych i ubezpieczeniowych
  • Komunikatywność, otwartość, umiejętność pracy w zespole
  • Zainteresowanie branżą samochodową będzie dodatkowym atutem
  • Umiejętność obsługi komputera i pakietu MS Office / Google Suite
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie komunikatywnym
  • Pewność siebie i profesjonalizm w kontaktach z klientami, odpowiedzialność oraz postawa wzbudzająca zaufanie
Co my możemy zaoferować Tobie?
  • Pracę w dynamicznie rozwijającej się międzynarodowej firmie w branży motoryzacyjnej
  • Stabilne warunki zatrudnienia na cały etat w oparciu o umowę o pracę
  • Wynagrodzenie oparte na podstawie i premii uzależnionej od indywidualnych wyników pracy
  • Oferta pracownicza - zakup samochodów na preferencyjnych warunkach cenowych
  • Bardzo pozytywny i zmotywowany zespół z szybką ścieżką decyzyjną
  • Benefity pozapłacowe (karta sportowo-rekreacyjna, opieka medyczna, ubezpieczenie grupowe i wiele więcej)

Informacje Dodatkowe

Jeśli jesteś zmotywowany i lubisz wyzwania - czekamy na Ciebie!

Opis firmy

AUTOHERO to jeden z europejskich liderów sprzedaży samochodów używanych. Nasz marka obecna jest już w aż dziewięciu krajach - Polsce, Niemczech, Austrii, Szwecji, Holandii, Belgii, Francji, Włoszech oraz Hiszpanii. Łącznie w ofercie mamy ponad 2.500 samochodów osobowych. W Polsce nasz flagowy salon sprzedaży znajduje się w hali kultowej fabryki FSO - wszystkie oferowane samochody znajdują się na zadaszonej przestrzeni, co jest ogromnym wyjątkiem w skali europejskiej. Wszystkie nasze samochody są sprawdzone przez niezależnych rzeczoznawców, a każdy klient otrzymuje od nas bezpłatną roczną gwarancję na swój samochód.

Government Affairs Manager - MICROSOFT CENTRAL & EASTERN EUROPE

Poland

Microsoft is recruiting a professional to manage its corporate affairs work in Poland. The professional will act as general adviser and key partner to the business on corporate, government and industry affairs issues. The position in based preferably in Warsaw.

The professional will work as part of the CEE Corporate, External Legal Affairs team that includes government affairs professionals, attorneys, investigators and administrators. The candidate will directly report to the Government Affairs Lead in CEE and also work closely with the other government affairs professionals for the region.

The successful candidate will have at least six years relevant experience in the areas of public policy and government affairs. Experience and/or relationships with key government officials is a plus. Fluency (written and spoken) in Polish and English is required, knowledge of another language of the region would be an additional value.

Responsibilities

The Government Affairs Manager acts as general adviser to business leadership on legal and corporate affairs issues affecting the subsidiary in Poland and several other Eastern European countries.
  • The Manager creates ties with governments, industry and community organizations to support the company’s public policy objectives. He also provides strategic advice on opportunities and trends in public policy to subsidiary business leaders. In addition, he manages Microsoft’s country-specific community outreach, community affairs and philanthropy programs.
  • Specific corporate affairs responsibilities of the position include:
  • Developing, orchestrating and implementing, in partnership with the Government Affairs Lead and other key stakeholder groups in the Company, the strategy planning with the aim to positively shape the debate and public policy outcomes on issues important to the ICT industry.
  • Managing the budget; this includes allocation of money to countries/projects in alignment with the overall strategy.
  • Working in close partnership with the Company’s public relations team to develop effective internal and external communications strategies.
  • Externally representing the Company in small and large group settings to promote the Company’s and the industry’s position on important public policy issues.
  • Working closely with the Microsoft leadership team in the region to keep them well informed on public policy issues, debates and trends and providing proactive advice on the impact and relevance of these issues to the Company’s businesses.
  • Being a leading voice for the Company in (and building and strengthening the Company’s relationship with) industry partners, trade associations, advocacy organizations, multi-lateral organizations, and industry coalitions to more effectively shape and advance the industry’s position on important public policy issues.
  • Identifying new and emerging legal and regulatory issues that may affect Microsoft’s businesses in the region. Coordinating with internal and external legal and non-legal expert resources, as necessary, to help analyze and address such issues in the implementation of the company’s business strategy.

Qualifications

Key Experience:
  • A minimum of six years of relevant professional activity in Poland, combining government affairs, public policy and public relations.
  • Experience in building and managing relationships with key government officials.
  • A combination of private and public sector work experience.
  • A strong understanding of business issues and thinking.
  • A proven record of cross-group collaboration.

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 5 year studies at university in the areas of law, economics, communications, political science, international affairs or equivalent is strongly preferred.
  • Excellent written and spoken Polish and English. Additional language from the region is a plus.

The Successful Candidate Will
  • Have the ability to work proactively and independently while also being capable of working and contributing in a collegial team situation within the subsidiary and across the region.
  • Help grow business opportunities through application of public policy.
  • Manage a broad workload across corporate, government and industry affairs issues to enable and support Microsoft’s priorities in CEE.
  • Adapt to a changing environment with creative solutions in support of local and regional business directions.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

whole_unnormalized_body:
For our Warsaw offices, we are looking for a Functional Consultant.

Your Responsibilities
  • Support both local and international projects for implementation of WKFS’ solutions, working in multi-national WKFS teams and providing functional knowledge on banking. Full availability to travel is therefore essential.
  • Handle functional designs; test and modify new and existing specific risk and reporting solutions for customers
  • Provide support for existing implementations and as well provide the solution for dedicated problems at customer side
  • Develops functional analysis responsive to regulators and projects specific requirements and adapts to specific customer developments
  • Regularly reports to the Project Manager in order to inform about all issues related to the projects he/she is participating
  • Participates on testing, documentation, preparation and execution of client training and workshops
  • Support the pre-sales and support team if needed
  • Participate on analyses requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints
    • Qualifications And Skillset

    Education: Bachelor degree (or higher) in Economics/Financial Science/Banking

    Essential
    • At least 2-3 years of experience in risk management (Market Risk, ALM, Liquidity Risk) preferably gained from working within a banking organization, consulting companies, or from providing similar solutions to financial services institutions
    • Knowledge of options pricing models, financial instruments pricing
    • Solid understanding of Economic Capital regulations and methodologies, Credit Risk and Credit Risk Portfolio, regulations will be an asset
    • Knowledge of Project Management methodologies and experience gained on the projects will be huge asset
    • Have track-record of working in a financial services environment in the area of risk management
    • Willingness to travel and complete work on customer sites as required
    • Fluency in Polish and English, written and oral


      • Desirable
      • Sound understanding of risk management principles preferably gained from working with a risk management software vendor
      • Previous experience in international consulting roles ideally bringing with you a trackrecord in project/scope management gained from working directly with clients/customers
      • Fluency in other European languages (especially Russian, German, French, etc) will be a huge asset.
        • Personall Skills
        • Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
        • Responsible, methodical and organised
        • Self-learner who is motivated to be part of a dynamic, multi-cultural and geographically distributed team environment
        • Assertive, being able to make expert decisions based on personal judgement and to convince others of the rationale for your choice
        • Team-oriented player.
        • Flexible to travel up to 50% of the time.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Financial Planning & Analysis Lead



This role is mainly responsible for Financial Planning, Analysis and Reporting activities including but not limited to month-end closing activities to support the managerial reporting for the commercial operations. The lead will work closely with the Finance Directors in the finance support to ensure timely and quality finance deliverable.


Responsibilities:



  • Ability to lead and develop a team responsible for the budget and forecast process
  • Oversee the daily management of the Center of Excellence activities which includes the interaction with the business partners, finance colleagues and the direct supervision of his/her team; ensuring the objectives for finance are achieved
  • Ability to move from strategic to operational
  • Process and standardisation focus
  • Ability to work with other functions. Serve as key point of contact with International Cluster Finance Directors and Commercial leadership by Market
  • Result oriented with people focus



Requirements:

  • 8 to 10 years of experience in finance or accounting preferable with a multinational company
  • Hands-on finance experience in preparing budgets, forecast and managing financials
  • Strong commercial and / or decision support experience in financial planning and analyses, forecasting, and management reporting and analytics
  • Demonstrated proficiency in Accounting
  • Working knowledge of SAP
  • Experience with internal controls and process standardization



We offer:

  • Contract of employment
  • Benefits package
  • Flexible working hours
  • Possibility to work remotely from home on selected days
  • Modern office space with fresh fruit deliveries and gaming room



If you meet requirements described above, please send your application in English by clicking on the Apply button.

Only chosen candidates will be asked to participate in this recruitment process.




Zoetis is the leading animal health company, dedicated to supporting its customers and their businesses. Building on more than 65 years of experience in animal health, Zoetis discovers, develops, manufactures and commercializes medicines, vaccines and diagnostic products, which are complemented by biodevices, genetic tests and a range of services. Zoetis serves veterinarians, livestock producers and people who raise and care for farm and companion animals with sales of its products in more than 100 countries. In 2018, the company generated annual revenue of $5.8 billion with approximately 10,000 employees. For more information, visit www.zoetis.com.

Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.

Position Description

In collaboration with the Elanco Affiliate organization and Order to Cash Operations, the Quality Manager leads the implementation, maintenance and operations of the Quality system for the Elanco Solutions Center (ESC), and escalates any quality matters relating to the appropriate affiliate and ESC management, Regional Quality Director or Corporate management when needed.

The Quality Manager will provide independent quality oversight ESC GxP activities and decisions in collaboration with the Affiliate Quality organization and ensure specific Affiliate requirements are met.

The Quality Manager will represent the ESC Quality organization within ESC, ensure active communication with the Affiliate Quality Organization and maintain a strong working relationship inside and outside of ESC.

Functions, Duties, Task
  • Manage the Quality Systems in place to support activities managed through ESC comply with the applicable GxP, other applicable company quality standards and local regulations
  • Manage Quality Management activities within the ERP (SAP) system associated to Customers and Material Master (QM Power user & QM Data Steward activities)
  • Accountable for Quality Management activities including but not limited to Recall activities, Product Complaint management, Customer License management, Inventory management (expiration, returns, adjustments)
  • Demonstrate continuous improvement and minimize risk by a routine self-assessment, corrective and preventative actions (CAPA), and use of a Quality Plan
  • Ensure Audit preparation and observation completion
  • Raise Notifications to Management, if and when required
  • Accountable for the completion & accuracy of operational quality tasks, including but not limited to deviations management, change control management, quality document management and maintenance of the Quality Plan, Quality Agreements
  • Monitor, trend, interpret & report on Quality metrics
  • Help and give guidance on resolution of Quality issues, as applicable
  • Develop local talent to sustain competitiveness; this includes coaching employees; developing and implementing impactful training plans; managing & evaluating performance against expectations / scorecard
  • Comply with all company local and global policies including Quality frameworks, Code of Conduct, Corporate Citizenship, anti-discrimination, harassment, and health, safety and environment (HSE) policies
  • Perform any other duties or serve in such other capacity as may be determined by Company management

Experience
  • Bachelor degree in pharmacy, science, engineering, or related field and / or relevant experience
  • Fluent in English (written & verbal)
  • Demonstrated leadership / influencing skills in a cGxP environment; preferably within a Quality role. Typically over 3-5 years. Examples of cGxP environments could include manufacturing, warehouse management, affiliate quality.
  • Ability to both lead and support; and a track record of business partnering with internal stakeholders
  • Effective communications (written/verbal), presentation and facilitation skills
  • Interpersonal savvy, with the capacity to build strong relationships at a senior level
  • Demonstrated analytical & investigational skills
  • Effective organizational and planning skills; managing near term priorities & strategic aspirations
  • Experienced in both Microsoft Office and SAP
  • Inventory management and QM data knowledge highly regarded.
Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

position: Compliance QA Game Tester (Online recruitment process)
whole_unnormalized_body:
Requirements
  • Minimum 6 months of experience in compliance games testing;
  • Working knowledge of XR, TRC or Lotcheck certification requirements;
  • Good understanding of quality assurance processes;
  • Good knowledge of English (min. B2);
  • Ability to meet deadlines;
  • Excellent attention to detail;
  • Patience and persistence for repetitive work.


Scope Of Services
  • Executes assigned tests accurately and sufficiently to have confidence in documented results;
  • Reports results in a clear and concise manner into a bug database;
  • Regresses assigned issues and validates that the issues have been addressed correctly;
  • Escalates any issues preventing/impacting test execution;
  • Provides feedback regarding test approach and test case improvement.


We Offer
  • professional development opportunities in a multi-cultural environment - Lionbridge has offices in over 20 countries and many of these offices work collaboratively on projects, exposing our employees to a wide range of cultures and work styles
  • ability to cope with latest technologies
  • work in a creative team and good working environment
  • employment contract or contract of mandate (you may choose what kind of cooperation is best for you!)


This is an on-site job in the Warsaw office - remote work is not possible.
We do not sponsor visa or a work permit for this role.

We kindly inform that Lionbridge reserves right to contact only selected candidates.

position: HR Operations Associate (Fixed term for 2 years)
whole_unnormalized_body:
Role Summary:To provide professional & proactive HR time & attendance administration support to the GE businesses as part of the People Operations team in Poland.
Essential Responsibilities:HR Administration (90%)
  • maintain (verify, enter data to T&A system, return to employee if correction needed, archive) employee time & attendance documentation (sick leaves, special leaves, overtime, childcare leave etc) in accordance with local labor legislation & Data Privacy regulations
  • maintain internal time & attendance system – data entry & update, customer query support, advisor for the users; reporting
  • processing e-forms including verification, data entry and passing information to appropriate teams
  • Ensure that high standards of accuracy and quality are maintained with appropriate controls in place, taking accountability for compliance with defined HR processes, relevant legal and GE policy requirements
  • Other regular or ad-hoc HR Administrative tasks including supporting benefits or new starter administration, maintaining personnel files or processing purchase orders
  • Creation/maintenance of internal documentation on HR processes
  • Support other team members in their activities in area of HR Operations, Payroll, Benefits and HR projects
HR/Employee Partnership (10%)
  • Act proactively to contact with internal customers or colleagues to ensure timely resolution of transactions or queries
  • Actively seek customer feedback & use it to improve our processes
  • Deliver on commitments, manage expectations & keep customers informed on progress – taking clear accountability and ownership throughout the process
  • Act urgently in case of any non-standard situations which require non-standard solutions
Qualifications/Requirements:Core KPI’s:
  • Quality & accuracy measures
  • Timeliness of work
  • Feedback from GE employees, HR Managers and People Leaders on efficiency, professionalism & helpfulness
  • Compliance & Controllership: zero compliance breach
Desired Characteristics:Essential
  • Ability to prioritise multiple tasks & work to deadlines
  • Comfortable delivering against quantitative and qualitative performance metrics
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Proven ability to work professionally & proactively with a remote client base
  • Fluency in local language (Polish) and English, with polite, professional communication skills
  • Ability to anticipate and resolve challenges
  • IT skills in area of MS Windows, Outlook, Excel, Word; fluent computer usage
  • Confidentiality & controllership mindset
  • Supportive and enthusiastic team player
  • University or college graduate
Optional
  • Experience with using Workday; Oracle HR; RB Payroll; Replicon; SAP HR
  • Experience is administrative tasks (best in HR Operations / T&A / payroll / PPK&PPE)
  • Experience in work at SSC and/or global organization
  • Experience in RPA (UI Path)
  • Being open for a continuous and ad-hoc changes of the processes, service model and tools
About Us:GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.comAdditional Locations:Poland;Warsaw;

Job Description

Job Purpose

Takes responsibility and manage whole tender offer preparation process – search, preparation and submission of offers. Is point of contact for customers in the area of tenders affairs. Coordinates of tender department work and represents it internally and externally.

Key Performance Areas
  • Prepare and submit tender offers
  • Build correct and updated tender related documents database

Key Functions/Tasks
  • Monitor and gather information regarding upcoming tenders
  • Take responsibility and coordinate the whole tender offer preparation and submission process
  • Prepare and submit tender offers correctly and on time
  • Communicate with customers in tender related affairs
  • Coordinate work within tender department
  • Is point of contact for customers and internal stakeholders in things related to tenders
  • Work closely with sales teams and QARA manager in relation to tenders
  • Represent tender department internally and externally
  • Update tender database
  • Update tender-related documents database on S+N network drive; ensures the database is complete and up to date
  • Give ideas and implement new and more effective solutions related to tenders processing and archiving
  • Learn about and share internally novelties in tender law

Requirements
  • Education: higher
  • Experience of 3+ year work in tender department
  • Experience in medical devices or healthcare area will be an advantage
  • Practical knowledge of the Public Procurement Law
  • Good work organization; able to work under time pressure
  • Accurate, meticulous, structured and organized personality; reliable in preparing documentation
  • Analytical skills
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Able to work in a team
  • English on at least intermediate level in spoken and writing
for this position we offer
  • private health care | multisport card | life insurance
  • annual bonus | sharesave plan |
  • caring, collaborative and courageous business environment

We're looking for a motivated and driven Junior Regional Operations Manager who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

Your Tasks – Paint the world green
  • You support the technical and operational preparation of Bus Partners for the launch of their lines
  • You manage assigned lines including ensuring punctuality and additional services
  • You ensure the optimization and enhancement of connections in accordance with FlixBus standards
  • You train bus drivers in terms of daytime and night service lines for FlixBus
  • You provide our Bus Partners with support in all technical and operational matters
  • You are responsible for the flawless and timely implementation of various operational projects
  • You carry out inspections of vehicles and drivers' work as necessary
  • You provide support for solving crisis situations (failures, accidents)
  • You provide support to the operational team in other tasks as needed
  • You regularly report on your work, results, project statuses while keeping all relevant stakeholders informed, signaling next steps and following up when needed

Your Profile – Ready to hop on board
  • Bachelor or higher degree in a relevant field (transport, logistics, civil engineering, economics, management etc.)
  • A proven track record of strong results in a similar role, preferably in the transport industry
  • Fluency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Fluent Polish - very good level of English (min. B2)
  • Readiness for business trips - approx. 20% of working time
  • Accuracy and punctuality in carrying out tasks
  • Ability to juggle multiple tasks and projects with strict deadlines
  • Strong drive, self-motivated, accountable
  • Ability to make decisions and act autonomously while escalating when necessary
  • Certificate of professional competence in passenger transport - nice to have/not essential
  • Previous team management would be a strong plus (a desire to develop as a people manager is needed)
  • The ability to adequately deal with different stakeholders (business partners, bus drivers, station managers, or regional authorities) with high social and negotiation skills

Our Perks – More than just a job
  • Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride.
  • Trust-based working. We don't punch the clock – organize your own schedule. We trust in what you do!
  • Push boundaries. Everyone is equally important and works together on uncharted challenges alongside inspiring colleagues from all over the world.
  • Fun at work and beyond. Discover the world with your free FlixBus rides and join our regular team events – there's always something to celebrate!
  • Feel at home. We provide you with a laptop, comfortable working space, free drinks, a casual dress code, diverse employee discounts and more.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you!

About FlixMobility

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world – and our journey has just begun.

FlixMobility is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

30% of food produced is wasted. We are on a mission to change that.

Too Good To Go is a social impact company that reduces food waste by making surplus food from cafés, restaurants and supermarkets available to users. Our users purchase food through an app, collect locally and enjoy knowing they are saving food, money - and the planet!

We’re growing fast with 14 countries currently active and more coming, and we’ve just been named “Europe’s hottest startup 2019”. But here’s what really matters: through our app, we’ve saving one meal per second - currently, that means that more than 28 million meals have been saved from the bin -equalling more than 70 million kg of CO2 saved!

With our current country manager taking on new responsibilities in the company, we’re now looking for a new ‘Chief Waste Warrior’ to join our tribe and support our local team in Poland. You will be leading a team of 10+ Waste Warriors and have an established management team around you, leading the Sales, Success, Marketing, People&Culture and Key Account departments.

Ready to join the movement?
  • As Country Manager, you will be leading, supporting and challenging the local management team in scaling Too Good To Go in Poland
  • You will be the face and voice of Too Good To Go
  • You will steer the team in the right direction and keep the focus on ambitious growth goals
  • You will lead a young, ambitious team from diverse backgrounds and help them get to the next level
  • Beyond scaling our business, you will be a visionary about our mission. Dreaming of a world with no food waste, you will carry on a strategic positioning to truly influence food waste and the overall ecosystem

Personal attributes
  • You are a real leader. You have strong experience in leading a team and you’re the kind of inspiring leader people want to follow: you help your team reach their full potential and grow beyond.
  • You have a true passion for sustainability and fighting food waste as a must - you are driven by the urgency of change and action for the planet
  • You are fluent in Polish and English, other languages are a plus
  • You’re not just dreaming of a world without food waste, but you know how to get there by relying on data, facts and setting ambitious KPIs
  • You have a strong sense of teamwork and like to bring people together to build a strong, healthy and safe community for all
  • You have a results-oriented mind. You don’t mind hard work and love it when things move quickly, and you get the chance to do different things every day
  • You can prioritize tasks efficiently in order to meet competing deadlines
  • You’re not afraid to delegate and give your team additional responsibilities


Professional Skills
  • 5+ years of experience in a management position, preferably in a high-growth company
  • You have a solid sales/business development experience
  • Experience acquiring and working with Key Accounts/Corporate partners
  • Strong negotiation skills with which you can support your account managers and your Head of Sales
  • Leadership experience: you know how to recruit the best people and develop your existing team
  • Experience or a network in the food industry is a strong plus


What We Have To Offer
  • A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change
  • An international company with 500 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 13 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support!
  • Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment
  • An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity
  • A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together

How To Apply
  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go
  • We want to know how you work - if you have a video introduction or a link to a project you made thrive, then tell us about it!
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • The deadline is “the sooner the better”.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or Linkedin direct messaging

Background

The OSCE has a comprehensive approach to security that encompasses politico-military, economic and environmental, and human aspects. It therefore addresses a wide range of security-related concerns, including arms control, confidence- and security-building measures, human rights, national minorities, democratization, policing strategies, counter-terrorism and economic and environmental activities. All 57 participating States enjoy equal status, and decisions are taken by consensus on a politically, but not legally binding basis.

The Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR) is the principal institution of the OSCE responsible for the human dimension. ODIHR is active throughout the OSCE area in the fields of election observation, democratic development, human rights, tolerance and non-discrimination, and the rule of law. ODIHR's assistance projects and other activities are implemented in participating States in accordance with the ODIHR's mandate.

The Information Technology Unit provides support to ODIHR in the field of Information and Communication Technology, including information systems for technical programmes and management. It is responsible for planning, developing and implementing an ICT strategy, for setting and enforcing common ICT standards and for supporting local ICT serves and their users.

Tasks and Responsibilities

Under the direct supervision of the Second Deputy Director, the incumbent performs the following functions:
  • Managing the IT Infrastructure operations (systems, LAN/WAN, Helpdesk), business application systems, telecommunications, systems security, systems administration, user support for about 200 staff members, and limited systems support and development;
  • Preparing budgets, projections for ICT spending and ICT and Business Applications strategy and policies; monitoring the budget and procurement requirements of the Unit to ensure optimal planning and use of financial resources;
  • Managing hardware and software standards, planning capacity, evaluating and selecting the most appropriate and cost-effective hardware and networking infrastructure;
  • Providing recommendations for the development and management of business applications, information, resources, and technology to support the organization’s strategic goals and priorities;
  • Providing ICT guidance and support for ODIHRs field activities, observation missions, conferences, projects and tools for external customers, Coordinate together with the business units the design, implementation and continuous development of IT-tools and methodologies necessary to support the implementation of their mandate;
  • Making presentations to higher level management on ICT strategy, budget and related activities and advising and assisting Senior Management on the application of Information Technology services as a cost effective tool;
  • Providing leadership and managing the staff of the Unit to ensure the timely delivery of outputs and the availability of the right skills and competencies; monitoring staff performance and carry out performance appraisals, managing the continuous update and skills training for staff, particularly in relation to new ICT technologies and Applications developments, coordinating related work assignments and resource allocation;
  • Performing other duties as assigned.
    • For more detailed information on the structure and work of the OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights, please see https://www.osce.org/odihr

    Necessary Qualifications
    • First-level university degree in Computer Science or equivalent course of study; formal certification in ITIL and Project Management;
    • Minimum of six years of progressively responsible professional experience in the ICT area; managerial and versatile technical experience; experience of working for an international corporation or organization;
    • Excellent knowledge of English with highly-developed presentation and writing skills is essential; working knowledge of other OSCE languages is an asset;
    • Ability to work with people with different national, religious or cultural backgrounds.
    • Demonstrated gender awareness and sensitivity, and an ability to integrate a gender perspective into tasks and activities.


    Required competencies

    Core values
    • Commitment: Actively contributes to achieving organizational goals
    • Diversity: Respects others and values their diverse perspectives and contributions
    • Integrity: Acts in a manner consistent with the Organization’s core values and organizational principles
    • Accountability: Takes responsibility for own action and delegated work
    Core competencies
    • Communication: Actively works to achieve clear and transparent communication with colleagues and with stakeholders of the Organization
    • Collaboration: Works effectively with others on common goals and fosters a positive, trust-based working environment
    • Planning: Works towards the achievement of goals in a structured and measured manner
    • Analysis and decision-making: Analyses available information, draws well-founded conclusions and takes appropriate decisions
    • Initiative-taking: Proposes and initiates new ideas, activities and projects
    • Flexibility: Responds positively and effectively to changing circumstances
    Managerial competencies (for positions with managerial responsibilities)
    • Leadership: Provides a clear sense of direction, builds trust and creates an enabling environment
    • Strategic thinking: Identifies goals that advance the organizational agenda and develops plans for achieving them
    • Managing performance: Helps to maximize team performance by providing active feedback and skill development opportunities


    Remuneration Package

    Monthly remuneration is approximately EUR 5,342 depending on post adjustment and family status. OSCE salaries are exempt from taxation in Poland.

    Social benefits will include possibility of participation in the Cigna medical insurance scheme and the OSCE Provident Fund. The Organization contributes an amount equivalent to 15% of the employee's salary to this Fund and the employee contributes 7.5%. Other allowances and benefits are similar to those offered under the United Nations Common System.

    Appointments are normally made at step 1 of the applicable OSCE salary scale.

    How To Apply

    If you wish to apply for this position, please use the OSCE's online application link found under https://jobs.osce.org/vacancies .

    The OSCE retains the discretion to re-advertise/re-post the vacancy, to cancel the recruitment, to offer an appointment at a lower grade or to offer an appointment with a modified job description or for a different duration.

    Only those applicants who are selected to participate in the subsequent stages of recruitment will be contacted.

    Please note that vacancies in the OSCE are open for competition only amongst nationals of participating States, please see http://www.osce.org/states .

    The OSCE is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce, and encourages qualified female and male candidates from all religious, ethnic and social backgrounds to apply to become a part of the Organization.

    The OSCE is a non-career organization committed to the principle of staff rotation, therefore the maximum period of service in this post is 7 years.

    Please be aware that the OSCE does not request payment at any stage of the application and review process.

No Relocation Assistance Offered
# 81880 - Warsaw, Mazovia, Poland

Responsibilities
  • Coordination of projects across various domains and business functions;
  • Work with the Global Data Management Team, establish timelines, review resources requirements for project activities;
  • Lead change management activities for all affected resources, contribute to the organization, process and technology design, effectively communicate all aspects of the change and execute training programs within the division;
  • Conduct business processes analysis and mapping;
  • Track, report and communicate progress against plans;
  • Ensure Data Management business operations within the assigned scope of responsibility;
  • Develop and implement data management solutions, policies and procedures for the Divisions within the scope of the responsibility, ensuring quality, security, accessibility and availability of all relevant data;
  • Monitor service levels for the execution of creating, maintaining and archiving data management processes;
  • Monitor and report Key Performance Indicators for Data Quality and SLAs.

Qualifications
  • A University Degree;
  • 2-5 years of experience in master data, project management, supply chain or in customer service area
  • Fluent in English;
  • Practical knowledge of G Suite tools (Sheets, Docs, Slides), MS Office skills (Excel/Access);
  • SAP/MDG experience;
  • GDSN experience would be an asset;
  • Autonomous, results oriented, promoting team-work, problem solving;
  • Analytical skills;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Equal Opportunity Employer
Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Are you interested in working for Colgate-Palmolive? You can apply online and attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by e-mail are not considered in the selection process. Become part of our team. We look forward to your application.

Colgate-Palmolive is a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition. Colgate sells its products in over 200 countries and territories around the world under such internationally recognized brand names as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, Tom’s of Maine, Sorriso, Speed Stick, Lady Speed Stick, Softsoap, Irish Spring, Protex, Sanex, Elta MD, PCA Skin, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Science Diet and Hill’s Prescription Diet.

For more information about Colgate’s global business, visit the Company’s web site at http://www.colgatepalmolive.com. To learn more about Colgate Bright Smiles, Bright Futures® oral health education program, please visit http://www.colgatebsbf.com. To learn more about Hill's and the Hill’s Food, Shelter & Love program please visit http://www.hillspet.com. To learn more about Tom’s of Maine please visit http://www.tomsofmaine.com.

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject "Accommodation Request" should you require accommodation.

Lokalizacja: Warszawa, Centrum

Forma współpracy: B2B

Klient: Firma z branży technologicznej i usług informatycznych

Wynagrodzenie: do 140zł/h

Wymagania
  • Kilkuletnie doświadczenie programistyczne (najlepiej Scala lub Java)
  • Doświadczenie z TypeScript
  • Znajomość: aplikacji Lagom, chmury IBM, Apache Kafka, Jira, Git i Kubernetes
  • Doświadczenie w programowaniu w React.js
  • Doświadczenie w zarządzaniu zespołem IT (zarówno pod względem technicznym, jak i dyscyplinarnym, w różnych lokalizacjach)
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego
  • Mile widziana znajomość języka niemieckiego

Oferujemy
  • Prywatną opiekę zdrowotną
  • Elastyczne godziny pracy
  • Lekcje języka angielskiego
  • Wewnętrzne oraz zewnętrzne szkolenia
  • Projekty rozwoju oprogramowania dla światowych rynków
  • Siłownia, darmowe śniadania, strefa gier

Rekrutacja 100% online.

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Internet

whole_unnormalized_body:
Lokalizacja: Warszawa, Centrum

Forma współpracy: B2B

Klient: Firma z branży technologicznej i usług informatycznych

Wynagrodzenie: do 140zł/h

Wymagania
  • Kilkuletnie doświadczenie programistyczne (najlepiej Scala lub Java)
  • Doświadczenie z TypeScript
  • Znajomość: aplikacji Lagom, chmury IBM, Apache Kafka, Jira, Git i Kubernetes
  • Doświadczenie w programowaniu w React.js
  • Doświadczenie w zarządzaniu zespołem IT (zarówno pod względem technicznym, jak i dyscyplinarnym, w różnych lokalizacjach)
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego
  • Mile widziana znajomość języka niemieckiego

Oferujemy
  • Prywatną opiekę zdrowotną
  • Elastyczne godziny pracy
  • Lekcje języka angielskiego
  • Wewnętrzne oraz zewnętrzne szkolenia
  • Projekty rozwoju oprogramowania dla światowych rynków
  • Siłownia, darmowe śniadania, strefa gier

Rekrutacja 100% online.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Huuuge Games — We’re a global, fast-moving hyper-growing free-to-play game developer & publisher on a mission to empower billions of people to play together.


Join Huuuge Games and become our 2D Artist



Your everyday responsibilities will be as follow:

 

  • Developing and maintaining failure-free online services for games with a big player base
  • Effective communication with Scrum team members to solve complex technical challenges
  • Identifying opportunities for improvement and making constructive suggestions for changes


Your everyday responsibilities will be as follow:

  • Creates and/or enhances art assets, drawings, game themes, characters, backgrounds, objects and symbols for 2D games
  • Follow company art direction and production pipeline. Proposes approaches that compel positive enhancements to art direction and pipeline.
  • Participate in planning and milestone delivery for the assets
  • Participate in establishing and maintaining the highest visual quality for the game
  • Reporting directly to Art Director, working in a fast-paced, creative environment


What is important for us?

  • You are a passionate and creative artist
  • You are familiar and comfortable with working in casual game art styles
  • You are self-motivated and collaborative – you enjoy working with
  • Broad experience creating appealing 2D assets, characters, backgrounds
  • Ability to communicate, give and receive constructive feedback
  • Proficiency in Adobe CS Package (Photoshop etc.)
  • Understanding of the art production process for mobile games, from concept to final in-game assets
  • Strong visual design skills and an understanding of usability design principles.
  • Portfolio demonstrating relevant skills required
  • Must be willing to complete a simple test if required to do so


Surprise us with these additional assets:

  • Experience in the game industry
  • Knowledge of technical constraints, optimization, and implementation
  • Experience designing and implementing UI artwork for mobile games
  • Skills in 2D animation and special effects for games


What you will get in return?


  • Sports club membership card
  • Life insurance
  • Private Health Care
  • Books & e-books - Huuuge Library

 

Send us your CV and become a part of Huuuge Games!

whole_unnormalized_body:
Timberseed is a London-based recruitment company which specialises in Executive Search and Sales Consultancy. Most of our candidates are graduates, although we also place people with up to 10 years’ experience.

In our Warsaw office, we oversee most of the sourcing, research and admin side of the business. We’ve been consistently growing in the past year and are looking to double our size within the next year. This is a great opportunity for anyone who wants to work in an English-speaking environment and be part of a growing start-up!

Key Responsibilities
  • Participate in sourcing activities by identifying and approaching suitable candidates;
  • Use professional recruitment platforms, such as LinkedIn or Reed, for candidate generation;
  • Support the Recruitment Consultants in London with research work;
  • Actively participate in the improvement and well-functioning of processes;
  • Report on a daily and weekly basis on progress.

Skills
  • Good time management, prioritisation and organisation skills, with attention to detail;
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment whilst ensuring good work standards;
  • Capacity to learn and adapt quickly to new knowledge related to recruitment processes;
  • A university degree is preferable;
  • Good command of English.

Benefits
  • Exposure to an English-speaking work environment;
  • Rewarding work culture, clear progression path that can see you evolve into a team leader;
  • Modern and comfortable working atmosphere, in central location;
  • Friday drinks and company socials.
Location: Centrum - Warsaw

Working Hours: Full-time

Status: Contractor (ZUS covered)

Salary: 18.75 PLN per hour with possibility to progress

whole_unnormalized_body:
Agencja Zatrudnienia Silverhand jest podmiotem należącym do międzynarodowego holdingu, wyspecjalizowanego w świadczeniu najwyższej jakości usług rekrutacyjnych.

Dzięki naszemu wieloletniemu doświadczeniu, globalnym zasobom wiedzy oraz innowacyjnym metodom selekcji tysiące osób zmieniło pracę na lepszą. Oferujemy bezpieczne oraz stabilne zatrudnienie.

Klient Oferuje
  • zatrudnienie w oparciu o umowę o pracę lub B2B
  • wynagrodzenie w pełni do negocjacji
  • kartę multisport
  • prywatną opiekę medyczną
  • dofinansowanie do kursów języków obcych
  • pracę w innowacyjnej i dynamicznie rozwijającej się firmie
  • możliwość rozwoju zawodowego oraz szkolenia umożliwiające zdobycie bądź poszerzanie umiejętności

Do Głównych Zadań Osoby Zatrudnionej Należy
  • monitorowanie dostępności systemów oprogramowania i świadczonych przez nich usług
  • zapewnienie wsparcia w przypadku awarii tych systemów / usług
  • analiza i rozwiązywanie problemów związanych z systemami oprogramowania pośredniego
  • przeglądanie dzienników i rozwiązywanie problemów
  • zarządzanie planami produktowymi:
  • planowanie i przeprowadzanie aktualizacji cyklu (w koordynacji z innymi zespołami)
  • planowanie i zarządzanie przepustowością tych usług w celu zapewnienia wystarczającej przepustowości
  • zapewnienie standardowych procedur operacyjnych (SOP) i innej dokumentacji technicznej
  • wspieranie innych zespołów w korzystaniu z tych usług
  • synchronizacja, harmonizacja i utrzymanie zgodności z podstawowymi standardami i standardami ICT klienta
  • współpraca z członkami zespołu

Wymagania
  • 9 lat połączonego wykształcenia policealnego i doświadczenia zawodowego z co najmniej 4-letnim doświadczeniem zawodowym w dziedzinach opisanych poniżej
  • praktyczne doświadczenie w administrowaniu systemami Linux (systemy Ubuntu i / lub RedHat)
  • doświadczenie w pracy ze złożonymi, rozproszonymi systemami
  • analiza, monitorowanie, konserwacja, instalacja i aktualizacja różnych produktów oprogramowania
  • projektowanie, testowanie i dokumentowanie zmian architektonicznych
  • znajomość powłok skryptowych systemu Linux
  • doświadczenie w integracji systemu
  • instalacja nowych narzędzi zgodnie z wymaganiami i integracja ich z istniejącym ekosystemem
  • wyższe wykształcenie pierwszego stopnia w dziedzinie informatyki lub dziedziny pokrewnej (mile widziane studia drugiego stopnia)
  • język angielski na poziomie B2 lub wyższym
  • certyfikat administracji Linux (LPIC-1 lub RHCSA)

Specjalne narzędzia / systemy oprogramowania pośredniego, w których wiedza jest obowiązkowa:
  • RedHat JBoss (bardzo ważne)
  • PostgreSQL
  • Apache (w tym mod_cluster, mod_security i inne moduły bezpieczeństwa)
  • Drupal
  • ElasticSearch
  • Serwer i portal ESRI ArcGIS
  • Solita + ClamAV

Inne narzędzia, które integrują ekosystem i które muszą być wspierane:
  • Maven
  • Git
  • Jenkins
  • Redmine
  • SonarQube

Oferta skierowana do kobiet i mężczyzn spełniających warunki rekrutacji.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Oferty pracy dla nauczycieli w Skype: Matematyka.
Specjalizacja: Matematyka dla dzieci, Matura z matematyki.
Poziom grupy docelowej: Niższy średnio zaawansowany.
Wiek grupy docelowej: Szkoła średnia (12-17).
Chłopak klasa 1 liceum, przygotowanie do przyszłej matury,ćwiczenie na bieżąco materiału

Obowiązki

Umiejętność klarownego przekazania wiedzy, korzystając z materiałów lub pomocy dydaktycznych.
Nie utrudniaj uczniom dostępu do siebie i służ im radą i wskazówkami.
Skupienie na zdolnościach ucznia, które umożliwią najlepsze wyniki w nauce.
Omów i zrozum oczekiwania ucznia, zanim przystąpisz do prowadzenia lekcji z przedmiotu Math.

Wymagania

Umiejętność dokonania analizy procesu myślowego ucznia, a także zachęcania do dyskusji i debaty.
Należy mieć pozytywne nastawienie, dobre maniery i służyć pomocą.
Utrzymywanie profesjonanych i stabilnych relacji z uczniem.
Chęć pracy w różnorodnym i wielokulturowym środowisku.

Oferujemy

Pracuj zgodnie z własnym, elastycznym grafikiem.
Doświadczenie w nauczaniu studentów z całego świata.
Friendly and creative international team.
Wynagrodzenie w oparciu o godziny pracy.

whole_unnormalized_body:
New Product Delivery Manager

We’re Coty, a global leader in beauty. We’re World #1 in Fragrance, World #2 in Professional Hair Care and World #3 in Color Cosmetics. Our iconic portfolio of more than 77 brands are sold in over 150 countries around the world. We believe in beauty with a purpose and brands that inspire, no matter where they are in the world.

THE ROLE

We are currently looking for a New Product Delivery Manager to join our Warsaw Planning Hub in a city center. You will be part of multifunctional, young and dynamic team of Project Managers and Coordinators passionate and energized to deliver new products for our customers and consumers. You will be leading a team of project coordinators and multifunctional Planning Hub team in evaluation and execution of various initiatives end-to-end having Global teams and markets as main stakeholders.

What You'll Do
  • Leading a team of project coordinators, providing required support and driving supply chain constraints resolution to guarantee delivery of new products on time, in full and within expected cost.
  • Acting as project leader for Global High-complexity initiatives.
  • Being a role-model of company values and culture.
  • Representing the Planning Hub to the Global and Regional multi-functional Project team, being a SPOC for specific Market or Region.
  • Owning regular Supply Planning interface with other functions and leadership team, driving discipline in the defined supply network(s) of the Project.
  • Optimizing internal and external business processes and tools, growing capability of direct team and Planning Hub multi-functional teams.

What You'll Bring
  • Min 3 years of experience in the areas of Supply Chain Planning, New Products Development & Implementation and/or Project Management
  • People management experience will be an asset
  • Good understanding of inter-dependencies within Manufacturing, Planning, Quality Assurance, R&D and Commercial planning
  • Leadership and influencing skills, experience in leading cross-functional teams
  • Fluent English verbal/written communication skills
  • Strong Excel and MS Project skills, knowledge of SAP/JDA/Power BI will be an advantage

What We Offer

This is a unique opportunity to get the knowledge of supply chain end-to-end, work within a truly multifunctional team on challenging projects and initiatives. Within this role you will be able to make a valuable impact for our customers and consumers by working on delivery of new products and technologies. It is a great position to shape your project management, people management and supply chain skills.

Benefits
  • sport card, private medical care, private health insurance, lunch card, travelcard reimbursement, massages in the office, discounts on Coty products, extra day of holiday for birthday, CIGNA support and more!

Założona w 2001 Agencja Pracy Tymczasowej, Agencja Pośrednictwa Pracy i Doradztwa Personalnego Work & Profit jest obecnie jedną z największych niezależnych polskich agencji zatrudnienia. W ciągu siedemasntu lat naszej działalności daliśmy pracę przeszło 50 000 pracowników w całym kraju. Skutecznie znajdujemy pracowników dla największych firm, jak również małych rodzinnych przedsiębiorstw w Polsce. Agencja jest wpisana pod nr 396 w Krajowym Rejestrze Agencji Zatrudnienia.
  • wykładanie towaru
Praca w godz. 7:00-15;00 i 15:00-23:00.

Warszawa , różne lokalizacje.

Wykładanie towaru Warszawa

Do zadań osoby zatrudnionej będzie należało: wykładanie towaru i ekspozycja towaru zgodnie ze standardami Firmy.

Wymagania
  • Ukończone 18lat
  • Komunikatywność i kultura osobista
  • Schludny wygląd
Oferujemy
  • Zatrudnienie w oparciu o umowę cywilnoprawną (praca tymczasowa)
  • Wynagrodzenie wypłacane w terminie, stawka 20 zł brutto/h
  • Elastyczny czas pracy
    • Pracę w młodym zespole.

    Wypłaty tygodniowe.

    Osoby zainteresowane prosimy o wypełnienie formularza aplikacyjnego lub o kontakt pod numerem:693842510. Do przesyłanej oferty prosimy dołączyć oświadczenie: ’Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych (oraz pozostałych informacji zawartych w CV) na potrzeby obecnego procesu rekrutacyjnego prowadzonego przez Work&Profit Sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Bielsku-Białej ul. 11 Listopada 7B. (Zgodnie z art.6 ust.1 lit. a ogólnego rozporządzenia o ochronie danych osobowych z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. (Dz. Urz. UE L 190 z 04.05.2016)’ Zgoda dobrowolna (jeżeli chce Pan/Pani uczestniczyć w przyszłych rekrutacjach): ’Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych oraz pozostałych informacji zawartych w CV na potrzeby przyszłych procesów rekrutacyjnych prowadzonych przez Work&Profit Sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Bielsku-Białej ul. 11 Listopada 7B. 29Forward is fast growing BI consulting company providing service in many countries. We are looking for a person who will join a team supporting our client. We are waitnig for you!


Project you can join

In your role as IT/ SAS Administrator you will maintain and develop SAS platform, enhance performance and maintain SAS BI environment. SAS Administrator is responsible for writing scripts in Unix environment, configurations, finding errors, installing hotfixes, start/stop SAS Application, perform test cases.


Main tasks:

  • Incident resolution, implements of changes, fulfil user’s requests according to ITIL rules
  • Developing Unix based scripts to automate processes in the SAS infrastructure,
  • Supporting the optimization / troubleshooting / performance tuning of the SAS platform,
  • Performing requirement analysis, investigating and implementing solutions.
  • Reliable and timely execution of assigned tasks in accordance with the regulations of the Company.


Requirements


What we expect from you:

  • Experience level: Junior or Regular
  • Command line (scripting)
  • Scheduling tools ( e.g UC4)
  • Feel comfortable using WinSCP and Putty
  • SAS Management Console
  • Readiness for occasional business trips to Germany


Technologies:

  • Bash
  • Unix
  • Tomcat
  • Putty
  • WinSCP


Nice-to-have:

  • Cloud Administration skills (Azure, AWS, others )
  • Automation (e.g. Ansible, Jenkins)
  • Containerization (e.g. Docker)
  • SSL certificate for SAS
  • ITIL


Foreign language skills:

  • English – B2/C1
  • German – nice to have


What we offer:

  • Full time employment contract
  • Competitive salary depends on seniority and experience.
  • Healthcare package: Medicover Premium
  • Leisure package (Sport card)
  • 28 days of holidays +2 days dedicated for personal development
  • Annual financial bonus
  • Personal development: (conferences, trainings)
  • Integration events

Jeżeli:

  • Masz co najmniej 3 lata doświadczenia w pracy z VMWare;
  • Znasz produkty backupowe Avamar i/lub Veeam;
  • Potrafisz konfigurować macierze DELL/EMC;
  • Masz praktyczną wiedzę dotyczącą platformy serwerowej DELL;
  • Potrafisz zarządzać urządzeniami sieci SAN;
  • Pracujesz z systemami Linux RH i Centos oraz piszesz skrypty w bash;
  • Znasz Kubernetes/Docker- mile widziane.

Będziesz odpowiedzialny za:
  • Administrowanie środowiskiem wirtualnym w całej firmie;
  • Automatyzację zadań przy wykorzystaniu PowerCli i bash;
  • Zarządzanie serwerami i macierzami całego przedsiębiorstwa;
  • Administrowanie backupami;
  • Tworzenie procedur DRTestowe odtwarzanie systemów.

Oferujemy: 

  • Umowę o pracę;
  • Pracę w dynamicznie rozwijającej się, międzynarodowej firmie o wysokiej kulturze zarządzania;  
  • Zatrudnienie w zgranym zespole profesjonalistów i pasjonatów;
  • Szkolenia i możliwość udział w projektach ogólnofirmowych;  
  • Akcjonariat pracowniczy, udział w zyskach przedsiębiorstwa;  
  • Benefity pozapłacowe: ubezpieczenie na życie, Fundusz Świadczeń Socjalnych, opieka medyczna, karta Multisport, smartfon;
  • Dogodny dojazd do biura - Centrala mieści się przy drugiej linii metra;  
  • Możliwość przyłączenia się do licznych inicjatyw na rzecz społeczności lokalnych poprzez Fundację Leroy Merlin Polska.

Cloud Engineer


As a specialist, this role is expected to have skills and experience around frontend and backend development of applications, api’s, microservices built on cloud-based infrastructure and platform. Candidates should possess practical hands-on experience with development tools and languages, setting up CI/CD pipelines, testing frameworks and tooling, agile development processes and other full-stack development tools and practices . This is a self-starter type of a role where you will be part of a team with similar interests and skills around designing, developing and delivering these innovations. You should be relishing continuous learning and application of that newly acquired knowledge into your projects. If you like to help shape a new customer-facing technical organization and embark on new missions with like-minded engineers and innovators, this role is for you.



Responsibilities:


  • Customer business problem discovery and analysis,
  • Use case storyboarding and user experience design and definition,
  • Testing solutions with pilot customers to gain user feedback/acceptance,
  • Development of demos and showcases of solution,
  • Assist with conducting proof of concepts and pilot implementations with customers,
  • Provide product and technical feedback to engineering to address gaps,
  • Collaborate with your teammates to define new delivery practices and methods to innovate with new solution areas and scale your efforts,
  • Create compelling video and other types assets to evangelize solutions,
  • Enable other technical resources (customer engineers, professional services and customer success) with our packaged solutions to reach more customers.     



Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience,
  • Experience working within the technology and cloud computing market,
  • Experience serving in the capacity of a Solution/Sales Engineer in a cloud computing environment, or in a customer facing role in a Professional Services or Systems Engineering capacity,
  • Experience of hands-on experience with cloud-based app development and software engineering,
  • Strong project and client management skill sets,
  • Experience with data, information management and databases - relating to Big Data trends and issues within businesses,
  • Technical experience of web/internet related technologies, architecture across SaaS/PaaS/IaaS and competitive cloud productivity suites,
  • Familiarity with architecture and operational aspects of large scale distributed systems and with the popular technologies in the machine learning/big data ecosystem (TensorFlow, Spark, etc).

Job Description

Believe is looking for a passionate Artist Relation Manager to join the team in Warsaw. A keen knowledge and network in the independent music industry is key, as Believe continues to drive its artists and label acquisition strategy in Central & Eastern Europe

Missions

  • Detect and sign Entry level artists in the region
    • Support and execute our sales strategy for entry level Artists
    • Work with our talent scouts team to sign artists at earliest possible stage
    • Offer Standard Distribution deals
    • Project revenues and define the best deal terms with Artists
  • Partnership Management
    • Look after artists success through our monitoring tools
    • Engage with your portfolio on a regular basis
    • Drive Artists to our support team to cover all operational issues
    • Contribute to upsell artists to higher tier of partnerships
    • Escalate client feedback and contribute to overall services improvement

    Qualifications
    • First experience in sales and negotiation
    • knowledge of artists landscape and artists deals
    • Passionate about technology, data and artists / label development

    Additional Information

    Believe is committed to ensuring equal opportunities in employment, regardless of origin, sex, morals, sexual orientation, gender, age, family status pregnancy, political opinions, trade union activities, religious beliefs, physical appearance, family name, place of residence, state of health, or disability.

Site Name: Warsaw, Poznan Grunwaldzka
Posted Date: Apr 2 2020

Poznan Tech Hub is GSK worldwide biggest IT center hiring about 700 highly-skilled IT professionals. We are part of GSK, which aspires to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. At Poznan Tech Hub we build a truly international team which provides services to all GSK locations around the world. Our talented IT experts have a unique opportunity to contribute to the entire product life cycle from research and development, through manufacturing, to commercialization and support salesforce of new vaccines, medicines and healthcare products.

It is a great time to join GSK Tech Hub in Poznan. We value courage, accountability, development and teamwork. You will be encouraged to experiment and collaborate across teams to bring innovation to our every day job. We are open to candidates with various levels of experience - whether you are a seasoned specialist with deep expertise or a graduate looking to kick start your career. Help us to lead in Technology to improve lives of patients and consumers around the world.

Work in Poznan or Warsaw

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include the following:
  • Become a subject matter expert and translate technical details of the Sharepoint Intranet (Connect GSK) and Workplace from Facebook into engaging and easy to consume content for users
  • Create, maintain and deliver appropriate training materials for these products to support and upskill employees and ensure we are delivering the best user experience
  • Continuously promote and communicate the value of these products, including new features and solutions through content such as case studies, videos, website copy and blog posts
  • Collate insights, user experiences and product feedback to enhance the products
  • Help influence the product content management systems, gather feedback from content owners as to what analytics they would like to see to create more effective content
  • Support stakeholders to develop appropriate methods for users to be able to obtain metrics and measure the performance of their content

Why you?

Basic Qualifications

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
  • Experience in creative documenting/revising processes and procedures
  • Strong interpersonal skills to develop and maintain successful client and stakeholder relationships
  • A solid understanding of communication best practices
  • Social media management experience including Workplace from Facebook
  • Experience with using content management systems (CMS) and Microsoft Sharepoint
  • Understanding of HTML and web technologies
  • Understanding of Search Engine Optimisation (SEO), best practices and application
  • Positive can-do attitude, who always keeps the employee at the heart of everything we do
  • An analytical approach with experience in producing and analysing metrics and reports
  • Willingness to give and receive constructive feedback

Why GSK?

Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork.
  • Career at one of the leading global healthcare companies
  • Contract of employment
  • Attractive reward package (annual bonus & awards for outstanding performance, recognition awards for additional achievements and engagement, holiday benefit)
  • Life insurance and pension plan
  • Private medical package with additional preventive healthcare services for employees and their eligible
  • Sports cards (Multisport)
  • Possibilities of development within the role and company’s structure
  • Personalized learning approach (mentoring, online trainings’ platforms: Pluralsight, Business Skills, Harvard Manage Mentor, Skillsoft and external trainings)
  • Extensive support of work life balance (flexible working solutions, short Fridays option, health & wellbeing activities)
  • Supportive community and integration events
  • Modern office with creative rooms, fresh fruits everyday
  • Free car and bike parking, locker rooms and showers

G8

If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).

GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

Poszukujemy specjalisty sprzedaży – dobrego słuchacza, doradcy nastawionego na wyniki klienta. Jeśli rozumiesz branżę marketingu internetowego i chcesz podjąć się wyzwania budowy i rozwijania relacji z klientami – to ogłoszenie jest dla Ciebie.

O agencji marketingu internetowego Scorise – Nasza agencja digital marketingu Scorise z siedzibą w Warszawie na Saskiej Kępie zajmuje się realizacją projektów SEO, SEM i social media od 2010 roku. Wierzymy, że nasze cele osiągamy dzięki pomaganiu klientom w osiągnięciu ich celów. Dlatego też dążymy do tego, by stać się najczęściej rekomendowaną przez Klientów agencją SEO SEM w Polsce.

Jako New Business Manager będziesz odpowiedzialny/a za sprzedaż usług SEO, SEM, social media i doradzanie klientom w zakresie promowania biznesu w internecie.

Zadania i Obowiązki

Pierwszy kontakt z potencjalnym klientem na bazie zapytań kierowanych do Scorise oraz na podstawie własnych źródeł potencjalnych klientów

Prowadzenie kampanii cold mailingowych

Budowanie bazy danych potencjalnych klientów oraz obsługa systemu CRM (Pipedrive)

Bieżący kontakt z potencjalnymi klientami i sprzedaż usług Scorise (SEO, SEM, social media)

Przygotowanie ofert i umów na podstawie wzorów

Kontakt z dotychczasowymi klientami w celu dosprzedaży usług

Prowadzenie negocjacji warunków umowy z klientami

Oczekiwania

Podstawowa znajomość pakietu Google – Dokumenty, Arkusze kalkulacyjne, Prezentacje

Dobra orientacja w branży marketingu internetowego

Doświadczenie w sprzedaży doradczej do sektora B2B.

Doświadczenie w obsłudze systemu CRM

Będzie Dodatkowym Atutem

Znajomość języka angielskiego umożliwiająca swobodną komunikację z Klientami B2B

Oferujemy

Wynagrodzenie składające się ze stałej części comiesięcznej oraz premie uzależnione od osiąganych wyników oraz niezbędne narzędzia pracy (telefon, laptop).

Kameralny, niezwykle przyjazny i wspierający zespół tworzący niesamowitą atmosferę w firmie.

Wierzymy, że bez względu na rangę w firmie każdy ma takie samo prawo do swobodnej wypowiedzi i własnego zdania.

Wysoki poziom niezależności i możliwość wdrażania własnych pomysłów.

Mamy płaską strukturę organizacyjną – każda osoba w firmie jest dla Ciebie dostępna.

Elastyczny charakter współpracy (godziny i miejsce).

Możliwość sprzedaży usług do bazy naszych kontaktów, którą wciąż rozbudowujemy od lat. Przychodzi do nas do 30 leadów miesięcznie – zapytań ze strony internetowej oraz z poleceń od naszych klientów.

Dobra lokalizacja na zielonej Saskiej Kępie – biuro 10 minut pieszo od Ronda Waszyngtona w Warszawie.

Pakiet medyczny.

Wsparcie w generowaniu leadów poprzez organizację rekomendacji biznesowych i polecenia od naszych Partnerów.

Chcesz aplikować?

Jeśli chcesz do nas dołączyć, to wyślij swoje CV na e-mail click apply.

Prosimy o dopisanie następującej klauzuli: „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych dla potrzeb niezbędnych do realizacji procesu rekrutacji oraz do celu przyszłych rekrutacji prowadzonych przez Scorise Agency Sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Warszawie.”
