whole_unnormalized_body:
KWS Berlin GmbH is looking for a business partner Central Europe (m/f/d) for our Berlin-based office. The Business Partner Finance Central Europe (ie. Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia) is a key interaction point for the business whom provides high-quality consulting and insight-related and knowledge-based services from a functional perspective and to improve decision making. The business partner facilitates the supporting role to the lead of Business Partners EMEA. Within this role the Business Partner connects, challenges and monitors the business units and the global function leads in their chosen strategies. Moreover, guaranteeing that the chosen business strategies deliver the highest financial value at an “acceptable level of risk”. Confirming quality and efficiency of processes and services for KWS while being compliant, while ultimately focusing on adding benefits and creating a future-oriented finance function.

The position is unlimited and fulltime. The starting date is April 1st, 2020.


Your tasks:


  • You are the first point of contact as well as an interface between function and business for knowledge-based activities.
  • You proactively consult and work with the business in order to solve complex issues and to develop adequate solutions.
  • Moreover, you will support the business in the decision-making process with adequate information, reports and analytics.
  • You will also manage and support improvement projects.
  • Your ensure that the definition and implementation of the functional KWS-wide strategy and regional/global strategic priorities.
  • Furthermore, your will make sure that local and legal deadlines are met in full on time.
  • You are responsible for cash-flow planning management, hedging, financial engineering and dividend payment.



Your profile:


  • Preferably you have an academic degree in Business, Economics, Finance or similar.
  • You have several years of professional experience in the field of finance or controlling in an globally acting environment. Professional experience in the producing industry is an asset.
  • You have a proven track record of good operational finance and business partnering experience in a global diverse environment.
  • You have project management experience (PMP preferred).
  • You have a good knowledge of SAP and MSO. Having worked with other ERP systems is an asset.
  • You demonstrate excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills together with an excellent level of customer orientation.
  • You are willing to travel at least 60% of the time.
  • You have strong influencing and partnership skills.
  • You have a very good command of Polish, English, German (written and spoken).



﻿We offer:

 

  • Opportunity to work in an international environment and team
  • Professional and personal development 
  • Attractive remuneration and flexible working hours
  • Financial support for public transport
  • Several corporate employee benefits
  • 30d of vacation
  • a location in the heart of Berlin

We are looking for a suitable candidate for PR Specialist position in Huawei Polska Consumer BG. The ideal candidate would be in charge of holistic PR communication management, including media relations and product marketing campaign implementation. 


Job Requirements


  • University Degree (preferably Marketing or Journalism), telecommunication related would be a plus.
  • Have at least 3 years of experience working as a PR specialist or copywriter.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a multi-cultural environment.
  • Excellent project management skills.
  • Creative, reliable, responsible and accurate with an attention to details
  • In-depth understanding of all key social media platforms in Poland
  • Very Good English in speaking, reading and writing.
  • Good MS Office skills.

 

Main Responsibilities


  •  Implements PR and communication plans;
  • Plan and supervise media projects, events, fairs, conferences etc.
  • Build relationships with partner organizations, generate publicity around conducted social responsibility projects.
  • Coordinates PR calendar to ensure always-on quality communication based on business requirements throughout the year.
  • Support the implementation of promotional plans
  • Manage media relations and requests
  • Write press releases, speeches and other PR copy
  • Keeping up to date with industry best practice and monitoring PR activities of competitors.
  • Support to marketing team to create digital content for the different social media channels.
  • Plan and implement spreading information about product launch events, monitor the implementation and assess the results;
  • Stay up-to-date with developments and generate new ideas to draw the audience’s attention

job_description_details.Industry: Consumer Electronics Information Technology & Services Internet

whole_unnormalized_body:
O R.Power

R.Power jest liderem sektora fotowoltaicznego w Polsce z 20% udziałem w rynku – jedna na pięć instalacji elektrowni słonecznych oddanych do użytku w Polsce była rozwijana przez R.Power. Obecnie R.Power posiada portfel elektrowni fotowoltaicznych o mocy 800 MWp w fazie rozwoju na terenie całej Polski, stale poszerzając bazę projektów. R.Power działa w całym łańcuchu wartości rynku fotowoltaicznego, w tym w projektach, inwestycjach, doradztwie inżynieryjnym, budownictwie (EPC) i świadczeniu usług obsługi (O&M) istniejących elektrowni fotowoltaicznych.


Opis stanowiska – dlaczego warto pracować na tym stanowisku ?

Starszy Menedżer Biura Rozwoju Projektów (PMO) zapewnia spójność działania różnych obszarów organizacji związanych z rozwojem projektów elektrowni słonecznych na terenie Polski. Osoba zatrudniona na tym stanowisku będzie odpowiedzialna za maksymalizację efektywności działania w zakresie rozwoju projektów (od momentu przyjęcia ich do organizacji do momentu osiągnięcia gotowości do budowy) zarówno poprzez zapewnienie stosowania odpowiednich procedur, systemu raportowania czy też przepływu informacji, jednocześnie poszukując ciągle nowych rozwiązań optymalizacyjnych. Dzięki temu praca ta daje możliwość połączenia zastosowania ustrukturyzowanego i metodycznego podejścia z kreatywnym i niestandardowym myśleniem.

Starszy Menedżer Biura Rozwoju Projektów (PMO) uczestniczy również w procesach due dilligence projektów elektrowni słonecznych współpracując z kancelariami prawnymi, doradcami biznesowymi i technicznymi. Praca na tym stanowisku łączy w sobie możliwość wielokierunkowego rozwoju poprzez zgłębianie aspektów prawnych, technicznych i ekonomicznych projektów elektrowni słonecznej.


Zakres obowiązków

·        Koordynacja procesu rozwoju projektów elektrowni słonecznych z portfela grupy kapitałowej do momentu ich gotowości do realizacji (budowy)

·        Koordynacja prac komórki Biura Wdrażania Projektów (PMO)

·        Koordynacja prac między poszczególnymi działami rozwoju projektów

·        Wprowadzanie rozwiązań zapewniających usprawnienia procesu rozwoju projektów

·        Identyfikowanie i monitorowanie red flag w ramach poszczególnych projektów

·        Zapewnienie odpowiedniego systemu przepływu informacji i raportowania

·        Zapewnienie systemu weryfikacji projektów i systemu archiwizacji dokumentacji projektowej

·        Udział w projektach transakcyjnych w zakresie due dilligence projektów elektrowni słonecznych

·        Współpraca z inwestorami, kancelariami prawnymi, doradcami technicznymi w zakresie badania projektów elektrowni słonecznych

·        Raportowanie prac bezpośrednio do Zarządu.


Wymagania

·        Ukończone studnia co najmniej pierwszego stopnia o profilu

zarządzania/ekonomicznym/technicznym

·        Ponad 5 lat doświadczenia w zarządzaniu dużym portfelem projektów lub prowadzeniem PMO

·        Znajomość sektora energii słonecznej / odnawialnej będzie dodatkowym atutem

·        Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego

·        Sukcesy w pracy w zespołach interdyscyplinarnych i zarządzaniu nimi

·        Silne umiejętności analityczne i rozwiązywania problemów

·        Silne umiejętności zarządzania czasem i zdolność do efektywnej pracy przy minimalnym nadzorze

·        Zorientowanie na cel.

 

Kontakt: Proszę o wysyłanie CV na adres: ag@rpower.pl

position: CIB F&BM Global Program Management EMEA - International Regulatory – Business Analyst - Associate
whole_unnormalized_body:
Outline of Role

Purpose: EMEA Regulatory Business Analyst role within International Regulatory Projects, working as part of a multi-region team managing the implementation aspects of new regulations, internal operating model changes/business process re-engineering, business deliverables on new technology deployments, plus integration into Finance of LOB driven projects (e.g. new legal entity set-ups and product roll outs, technology refresh initiatives).

Priorities & Key Outputs
  • Capture business requirements, analyse and translate them into functional and non-functional specifications
  • Provide guidance for complex regulatory requirements, including translation and application of such into reports
  • Assist with product specific issue management, evaluation of impact, remediation and enhancements
  • Liaise with data providers regarding reporting requirements, reporting process and issues management
  • Organize user acceptance testing and support and follow-up investigation of questions, issues, and defects
  • Analyse and explain results including key business drivers for significant fluctuations
  • Timely escalation of issues and risks to the Project Manager ensuring robust risk mitigation strategies
  • Performing detailed and high level analytical reviews and preparing reports and analyses for senior management, including trend analyses and commentary on key statistics reported
  • Assist strategic agenda for data sourcing/consumption by communicating reporting requirements, performing testing, monitoring progress, communicating status and other activities as needed

Relationships

Develop excellent working relationship with FRAA and technology teams

Develop excellent working relationships with the business and all stakeholders

Technical Skills & Knowledge
  • Knowledge of quantitative analysis (such as AnaCredit)
  • Good knowledge and understanding of Financial products: Loans, Deposit, Commitment, Cash
  • Experience in designing and documenting business & data requirements
  • Experience in planning & execution of User Acceptance Testing.
  • An understanding and an appreciation of the Project Life Cycle
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving and synthesizing skills (you know how to figure things out)
  • Must have a rigorous insistence on detail, analytical thinking and problem solving
  • Team player with ability to work with colleagues in a collaborative manner, as well as being able to proactively progress multiple tasks independently.
  • Very good communication, negotiation and relationship management skills

    Experience Must Include:
  • Experience as Business Analyst in AnaCredit or quantitative analysis
  • Advanced Excel and /or Access skills with ability to work with, and use, large amounts of data in organized and effective manner. (SQL knowledge would be advantageous)
  • Good understanding of the Project Lifecycle & Experience of Agile methodology
  • Ability to work as a team player and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.

Competencies
  • Demonstrates Initiative
  • Self motivating
  • Negotiation skills
  • Ability to articulate risks versus rewards surrounding project dynamics
  • Clear and concise written / oral communication skills
  • Deadline focussed
  • Cooperation and Teamwork
  • Judgement – Analyse problems skilfully, uses logic to reach solutions
  • Maintain High Standards in Quality of Work
  • Supports Diversity

Qualifications

By experience

Degree preferred

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, offering solutions to the world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions in more than 100 countries. We have a sophisticated local market presence in Europe, Middle East and Africa which is complemented by staff around the world who support our growth and serve our clients 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. We are excited to expand our team in Poland and we’re looking for collaborative, innovative and dedicated individuals to join us in our new corporate centre in Warsaw. Bring us your expertise and you’ll be part of a global community, working with people around the world and with a company that’s committed to investing in you and making a success of this key new location for our business.

Corporate & Investment Bank

The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package. JPMorgan Chase & Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

This is an exciting opportunity to join ICON- DOCS

As a global provider of drug development solutions, our work is serious business. But that doesn't mean you can't have fun while you do it. With our vision to be the partner of choice in drug development, we hire only the best and brightest in the industry. Are you one of them?

The focus of this position is to functionally manage the operational aspects of the Global Clinical Development Operations, managed trials through oversight and management of the G-CTAs (Study-facing). Responsibility for capacity management and resourcing of tasks associated with trial start up, execution or close out in all phases of clinical trial development. The range of tasks may vary to some degree depending on the therapeutic area and trial specific requirements.

The Role

  • Line manages all assigned G-CTA (Study-facing) as per requirements of role, including performance management.
  • Ensure G-CTA (Study-facing) resources are identified and assigned as necessary to support Janssen clinical trials.
  • The G-CTA Program Lead and Janssen FM will define resource needs/requirements and interact with G-CTA FM to review current situation per portfolio.
  • Partner with G-CTA Program Lead to assign G-CTAs (Study-facing) per needs of the Janssen portfolio (i.e., G-CTA (Study-facing) work assignments, workload requirements and distribution and delegation of tasks to the supporting G-CTAs (Central)).
  • Support G-CTA (Study-facing) delivery of trial and/or activity-specific milestones on time and within budget with quality and in compliance with all relevant SOPs, policies and applicable regulatory requirements (G-CTA FM will be trained on all relevant Janssen SOPs)
  • Support operational and process definition for the function. Partner with G-CTA FMs and G-CTA Team Leads (TL) to identify, interview, on-board, and train staff per company-specific standards/expectations and trial specific requirements.
  • Support inspection readiness activities. Align with Janssen-led activities to coach G-CTA (Study-facing) on their possible role in inspections and any necessary follow-up activities which could result in a Corrective And Preventive Action (CAPA).
  • Ensure G-CTA (Study-facing) have a clear understanding and knowledge of GCO SOPs, Work Instructions (WI) and Instructions For Use (IFU) supported by documentation of training compliance in Janssen's training and learning system.
  • Track all training metrics and follow-up with employees who are out of compliance. As necessary, and in partnership with G-CTA Program Lead, G-CTA FMs and G-CTA
  • Team Leads and/or central team leadership, suggest and implement solutions to problems with study timelines, schedules, resources, etc. Take corrective action where necessary.
  • Support the G-CTA (Study-facing) to ensure quality of work deliverables assigned meets requirements as defined in the Quality Oversight Plan agreed with Janssen.
  • Manage DOCS Operational deliverables to requirements as designated by agreed program key performance indicators and the operational metrics.
  • Track all operational metrics and quality plan deliverables and report at least monthly to G-CTA Program Lead or as required by program requirements.
  • Ensure G-CTA (Study-facing) align with trial/program-specific Goals and Objectives (G&O) as they apply to their scope of responsibilities and accountability.
  • Manage all organizational aspects of staff management as required by DOCS systems and processes.
  • Ensure client and DOCS operational systems are current and accurate all times to facilitate accurate reporting, analysis and business operations.

What you need

  • Ability to manage the workload and capacity of G-CTA (Study-facing) locally and in coordination globally.
  • Ability to motivate others and enhance performance through excellent, clear and concise communication of goals and expectations.
  • Strong, confident communication and presentation skills (client facing and internal)
  • Experience in identifying and hiring staff to fulfil role.
  • Ability to train and mentor others.
  • Ability to work cross-functionally to meet business objectives.
  • Flexibility in changing priorities
  • Excellent organizational, written and verbal communication skills (English) and the ability to work independently within a global, virtual team environment.
  • Excellent independent time management skills.
  • Proven ability to plan and track deliverables and timelines.
  • Excellence in providing quality work and being detail oriented.
  • Bachelor's degree with prior line management and clinical experience preferred. However,
  • other relevant experiences and skills may be considered by the hiring manager when considering the candidate's eligibility
Desired Skills and Experience

Ability to manage the workload and capacity of-CTA's (Study-facing) locally and in coordination globally.
Ability to motivate others and enhance performance through excellent, clear and concise
communication of goals and expectations.
Strong, confident communication and presentation skills (client facing and internal)
Experience in identifying and hiring staff to fulfil role.
Ability to train and mentor others.
Ability to work cross-functionally to meet business objectives.

Job Description

Finance role to review and process third party invoices and prepare weekly payments for all International Affiliates within the SSC. This position requires detailed understanding of Procure to Pay (P2P) processes, systems and policies. For example, accounts payable, invoice to purchase order matching, payment / expense processing, vendor onboarding etc. The role is responsible for maintaining the internal control environment and proactively ensuring compliance and efficiency in the P2P area.
  • Process supplier invoices into Oracle for assigned GBS markets according to the Service Level Agreement and in line with all process-related SOPs.
  • Prepare weekly payment batches while ensuring banking details and supplier data is accurate. Process manual payments through online banking tool as required and troubleshoot/resolve rejected and returned payments timely.
  • Monitor and follow up on the sub-ledger aging report, identifying issues and taking the appropriate actions; including issue reporting and management escalation. Perform month-end close for assigned GBS markets for AP & PO sub-ledgers and prepare reconciliations to GL.
  • Provide helpdesk support for assigned GBS markets in a timely and professional manner.
  • Facilitate an open and collaborative communications with GBS markets that promote continuous improvement and standardized processes.
  • Assist with external and internal audit inquiries for GBS markets and ensure SOX control compliance as necessary.
  • Support other functions in the P2P team as holiday and emergency backup.

Qualifications
  • 2+ years of experience in an accounting function
  • Good understanding of international banking and payments systems
  • Experience in an international environment preferred
  • Experience with Oracle ERP preferred
  • Fluent in English and other languages preferred
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or similar faculty

Additional Information

Finance role to review and process third party invoices and prepare weekly payments for all International Affiliates within the SSC. This position requires detailed understanding of Procure to Pay (P2P) processes, systems and policies. For example, accounts payable, invoice to purchase order matching, payment / expense processing, vendor onboarding etc. The role is responsible for maintaining the internal control environment and proactively ensuring compliance and efficiency in the P2P area.

position: Global Product Marketing and Communication Specialist
whole_unnormalized_body:
Mercer is seeking candidates for the following position based in the Warsaw office:

Global Product Marketing and Communication Specialist

What can you expect?

The Global Product Marketing and Communication Specialist is responsible for handling day-to-day general product enquires, performing business intelligence analysis and supporting Management with product general promotion activities.

What is in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and attractive benefits package (including language courses, sports card, private health care, life insurance, lunch card)
  • Development within a growing company through online and real-life trainings with our business partners and by giving you access to a learning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Harvard Business Review, Leading Edge, edX, Udemy, Mercer Workday Learning)
  • The opportunity to gain valuable experience in an international organization and to have global exposure – working with stakeholders at different levels
  • Extensive training program to ensure the candidate can perform well in the role - you will also be assigned a ‘buddy’ who will be supporting you throughout your first weeks
  • A-class office building facilities near to Plac Zawiszy

We will count on you to:

  • Development and maintenance of marketing and promotion materials, such as: product brochures and videos, client documentation, email communication, social media content including graphic design concept, meeting presentation templates and sales tool kits
  • Ensure external and internal www sites content is relevant and up to date
  • Support Global Product Owner with general product marketing activities and sales analysis
  • Work closely with internal Indirect Sales, Marketing, Client Services and Graphics teams to promote surveys among clients and prospects through various channels
  • Gather ideas for product improvement and leverage digital communication materials
  • Conduct global product competitive analysis
  • Actively contribute to product strategic roadmap development

What you need to have:

  • An eye for design with a strong attention to detail
  • Analytical mind
  • Experience in creating and developing targeted compelling, user-focused content across multiple channels including: website, social media and email marketing
  • Proficient in Power Point
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
  • Advanced command of English enabling effective communication with stakeholders and internal teams around the world, including senior leadership
  • Awareness of innovative best practice and emerging trends within digital communications, and a willingness to keep up to date with these

What makes you stand out:

  • 2-3 years of experience on similar role within international company
  • Understanding Mercer products, client needs and drivers.
  • Knowledge of graphic design tools.

Talentuno wykorzystuje technologię, by wspierać każdego w procesie polecania swoich znajomych na otwarte stanowiska i zarabianiu na tym.

Obecnie Dla Naszego Klienta Poszukujemy Osoby Na Stanowisko

Digital Analyst

Zakres Obowiązków
  • przeprowadzanie analiz środowiska online, na potrzeby jednostek odpowiedzialnych za sprzedaż, marketing, rozwój produktów
  • komunikację z jednostkami biznesowymi w zakresie dostarczania wniosków z analiz oraz rekomendacji optymalizacji środowiska e-commerce
  • konfiguracja i stały monitoring ruchu w sklepach internetowych, proponowanie zmian zwiększających sprzedaż

  • wdrażanie skryptów Google Analytics za pomocą Google Tag Manager,
  • przygotowanie raportów z wykorzystaniem Google Data Studio

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Financial Services

whole_unnormalized_body:
We Offer

The Incident Management Process Specialist reporting to the Incident Management (IM) BPL is responsible for supporting the Global Incident Management team as well as contributing to the strategic direction of the Incident Management process within Credit Suisse the identification and execution of process improvement projects and focus on optimizing the Incident Management tool and reporting functionalities via automation to ensure continues improvement in the service capabilities provided by the Global Central Incident Management team.

The ideal person in this role is expected to continuously drive for improvements through the identification and implementation of automated solutions to improve the adherence to the Global Incident Process and Standard Documentation, drive down aging incidents, identify reoccurring incidents and instability trends and working closely with the other ITSM process functions to drive IT stability within the firm. Responsibilities also include defining and/or implementing process guidelines and standards practitioners and partners, ensuring process critical metric reports are produced and monitored, and governance of the process maintained.

Major Responsibilities
  • You will support day-to-day activities and actively contribute to the vision and direction of the team.
  • Actively contribute to continual service improvement initiatives (from people, process and tool perspective), improving operational efficiencies, evolving existing processes and enhancing the user experience of incident management
  • You will guide and collaborate with other teams in various geographical locations.
  • You will build relationships and partner with the key stakeholders both in and out of region.
  • You will actively contribute to improving communication and training capabilities of the process team to partners
  • Contribute to monthly working groups for Incident Management, which represent all areas using Incident Management and will also chair this forum as and when required.
  • Define and document in-scope processes working with business partners across IT and the business and aligned to the ITIL framework.
  • Assist with the prioritisation, UAT co-ordination and post implementation testing of the Incident Management portion of regular Service-now releases
  • Participate in process ownership governance activities and meetings to ensure effective process management and adoption across the organization.
  • Oversee and drive projects relating to IM Process (EG Data standardisation) across all areas within Credit Suisse
  • Actively contribute to the identification and implementation of automation initiatives to remove manual overhead and at the same time improve the process governance provided by the Global Incident Management team. These automated initiatives covers tools, reporting, data quality and improved flow of data between the different ITSM functions within Credit Suisse.
  • Deputise as and when required for the IM BPL

You Offer
  • Strong IT operational background and experience.
  • Detailed knowledge of ITSM processes, especially incident, problem and change.
  • ITIL Foundation certification required.
  • Proven experience in execution of (but not limited to) incident and problem management.
  • Proven and strong experience of working in the IT Service industry.
  • Strong skill set in writing Excel macros, SQL, VBA.
  • Experience in analyzing, reporting and presenting incident data
  • Strong experience in and desire for continues process improvements and automation.
  • Proven experience in owning and driving efficiency and automation initiatives
  • Confident personality with effective relationship management skills to interact with team member and senior partners across various departments and regions.
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
  • Solid organizational and analytical skills.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
  • Service now experience is a plus!

Our benefit
  • Private medical care

Poland-Warsaw-Warsaw

We Offer

The Incident Management Process Specialist reporting to the Incident Management (IM) BPL is responsible for supporting the Global Incident Management team as well as contributing to the strategic direction of the Incident Management process within Credit Suisse the identification and execution of process improvement projects and focus on optimizing the Incident Management tool and reporting functionalities via automation to ensure continues improvement in the service capabilities provided by the Global Central Incident Management team.

The ideal person in this role is expected to continuously drive for improvements through the identification and implementation of automated solutions to improve the adherence to the Global Incident Process and Standard Documentation, drive down aging incidents, identify reoccurring incidents and instability trends and working closely with the other ITSM process functions to drive IT stability within the firm. Responsibilities also include defining and/or implementing process guidelines and standards practitioners and partners, ensuring process critical metric reports are produced and monitored, and governance of the process maintained.

Major Responsibilities
  • You will support day-to-day activities and actively contribute to the vision and direction of the team.
  • Actively contribute to continual service improvement initiatives (from people, process and tool perspective), improving operational efficiencies, evolving existing processes and enhancing the user experience of incident management
  • You will guide and collaborate with other teams in various geographical locations.
  • You will build relationships and partner with the key stakeholders both in and out of region.
  • You will actively contribute to improving communication and training capabilities of the process team to partners
  • Contribute to monthly working groups for Incident Management, which represent all areas using Incident Management and will also chair this forum as and when required.
  • Define and document in-scope processes working with business partners across IT and the business and aligned to the ITIL framework.
  • Assist with the prioritisation, UAT co-ordination and post implementation testing of the Incident Management portion of regular Service-now releases
  • Participate in process ownership governance activities and meetings to ensure effective process management and adoption across the organization.
  • Oversee and drive projects relating to IM Process (EG Data standardisation) across all areas within Credit Suisse
  • Actively contribute to the identification and implementation of automation initiatives to remove manual overhead and at the same time improve the process governance provided by the Global Incident Management team. These automated initiatives covers tools, reporting, data quality and improved flow of data between the different ITSM functions within Credit Suisse.
  • Deputise as and when required for the IM BPL

You Offer
  • Strong IT operational background and experience.
  • Detailed knowledge of ITSM processes, especially incident, problem and change.
  • ITIL Foundation certification required.
  • Proven experience in execution of (but not limited to) incident and problem management.
  • Proven and strong experience of working in the IT Service industry.
  • Strong skill set in writing Excel macros, SQL, VBA.
  • Experience in analyzing, reporting and presenting incident data
  • Strong experience in and desire for continues process improvements and automation.
  • Proven experience in owning and driving efficiency and automation initiatives
  • Confident personality with effective relationship management skills to interact with team member and senior partners across various departments and regions.
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
  • Solid organizational and analytical skills.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
  • Service now experience is a plus!

Our benefit
  • Private medical care
  • Life insurance for employees and additional insurance options available for family members
  • Pension plan
  • Charity days
  • Training and development
  • Internal Mobility

Other Optional
  • Language training course

IT Service Desk Poland team acts with cross border incident management and request fulfilment, takes active part in IT communities and takes responsibility at global level for successful deliveries.

In Nordea, we’re harnessing the power of technology to reinvent the future of banking. A tech revolution is underway – and you can make an impact. Though we’re a Nordic bank, we’re also a large IT employer in Tricity and Warsaw. Working with international teams in an inspiring working environment, you’ll have lots of opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.

About This Opportunity

As an IT Service Desk Specialist you will work together with Nordic Units in order to align local procedures to the Nordic standards and solve tasks that require independent judgment and own decisions on how they should be solved. You will be responsible for supporting end users in case of IT failures or standard requests according to defined processes. You will act as first level support to all end users (single point of contact).

What you’ll be doing
  • Provide support to end users through all appropriate channels, such as phone or ITSM tools regarding any kind of IT-related problems to ensure high availability for customers
  • Align IT activity to business, prioritize and assign necessary resources to swiftly close end users’ problems
  • Interact with second line support or external vendors in all tasks related to IT infrastructure and application problems or requests in order to avoid or solve problems and incidents
  • Track, prioritize and document all incidents reported to the service desk using the relevant tools following the incident management procedure to avoid future incidents
  • Diagnose software and hardware problems in order to find the right solution and thereby help the end user
  • Actively participate in knowledge sharing among colleagues in order to create and implement best practice
  • Take responsibility for own learning and keep updated within own area of responsibility to secure continuous competence building and personal growth

You will be working with a lot of great colleagues in our new office in Warsaw.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you
  • You have at least 1 years of experience from a similar position and maybe you have a bachelor’s degree (computer science or likely)
  • You have knowledge of ITIL methodology – knowledge of incident, change and problem management will be considered an advantage
  • You are open-minded as a person and like to work in a role with high customer-focus. Furthermore, you have very good communication skills and are solution oriented with a ca-do approach when dealing with challenges
  • We expect that you speak and write English fluently.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!
Next steps
Submit your application no later than 25 April 2020.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Description

Description: Since 2004 Easy Consult is an International Recruitment Agency and has been a trusted partner providing career opportunities and variety of options to work abroad using your native tongue. Striving to be a market leader, we are always on the look for the best career opportunities staying true to our mission of building long lasting partnerships with our clients, candidates and employees. We believe in the worth of our services, where open communication and human relations are of utmost importance. Choosing to work with us, you will get access to a great number of positions in different countries as Bulgaria, Poland, Serbia, Spain, Germany as well as positions in the following fields: Administrative and Office Work, Economics and Finance, Information Technologies, Management, Customer Service, Production, Tourism, etc. For a client of ours - a leading international company with more than 20 years of experience in complex IT solutions and sales methods, we are currently seeking experienced individuals to join the rapidly expanding sales team. Due to the growth of their business, we are looking for a new team member to join their team of worldwide recognized experts. They need a communicative, multitasking and positive Team Lead with English who is willing to take the next step in his career. Responsibilities: Drive and upkeep the performance delivery of the assigned Team in terms of KPI-s and general metrics, monitor team performance and report on metricsSetting clear team goalsDelegating tasks and set deadlines for your internal teamMotivate team membersDiscover training needs and provide coachingListen to team members feedback and resolve any issues or conflictsRecognize high performance and reward accomplishmentsBe in contact with the client/stakeholder for all operational topics and maintain the impeccable relationship at all levelsPositively manage internal relationshipsParticipating in interview processesCollaboration with Delivery Manager and Project Manager Participating in onboarding of new team membersManaging Time Sheets and Administration related to the assigned team Requirements: Requirements: Previous hands-on team management experienceStrong Relationship Building SkillsExcellent interpersonal and communication skills to liaise with customers and team membersWorking in an organized way to meet the deadlinesFluent (business) English is a mustGood excel skills will be an advantageIT interest or curiosity for innovative technologies will be an advantage Offer: The offer: We welcome you to a stable and growing company with an excellent network of partners and clientsWe promote your success with ongoing professional training so that your talents continue to growYour new work environment is open and friendly - and also offers interesting career opportunitiesYou can look forward to a competitive payment with a variable success componentYou can expect fully international experience that stimulates achievement and excellent customer serviceYou will receive health insurance package Language: English
Company Name: Europe Language Jobs / Jobs abroad for language speakers

whole_unnormalized_body:
Software AG is looking for ambitious, confident and tenacious individuals for our rapidly growing Polish Sales Team. As a first point of contact with prospects, our Inside Sales Rep (ISR) create demand for our expansive portfolio of industry leading solutions and play a key role in our business success strategy. Qualifying conversations to understand the buyer's journey of challenges and priorities, and help to determine the appropriate next steps in the sales/evaluation process, our ISRs are a key component of the pipeline and revenue growth for Software AG along with being our sales superstars of the future.

 

Tasks and Responsibilities:

 

A ISR supports local sales team members with qualified opportunities - and will need to build strong professional relationships throughout the Sales & Marketing organizations. 

•  Follow up on Marketing Qualified Leads (i.e. Marketing Events, Webinars, Website Downloads)

•  Execute established daily cadence of prospecting and conversations to qualify leads and create new Sales Qualified Opportunities

•  Collaborate with sales team in defined territories to penetrate targeted accounts with an innovative and strategic approach

•  Maintain daily activities in SalesForce.com by tracking all calls, emails, and interactions with prospects and customers

•  Work closely with Marketing to both develop and leverage strategic campaigns to drive pipeline revenue and provide a feedback channel for greater traction of message

• Understanding of our Digital Business Platform, marketplace and competition

• Build working relationships with field sales, sales engineers, market development, and consulting to develop joint account plans/strategies

 

Professional Experience in year(s): 

Must have minimum of 1-2 years working experience in a professional business environment. While not necessary, the ideal candidate will have experience of working within an inside sales team and also the language skills to be able to support one or more countries across the EMEA region.

 

Desired Skills & Experience:

•  A burning desire for success and growth in a world class organization

•  Coachable with a willingness to learn, with a commitment to excellence

•  Superior communication, relationship building and collaborative capabilities

•  Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

•  Some B2B sales experience is a plus

 

What's in it for you?

•  For willing self-starters and results driven candidates, there is an incredible opportunity to advance your career within an identified progression route

•  Competitive salary with bonus opportunities

•  Work with multi-cultural and diverse team

•  Generous, flexible and industry leading benefits package

Enter Air Services jest firmą w pełni zależną od Enter Air i zajmuje się obsługą techniczną i serwisem samolotów jednej z największych linii turystycznych w Europie, realizującej połączenia dla czołowych polskich i zagranicznych biur podróży w ponad 30 krajach od Islandii i Portugalii po Kenię i Wyspy Zielonego Przylądka. Flota Enter Air składa się z 23 samolotów typu Boeing 737. Jesteśmy zgranym, dynamicznie działającym zespołem, połączonym pasją lotnictwa! Dołącz do nas!

 MAGAZYNIER LOTNICZY

Twoje obowiązki

  • Prowadzenie gospodarki magazynowej w organizacji obsługowej Part 145, w tym m.in.:- przyjmowanie, klasyfikowanie, ewidencjonowanie i znakowanie części, materiałów, sprzętów
  • wydawanie części, materiałów, sprzętów i ich dystrybucja do lokalnych magazynów lub dostawców zewnętrznych
  • prowadzenie, zgodnie z obowiązującymi przepisami, ewidencji ruchu i stanów zapasów oraz innych wymaganych dokumentów
  • kontrolowanie i ewidencja warunków magazynowania – raportowanie zdarzeń
  • Prowadzenie gospodarki narzędziowej
  • Zapewnienie niezbędnych części, materiałów i sprzętu do zaplanowanej obsługi technicznej w koordynacji z obszarem planowania produkcji i kierownikiem zmiany
  • Współpraca w ramach organizacji obsługi technicznej Part 145 z organizacją Part M operatora samolotu
  • Dystrybucja części i materiałów lotniczych

    • Nasze wymagania

    • Wykształcenie średnie (preferowane techniczne)
    • Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego w mowie i piśmie (mile widziana znajomość terminologii technicznej – lotniczej)
    • Mile widziane doświadczenie w prowadzeniu gospodarki magazynowej
    • Prawo jazdy kat. B

    • Umiejętność pracy w zespole i odporność na stres
    • Punktualność i dokładność w wykonywaniu powierzonych obowiązków
    • Gotowość do poszukiwania nieszablonowych rozwiązań
    • Dyspozycyjność do pracy w trybie zmianowym

    Nasza oferta

    • Wyjątkowa praca w największej turystycznej linii lotniczej w Polsce
    • Opieka medyczna i ubezpieczenie na życie
    • Karta Multisport i Klub Biegacza
    • Bilety lotnicze dla Pracowników i ich rodzin

  • Prowadzenie dokumentacji odnośnie projektów;·

 

Wymagania:

  •  Szeroka znajomość zagadnień związanych z technologiami (szczególnie zakresy typu·

telekomunikacja, oprogramowanie, bezpieczeństwo, OS, AI, UX);

  • Doświadczenie w dziale R·&D;
  • Wcześniejsza współpraca ze start-upami lub uniwersytetami;·
  • Mile widziane jest doświadczenie w takich obszarach, jak business development, research,·

transfer technologii, inwestycje w start-upy, środowisko uniwersyteckie;

  • Bardzo dobra znajomość j. angielskiego;·
  •  Wykształcenie wyższe o profilu inżynierskim;·
  • Silnie rozwinięte umiejętności komunikacji;·
  • Gotowość do podróży służbowych, które mogą się czasem pojawić, zarówno w Polsce, jak i za·

granicą.

 

Oferujemy:

  • Pracę w międzynarodowym, nowo powstającym zespole R·&D;
  • Wpływ na rozwój innowacji technologicznych w dużej firmie·
  • Zatrudnienie na podstawie Umowy o Pracę lub B2B;·
  • Atrakcyjny system premiowy·
  • Benefity: karta sportowa, ubezpieczenie, prywatna opieka medyczna·
  • Możliwość regularnego obcowania z językiem angielskim;·
  • Dogodny dojazd do biura mieszczącego się przy Rondzie Daszyńskiego (tuż przy stacji·

metra);

Through our portfolio of leading enterprise software solutions, we ignite business performance for thousands of customers globally. We’re doing it in an entirely remote workplace that is focused on building teams of top talent, and operating in a model that provides challenging opportunities and personal flexibility. Are you ready to take the next big step in your career? This listing is for our Customer Success Manager position, but we have found great applicants often have a current title of Key Account Manager or similar, so don’t be confused about that difference, we are glad you found us.

Do you have an exemplary track record in sales or account management within the technology or enterprise software space? If you didn't love selling, would you be a management consultant, understanding and mapping solutions to important business problems? Will you thrive working alongside the smartest peers in the industry, assessing commercial opportunities across multiple products and verticals? If so, you could be the right person to join our team as a Customer Success Manager.

Ignite makes over 90% of its sales, marketing and R&D investments in existing customers, and our unique, Netflix-style licensing model allows customers to access new solutions as part of their current subscription. As an Ignite CSM, this gives you the unprecedented capability to offer customers new solutions as fast as you can identify their business needs and map solutions to those needs.

Key responsibilities:

  • Identify sales opportunities within an installed customer base for solution expansion, solution innovation upsell, support program upsell, and new solution cross-sell
  • Perform regular cadence of business reviews with customers, surfacing customer needs and mapping Ignite’s value proposition to those needs
  • Qualify sales opportunities using the Scotsman framework to required probability for contract closing by the sales team
  • Operate effectively using Ignite’s structured sales processes and tools

Candidate requirements:

  • 3+ years in technology sales, including upselling and cross-selling
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
  • Account management or client partnership experience across several industries and a portfolio of solutions
  • Over-achievement versus quota in past sales or account management roles
  • Excellent written and spoken business English

What you will be doing:

Spending 50%+ of your time conducting business reviews with your customers, cycling through the process stages of Prepare, Engage, Execute and Review

Advancing 20+ sales opportunities per quarter from identified concept to sales qualified using video meetings, emails and phone conversations

Researching and understanding customer business objectives through Ignite's FirstRain tool, analysis of customer solution usage, and review of publicly available information

Executing <24 hour response to customer inquiries, bringing specialized Ignite resources to bear in order to solve customer issues

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. If you found this interesting, Apply on crossover.com. After applying you will take a few online “screening” assessments to check for a basic fit, and then move on to some real-world written questions. You will also be assigned to one of our recruiting specialists who can answer questions you might have about the process, role, or company, and help you get to the final interview step. We look forward to meeting you!

Crossover Job Code: LJ-4221-PL-Warsaw-KeyAccountMana

whole_unnormalized_body:
We are a member of French ALTEN Group present in 25 countries around the world and employing over 34,000 engineers and IT specialists. Since 1988 we deliver advanced IT systems for well-known brands, develop medicine and the renewable energy industry. ALTEN innovates aero and cosmonautics, trains, electric and autonomous vehicles, and even space rockets. We are currently looking for Business/System Analyst who will join our team.
Main tasks  

  • Business process analysis
  • Acquiring business requirements and preparing change specifications for IT systems developed in the Department
  • Preparation of functional specifications of IT systems
  • Preparation and implementation of functional and integration tests, data conversion, authorization model
  • The use and development of tools supporting functional tests 


Requirements

  • Knowledge of methodologies for obtaining requirements and preparation of functional specifications for IT systems
  • Practical experience in the preparation, definition, description and modification of business processes and data model
  • Practical experience in implementing IT projects with particular emphasis on creating custom applications
  • Practical experience in implementing integration and migration projects
  • Practical experience in testing (functional, integration, data conversion / reconciliation, authorization model)
  • Knowledge about SQL


We offer

  • Stable and long-term cooperation
  • Certification and training opportunities
  • Possibility to choose type of contract (B2B also)
  • Benefit package (MultiSport card, Medicover, MyBenefit)
  • Unlimited growth and development opportunity
  • Relocation support & relocation package

Do not hesitate and join our team!

    z branży FMCG o najwyższych standardach pracy,

Senior Statistician



An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Senior Biostatistician to join a global CRO in either office based in multiple European locations or home-based with occasional travel. Leading project-based statistics teams, you will project manage the workload and delivery of statistical support for our sponsors. In addition to leading the team, you will also represent our brand for all client-facing reviews offering statistical expertise and reporting.  



Responsibilities



  • Leading all biostatistics activities related to clinical trials as a responsible project statistician.
  • Communication line for project teams, clients and vendors on statistical questions.
  • Development and review of statistical sections of protocols, including sample size calculations.
  • Development of statistical analysis plans.
  • Development and documentation of analysis database structures (i.e. SAS analysis data set structures).
  • Development of SAS program requirements and specifications.
  • SAS programming and program validation.
  • Review and QC of statistical deliverables (tables, listings, figures, etc.).
  • Performing statistical analysis and reporting results.
  • Providing consultation on experimental design, statistical methods, and approaches for the purpose of assessing the safety and efficacy of drug products.
  • Liaison with DM on statistical questions related to data issues, including coordination of data transfers from DM to Statistics.
  • Participation in bid defense meetings and kick-off meetings.
  • Communication line for project teams, including statisticians and SAS Programmers.
  • Communication line for customers and vendors on statistical questions.
  • Conducting of project-specific training of statisticians and SAS programmers.
  • Coaching and training of statisticians (non-project-related).
  • Preparation and delivery of presentations at investigators' meetings
  • Preparation for and attendance at internal and third-party study audits pertinent to Statistics.
  • Preparation of the answers to the internal/external audits findings/recommendations, and follow-up on and resolution of audit findings.
  • Participation in the development of guidelines, procedures and other Quality Systems Documents (QSDs) pertinent to activities of the Biostatistics department.



Ideal Candidate


  • MSc in Statistics or related field.
  • Extensive experience in SAS and CDISC ADaM IG 1.0 or later, define 1-0-0.xml ad define 2-0-0.xml.
  • Knowledge of CDISC SDTM IG 3.1.3 or later nQuery Advisor software is a bonus.
  • Experience working as part of a statistical function within a CRO.



What we offer


  • Competitive Salary
  • Attractive benefits package
  • Flexibility on location/home-working.

We are looking for a Receptionist for our Integrated Facility Management business line.

About JLL

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

Role Purpose

The Receptionist reports into the Office Services Coordinator and is responsible for managing the front desk; providing support to ensure facilities services are provided in an effective and efficient manner. As front of house support the Receptionist must also demonstrate a high level of security awareness at all times and have knowledge of emergency evacuation procedures and Health & Safety.

What this job involves

  • Receive, direct and relay telephone, fax & email and other queries
  • Greet, assist and direct candidates/new hires/visitors and the general public to the appropriate staff member
  • Manage incoming/outgoing mail and courier services
  • Maintain the security sign-in book and a general filing system of correspondence, contacts and deliveries
  • Assist in the preparation of the reception interview rooms
  • Taking New hire photographs
  • When Security on site is not present
    • Issuing of ID and access badges for new hires/vendors/visitors and maintaining record of same.
    • Print badges for new hires/loaner badges etc. at the direction of the Facilities Management and maintaining records of same.
  • Assist the Office Service Coordinator in managing the repair and maintenance of office equipment and in the ordering of office supplies.
  • Maintain the reception area in good order
  • Support the facilities team
  • Responsible for all other duties and tasks as assigned

 

Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity.

Sounds like you? To apply you need to be / have:

  • Experience in reception, concierge or related field
  • Experience within a large commercial organisation would be beneficial
  • Must have experience in running a front desk
  • Excellent people skills and ability to interact with a wide range of client staff and demands
  • Strong PC literacy and proven ability to manage daily activities using various systems.
  • Excellent organisational and communication skill (both written and oral)
  • Must be fluent in English
  • Problem solving & decision making skills
  • Be customer focused
  • Possess cultural awareness and sensitivity

 

What you can expect from us

  • You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
  • Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay.
  • Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

Apply today at jll.com/careers.

 

JLL Privacy Statement

 

When you visit JLL websites, JLL may collect information related to those visits, without you actively sending that information. This information may include, for example, the internet browser you are using, your access device’s operating system, the language in which that system presents information to you, your IP (Internet Protocol) address, the web search that took you to the JLL website, the web pages and advertisements displayed to you, and the links you click on.

For additional details please see JLL's Global Privacy Statement or our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here.

SENIOR SPECIALIST INTERNAL CONTROLS

(office based in the center of Warsaw)


OVERVIEW:

As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We’ve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 50 years now.

Today, worldwide almost 7,000 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 70 locations on all continents. The Internal Controls Senior Specialist – Europe and Asia (Poland) is responsible for supporting the Senior Internal Controls Manager in the execution of the Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) 404 compliance program (at European and Asian In-scope locations) including the maintenance and preparation of clear, detailed and accurate SOX documentation, including: narratives/process diagrams, control descriptions, risk control matrices, test plans and test results evaluations (including support of and managing the external third party testing program), develop remediation plans and follow through for implementation.

The Senior Specialist is expected to develop working relationships with various levels of management, and work together with Finance, IT, Audit and Business Unit professionals to successfully achieve the objectives of the global SOX 404 program. The Senior Specialist will be responsible for developing proficiency of the SOX Tool (Auditboard) and understanding of the SOX IT program and tools in support of the Senior Manager. In addition, the Senior Specialist will be expected to take the lead on assigned projects, manage deliverables, and develop relevant reports. 


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Support the global scoping process and specifically communicate with the European entities regarding the accounts and processes in scope for the internal controls audit
  • Participate in the development of and communication of the SOX testing schedule
  • Perform "walkthroughs" with financial process owners as part of Control Certification process for the European and Asian entities
  • Assist with controls transitioned from local entities to the business support center
  • Participate in close-out meetings with local finance management, third-party control testers and agree on remediation for noted deficiencies
  • Review of process/control documentation, historical audit findings and provide final gaps report
  • Rationalize and walkthrough controls for EMEA business support entities including:
  • Translation of process documentation to English
  • Completion of control walkthroughs and gaps report
  • Harmonization of centrally located controls
  • Work through gaps and support implementation of remediation
  • Perform other duties as required. 

 

REQUIREMENTS:

GENERAL: 

  • Proposes new ways to address current issues, situations and provides solutions
  • Quick to learn and is able to focus on the most important elements in new or ambiguous circumstances in relation to SOX program management and project management
  • Uses his/her knowledge of the business or processes to anticipate issues and initiate preventative actions
  • Comfortable making decisions with incomplete or absent information if necessary
  • Able to take a stand with peers or management. Has negotiation skills and the ability to constructively influence others’ to achieve results
  • Partners with business leaders to identify and create value for own business area
  • Applies understanding of the organization’s technology, systems and data to support SOX process and controls analysis and communicates effectively with the business partners
  • Takes initiative to share emerging trends and policies and their implications to Bruker from a SOX controls and process perspective.
  • Able to successfully manage complex projects with demanding deadlines and key stakeholders.
  • Able to perform in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Sets clear objectives and holds people accountable. Effectively communicates vision, strategy, goals and progress. Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Able to build strong collaboration between stakeholders and finds ways to forge higher levels of teamwork and collaboration within and between groups.
  • Strong communicator and listener and effectively gets messages across to the audience
  • Organize, analyze, and interpret data, records, and reports. Strong analytical skills and a problem solver.
  • Strong understanding of GAAP, financial controls (SOX 404 and COSO framework), leading practices, process analysis and risk assessment
  • Operate with a high standard of ethics and professionalism
  • Strong knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office applications including: Excel, Word, Project, Visio and SharePoint
  • Up to 15% travel (yearly base).


SPECIFIC: 

  • Minimum 4-6 years of Internal Controls work experience
  • A mix of public accounting experience and additional experience with internal controls, internal audit or systems design and implementation.
  • Experience with SEC companies
  • Experience with SAP a plus 
  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or business administration required, other related field training a plus
  • Desirable Certifications: CPA, CIA or relevant controls experience is preferred.

 

Bruker is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability and other protected characteristics. 

Bruker BSC offers a comprehensive and competitive salary and benefits package, work in an international and dynamic environment, stable and long-term cooperation and the office in the heart of Warsaw.

KWS Berlin GmbH is looking for a business partner Central Europe (m/f/d) for our Berlin-based office. The Business Partner Finance Central Europe (ie. Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia) is a key interaction point for the business whom provides high-quality consulting and insight-related and knowledge-based services from a functional perspective and to improve decision making. The business partner facilitates the supporting role to the lead of Business Partners EMEA. Within this role the Business Partner connects, challenges and monitors the business units and the global function leads in their chosen strategies. Moreover, guaranteeing that the chosen business strategies deliver the highest financial value at an “acceptable level of risk”. Confirming quality and efficiency of processes and services for KWS while being compliant, while ultimately focusing on adding benefits and creating a future-oriented finance function.

The position is unlimited and fulltime. The starting date is April 1st, 2020.


Your tasks:


  • You are the first point of contact as well as an interface between function and business for knowledge-based activities.
  • You proactively consult and work with the business in order to solve complex issues and to develop adequate solutions.
  • Moreover, you will support the business in the decision-making process with adequate information, reports and analytics.
  • You will also manage and support improvement projects.
  • Your ensure that the definition and implementation of the functional KWS-wide strategy and regional/global strategic priorities.
  • Furthermore, your will make sure that local and legal deadlines are met in full on time.
  • You are responsible for cash-flow planning management, hedging, financial engineering and dividend payment.



Your profile:


  • Preferably you have an academic degree in Business, Economics, Finance or similar.
  • You have several years of professional experience in the field of finance or controlling in an globally acting environment. Professional experience in the producing industry is an asset.
  • You have a proven track record of good operational finance and business partnering experience in a global diverse environment.
  • You have project management experience (PMP preferred).
  • You have a good knowledge of SAP and MSO. Having worked with other ERP systems is an asset.
  • You demonstrate excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills together with an excellent level of customer orientation.
  • You are willing to travel at least 60% of the time.
  • You have strong influencing and partnership skills.
  • You have a very good command of Polish, English, German (written and spoken).



﻿We offer:

 

  • Opportunity to work in an international environment and team
  • Professional and personal development 
  • Attractive remuneration and flexible working hours
  • Financial support for public transport
  • Several corporate employee benefits
  • 30d of vacation
  • a location in the heart of Berlin

WealthArc is the fast-growing FinTech platform for wealth management professionals. By automating manual processes and making data integration easy, WealthArc changes the way of managing investments in Switzerland and beyond.


We are looking for an exceptional Senior Data Science Analyst to join our young and dynamic R&D Team in Warsaw. We offer a work in unique start-up culture, in which creativity, passion, and independence are not just welcomed but required.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain ETL/API engine that transforms custodian bank portfolio data into the standard format
  • Propose and lead initiatives to improve quality of data and to automate ETL & data quality processes, especially applying data science where possible
  • Bring new ideas to scale and automate data processes with growing number of client accounts and APIs
  • Work closely with Product, Engineering, Customer Support, and Sales teams


Requirements:

  • 4+ years of experience in analytics or data science – including practice in proposing and implementing data science models
  • Proficient in at least one programming language such as SQL, Python or R
  • Strong team player, ability to lead small project teams (up to 3 people)
  • Understanding of financial products modelling or experience in financial industry is nice to have
  • Fluent English


What you can expect:

  • An exciting job with a lot of independence
  • Flexible working hours
  • Opportunity to grow and steep learning curve
  • Participation in Tech Talks, training and conferences

whole_unnormalized_body:
WealthArc is the fast-growing FinTech platform for wealth management professionals. By automating manual processes and making data integration easy, WealthArc changes the way of managing investments in Switzerland and beyond.


We are looking for an exceptional Senior Data Science Analyst to join our young and dynamic R&D Team in Warsaw. We offer a work in unique start-up culture, in which creativity, passion, and independence are not just welcomed but required.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain ETL/API engine that transforms custodian bank portfolio data into the standard format
  • Propose and lead initiatives to improve quality of data and to automate ETL & data quality processes, especially applying data science where possible
  • Bring new ideas to scale and automate data processes with growing number of client accounts and APIs
  • Work closely with Product, Engineering, Customer Support, and Sales teams


Requirements:

  • 4+ years of experience in analytics or data science – including practice in proposing and implementing data science models
  • Proficient in at least one programming language such as SQL, Python or R
  • Strong team player, ability to lead small project teams (up to 3 people)
  • Understanding of financial products modelling or experience in financial industry is nice to have
  • Fluent English


What you can expect:

  • An exciting job with a lot of independence
  • Flexible working hours
  • Opportunity to grow and steep learning curve
  • Participation in Tech Talks, training and conferences

In January 2014 we have created a regional HR boutique providing recruitment & consulting services in Central Eastern Europe. After a few years of successful delivery in the area of Sales & Marketing, Engineering and BPO/SSC in February 2019 we became part of L.M. International Group. We are proud to call ourselves Experts in recruitment for the BPO/SSC sector.

(Junior) Back Office Specialist with English
KAOK

Responsibilities
  • Work in one of the administration departments,
  • Producing and providing regular data analysis and reports,
  • Communication in with business clients via e-mail,
  • Extracting data from various reporting environments and tools,
  • Analyzing and presenting data in MS Excel,
  • Preparing reports, entering data into system.


Requirements
  • Very good knowledge of English (C1),
  • Experience in customer service or other internships will be an asset,
  • Good communication & interpersonal skills,
  • Customer orientation.


Our Client Offers
  • Multicultural work environment,
  • International assignments and projects,
  • Induction training and language courses
  • Private medical care with family option,
  • Life and accident insurance,
  • 26 days of holiday regardless of your seniority,
  • Multisport.

whole_unnormalized_body:
We are looking for a suitable candidate for PR Specialist position in Huawei Polska Consumer BG. The ideal candidate would be in charge of holistic PR communication management, including media relations and product marketing campaign implementation. 


Job Requirements


  • University Degree (preferably Marketing or Journalism), telecommunication related would be a plus.
  • Have at least 3 years of experience working as a PR specialist or copywriter.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a multi-cultural environment.
  • Excellent project management skills.
  • Creative, reliable, responsible and accurate with an attention to details
  • In-depth understanding of all key social media platforms in Poland
  • Very Good English in speaking, reading and writing.
  • Good MS Office skills.

 

Main Responsibilities


  •  Implements PR and communication plans;
  • Plan and supervise media projects, events, fairs, conferences etc.
  • Build relationships with partner organizations, generate publicity around conducted social responsibility projects.
  • Coordinates PR calendar to ensure always-on quality communication based on business requirements throughout the year.
  • Support the implementation of promotional plans
  • Manage media relations and requests
  • Write press releases, speeches and other PR copy
  • Keeping up to date with industry best practice and monitoring PR activities of competitors.
  • Support to marketing team to create digital content for the different social media channels.
  • Plan and implement spreading information about product launch events, monitor the implementation and assess the results;
  • Stay up-to-date with developments and generate new ideas to draw the audience’s attention
