whole_unnormalized_body:
We are looking for an Analyst, Portfolio Management for our Corporate Solutions business line.

About JLL

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

Sector Overview

Portfolio Management team is aiming to support the Clients in making strategic decisions with regards to their real estate portfolio. The team is involved in projects for Clients from various industries and geographical zones, performing collection, validation and collation of key real estate market information and using it for comprehensive analyses supporting portfolio management process.

Role Purpose

The role purpose is to support the team in the real estate portfolio optimization analyses as well as in matching Client’s real estate strategy with business needs.

What This Job Involves-
  • Gathering and evaluating real estate market and property data
  • Supporting Transaction Managers in financial evaluation of the deals
  • Financial analyses of the Clients real estate portfolio in order to support key strategic decisions
  • Preparing Client-facing documentation- PowerPoint presentations with portfolio analyses summary, key findings and recommendations
  • Support internal and external Clients with analyses focused on real estate and finance
  • Collate, validate and verify data and conduct qualitative analyses
  • Maintain internal and external databases and systems
Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity.

Sound like you? To apply you need to be / have-
  • Fluent English
  • Bachelor’s/M.A. degree in Real Estate or Finance or Economics
  • At least 2 years of work experience (real estate industry experience is not necessary, but it will be a plus)
  • Good knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel (VBA would be a plus) and Power Point
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Highly analytical and good visualization skills
  • Numerical proficiency
  • Creative and pragmatic mind-set, strong attention to details

We are looking for an Analyst, Portfolio Management for our Corporate Solutions business line.

About JLL

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

Sector Overview

Portfolio Management team is aiming to support the Clients in making strategic decisions with regards to their real estate portfolio. The team is involved in projects for Clients from various industries and geographical zones, performing collection, validation and collation of key real estate market information and using it for comprehensive analyses supporting portfolio management process.

Role Purpose

The role purpose is to support the team in the real estate portfolio optimization analyses as well as in matching Client’s real estate strategy with business needs.

What This Job Involves-
  • Gathering and evaluating real estate market and property data
  • Supporting Transaction Managers in financial evaluation of the deals
  • Financial analyses of the Clients real estate portfolio in order to support key strategic decisions
  • Preparing Client-facing documentation- PowerPoint presentations with portfolio analyses summary, key findings and recommendations
  • Support internal and external Clients with analyses focused on real estate and finance
  • Collate, validate and verify data and conduct qualitative analyses
  • Maintain internal and external databases and systems
Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity.

Sound like you? To apply you need to be / have-
  • Fluent English
  • Bachelor’s/M.A. degree in Real Estate or Finance or Economics
  • At least 2 years of work experience (real estate industry experience is not necessary, but it will be a plus)
  • Good knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel (VBA would be a plus) and Power Point
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Highly analytical and good visualization skills
  • Numerical proficiency
  • Creative and pragmatic mind-set, strong attention to details

Description

Amazon strives to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover virtually anything they want to buy online. By giving customers more of what they want - low prices, vast selection, and convenience - Amazon continues to grow and evolve as a world-class e-commerce platform. Amazon's evolution from Web site to e-commerce partner to development platform is driven by the spirit of innovation that is part of the company's DNA. The world's brightest technology minds come to Amazon to research and develop technology that improves the lives of shoppers and sellers around the world.

Job Description

Amazon is seeking an experienced Benefits and Pension Support Specialist to lead the Benefits Administration in Europe. This role will collaborate extensively with internal stakeholders/ external partners and lead the team to develop and execute against a multi-year road-map for benefit administration support in Europe. Strong project management skills as well as proven abilities to help design and implement tools/processes are critical to this role. The ideal candidate should be able to work independently, be innovative, and have a desire to participate in change, and appreciate a dynamic environment. We are seeking someone with a demonstrated history of successfully owning and managing large, complex problems and engaging with cross-functional teams, and numerous stakeholders, directly and through influence.
Core Responsibilities
v Project Management: Responsible for transition of existing and launch of new benefits and pension administration processes/programs. Standardizing processes across based on local plans, regulations and requirements; aligning recommended processes with IT solutions (for example, Benefits tool); and facilitating approval from stakeholders. Responsible for supporting cyclical benefits and pension events and activities, such as enrolments, renewals, reporting and reconciliation.

v Continuous Improvement: Own overall service quality at process level. Define and monitor benefit and pension administration critical to quality (CTQs) metrics, perform root cause analysis on defects and implement remediation; own continuous improvement strategy.

v Customer Service: Manage employee escalations, exceptions and appeals and provide advice and monitor resolution on full range of benefit and pension related topics.

v Vendor and Audit Management: Manage outside vendors performing benefit administration services for Amazon. Certify periodic audits. Work closely with a local HR team, payroll, HR Shared Services, providers and vendors ensuring that the benefits administration is delivered consistently, and in line with contract/legal requirements.

v People Management: Lead a team of benefits support specialist dedicated to specific programs/countries.

Multiple EU locations available.


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, HR or related field
  • 8+ years of relevant program management experience, working experience on benefits
  • Fluent in English
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve program success through influence and partnership from design to delivering of initiatives
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills with ability to interface with all levels of the organization and demonstrated ability to influence decision makers
  • Deep understanding and experience in delivering high levels of customer service
  • Highly organized, able to prioritize and work under pressure on a number of projects/initiatives at the same time in a rapidly growing environment
  • Strong data analysis skills; the ability to extract and synthesize data in order to make data-backed business decisions
  • Ability to develop ad-hoc reporting to meet specific business needs and inquiries
  • Successful record of building operational processes and procedures, continuously improving programs and efficiencies
  • Periodic Global business travel may be required.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience managing large-scale employee benefit or pension administration programs, associated vendor management, and program development and delivery
  • Exceptional analytical skills, including proven abilities in process development and data management, financial accounting, reporting, auditing and reconciliations, and strengths in reporting and communicating data and trends to business leaders

position: Portfolio Reconciliations and Client Valuations- Associate – Warsaw
whole_unnormalized_body:
YOUR IMPACT

Are you looking to apply your quantitative skills while deepening your understanding of margin process for various products? Our collateral Management team is seeking a professional who is looking to collaborate with Clients, Credit risk, Sales, Controllers, traders, strategists and structurers to mitigate risks associated with the Collateral management functions

Responsibilities And Qualifications

OUR IMPACT

Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to deliver banking, sales and trading and asset management capabilities to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and control to preserve and enhance the firm’s assets and its reputation. For every trade agreed, every new product launched or market entered, every transaction completed, it is Operations that develops the processes and controls that makes business flow.

Collateral Management, part of Margin, Valuations & Pricing Operations sits within the Goldman Sachs Securities organization. A global, multi-faceted and cross product function, the primary objective of the department is the mitigation of counterparty credit risk through the active monitoring of clients’ derivative and securities financing portfolios. Collateral Management is a global function, with regions in Salt Lake City, New York, London, Frankfurt, Bangalore, Singapore, and Warsaw working closely together. The team has a rare opportunity to support products and business ranging from foreign exchange, commodities, credit, equity, interest rates, repo, insurance/pensions and bespoke structured derivatives and arrangements. The team manages a wide range of complex processes, with members developing skills and competencies around derivative & security products and their respective business areas, legal agreements, technology flows and regulations.

How You Will Fulfill Your Potential
  • Liaise with clients in order to track and resolve position discrepancies
  • Consolidate requests in order to communicate pricing and position issues with Controllers, Credit and Middle Office teams
  • Deliver position reports to clients and 3rd party vendors on a timely fashion
  • Constantly recommend and develop more efficient methods of price consolidation and delivery
  • Participate in development and implementation of Portfolio Reconciliation mandate
  • Plan and execute projects under Manager's direction
  • Review and resolve collateral disputes using various firm tools while liaising with clients, trading, Controllers, Credit, etc.
  • Leverage your quantitative and analytical skills to identify complex dispute drivers across all OTC derivative products and liaise with trading desks and Controllers to resolve.
  • Use your inquisitive mindset to identify control weaknesses with respect to process flow methodology as well as develop an understanding of how cash flows and trades are valued and discounted inline with LIBOR and CSA specific methodologies.
  • Grow with the team; develop a deeper understanding of complex derivative transactions and work with our business partners to progress to progress collateral dispute investigation and resolution.


Basic Qualifications

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  • Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of three years of experience in financial services.
  • Proven analytical skills, problem solving ability, and a control mentality paired with meticulous attention to detail
  • Aptitude for building relationships and ability to communicate complex issues to a wide array of internal clients with differing levels of product experience
  • Self-motivated and proactive team player who takes ownership and accountability of projects, has strong organizational skills as well as the ability to effectively manage competing priorities
  • Flexible and able to work well under pressure in a team environment
  • Knowledge of OTC derivatives and trade flows will be a significant help

About Goldman Sachs

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

Front Office Clerk (short-term)

OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR)

Deadline for Application: 26 March 2020

Background

The Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR) is the principal institution of the OSCE responsible for the human dimension. ODIHR is active throughout the OSCE area in the fields of election observation, democratic development, human rights, tolerance and non-discrimination, and the rule of law. ODIHR’s assistance projects and other activities are implemented in participating States in accordance with ODIHR’s mandate.

The Office is looking to appoint a Front Office Clerk (short-term) on the full-time basis for a period of 6 months, starting from 01 May 2020, with the possibility of further extension of contract (in total up to 1 year).

Tasks And Responsibilities

Under the general supervision of the Senior Administrative Assistant, the incumbent performs the tasks of a Receptionist, Switchboard Operator, Meeting Assistant, Administrative and Mail Clerk. Work is organized in shifts between 8 am and 6 pm.

The Incumbent Performs The Following Duties
  • Operating a telephone switchboard; placing official incoming calls, establishing telephone connections upon request of staff members, taking and delivering messages;
  • Obtaining additional information on the identity of persons from the Security Guards who are controlling access of visitors to the building;
  • Greeting visitors and supplying general information on the work programme of the Office;
  • Distributing mail correspondence and parcels to addressees;
  • Keeping informed on presences/absences (including duty travel, annual leave, attendance at outside meetings) of staff members and answers queries in that respect;
  • Providing logistic support for in-house meetings and conferences;
  • Updating logs of official correspondence (Note Verbale) and experts contracts, scanning invoices;
  • Performing other duties as assigned.

For more detailed information on the structure and work of the OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights, please see

Education And Experience
  • Completed secondary education;
  • Two years of office experience, including at least one year of experience as a switchboard operator;
  • Proficiency in Polish and English, Russian language is an asset;
  • Ability to operate modern telephone equipment;
  • Excellent communication skills and tact in dealing with people from a variety of national and cultural backgrounds.
  • Demonstrated gender awareness and sensitivity and an ability to integrate a gender perspective into tasks and activities;

Remuneration

Monthly remuneration, subject to social security deductions, is approximately 5,100 PLN. OSCE salaries are exempt from taxation in Poland. Social security will include participation in the Cigna International medical insurance scheme (current approximate deduction for a staff member is 44 Euro).

Appointments for short term assignments are always made at step 1 of the applicable OSCE salary scale.

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please use OSCE’s online application link found under

The OSCE retains the discretion to re-advertise the vacancy, to cancel the recruitment, to offer an appointment at a lower grade or to offer an appointment with a modified job description or for a different duration.

Only the OSCE on-line applications will be accepted and short-listed applicants contacted.

The OSCE is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce, and encourages qualified female and male candidates from all national, religious, ethnic and social backgrounds to apply to become a part of the Organization.

Please note that vacancies in the OSCE are open for competition only amongst nationals of participating States, please see

No application fees or information with respect to bank account details are required by OSCE for our recruitment process.

Please note that in the event of invitation for interview, the OSCE is unable to reimburse costs incurred.

Job Description

Finance Business Partner for commercial functions (Sales PO1, Marketing (Beverages and Snacks), Trade Marketing, Commercialization and Revenue Management), serving as a single point of contact for all activities driving Revenue generation.
Provides clarity of financial impact of commercial activities, runs budgets, forecasts and it’s variances, challenges business-owners to improve efficiency, works across siloses to connect business owners, drives required team & supporting systems transformations to respond to faster pace of business.
Drives growth with profitability in mindset.

Accountabilities
  • Leads budgeting processes (AOP, IBP, Forecasts) for Top Lines (volume, pricing, Discounts & Allowances) between Sales / Trade Marketing, Marketing and Top Management for all channels (including planning by customer for Modern Trade) for Beverages and Snacks;
  • Leads Revenue Governance agenda in partnering with Senior Commercial teams to ensure that key Net Revenue KPIs are achieved in line with strategic goals and AOP targets are obtained;
  • Delivers regular Corporate Reporting according to Sector requirements (Brands, Channels, NRRs,etc);
  • Drives Tools & Systems (TM1, PGT, MOSAIC, BI…) usage and development to reduce repetitive work, increase automation and standardization, leverage technology in everyday work in order to support changes in ongoing business;
  • Support Controlling team in managing D&A budgets (on & off, fixed / variable, contractual / out of contract) by providing latest assumptions on forecasted spend, as well as on YTD performance;
  • Ensure personal development of employees by regular work on improving their skills, develops talents toward Finance Vision agenda;

Functional Competencies

Qualifications/Requirements
  • High level of business acumen, commercially savvy, with strong analytical skills;
  • A strong Financial background with sound Commercial understanding;
  • 8-10 yrs+ overall experience, 3 yrs+ managerial (min);
  • Has good knowledge of how FMCG s Commercial business operate and interact;
  • Fluent English and Polish;
  • MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, advanced working knowledge of analytical applications;
  • University degree;

Leadership Effectiveness
  • Managing through tight timelines requires proper planning and self discipline (rigid reporting calendar for forecasts, short lead-times for business analysis, quick turnaround data interrogation requests etc.);
  • Collaborates well with others and is able to influence at a senior level in the organisation through reasoning and relationships, Understands and uses informal networks at the appropriate level to get things done;
  • Managing ambiguity ~ working within a complex, fluid cross-functional environment managing significant amounts of change, and being able to influence a broad base of cross-functional stakeholders & peers, clearly articulates , simplify and presents information;
  • Looks ahead to reasonably anticipate business opportunities and obstacles;
  • Change-driver, leading team to do things differently;
Relocation Eligible: Eligible for Standard Relocation
Job Type: Regular

Careers that Change Lives
Engineers create our market-leading portfolio of innovations. Combine the best of your experience with training and mentorship to move forward. If you want a challenging, energizing, rewarding career that changes lives, join us. Help us bring the next generation of life-changing medical technology to patients worldwide. Together, we can confront the challenges that will change the face of healthcare. Join us for a career that change lives.

A Day in the Life

As An EBusiness Analyst You Will Be
  • Support for Customer Care Operations related to e-business and e-commerce activities in EMEA region
  • Maintenance and setup of e-business objects, like incoming e-orders, outgoing e-invoices, automated notifications, etc.
  • E-catalogues maintenance – data integrity, cleansing and regular updates of product master database
  • Regular mailbox monitoring and action triggering for e-ordering and e-invoicing processes
  • Monitoring of web portals for manual order entry
  • Monitoring GHX dashboards for e-ordering and e-invoicing for any errors
  • Preparing data for new customer implementations – GLNs, relationships ship-to/sold-to/bill-to
  • Monitoring SAP e-ordering dashboard (ZSM_EORDERS_NEW)
  • Reporting and analysis of e-business statistics
Must Have
  • Desire to learn new things
  • Ability to understand complex issues
  • Readiness for unexpected challenges
  • Teamspirit mood
  • Some e-business or e-commerce
  • Sales reporting, sales analysis and Pricing/tenders/contracts maintenance
  • Languages: Very good English – substantial;
  • MS Excel – high/expertise level; data manipulation and look-up; SAP literate
  • Self-organized, able to work either as part of the team or independently and deliver expected results without direct supervision
Nice Have
  • Experience with B2B e-business solutions, EDI, e-commerce
    • Familiarity with GS1 Standards (GTIN, GLN, EAN) and barcodes
    • Knowledge of product classification systems (UNSPSC, CPV)
    • Knowledge of SQL queries
    About Medtronic

    Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.
    We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

    At Medtronic, you will find a diverse team of innovators who bring their unique backgrounds and their individual life experiences to work every day. We work hard to cultivate a workforce that reflects our patients and partners, we believe it’s the only way to drive healthcare forward. We want to attract a diverse workforce, regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state or local law. Join us, and bring the power of your point of view to our culture of collaboration and innovation. It is through strong diversity, inclusion and engagement that we can remain a leader in medical technology and solutions. And by embracing everything you have to offer — your unique perspectives, talents and contributions — we can live up to the promise of our Mission.

Description

Syncron is currently looking for a driven Expert Services Consultant to join our Warsaw Customer Success team. As a Consultant you’ll work closely with the local team as well as our colleagues from other offices in order to implement Syncron’s solutions for our international customers, which are leading companies from the construction equipment industry, rail, aviation and other related fields.

In the first year at Syncron, the Implementation consultant is expected to learn about Syncron’s products and to be able to assume a customer-facing role. This role includes development of complex software solutions from the business side: presentations, data analysis, documentation and reporting.

Responsibilities
  • Taking part in delivering software to customers, including:
    • Gathering, analyzing and documenting customer requirements
    • Designing business and process solutions related to supply chain based on Syncron’s products
    • Identifying customer needs and suggesting extensions and additional services
  • Configuring Syncron’s products to fulfill customer’s needs:
    • Modelling the supply chain and fine-tuning parameters
    • Testing configuration and ensuring business alignment
  • Delivering workshops & user training
  • Manage Implementation Projects within time and budget constraints
  • Identifying and reporting enhancement ideas and bugs to the Product Management department

Requirements
  • University degree (engineering or IT preferably)
  • A minimum of 3-5 years of work experience
  • An interest in leveraging Information Technology to reach world class business objectives
  • Strong Business acumen and customer focus
  • Extensive analytical skills:
    • Ability to understand and document customer requirements
    • Data analysis and reporting skills
  • Excellent communication skills – both spoken and written
  • Structured work approach and thoroughness
  • Basic knowledge of SQL and relational databases
  • Willingness to travel

Preffered Qualifications
  • Consulting experience where previous experience from design and/or implementation of ERP systems or other applications
  • Experience in working with Price Management applications such as forecasting, supply planning, order management, price management, etc.
  • German, Spanish or French languages are a plus

About Syncron

Syncron empowers the world’s leading manufacturers to maximize product uptime and deliver exceptional after-sales service experiences, while driving significant revenue and profit improvements. From industry leading investments in research and development, to providing the fastest time-to-value, Syncron’s award-winning, cloud-based service parts inventory, price and uptime management solutions are designed to continually exceed customer expectations. Top brands from around the world trust Syncron to transform their after-sales service operations into competitive differentiators. For more information, visit syncron.com.

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Internet

whole_unnormalized_body:
Country Poland

Location Warszawa

Function Information & Digital Technology

Level Experienced Professional

Job Type Permanent

Contractual Legal Entity BAT Polska Trading Spzoo (PL12)

Application Deadline 29.04.2020

British American Tobacco (BAT) is one of the World’s leading consumer goods companies, with brands sold around the globe. Our vision is to “Transform Tobacco” and our industry, so - during 2019 - we are setting up a new “Tech Hub” in Poland to support and drive our digital transformation. This is the start of the journey and we are looking for team player who is passionate about change and ready to support us in making digital part of our DNA.

PURPOSE STATEMENT

Are you Analytics and Big Data enthusiast? Always looking how you can improve business through data and generate new insights? Ready for challenges around supply chain and track and trace systems with billions of events? Please apply!

We have extremely exciting opportunity to join our Track and Trace programme and lead Analytics capability. The primary objective is to ensure we are in position to monitor our compliance rate and provide tools to the business to investigate the root causes behind noncompliance. Furthermore, Data and Analytic Lead will be responsible for identifying and driving Analytics use cases for Track and Trace data in the wider Manufacturing & Supply Chain context.

CONTEXT

BAT has developed its Serialisation and Track and Trace solution to comply with various regulations (most recently TPD 2019) i.e. tracking of unit packs, cartons, master cases and pallets from manufacturing extending up to the final warehouse before the first retailer. The template solution has been deployed across the geographical scope of EU member states, as well as any other site supplying EU member states. Meanwhile the aspiration of BAT is to use the Serialisation and Track and Trace solution developed for TPD as the fundamental global Serialisation and Track and Trace template solution to be used for all other similar regulations for Tobacco products around the world, as well as any other internally driven requirement of Global Serialization and Track and Trace within the group.

Since July 2019 the common template solution has already been Live, adopted with the appropriate adjustments and additional functionalities (gaps) required for compliance to the regulations in United Arab Emirates (UAE), Russia and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA). The solution template was also deployed and adopted within the countries in scope of the EUCA agreement (e.g. Serbia, Ukraine, Switzerland, Turkey, etc.) to allow deployment, support and maintenance of a single template solution within the wider European region.

From January 2020, a new programme will be established with global scope and a mandate to deliver and deploy Track and Trace solution to BAT entities around the world, driven by new demand of Serialization and Track and trace regulations at national or country union level or proactively driven by internal BAT business decisions and priorities. It is expected the programme will have 5 years duration.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES

Product ownership
  • Work closely with business owners to elucidate functional and non-functional requirements related to TnT master data and Analytics reports; when appropriate split the requirement (feature) into smaller stories
  • Review analytics and Data requirements in the context of new Track and Trace deployments and identify the existing solution (wherever applicable) or suggest the new ones
  • Drive innovation through identifying new ways in which existing data could be used to provide business value
  • Create roadmap for analytics solutions and technologies aligned with BAT DRA strategy
  • Communicate progress, proactively manage risks and issues, escalating to the Project IDT Lead, where necessary
  • Collaborate effectively with other product teams, SMEs, Deployment teams, Data and Analytics team, suppliers and others both within and outside the Programme structure
  • Understand and report progress against agreed outcomes and related success measures

Delivery management
  • Manages successful end-to-end delivery of product iterations, prioritizing work and making appropriate trade- offs
  • Use data to drive analysis of new features / iterations and drive prioritisation of future work
  • Promotes iterative approach to delivery
  • Focus on platform delivery and enabling business users to easily create reports addressing their needs by themselves (self service)
  • Plan and provide Data support for TnT development releases and new deployments
  • Ensures all new deliverables within the area of responsibility are smoothly handed over to relevant BAU teams.

Solution assurance
  • Ensures the existing functionalities are leveraged as much as possible instead of developing new customizations
  • Reviews the functional end to end design to confirm its suitability regarding business requirements
  • Validates the delivered product to confirm its readiness for UAT; not afraid of getting her/his hands dirty
  • Assists business users in acceptance testing to close the loop and ensure their requirements have been properly captured and delivered; addresses whatever identified improvements in iterative manner
  • Ensure underlying technology stack is stable and able to deal with actual data volumes
  • Identify and address issues related to data- report is only as good as the data

Additional Information

Knowledge, Skills & Experience

Ia Skills Required
  • Degree educated IT professional with business-facing IT experience in a global environment
  • Strong planning and prioritisation skills, with working knowledge of agile practices
  • Strong business engagement skills; ability to facilitate workshops, influence and negotiate with the business stakeholders
  • Passion for learning, adapting and exploiting new technologies to deliver business value

Ib Experience
  • A seasoned IT professional with, as a guideline 8+ years’ experience in the field of Data & Analytics
  • Experience of Big Data, including projects and latest subject matter thought leadership
  • Expert knowledge of data, analytics and reporting technology components; it is expected that this knowledge will be a combination of broad awareness, mixed with deep expertise in specific components (e.g. Microsoft Azure, Cosmos, SAP BW, Azure data factory, Databricks, PowerBI)
  • Expert knowledge in integrating data into analytical platforms, ingestion technologies, data profiling, source-target mappings, ETL development, SQL optimisation, testing and implementation

Key Success Factors
  • Effective management of the backlog, with clear visibility of how the individual items link to the strategic theme and all relevant information provided to supplier team
  • Establish trusted advisor relationship with business to help them deliver full compliance
  • Deliver analytic platform where business user can easily create the reports by themselves
  • Unlocking the data to provide useful insights

British American Tobacco is one of the world’s leading multinational companies, with brands sold in over 200 markets, made in 44 factories in 42 countries.

We are proud that we are consistently among the top 5 companies on the London Stock Exchange. Our portfolio includes our world-famous Global Drive Brands - Dunhill, Kent, Lucky Strike, Pall Mall and Rothmans - along with many other leading international brands, such as Vogue, Peter Stuyvesant and State Express 555.

Alongside our traditional tobacco business, we are also developing products that offer consumers potentially less risky alternatives to regular cigarettes. Our Next Generation Products are already leading the way in the Industry of vapour and tobacco heating devices. We continue to develop a solid portfolio of consumer solutions which already include well known global brands like Vype, glo and Voke.

At Too Good To Go, we dream of a planet with no food waste.

Imagine if there was something we could all change today that would reduce global warming by 8%. That’s how much food waste contributes to the climate crisis.

We’re on a mission to change this!

Our app connecting businesses with unsold food, and consumers willing to buy at a discounted rate has grown since 2016 to become the biggest in Europe, with over 20 Million users, and more than 32 million meals saved.

Your mission

We are looking for an experienced, dedicated and self-driven Head of Key Accounts with a passion for tackling food waste. You will report to the Country Manager and will be pivotal in driving acquisition and development of key partnerships with hotels, restaurant chains, and supermarkets.

You will lead a small team focusing on growing and scaling Key Accounts at speed. This is a great challenge for a hungry and driven professional who can build, lead and nurture an enthusiastic Key Accounts team in a fast-paced environment without losing sight of our mission. The role will be part of an international Key Accounts team where best practices and learnings will be shared across borders.

Role Description

You will continuously develop our partnerships with Key Accounts on the Polish market, as well as provide leadership, structures, and support to the Key Accounts team as it grows.
  • Develop partnerships: Identify Key Accounts, lead the meeting presenting the app, develop the application in their stores.
  • Inspire & Empower: Champion a high-performance sales culture within the team to support our mission and business objectives.
  • Develop the team: Using your in-depth knowledge and experience of different sales and negotiation methodologies, you will ensure the team fulfills their potential and constantly train, coach, mentor and support for peak performance.
  • Strategy and market mapping: Analyze the market to identify geographic and segment opportunities for growth and build the plan for optimum results.
  • Structure and Optimize: Identify key performance drivers and set up the right team structures and processes for exponential growth.
  • Leadership and Management: Work with the management team on the broader plans for the Polish business including stakeholder reporting.


What We Have To Offer
  • A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change.
  • The experience of being part of an international company with 500 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 15 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support!
  • Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
  • An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
  • A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.


Requirements
  • You can identify opportunities to go after in the market and have experience with CRM and sales tools.
  • You have excellent sales skills and are able to build partnerships with Key Accounts. You are able to lead negotiations and create and deliver high impact pitches. You possess excellent commercial acumen.
  • You are a strong leader and can manage a team by setting targets, motivation and continuous development of skills.
  • You are data-oriented and work with KPIs to guide actions, also being able to track success.
  • You have full professional proficiency in Polish and English.
  • You are process-focused, continuously documenting and improving processes, sharing learnings with the global team; you are highly organized to develop client implementation plans.
  • You have a true passion for sustainability - you understand the urgency of action for the planet.


How To Apply
  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Antal Sp. z o.o.

W Antal zajmujemy się rekrutacją do ponad 20 lat. Dzięki działaniu w 10 wyspecjalizowanych dywizjach, świetnie orientujemy się w aktualnych trendach branżowych. Precyzyjnie określamy specyfikę stanowiska, klasyfikując kluczowe umiejętności i niezbędne kwalifikacje. Naszą misją jest nie tylko znalezienie kandydata, którego kompetencje wpisują się w wymagania danego ogłoszenia, ale przede wszystkim stanowiska, spełniającego oczekiwania kandydata.

Accountant

Currently we are looking for junior and experience accountant for our client, well-establish company located at Warsaw-Center. We are looking for candidates to AP, AR and GL team so duties might be a little bit different in every team.

One of the main advantages of working in this team are helpful boss and no overtime. In addition, the company is currently developing and offers real opportunities for fast promotion.

Responsibilities
  • Perform the Cash Management team tasks
  • Book all bank statements of the firm
  • Assist with basic treasury task as e.g. daily reporting on the firms funds on all accounts
  • Work closely with other teams to investigate unclear positions
  • Assist with set up of new bank accounts of the firm
  • Prepare monthly bank reconciliations
  • Work with the auditor
  • Ensure that data are processed accordance to accounting rules and legal compliances
  • Write and maintain process documentation
  • Perform all activities in line with agreed SLAs and KPIs
  • Seek opportunities for process improvements and applying improvements
  • Handle with customer's requests and queries
  • Communicate with internal and external customers in an efficient and effective manner
  • Ensure that all relevant company’s standards and guidelines are met


Requirements
  • English skills minimum at level B2
  • Any relevant ( for Junior) experience in Finance department will be a strong asset ( for Accountant at least two years of experience)
  • University degree preferably in accounting area courses (may be yet completing the studies if available for the full time job)
  • Familiarity with MS Office, accounting softwares
  • Attention to details
  • Analytical and problem – solving skills
  • Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
  • Creativity and open mind attitude
  • Very good self – organization and target orientation skills
  • Customer and teamwork focus and capability
  • Strong organizational, multi – tasking, and time- management skills
  • Flexibility, especially in the period of the month/year – end closing


Our Client Offers
  • Stable working conditions based on contrach of employment
  • MultiSpord card
  • Private health care
  • Language courses
  • MyBenefit platform (cinema tickets, vouchers)

For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.

position: Corporate - Global Security - EMEA Security Project Coordinator- Associate
whole_unnormalized_body:
Overview

Supporting JPMC Global Real Estate to deliver multi million pound technical security solutions as part of construction and design projects across the EMEA region, across all lines of business, including third party managed sites.  As part of Global Security Team which ensures the safety of the firm's employees, protects the firm's assets and to maintain a safe working environment. 

 

Role & Responsibilities:

  • Administration duties of all various in house applications used within Global Security, organising and taking ownership of tasks.

  • Assisting management with the day to day management of JPM’s technical security vendor, including meetings, scopes, quotes, quality management, service delivery and maintaining a close daily relationship.

     

  • Work closely with Global Technology, Core Infrastructure Services and Engineering to provide technical security solutions.

  • Third party oversight of the vendor and delivery of the master service agreement. 

  • Maintain the EMEA Operations Sharepoint site.

  • Deliver detailed scope reports, briefing packs and project updates.

  • Liaison with key stakeholders both internally and externally

  • Challenge and review work streams and process.

  • Day to day document control of project works and CAD security overlays.

 

The following skills are required

  • Project Management skills

  • Good understanding of Construction & Design

  • Ability to prioritise and manage multiple and complex work flows

  • Attention to financial scope/quotes.

  • Commercially aware and good understanding of sourcing.

  • Excellent verbal, written and communication skills.

  • Good understand of facilities management/moves and changes.

  • Must be effective communicator, both internally and externally to JPMC

  • Ability to work well within team and on your own

  • Good understanding of vendor management, SLAs and KPIs.

  • Knowledge of physical and technical security systems including access control and . 




J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, offering solutions to the world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions in more than 100 countries. We have a sophisticated local market presence in Europe, Middle East and Africa which is complemented by staff around the world who support our growth and serve our clients 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. We are excited to expand our team in Poland and we’re looking for collaborative, innovative and dedicated individuals to join us in our new corporate centre in Warsaw. Bring us your expertise and you’ll be part of a global community, working with people around the world and with a company that’s committed to investing in you and making a success of this key new location for our business. 
To be considered for this role, you may be required to complete the video interview powered By HireVue.
Corporate  Our professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we’re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.
JPMorgan Chase & Co. offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package. JPMorgan Chase & Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Main Responsibilities
  • Accomplish tasks of Qlikview and Reportive applications
  • Validate/check the consistency of data in the application before delivering to the client
  • Follow-up issues in collaboration with other teams
  • Maintain the documentation created by other team up to date
  • Translate documentation, clients’ requests and other team members’ analysis

Profile Requirements & Qualifications
  • Student (bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience) or graduate
  • Computer literacy, knowledge of Windows operating systems
  • Working knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word)
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Good communication skills in English
  • Open and problem-solving attitude
  • Willing to learn new things

We Offer
  • A full-time job (umowa o pracę)
  • Attractive employment conditions including a non-salary benefits package: medical care, sports card
  • Opportunity to work with global clients on international projects
  • A challenging job within an internationally recognized and growing organization

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Założona w 2001 Agencja Pracy Tymczasowej, Agencja Pośrednictwa Pracy i Doradztwa Personalnego Work & Profit jest
obecnie jedną z największych niezależnych polskich agencji zatrudnienia. W ciągu siedemasntu lat naszej działalności
daliśmy pracę przeszło 50 000 pracowników w całym kraju. Skutecznie znajdujemy pracowników dla największych firm,
jak również małych rodzinnych przedsiębiorstw w Polsce. Agencja jest wpisana pod nr 396 w Krajowym Rejestrze Agencji

Help us take Microsoft Teams to a billion users! Microsoft Teams is changing the way people and organizations work. Teams is used daily by more than 20 million users around the world in companies, schools, government, factories, hospitals, and more.

We are hiring for an experienced Senior Customer Program Manager on the Teams engineering team to guide customers in deploying, adopting, and fully leveraging Microsoft Teams to transform how they work. You will work closely across the engineering team, supported by a highly engaged global community of product and service technical experts and Microsoft’s sales and support organization.

The role is based in Prague, Czech Republic, with approximately 50% travel within CEE and elsewhere. The role requires fluency in English and any other CEE official languages.

Your primary responsibility will be to work directly with organizations to plan and drive their adoption of Microsoft Teams - including business vision, scenario design, technical planning, and adoption support. Part of your job will also require triaging and sharing feedback with the product engineers to improve Teams for your customers. As part of the product engineering team, you will work closely colleagues in Asia and around the world.

The successful candidate will bring a mix of business and technical experience, has driven and supported deployments of major technology initiatives, and understands how to build a win-win plan with business and technical leaders.

We operate in an extremely fast-paced and highly collaborative environment with rapid exploration, iteration and execution. Your colleagues are highly motivated and share a commitment to customer success.

Responsibilities
  • Drive Microsoft Teams adoption with strategic customers in CEE, with a specific user growth target
  • Discover and grow new opportunities for Microsoft Teams and Office 365, including “dark-to-cloud” situations
  • Co-lead the Microsoft Teams engineering strategy for CEE, targeting enterprise, government, and firstline worker opportunities, and more
  • Collect, triage, and drive for resolution on customer-blocking issues, including pushing for important product improvements
  • Land multiple reference customers and case studies
  • Identify and evangelize broader trends and opportunities to drive longer-term investments and product shifts
  • Partner closely with regional and in-country Microsoft sales, marketing, and customer success to drive growth initiatives, hackathons, and customer and public events and outreach programs

Qualifications
  • Direct customer engagement experience in the technology industry, either in an engineering role with a strong customer focus, or a sales, support, or customer success-type role with technical or engineering exposure
  • Track record of supporting large IT deployments from evaluation all the way through deployment and adoption at scale to thousands of users
  • Solid understanding of technology sales and deployment lifecycle and experience working closely with sales and support teams
  • Experience presenting to executives, IT staff, and end users; able to pivot quickly and adapt messaging to suit a range of audience technical levels and requirements
  • Technical understanding of collaboration technology and global cloud services, and general ability to ramp up on new product technology areas
  • Fluent written and spoken English
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

whole_unnormalized_body:
We’re Coty, a global leader in beauty. We’re World #1 in Fragrance, World #2 in Professional Hair Care and World #3 in Color Cosmetics. Our iconic portfolio of more than 77 brands are sold in over 150 countries around the world. We believe in beauty with a purpose and brands that inspire, no matter where they are in the world.

Currently to our global Supply Chain Innovation Center in Warsaw we are looking for:

CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA SPECIALIST with French or Spanish

The Role

Master Data Specialist is responsible for MD setup in the respective Business Unit in the following areas of Master Data: Customer, Material and Pricing. That includes data maintenance in SAP in quality and timely manner, using automation tool for maintenance, data validations, investigating queries from other functions and performing complex analysis on big data bases.

What You'll Be Doing
  • Maintaining master data in area of Customer, Material and Pricing (in SAP, eCommerce platform etc.)
  • Resolving issues within area of responsibility
  • Performing data analyzes using big amount of data
  • Obtaining, storing and delivering information for audit purposes
  • Training and coaching requestors and MD team members
  • Creating and updating existing procedures
  • Identifying inefficiencies and propose improvements for process and tools

What You’ll Bring
  • Very good knowledge of English and Spanish or French
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Ability to quickly learn new IT systems
  • Knowledge of SAP
  • Excel Skills
  • Ability to identify and implement improvements
  • Strong collaboration skills

What We Offer
  • Full time employment and intense onboarding program
  • Extensive on-the-job and formal training throughout career
  • Multicultural work environment in an beautifully designed office
  • Continuous learning and development through promotions and assignment changes
  • Attractive benefits package including sport card, private medical care, private health insurance, lunch card, travelcard reimbursement, massages in the office, discounts on Coty products, extra day of holiday for birthday, CIGNA support and more!

Ustaw z 2018, poz. 1000) oraz zgodnie z Rozporządzeniem Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (RODO)).

Nasza Oferta

ATMOSFERA : zapewniamy długoterminową i przyjemną współpracę w Najlepszym Miejscu Pracy IT (tytuł zdobyty czterokrotnie w badaniach AudIT Computerworld – Kantar)
ROZWÓJ : finansujemy certyfikaty, szkolenia i naukę j. angielskiego, umożliwiamy ścieżkę kariery
BEZPIECZEŃSTWO : oferujemy dobre pensje, stabilne zatrudnienie, ubezpieczenia grupowe, prywatna opieka medyczna, kilkunastoletnie doświadczenie na rynku
ROZRYWKA : organizujemy epickie wyjazdy integracyjne, regularne odwiedziny pubów, coroczne przyjęcia wigilijne, imprezy dla naszych dzieciaków
AKTYWNOŚĆ : karta Multisport, sponsoring firmowych grup sportowych i udziału w zawodach
BARDZO DOBRE WARUNKI PRACY : ergonomiczne, nowoczesne biura i centra kompetencyjne, wyposażone kuchnie, całkiem niezła kawa :), codzienne dostawy owoców do naszych biur, chillout room-y w największych oddziałach
ELASTYCZNOŚĆ : m.in. zmienne godziny pracy

Nasze Oczekiwania

Biegłe programowanie w R i/lub Pythonie
Min. 2 lata doświadczenia komercyjnego w obszarze Data Science
Doświadczenie w projektowaniu i przeprowadzaniu eksperymentów Data Science, w tym optymalizacji modeli
Doświadczenie we wdrażaniu, monitorowaniu i utrzymywaniu modeli w środowisku produkcyjnym
Bardzo dobre zrozumienie statystki i algorytmów machine learning
Umiejętność wizualizacji danych
Znajomość systemów kontroli wersji SVN lub GIT
Podstawowa znajomość SQL oraz zagadnień związanych z hurtowniami danych
Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego pozwalająca na swobodną pracę z materiałami technicznymi
Mile widziana znajomość Azure/AWS w zakresie uruchamiania modeli, pobierania danych

Kluczowe Zadania

Budowa modeli statystycznych
Analiza danych m.in w sektorze finansowym, ubezpieczeniowym, logistycznym
Tworzenie systemów wykorzystujących Machine Learning i ich optymalizacja
Tworzenie rozwiązań optymalizujących procesy biznesowe
Wsparcie w projektach młodszych członków zespołu

Kilka Słów o Projekcie

Projekt dotyczy budowy systemu do optymalizacji zamówień oraz prognoz sprzedaży.

Informujemy, że skontaktujemy się tylko z wybranymi kandydatami.

Informujemy, iż administratorem Państwa danych będzie grupa kapitałowa Britenet z siedzibą w Warszawie przy ul. Karolkowej 30, 01-207, Warszawa.

Karolkowej 30, 01-207, Warszawa dla realizacji obecnego oraz przyszłych procesów rekrutacyjnych.. whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

Job Description DevOps Engineer - Telco

Z ponad 74 000 specjalistami, CGI Group inc. jest piątą co do wielkości niezależną firmą zajmującą się wdrożeniami projektów informatycznych, obsługującą ponad 4500 klientów na całym świecie, ze swoich globalnych biur i centrów usług w obu Amerykach, Europie oraz w regionie Azji i Pacyfiku.

Do zespołu działającego w branży telco poszukujemy doświadczonych administratorów DevOps. Z uwagi na złożoność projektów transformacyjnych oraz duży nacisk na automatyzację procesów wytwórczych oprogramowania poszukiwani są pasjonaci DevOps obszarów back-end, front-end jak i aplikacji mobilnych (natywne i hybrydowe).

Branża telco daje gwarancję pracy w ciekawych projektach w środowisku o złożonej architekturze IT oraz skomplikowanych procesach biznesowych. Projekty te realizowane są w najnowszych technologiach, co powoduje ciągły rozwój członków zespołu.

Do Twoich głównych obowiązków będzie należało:
  • Rozwój i utrzymanie klastra Kubernates (IaaC)
  • Zapewnienie wydajności, dostępności i niezawodności platformy
  • Współpraca z zespołami developerskimi
  • Wsparcie on-call (standby) w sytuacjach awaryjnych
  • Automatyzacja monitoringu
  • Automatyzacja wdrożeń CI/CD
  • Wsparcie w Root Cause Analysis
  • Analiza incydentów (też raportowanych przez klientów)
  • Rozwój platformy (ulepszenia niezawodności, projektowanie i implementacja, narzędzia DevOps, strojenie)
  • Praca z IaaC (Ansible, Terraform)

    • Stos Technologiczny

  • Kubernetes, OpenStack
  • ELK
  • Grafana
  • Zabbix
  • Prometheus
  • Linux
  • Java, Node.js, python
  • Docker
  • git
  • CI/CD
  • Ansible, Terraform
  • Istio
  • PostgreSQL, MongoDB
  • Rabbit MQ, Active MQ

    • Główne Oczekiwania

  • Doświadczenie w utrzymaniu produkcji
  • Projektowanie oraz wdrożenia klastra Kubernetes
  • Automatyzacja implementacji, wdrożeń
  • CI/CD, tworzenie łańcuchów wdrożeniowych
  • Monitorowanie złożonych aplikacji
  • Automatyzacja infrastruktury
  • Doświadczenie w pracy z Openstack
  • Angielski biegły

    • Naszym Konsultantom Oferujemy

  • Umowa o pracę
  • Opieka zdrowotna / Medicover Maxima
  • Plan zakupu akcji (SPP) dofinansowany przez CGI
  • Multisport Plus i program Oxygen
  • Profit Participation Plan – dzielimy się zyskami
  • Premiowany program poleceń, standardowo 6k PLN
  • Praca Twórcza
  • Brown Bagi, hackathony i dzielenie się wiedzą
  • Prezenty okolicznościowe i świętowanie rocznic
  • Program wsparcia pracowników i dodatkowe ubezpieczenie w podróży

    • Your future duties and responsibilities

    Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

    Zbuduj z nami swoja karierę!

    Prowadzenie biznesu nigdy nie było bardziej pasjonujące niż w dzisiejszych czasach. Żyjemy w erze transformacji cyfrowej. Digitalizacja przyśpiesza i zmienia nasz świat z dnia na dzień. CGI jest w samym centrum tych zmian, towarzyszy i wspiera Klientów a pracownikom oferuje najbardziej rozwijające projekty i oferuje wyjątkowe możliwości rozwoju.

    Nasz sukces w CGI wynika z autentycznego zaangażowania naszych ekspertów i całej kadry. Jesteśmy zespołem. Stawiamy na dzielenie się: wyzwaniami i sukcesami, które są nieodłączną częścią naszej firmy. Wspólnie dzielimy się zyskiem, ściśle związanym z pewnym wzrostem CGI. Wszyscy zyskujemy dzięki wartości, którą wspólnie stworzyliśmy.

    Zapraszamy Cię do współtworzenia CGI – firmy będącej w czołówce największych, niezależnych firm świadczących usługi technologiczne i doradcze na świecie.

    Więcej o CGI na www.cgi.com. Zapraszamy do zapoznania się z nami!

    Rekomendacje kandydatów ze strony firm rekrutacyjnych uprzednio nie zaproszonych do współpracy z CGI nie będą rozpatrywane.

    CGI jest pracodawcą oferującym równe szanse.

    DevOps Engineer - Telco

    Position Description
    Z ponad 74 000 specjalistami, CGI Group inc. jest piątą co do wielkości niezależną firmą zajmującą się wdrożeniami projektów informatycznych, obsługującą ponad 4500 klientów na całym świecie, ze swoich globalnych biur i centrów usług w obu Amerykach, Europie oraz w regionie Azji i Pacyfiku.

    Do zespołu działającego w branży telco poszukujemy doświadczonych administratorów DevOps. Z uwagi na złożoność projektów transformacyjnych oraz duży nacisk na automatyzację procesów wytwórczych oprogramowania poszukiwani są pasjonaci DevOps obszarów back-end, front-end jak i aplikacji mobilnych (natywne i hybrydowe).

    Branża telco daje gwarancję pracy w ciekawych projektach w środowisku o złożonej architekturze IT oraz skomplikowanych procesach biznesowych. Projekty te realizowane są w najnowszych technologiach, co powoduje ciągły rozwój członków zespołu.

    Do Twoich głównych obowiązków będzie należało:
  • Rozwój i utrzymanie klastra Kubernates (IaaC)
  • Zapewnienie wydajności, dostępności i niezawodności platformy
  • Współpraca z zespołami developerskimi
  • Wsparcie on-call (standby) w sytuacjach awaryjnych
  • Automatyzacja monitoringu
  • Automatyzacja wdrożeń CI/CD
  • Wsparcie w Root Cause Analysis
  • Analiza incydentów (też raportowanych przez klientów)
  • Rozwój platformy (ulepszenia niezawodności, projektowanie i implementacja, narzędzia DevOps, strojenie)
  • Praca z IaaC (Ansible, Terraform)

    • Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

    Build your career with us.

    It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

    At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

    Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

    Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

    No unsolicited agency referrals please.

    CGI is an equal opportunity employer.

    Skills
    • Continuous Integration
    • Linux

Na Twój dzień będzie się składać :
  • ręczne lub maszynowe dzielenie przesyłek pocztowych,
  • sporządzanie odsyłek,
  • sporządzanie wiązanek listowych,
  • opracowywanie ładunków pocztowych w magazynie,
  • sporządzanie dokumentacji ekspedycyjnej,
  • obsługa komputera i programów ekspedycyjnych.

powyżej 50 lat lub po dłuższej przerwie w pracy

Czekamy na Twoje CV!


Wypełnienie formularza zajmie Ci tylko kilka minut.

Aplikuj

„Administratorem danych osobowych jest Poczta Polska S.A. z siedzibą przy ul. Rodziny Hiszpańskich 8, 00-940 Warszawa. Kontakt z Inspektorem ochrony danych: Inspektor ochrony danych Poczta Polska S.A., ul. Rodziny Hiszpańskich 8, 00-940 Warszawa, e-mail: inspektorodo@poczta-polska.pl.

Dane osobowe są przetwarzane w celu realizacji procesu rekrutacji na podstawie zgody oraz obowiązujących przepisów Kodeksu pracy. Kategorie przetwarzanych danych osobowych obejmują dane zawarte w formularzu aplikacyjnym oraz załączonych i wytworzonych w trakcie procesu rekrutacji dokumentach.

Dane osobowe będą przechowywane przez okres 2 lat od dnia złożenia aplikacji lub do momentu wycofania zgody na przetwarzanie danych osobowych.

Osobie, której dane dotyczą przysługuje prawo dostępu do treści tych danych, ich sprostowania, usunięcia, ograniczenia przetwarzania oraz przenoszenia danych, a także do cofnięcia zgody w dowolnym momencie, bez wpływu na zgodność z prawem przetwarzania dokonanego na podstawie zgody, przed jej cofnięciem. Osobie, której dane dotyczą przysługuje prawo wniesienia skargi do Prezesa Urzędu Ochrony Danych Osobowych.

Podanie danych jest dobrowolne, ale odmowa podania danych może skutkować brakiem możliwości wzięcia udziału w procesie rekrutacji.

Pani/Pana dane osobowe są przechowywane na serwerach zlokalizowanych w Unii Europejskiej i mogą być przekazane - na podstawie standardowych klauzul ochrony danych - do państwa trzeciego w związku z korzystaniem przez administratora z rozwiązań chmurowych dostarczanych przez firmę Microsoft. Stosowane przez Microsoft standardowe klauzule umowne zgodne z wzorcami zatwierdzonymi przez Komisję Europejską, dostępne są pod adresem: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/licensing/product-licensing/products.aspx w części Online Services Terms (OST)."

Team

Simplifying e-commerce. Whether our users want to build their brand website, track multichannel markets or offer customers live chat support, we're there. Raising the bar for ourselves and what our customers expect of us is what we do best at Shoplo.

Recently acquired by the global FinTech SumUp, we now have even more assets behind our mission.

We're looking for individuals who are constantly curious, innovative and brave as we work together across departments to push forward better and better solutions.

What You’ll Do

  • You will work with a modern tech stack built on Vue, Typescript, Jest, and Vue testing library
  • You will be a part of a colocated cross-functional team and collaborate with professionals from Engineering, Product and Design to bring exciting new features to our merchant-facing web applications
  • You will follow UI design best practices to contribute to our component library
  • You will be encouraged to share your knowledge with your peers and will also receive feedback and mentorship
  • You will have ownership of different projects and immediately see the impact of your work

You’ll be great for this position if

  • You have an in-depth understanding of JavaScript and DOM-related concepts
  • You have experience in building SPA applications in Vue (Typescript)
  • You have a good understanding of UI and unit testing concepts
  • You have a component-oriented approach and you are thinking in a reusable way

Why you should join SumUp

You’ll have the opportunity to take ownership, work with purpose and have an impact. You'll work with people who are ambitious, curious and empathetic. We have fun working together and believe in an open feedback culture.

We have a close, welcoming and international community (50+ nationalities) and we have some huge challenges ahead of us. To further disrupt the payment industry we need smart, creative and innovative people. Sound appealing? Hit the “Apply” button and let’s get in touch!

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

We are connected by all things that make us different - that is why our teams are created by people who want and are able to be themselves. We are the largest call center group in Poland, with offices in over 13 cities. Currently, to our team in Warsaw, we are looking for candidates who are proficient in Russian language and are willing to start the exciting journey on our new project related to the international sport events. If the enthusiasm and a good atmosphere at work is important for you, join us and be a part of the team with the best player on the market. Face interesting and ambitious challenges, get more work experience and develop your skills in a new role. There is a lot of knowledge waiting for you!
Customer Service Agent with Russian (Warsaw)

ZAKRES OBOWIĄZKÓW

Your Tasks
  • first level email support in Russian,
  • cooperation with other departments of the company regarding customer inquiries.
WYMAGANIA

If
  • you are fluent in Russian and you are communicative in English,
  • you are ready for work from 17PM till 19/21PM during the week with possibility of working during the weekend,
  • you know the MS Office package well, you have excellent communication and well-developed interpersonal skills,
  • you have the ability to deal professionally with customers in a foreign language,
  • you are customer and goal oriented and want to develop your skills at work.
OFERUJEMY

We Offer
  • attractive salary per hour and high incentive bonus,
  • recommendation bonuses - we are open to the opportunity of working with friends,
  • the training package and the support of experienced trainers and managers,
  • competencies development opportunities and other motivational programs,
  • free dress code and a very good atmosphere at work :)

position: IT General Manager / Head of Site
whole_unnormalized_body:
Opis stanowiska
General Manager IT / Head of Site

Our customer is a global Information Technology company manufacturing hardware and delivering services to their clients worldwide. Due to their long growth plans in Poland, they are now seeking an experienced General Manager / Head of Site to join their organization.

Responsibilities
  • Co-create and execute business strategies in order to ensure achievement of the company’s long term objectives.
  • Manage the direction of the company’s business lines in Poland by working closely with the senior management.
  • Supervise the company’s financial performance and report them quarterly.
  • Provide strategic advice to the board and execute the plan of growing the headcount significantly within the next 18 month.
  • Ensure appropriate level of synergy between business lines acting as a co-operation enabler.
  • Identify opportunities to increase efficiencies and improve processes both inside the team as well as in the processes related to the services delivery to the customers.
  • Constantly assure the company’s vision is clear to the employees and all company policies & legal guidelines are properly communicated across the business.
  • Assure the best practices and strong work ethics.
Requirements
  • 5+ years of experience in a similar role at an information technology company.
  • Previous experience managing large teams.
  • Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication.
  • Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Demonstrable experience in growing company’s headcount consistently.
  • Strong understanding of the Information technology market.
The offer
  • Work for one of the global IT leaders.
  • Opportunity to grow within the company.
  • Competitive salary and attractive bonus system.
  • Great deal of autonomy in making decisions.
  • Direct impact on the strategic direction of the company’s presence in Poland.

Junior Google Ads Specialist (Warszawa, 3350496)
Numer referencyjny: JGAS/jobs.pl

Wyzwania Przez Tobą
  • marketingowa obsługa Klientów firmy
  • analiza i optymalizacja kampanii
  • koordynacja projektów z działami Web developerów i Social Media
  • raportowanie

Oczekiwane Umiejętności
  • doświadczenie w Google Ads ( 1-2 lata)
  • znajomość Google Analytics
  • znajomość Google Tag Manager
  • bardzo dobra organizacja pracy
  • samodzielność, skrupulatność i sumienność

Oferujemy
  • Stabilne warunki zatrudnienia w oparciu o B2B/zlecenie
  • Bezpłatną naukę języka angielskiego
  • Prywatną opiekę medyczną
  • Możliwość współpracy z Klientem zagranicznym

Prosimy o dopisanie następującej klauzuli: „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie podanych przeze mnie danych osobowych zawartych w aplikacji dla potrzeb niezbędnych do realizacji procesu rekrutacji zgodnie z Rozporządzeniem Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (RODO). Jednocześnie oświadczam, iż zapoznałem się informacjami administratora o przetwarzaniu danych oraz z prawami jakie przysługują mi na mocy powyższego Rozporządzenia."

  • możliwość zdobycia doświadczenia w jednej z najbardziej uznanych grup mediowych w Polsce,
