Background

This position is open for secondment only and participating States are kindly reminded that all costs in relation to assignment at OSCE/ODIHR must be borne by their authorities.

Candidates should, prior to applying, verify with their respective nominating authority to which extent financial remuneration and/or benefit packages will be offered. Seconded staff members in the OSCE Secretariat and Institutions are not entitled to a Board and Lodging Allowance payable by the Organization.

The OSCE has a comprehensive approach to security that encompasses politico-military, economic and environmental, and human aspects. It therefore addresses a wide range of security-related concerns, including arms control, confidence- and security-building measures, human rights, national minorities, democratization, policing strategies, counter-terrorism and economic and environmental activities. All 57 participating States enjoy equal status, and decisions are taken by consensus on a politically, but not legally binding basis.

The Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR) is the principal institution of the OSCE responsible for the human dimension. ODIHR is active throughout the OSCE area in the fields of election observation, democratic development, human rights, tolerance and non-discrimination, and the rule of law. ODIHR's assistance projects and other activities are implemented in participating States in accordance with the ODIHR's mandate.

Tasks And Responsibilities

Under the supervison of the Director of ODIHR, the incumbent of the position of Ethics Adviser shall provide advice and assistance in respect of ethics related developments throughout the Office, and advice on issues relating to gender mainstreaming in ODIHR's programmatic and non-programmatic work. More specifically, the Ethics Adviser will perform the following functions and duties:

  • Maintaining regular contact with the OSCE Ethics Co-ordinator in the OSCE Secretariat on the overall Ethical Framework and its specific applicability in the ODIHR context;
  • Initiating, recommending and supporting necessary policy advice to the Director and senior management, including the First Deputy Director and Second Deputy Director, on how to best incorporate gender mainstreaming in the Office activities to ensure compliance with the OSCE gender commitments;
  • Supporting the implementation of the ODIHR Gender Mainstreaming Roadmap;
  • Identifying learning and development needs pertaining to ethics and gender mainstreaming, and preparing briefing and learning sessions for ODIHR staff;
  • Performing other related duties as assigned.
    • For more detailed information on the structure and work of the OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights, please see: http://www.osce.org/odihr

    Necessary Qualifications
    • First-level university degree preferably in gender and women's studies, law, political science, social sciences, public policy, corporate ethics or related field;
    • At least six years (full-time equivalent) of progressively responsible experience in the field of systems design in ethical standards, ethics and compliance programmes, code of conduct, accountability and compliance frameworks, gender mainstreaming and women's rights gained at national and at international levels;
    • Demonstrated understanding of issues relating to gender based discrimination and gender mainstreaming along with practical experience in applying gender mainstreaming as a strategy to achieve gender equality;
    • Demonstrated knowledge of regional and international good practices of gender mainstreaming;
    • Excellent knowledge of UN, Council of Europe, EU and OSCE standards and commitments in the area of gender mainstreaming and gender equality;
    • Demonstrated experience in gender mainstreamed project design and implementation;
    • Ability to operate Windows applications, including word-processing, email, internet and social media tools;
    • Professional fluency in English, with excellent written and oral communication skills in the said language; working knowledge other OSCE languages is an asset;
    • Demonstrated gender awareness and sensitivity, and an ability to integrate a gender perspective into tasks and activities;
    • Ability to work in a team and to establish and maintain effective working relationships with people of different national, cultural and professional backgrounds.


    If you wish to apply for this position, please use the OSCE's online application link found under https://jobs.osce.org/vacancies .

    The OSCE retains the discretion to re-advertise/re-post the vacancy, to cancel the recruitment, to offer an appointment with a modified job description or for a different duration.

    Only those applicants who are selected to participate in the subsequent stages of recruitment will be contacted.

    Please note that vacancies in the OSCE are open for competition only amongst nationals of participating States, please see https://www.osce.org/participating-states .

    The OSCE is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce, and encourages the nomination of qualified female and male candidates from all religious, ethnic and social backgrounds.

    Please be aware that the OSCE does not request payment at any stage of the application and review process.

    Please apply to your relevant authorities several days prior to the deadline expiration to ensure timely processing of your application. Delayed nominations will not be considered.

position: Safety, Evaluation and Risk Scientist/Senior Specialist
whole_unnormalized_body:
Site Name: Warsaw
Posted Date: Mar 20 2020

GSK is deeply committed to professional and personal development offering employment opportunities across a diverse collection of businesses and geographies. You’ll flourish in an inspiring environment where personal growth plays a vital part in the changing face of the business. Most of all, you’ll enjoy the sense of purpose that comes from leading change in an industry that touches millions every day.

Responsibilities
  • Providing high level scientific expertise in the safety evaluation and risk management of medicines, ensuring adverse events and other safety information are effectively evaluated in line with global compliance and regulatory requirements.
  • Identifying needs for product labelling updates and creating proper documentation, providing recommendations for labelling changes.
  • Driving discussion and managing of safety issues through matrix teams across the global organisation and presenting findings to high level experts.
  • Making sure that safety documents (e.g. periodic reports, signal evaluations, labelling documents, regulatory enquiries, risk management plans) are written accurately and in a timely manner to meet global compliance and regulatory requirements.
  • Providing accurate and fit for purpose exploratory/ evaluation documents and responses to internal or regulatory authority requests related to safety data or labelling content, in consultation with relevant stakeholders, as necessary.
Requirements
  • University degree in Pharmacy or other related life science field.
  • Experience in scientific literature review, data gathering, data synthesis, interpretation and authoring.
  • Knowledge of medical and drug terminology.
  • Advanced analytical thinking, with the ability to analyse scientific data
  • Robust scientific writing skills
  • Understanding of the pharmaceutical industry, drug development environment.
  • Ability to cooperate with stakeholders across the business with appropriate relationship building, teamwork and, where applicable, leadership.
  • Effective communication skills and the ability to present complex data/information concisely at all levels of the organization.
  • Self-motivated, with the intellectual flexibility to continually develop and learn new skills
  • Fluent English – written and spoken.
We Offer
  • We offer the opportunity to gain experience in well-known company, to cooperate with international environment where you can have an access to cutting-edge technology and work in friendly atmosphere.
  • We provide an attractive remuneration package and benefits (e.g. private medical healthcare, life insurance, sports card, pension plan, flexible working hours, home office), as well as the prospects of a comprehensive professional development.
  • Possibilities of development within the role and company’s structure.
  • GSK corporate culture is based on our values: patient focus, integrity, respect and transparency.
If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).

GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

position: Global Data Management Leader - Late RIA (permanent/secondment)
whole_unnormalized_body:
At AstraZeneca we are guided in our work by a strong set of values, and we're resetting expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. By truly following the science, we pioneer new methods, new thinking and bring unexpected teams together. From scientists to sales, lab techs to legal, we're on a mission to turn ideas into life-changing medicines that transform lives. We need great people who share our passion for science and have the drive and determination to meet the unmet needs of patients around the world. If you're swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you're our kind of person.



Role description:

  • To provide CDM subject matter expertise to the study team(s) and is responsible for overseeing and managing all CDM activities for the study.
  • Serves as a core team member of the Global Study Team(s) and is accountable for all CDM-related communications, specifications, and documentation that includes but not limited to the Data Management Plan (DMP).
  • The GDML is responsible for the overall quality and integrity of the clinical database, and they work collaboratively to ensure that AstraZeneca's Clinical Data is collected, managed, and reported clearly, accurately, and securely based on the study's protocol and to the highest scientific industry standards
  • Number of studies assigned to GDML will be based on a given therapeutic area, depending on size, complexity and working model.



Typical Accountabilities:

  • Serves as the expert in Clinical Data Management to provide oversight and advice to the clinical project team(s) regarding the CDM activities and deliverables
    • Manages and resolves issues related to CDM deliverables by developing solutions to complex problems to ensure consistency across organization
    • Provides input to the CDM related activities associated with regulatory inspections/audits
    • Provide CDM business expertise and consultancy in the selection and use of software systems and vendors
  • Development and oversight of CDM processes and standards and functional leadership:
    • Oversee quality and consistency with AstraZeneca strategies and standards across therapeutic areas
    • Works with the Standards Group to provide input into clinical project standards and processes based on industry best practices
    • Facilitates and manages valid change requests of project standards to the Standards Committee
    • Assesses AstraZeneca CDM needs and areas of improvement and recommends changes to the operating model
    • May be asked to provide strategic CDM expertise to Global Clinical Initiatives
  • Management and oversight of vendor performance.
    • Reviews, assesses and manages CDM delivery against KPIs and overall DM performance
    • Provides input into the contract process for the CRDM vendor
    • Manages all CDM timelines and CDM Deliverables for assigned studies
    • Ensures CDM billing is accurate and forwards recommendation to CDM for payment of invoices
  • Operational Responsibilities
    • Accountable for the execution and overall quality of DM activities and deliverables.
    • Acts as the single point of contact for all data management deliverables for the study team during the study set-up phase, responsible for the CRF design, DB specifications (including edit checks, CRF working instructions, etc.), during study conduct, and study close-out activities
    • Provide guidance and supervision to Lead Data Managers/DM Team Leads working on the study (CRO or in-house)
    • Accountable for "real time" Data Management, ensuring that CDM conducts initial reviews within 5 calendar days of a patient's data entering the EDC system, and manages the average query aging to no more than 30 calendar days
    • Accountable for the overall quality and completeness of the Data Management Plan (DMP)
    • Responsible for working closely with the Centralized Data Monitoring group to ensure quality and integrity of our most important data points



Requirements:

  • Education: Minimum of a BS in life sciences or computer science degree
  • Strong Data Management experience in the Biotech/Pharma/CRO industry
  • Demonstrated current understanding of GCP and regulatory requirements as they relate to data management systems and activities
  • Demonstrated current understanding of Good Clinical Data Management Practices (GCDMP)
  • Experience of clinical databases, different clinical data management systems and electronic data capture (EDC)
  • Demonstrate understanding and experience in query management process and reconciliation activities
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently under direction and close supervision
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Effective problem and conflict solving skills
  • Ability to work in a global team environment
  • High attention to detail and accuracy



Desirable:

  • Certified Clinical Data Manager (CCDM) via the Society of Clinical Data Management
  • Demonstrated knowledge of clinical and pharmaceutical drug development process
  • State of the art understanding of database structures, data standards (CDISC) and practices as they apply to CRF design, database development, data handling and reporting
  • Demonstrated understanding of clinical data system design / development / validation and system interoperability.
  • Excellent understanding and demonstration of the AZ values and behaviours
  • Excellent organizational and analytical skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with external partners
  • Ability to interact effectively with all levels of management



Next step - Apply today!



AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law. AstraZeneca only employs individuals with the right to work in the country/ies where the role is advertised.

position: Principal Global Black Belt Specialist - Modern Workplace
whole_unnormalized_body:
Come join Microsoft and be a part of our Modern Workplace commercial business.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our mission is our company’s goal and what each of us strives to achieve every day. As a culture, we are always learning, customer-driven, curious, experimental and open. We celebrate our differences and seek to listen and learn from one another for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community.

Modern Workplace represents a team of experts dedicated to helping our customers embrace new ways of working as they pursue digital transformation. We are partners to field sellers and help them gather key insights, test and incubate new strategies, and share learnings with leaders across sales, engineering, and marketing to drive successful outcomes. We are technologists and business strategists who combine our diversity of skills, experiences, and perspectives to do our best work for our customers.

Modern Workplace Principal Global Black Belt (GBB) is an experienced business and technical leadership role in the EMEA Time-zone Leadership team focused on end to end sales execution (including M365 workloads, Surface, incubation value propositions and sales plays) and deliver growth for strategic solutions areas.

Responsibilities

End to end business and technical leadership (~70% of the role) will be focused on:
  • Leading selected strategic and complex sales opportunities and customer engagements in partnership with the Area sales teams - with the focus on Modern Workplace transformation deals and customer engagements (including M365 solutions, Surface, incubation and cross workload)
  • Driving scalable coaching with the Area sales teams to diversify the sales plays from mainstream to more advanced scenarios leading to future expansion with the main focus on a “challenger mentality” by inspiring field sellers to engage early and lead with new insights on how to grow the customers’ business.
  • Role modelling BDM engagement with new modern workplace sales plays and identifying insights and learnings to make recommendations for scaling motions to broader field and partners
  • Identifying market trends and in-depth customer insights for optimisation and development of the Modern Workplace sales programs and value propositions
  • Continuously find new opportunities to increase our sales teams’ capability and fluency with solution selling and value conversations, sharing best practices and contributing to the development of future readiness programs
  • Championing the customer asks, blockers and escalations to progress deals faster into closure
  • Contributing to the Time-zone strategic and operational plan reactively or proactively, subject to specific Area and Time-zone needs.

Solution area strategy and growth (~30% of the role) will be focused on:
  • Driving programmatically selected motions and/or strategic focus areas in partnership with the corporate and field stakeholders for positive business impact in the chosen Areas (this will involve initiatives like selected strategic big bets, sales motions like ‘continuous selling’ or landing increased investment to support challenged Area)
  • Contributing to solution area future growth planning regarding sales motions and value proposition design (including new SKUs) with strong Time-zone point of view with consolidated feedback, learnings, and insights
  • Leading best practice sharing across Areas, Time-zones, and communities to multiply the business impact in selected solutions or motions
  • Influencing stakeholders to keep Modern Workplace Solution Area high in the senior leadership agenda in the Time-zone and Areas, supporting executive customer conversation by showcasing relevant solutions/sales plays and therefore gaining mindshare.

Qualifications

Experiences Required: key experiences, skills and knowledge:
  • Strategic thinking & execution. Ability to identify key market trends and deep recurring customer insights which help to develop future propositions and strategies. Ability to improve sales and business strategy options in partnership with other stakeholders, while also being able to execute on complex opportunities successfully.
  • Solution understanding. Understanding of relevant cloud technologies. Ability to learn and develop depth on Microsoft Modern Workplace and Cloud solutions, including value selling and competitive solutions.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a collaborative relationship building style. Distinguished written and verbal communication skills to confidently present to customers, partners and in internal business reviews for senior leadership and key stakeholders. Ability to influence decision making with compelling and data-driven proposals.
  • Performer. Ability to manage multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously and programmatically with clear prioritisation. Highly driven person and a self-starter who consistently exceeds goals and expectations and has the ability, characteristics, and determination to compete effectively against the skilled and diverse competition.
  • Collaborative. Ability to build relationships and influence key partners, achieving results through collaboration with members of the Microsoft corporate teams (sales leads and program teams, business architects, readiness, marketing, product groups, and engineering) and with the field sales, BG and Microsoft partners to solve customer challenges and opportunities. Ability to leverage best practices and deliver results.
  • Growth Mindset. Ability to effectively and efficiently change a system for an outcome over time and to overcome and work around challenges that are inevitable in rapidly growing businesses - a positive approach to problem-solving, learning, and development of potential.
  • Education & experience
  • BS/BA degree or M.Sc/MBA is required either in technical or business field.
  • Additional training in sales, business or marketing preferred.
  • Extensive years of relevant experience in the solution sales or solution/ technical leadership roles, preferably in the sales/customer and partner interface.

    •  

    Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

    Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

whole_unnormalized_body:
We are looking for an Administrative Support for our Corporate Solutions Operations business line.

 

About JLL

 

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

 

Role Purpose

The role will be part of a JLL team working closely with one of our most dynamic & fast-growing Client from the online retail industry. The Client’s EMEA Real Estate and Facilities (GREF) team provides real estate transaction expertise, capital investment program management and facility maintenance and operation across multiple countries. GREF partners with suppliers to ensure quality, innovation and scalability with Client’s business and utilizes customer driven feedback to continuously improve and exceed employee expectations.

The person working in this role will be part of the EGREFO (EMEA Global Real Estate & Facilities Operations) team. EGREFO are an EMEA-wide operations team, whose scope includes encompassing tools, policies, standard operating processes and program management, and centralize the critical data in efficient user-friendly document repositories. We ensure the client’s culture is maintained in EMEA GREF corporate offices, and that client’s expectations are clear, concise and implemented by vendors and our IFM (Integrated Facilities Management) team.

Duties of the role include providing support to the Program Managers, assisting with general needs, managing administrative activities, as well as project communications, documentation, reports and contracts, checking documents for accuracy and compliance within GREF’s standards and procedures. The team member will be tasked to maintain accurate records, and manage document filing system for all operational and financial transactions for easy reference and retrieval; efficient document management including file closures, archiving and monitoring. Other tasks include organizing team meetings, coordinating communication and driving team collaboration.


What this job involves

  • Provide a full range of moderate to complex clerical duties
  • Liaise with executive and senior administrative assistants to handle requests and queries
  • Assisting with all aspects of administrative management, directory maintenance, logistics, equipment and storage
  • Coordinate between vendors/contractors, solving and supporting issues
  • Manage administrative and supporting processes across selected business areas
  • Support in coordinating operational developments, managing timelines & tracking action items
  • Scheduling and coordinating meetings, events and other similar activities
  • Preparing reports, business mailing, agendas and presentations, typically using Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Performing multifaceted general office support
  • Proof reading documents for accuracy
  • Provide sound contributions to knowledge networks and communities of practice
  • Take action items and support team to deliver against committed timelines
  • Act as support to Program Managers to support delivery of agreed projects
  •  
  • Sounds like you? To apply you need to have:
  •  
  • High School degree at minimal; additional qualification as an Administrative assistant or Secretary
  • Proven experience working in a fast-paced dynamic team
  • Highly autonomous and requiring minimal supervision, with natural bias for action
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
  • Good understanding of and respect for cultural differences and the capacity to work effectively in a multicultural environment
  • Teamwork and collaboration skills, with experience in working with virtual teams being a benefit
  • Fluent ability to read, write, speak English
  • Superior verbal and written communications and interpersonal skills to converse with a diverse group of customers at all levels in the organization, as well as external customers
  • Experience in Real Estate, Architecture, Design, Space or Portfolio management is a benefit
  • Understanding of real estate operations will be a benefit
  • Problem-solving and critical thinking skills
  • Basic analytical skills, ability to draw conclusions on data
  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize work
  • Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge of office management systems and procedures, office equipment
  • Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS PowerPoint)

What you can expect from us

  • You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
  • Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay.
  • Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...


  • Apply today at jll.com/careers.

JLL Privacy Statement

 

When you visit JLL websites, JLL may collect information related to those visits, without you actively sending that information. This information may include, for example, the internet browser you are using, your access device’s operating system, the language in which that system presents information to you, your IP (Internet Protocol) address, the web search that took you to the JLL website, the web pages and advertisements displayed to you, and the links you click on.

For additional details please see JLL's Global Privacy Statement or our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy .

position: Knowledge Specialist (Advanced Manufacturing/Energy & Natural Resources Practice)
whole_unnormalized_body:
WHO WE ARE

 

Bain & Company is a leading global consulting firm, serving clients from offices in all major global cities. We work with top executives to help them make better decisions, convert those decisions to actions, and deliver the sustainable success they desire.

 

THE TEAM

 

Knowledge Management is critical to harness the best of our consulting staffs’ individual and collective expertise. Our practices are critical to Bain’s commercial success and are a key strategic priority. Bain’s Practices support teams across the globe with industry, capability, and enabler expertise and knowledge.

 

The Advanced Manufacturing & Services (comprised of 5 sector clusters, including Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Airlines and Logistics, Construction & Building Products, and Machinery, Packaging, and Metals) and Energy & Natural Resources (comprised of 5 sectors: Agribusiness, Chemicals, Mining, Oil & Gas, and Utilities) are two of the largest and fastest growing industry practices at Bain. 

 

THE ROLE

 

The mission of the Strategy Knowledge Specialist is to:


  • Capture and share Bain’s expertise across the AM&S/E&NR sector  
  • Highlight and optimize knowledge used in selling situations and in the delivery of consulting projects
  • Enhance Bain’s AM&S/E&NR industry sector knowledge base on critical themes, products, or trends impacting our clients

 

WHAT YOU WILL DO



  • Mine existing AM&S/E&NR practice and sector content and create customized client-ready materials in response to case team and senior affiliate requests for internal knowledge in support of client selling and serving activities
    • Advise and guide case teams and senior affiliates towards the best information to help answer client questions
    • Help identify and connect experts within the Bain network to consulting teams
    • Collaborate with Bain’s Information Services or other departments to collectively provide consultants the best consolidated view of our internal and external knowledge across the five AMS sectors
    • Develop and package summary documents and provide updated or bespoke analysis for experienced and senior audiences

  • Own and curate the practice knowledge base 
    • Work with AM&S/E&NR practice and sector leadership to get alignment on prioritization of content gaps and action plan for filling gaps
    • Develop and own tools and process for identifying and tracking gaps in our existing knowledge base
    • Own implementation plan and lead efforts to fill gaps from internal sources

  • Identify, capture, and package our consulting teams’ and senior practice members’ knowledge across the AM&S/E&NR practice and sectors
    • Collect, analyze, codify, and share data and information using our global knowledge management platform
    • Work directly with consulting teams, in coordination with other Knowledge Specialists and practices, to understand, capture and disseminate key insights from project work
    • Oversee Knowledge Associate in managing and maintaining the AMS knowledge base on Bain’s intranet

  •  Contribute to the development and execution of the AM&S/E&NR practice and sector strategy
    • Analyze, understand and interpret underlying drivers of practice performance, overseeing Knowledge Associate support of tracking and analysis
    • Assist with content planning and logistics for annual practice and sector meetings
    • Drive practice and sector affiliate engagement, including preparation for experience-sharing calls and publications

  • Serve and contribute as a member of the department and larger Bain community, in line with Bain’s Operating Principles
    •  Prioritize work, communicate issues and progress to supervisor
    • Assign, review, and provide feedback on junior practice member’s work, who are often located in another Bain office.  Manage day to day workplan for juniors and provide coaching and development
    • Demonstrate flexibility with the changing demands of the industry, the leadership team, and commercial demand for varying products
    • Adopt a mindset of supporting and contributing to Bain’s team-focused community (e.g. training, mentoring, projects)

 

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
  • Minimum BA or equivalent undergraduate degree with strong academic credentials
  • Minimum 4+ years of experience, ideally in a professional services firm environment, with exposure to one or more of the following disciplines:
    knowledge management, research, strategic planning/analysis, business development, consulting, or project management
  • Results-focused achiever with high sense of ownership
  • Good business sense combined with structured problem-solving and analytical abilities
  • Desire to work in a fast-paced and sometimes demanding professional environment; ability to juggle multiple priorities and work independently
  • Attentive to detail and organized; ownership mentality and commitment to high-quality results
  • Intellectual curiosity, creative, positive mindset
  • Strong interpersonal skills and willingness to team with colleagues across the globe
  • Exceptional customer service attitude
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, including ability to engage with senior business executives
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Power Point, and Word; ability or desire to learn tools such as Tableau
WHAT BAIN CAN OFFER YOU 

We are proud to be publically recognized around the globe as a great place to work. Bain has ranked as a top company in Glassdoor’s “Best Places to Work” list for the past decade. Our global offices share a diverse and energetic environment and we are committed to fostering a supportive and positive culture.

 

The Knowledge Specialist role provides an exciting, long-term career path within Bain. We invest in your development with regular and customized training as you progress. This role offers the opportunity to learn and grow for years within a supportive and collaborative department. We offer a competitive base salary and bonus. In addition, Bain’s comprehensive benefits program is carefully designed to help meet the needs of you and your family for security and protection.

 

 

Ind123

Infopulse Poland is inviting talented professionals to join our project as aDelivery Manager for our respectable client, TietoEVRY, in our Warsaw office.

TietoEVRY is one of the largest IT companies in Europe with 24000 specialists that provides services to customers all over the world.

Banking industry is changing through digitalization, customer expectations and new regulatory requirements. Every day our developers, architects, designers and other specialists fulfil customer needs and create new ideas to help the banks, we collaborate with, to become even more efficient to match the increased competition.

Digital Banking Services is a department in Trondheim developing user-friendly solutions for the banks’ customers, internet banking and mobile bank solutions. We are 100 experts with high competence in product development and delivery. There is a high demand for our solutions, and we need to increase our capacity.

Our platform, based on Java, JavaScript, IOS and Android is flexible and dynamic, and is used by banks in the Nordic countries. You will collaborate in teams together with functional analysts, architects, and developers in close cooperation with our customers.

Areas of Responsibility
  • As a Scrum Master, you will have the following responsibilities:
    • By facilitating Scrum events and by coaching/training on Lean & Agile:
      • Help the team to self-organize; be cross-functional; create high-value products and remove impediments
      • Help the product owner to communicate vision, goals, PBIs clearly; support the product backlog and release plan and understand and practise Agility
    • By helping others to understand and enact Agile & empirical product development, by causing a change that increases the productivity of the Scrum team and by collaborating with other ScrumMasters
      • Help the organization to increase the effectiveness of Agile software development
    • By sharing knowledge and by the promotion of validated improvements, effective teamwork and spirit of partnership
      • Help the development and support teams to improve products, tools and processes
  • As a Delivery Manager, you will have the following responsibilities:
    • Endorse, defend and promote required and recommended practices and processes
    • Address all implementation problems associated with requirement engineering and software development processes
    • Participate in recruiting and regular evaluation of the team members to execute a growth strategy
    • Execute performance measurement and trend analysis of supervised deliveries
    • Ensure alignment within customer, markets and HQ for regional and global initiatives

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or appropriate educational or professional experience and/or skills is required
  • Ability to perform independently, efficiently and effectively under time constraints
  • Ability to prioritize and spot urgent tasks that need immediate attention quickly, give feedback, discuss risks and possible vectors of development, etc.
  • Proficiency in process documentation and project management tracking tools such as Jira, Microsoft Project, etc.
  • Good knowledge & practical experience with Scrum, PMBOK/PMI (is a plus). Agile is a must. Any certification is a plus
  • Strong interpersonal skills, excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills
  • Analytic mindset, ability to structure ideas and feedback
  • Advanced English — both spoken and written.
To apply (in English only) please use the "Apply now" form below and provide your full career details as an attachment. You are asked to include the detailed description of your skills and technologies mastered, professional experience and projects description. Please, be sure that all information you provide us will be accepted and kept in the strictest confidence.

Job Description



A new and exciting Robotic Process Automation ('RPA') team is currently being formed within the Digital stream of the GBS organisation. This team will be responsible for setting up a Robotic & Cognitive Centre ('RCC') and delivering on a pipeline of robotic process automation opportunities across the Enabling Units and Science Units.



To support the set-up of the RCC, we are looking for Process Analyst to support the delivery of the RPA pipeline and to help embed the RCC's newly defined ways of working.



The role holder will be responsible for working alongside business Subject Matter Experts ('SME') to identify and deliver process automations in conjunction with relevant technical RPA experts. The role holder should have a strong desire to gain exposure to leading edge automation techniques, and ideally experience of process mapping & optimisation, coupled with experience in stakeholder & change management. This experience will be combined with a strong analytical mindset and an ability to communicate simply, with precision and impact across the global user community.



Main duties and responsibilities



Reporting to the RPA Process Analyst Lead, the role will be responsible for the following activities:

  • Managing the relationships with key business stakeholders at all levels to support identification and capture of new process automation opportunities
  • Following the defined RPA methodology, work with business SMEs and RPA technical experts to develop the process automation design, ensure business inputs are secured as needed throughout the development lifecycle, owning more broad and complex processes
  • Development and ownership of required documentation during RPA lifecycle ensuring approvals and regulatory standards are met within project timelines
  • Ensure necessary change management activities are planned and delivered alongside the technical automation, working with others as applicable (Comms Team, Business Stakeholders)
  • Ensure business readiness for cutover to go-live
  • Support on the job coaching and training of new Process Analysts throughout the End to End lifecycle



Essential requirements

  • Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and influencing skills
  • Strong time management skills with ability to work at pace, handling multiple tasks & projects at one time
  • Energetic and self-motivated
  • Excellent presentation & oral communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills to be able to discover and interpret business change requirements
  • Have analysed and redesigned business processes using standard business process re-engineering techniques, e.g. swim lane diagrams, Lean Six Sigma
  • Demonstrated experience of change management
  • Comfortable with working virtually in a global environment
  • Willingness to undertake some domestic / international travel (as required)
  • Willingness to work flexible hours (as required)



Desirable:

  • Experience of process change and/or technology implementation (RPA, Ariba, ERP etc)
  • Experience of working in Agile methodology
  • RPA or other automation implementation experience
  • Experience and proven results of change projects within the Pharma industry
  • Experience of working globally

PPD is a leading global contract research organization providing comprehensive, integrated drug development, laboratory and lifecycle management services. Our clients and partners include pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device, academic and government organizations. With offices in 48 countries and more than 17,000 professionals worldwide, PPD applies innovative technologies, therapeutic expertise and a firm commitment to quality to help clients and partners bend the cost and time curve of drug development to deliver life-changing therapies that improve health.

For more information, visit www.ppdi.com.

An exciting opportunity is now available to advance your career as a

Remote Site Monitor

Responsibilities
  • Performs remote site management activities on assigned project(s) in accordance with FDA and/or local regulations and guidelines, ICH GCPs and PPD procedural documents.
  • Reviews study data from various sources remotely.
  • Contacts study sites to collect study documentation, resolves issues and requests outstanding information.
Qualifications

Education and Experience:
  • Bachelor's Degree in a life science-related field or relevant/equivalent combination of education, training and experience that provides the individual with the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
  • Basic medical/therapeutic area knowledge and understanding of medical terminology
  • Ability to attain and maintain a working knowledge of FDA and/or local regulation and guidelines, ICH GCPs and PPD procedural documents
  • Ability to successfully complete PPD's Clinical Foundation Training Program (CFP)
  • Ability to evaluate medical research data
  • Ability to advise, counsel, and motivate investigational sites
  • Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with medical personnel
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
  • Good organizational and time management skills
  • Proven flexibility and adaptability
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work in a team or independently, as required
  • Good computer skills with good knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and the ability to learn appropriate software
  • Ability to extract pertinent information from all study documents, such as protocols, electronic study data systems, CTMS and dashboards
  • Excellent English language and grammar skills
As an equal opportunity employer, PPD believes that employees are the key to its success, and is committed to your professional growth. We offer an attractive salary, comprehensive benefits package as well as bespoken personal development and training programs.

HOW TO APPLY: Please submit your CV in English. Suitable candidates will be contacted accordingly.

Registration on our website will also give you the opportunity to be considered for other positions if this one is not the most appropriate for your qualifications and experience.

whole_unnormalized_body:
We are looking for a Coordinating Officer - Budget and Finance Support. Deadline: 13.04.2020


DUTIES:

  • Organises budget programming, monitoring and reporting in the Division;
  • Develops and implements internal budgetary and financial practices in line with applicable regulatory framework;
  • Monitors and ensures consistent homogeneous budget and financial practices in the Division;
  • Assists Division’s management with advice on budgetary and financial aspects;
  • Supports Division’s management with scrutinising financial files, grants and tenders providing compliance assurance;
  • Supports and provides guidance to financial actors on financial regulatory framework;
  • Liaises and closely cooperates with Corporate Governance Division and other stakeholders involved in budget, finance and audit/control functions.


THE CAPACITY BUILDING DIVISION AND THE CAPABILITY PROGRAMMING OFFICE

The Capacity Building Division (CBD) is a matrix structure supporting the achievement of Frontex operational goals by providing the necessary capabilities. A matrix approach ensures that the focus is on services thus enabling fluid internal cooperation and collaboration.


CBD develops, delivers and deploys capabilities in support of the Frontex timely, effective, adequate and affordable response to threats, challenges and hazards at the external borders. It systematically identifies shortfalls and plans, programmes, budgets and implements activities across the full scope of capabilities in a financially and qualitatively sound manner.

The Division pools capabilities, including technical equipment and personnel, from Member States and Schengen Associated Countries. The Division manages the pools and makes them available for deployment to Frontex operational activities. It further provides the pools with its own capabilities, acquiring and managing equipment and service contracts throughout the lifecycle, while ensuring the necessary logistics support to deploy and sustain them in operational areas. The Division takes all reasonable practicable duty-of-care responsibilities in order to protect Frontex personnel deployed in all operational activities from harm, injury or occupational diseases. In support of making informed decisions the Division scans and assesses the latest developments in science and technology, performs market research, harmonises requirements, promotes interoperability and fosters innovation.


The Capacity Building Division consists of the following Units: Pooled Resources, Research and Innovation, and Training. It is assisted by a Capability Programming Office and a Capability Pools Office.


The Capability Programming Office (CAP) is responsible for horizontal planning, monitoring and reporting on the capabilities required for the implementation of the Agency’s short, medium and long term operational goals. It systematically identifies capability shortfalls deriving from the operational needs, risk analysis, vulnerability assessment, research and forecasting of future threats, challenges and hazards. It subsequently plans, programmes and budgets activities through a regularly revised Capability Development Plan (CDP) covering e.g. deployed personnel, training, science, technology, equipment, support, logistics, safety and health.


CAP is also responsible for managing pools of capabilities, developing their composition and responsiveness to the operational needs and making them available for deployment under safe and healthy working conditions.

Wymagania

  • Znajomość wirtualizacji (OpenStack, VMware, KVM, sieci wirtualne)
  • Dobre umiejętności pracy w sieci (IP / Routers / Switches)
  • Angielski-B2
Oferujemy
  • zatrudnienie na B2B/UoP
  • pracę na ciekawym stanowisku
  • ubezpieczenie medyczne, kartę Multisport
  • możliwość rozwoju zawodowego
Obowiązki
  • Wdrożenie VNF (zwirtualizowane funkcje sieciowe - głównie Evolved Packet Core i 5G Core)
  • Przygotowanie sprzętu do celów szkoleniowych (sprawdzenie, czy system jest dostępny zdalnie/ Rozwiązywanie problemów
  • Zarządzanie bazą urządzeń (spis przedmiotów, narzędzi i testowanie sprzętu)
  • Utrzymanie środowiska chmurowego

whole_unnormalized_body:
Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in two or more of the following programming languages: Java, C++ and Python.
  • Experience in managing software engineering teams.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science.
  • Experience with data structures, algorithms and software design, along with experience in mobile platforms, internet, video and streaming.
  • Experience in designing and implementing large-scale distributed systems.
  • Knowledge of Unix/Linux and/or Windows platforms.
  • Track record of coding and individual technical accomplishments and demonstrated academic record. Demonstrated technical skills.
  • Demonstrated people management and leadership skills, proven track record of mentoring and coaching team members.


About The Job

Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

Responsibilities
  • Manage a team of Software Engineers, including task planning and code reviews.
  • Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
  • Be responsible for the overall planning, actioning and success of technical projects.
  • Work closely with product management teams to ensure excellent product development.
  • Contribute technically to projects.

At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

null Job Description

Poszukujemy Stażystów, Którzy
  • Znają podstawową teorię uczenia maszynowego, w szczególności sztucznych sieci neuronowych.
  • Podążają za najnowszymi odkryciami w uczeniu maszynowym, aktywnie śledzą aktualne konferencje oraz publikacje naukowe.
  • Chcą trenować i wdrażać modele uczenia maszynowego na dużą skalę korzystając z narzędzi cloudowych.
  • Znają Python’a oraz narzędzia do implementacji modeli sieci neuronowych (np. PyTorch).
Na czym będzie polegał staż ?
  • Rozwój modeli uczenia maszynowego - implementacja nowych architektur, funkcji kosztu, budowanie zbiorów danych do modelowania, ewaluacja modeli.
  • Analiza literatury - wyszukiwanie, przegląd oraz referowanie relewantnych publikacji naukowych.
  • Przygotowanie modeli do wdrożenia produkcyjnego, wsparcie w zagadnieniach związanych z wydajnością proponowanych rozwiązań.
  • Zbieranie i wstępna analiza danych.

Dlaczego Warto Pracować z Nami
  • Pracując w zespole Machine Learning Research zobaczysz w jaki sposób rozwiązujemy problemy badawcze, które napotykamy w Allegro. W zespole pozostajemy na bieżąco z obecnymi odkryciami naukowymi, dzielimy się wiedzą z innymi członkami zespołów badawczych działających w Allegro.
  • W swojej codziennej pracy będziesz współpracował/a z ludźmi, którzy mają praktyczne doświadczenie we wdrażaniu modeli opartych o uczenie maszynowe na skalę niespotykaną nigdzie indziej w Polsce.
  • Będziesz miał/a możliwość pracy z nowoczesnymi narzędziami w chmurze GCP AI Platform.

Ze Swojej Strony Oferujemy
  • Startupową kulturę pracy i stabilność dojrzałej organizacji.
  • Nowoczesne biuro i narzędzia pracy.
  • Nieformalną atmosferę pracy w profesjonalnym zespole.
Wyślij swoje CV i rozpocznij staż!

whole_unnormalized_body:
Date: Jan 21, 2020

Ericsson is one of the leading ICT providers, with about 40% of the world’s mobile traffic carried through our networks. We enable the full value of connectivity by creating game-changing technology and services that are easy to use, adopt and scale, making our customers successful in a fully connected world. Our IoT, 5G and automation technology stands ready to unlock a wave of new value and thus bring positive change.

We are looking for a Technical Solution Manager to be based in Poland to strengthen our presales team and who take care of far-reaching business with operators in Poland in the RAN and Transport domains.

As Technical Solution Manager You Are Responsible For
  • Positioning Ericsson as thought and technology leader in RAN and Transport with the customer as the trusted influencer
  • Building a strong relationship with customer’s decision makers (C-level and middle management)
  • Generating new business opportunities and securing profitable business in tender phase using techno commercial tactics
  • Developing technical presentations & proposals and perform customer presentations with excellent feedback
  • Driving the technical negotiation
  • Contributing to the development of a prioritized view of network evolution needs and target architecture
  • Participating in knowledge transfer, documentation & information sharing including rest of Market Area Europe & Latin America and feedback to Business Area Networks
  • Staying abreast of on new technology/technical areas & share information about the solution to enable customer competence build up

Key Qualifications
  • You have broad technical know-how within RAN and Transport and in-depth know-how and proven sales experience in at least one area.
  • You are a creative thinker and are thrilled by identifying solutions to customer problems
  • You apply Consultative Selling
  • You possess excellent presentation & communication skills and can easily adjust your communication style to different audiences
  • You are a team player with very good collaboration and team leading skills
  • You have very good Operator understanding
  • Excellent English skills are mandatory and Polish will be a major plus

Leadership
  • Competence Drive, Master Strategy, Driving Innovation, Business Acumen, Enabling People, Courageous Leadership, Uncompromising Integrity, Customer Excellence, Excelling Execution, Embracing Change
  • People leadership, senior capability in managing and driving change in large, complex, and cross-functional teams
  • Strong cultural awareness and excellent interpersonal communications and networking skills
  • Thought Leadership in identifying short and long term priorities in order to support the business needs
  • Strategic thinking, see the big picture as well as complex relations and dependencies

What Do We Offer
  • Stable employment on the basis of an employment contract,
  • Work based on developing the latest solutions in the area of mobile technology,
  • Clearly defined career paths, trainings,
  • Rich benefits package (private medical care for the employee and their family, life insurance, Ok System, MultiSport, lunch voucher),
  • Work in an international environment based on cooperation,
  • Home office, flexible working hours, laptop and mobile phone,
  • Work - life balance.

Want to see technology make the difference? As IT Demand Analyst, you'll have the freedom to innovate, finding new ways to make our business faster, smarter and more agile than ever.



IT Demand Analyst

Warszawa, Mazovia Province

IT Demand Analyst sits within IT Global Hub and is responsible for validation and trafficking of IT demand (projects, platforms initiatives). IT Demand Analyst will be creating long-term plans based on capacity and business priorities.

Scope of Responsibilities:

* New demand verification and assignment;
* Monitor the demand plan to actual performance monthly, which includes demand and billings vs projection and forecast accuracy to provide detailed input to cross functional teams;
* Ensure that implementation pipelines are drawn up (annual, monthly, weekly, daily, shift) based on: marketing forecasts, business priorities, capacity plans and expected risks;
* Partner with the PMO & Vendor Management to create plan that optimizes cost and other terms for the full lifecycle of the projects;
* Support capacity management and bottlenecks early alerts;
* Ensure quality when faced time-to-market challenges;
* Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies;
* Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.



Skills/Experiences:

* 2+ year's of experience in project Demand Planning within IT;
* Very good verbal and written communication in English;
* A sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company's success;
* Experience working in mixed Waterfall and Scrum/Kanban development process;
* Enthusiastic about the use of technology;
* Able to priorities work and balance competing demands.

Equality



In Return RB offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation.
RB is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.

We’re JTI, Japan Tobacco International and we believe in freedom. We think that the possibilities are limitless when you’re free to choose. In fact, we’ve spent the last 20 years innovating, creating new and better products for our consumers to choose from. It’s how we’ve grown to be present in 130 countries.

But our business isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen for our business.

That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It’s why 9 out of 10 would recommend us to a friend. And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, six years running.

So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.

Learn more jti.com

Quality and Compliance Specialist

This is great opportunity to be a part of exciting project and drive transformation in the Company to ensure that internal customers around the world are getting the Best-in-class level of service.

Our offer includes

  • A competitive pay (together with annual bonus) and an attractive benefits package including medical care, Multisport card, life insurance, pension plan
  • Ambitious goal to set up new Global Business Center Complex environment of working with multiple stakeholders
  • On-going development opportunities in a multinational environment that will inspire you to grow professionally and personally
  • Wide variety of projects and tasks, ambitious goals and independence in achieving them
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Modern office in a convenient location

Main areas of responsibility

  • Ensuing overall GQM Documentation Framework and Standards are implemented and complied with locally
  • Ensuring continued governance and maintenance of the GQM Documentation Framework and Standards
  • Identifying opportunities for further refinements, improvements and efficiencies
  • Supporting of GBS in ensuing that any new processes or changes to existing processes are in complete compliance to the Global Quality Framework requirements (JSOX, SAP roles, documentation)
  • Regular audits of the framework
  • Ensuring regular reporting and information is escalated to the GM, the Global Quality Lead and other management as required
  • Driving compliance to specific JSOX controls with GBS control owners
  • Being the Local JSOX Coordinator as defined by FCG
  • Being the Local GBS representative and center of expertise for JSOX compliance
  • Coordinating and supporting internal and external audit
  • Supporting compliance initiatives as required for the local GBS with direction from the Corporate Compliance Lead

You as a professional

  • Have an University Degree (Economics, Business Administration, Engineering or Science)
  • 2-3 years of experience in a similar position in a multinational company
  • Proficient computer skills (MS Office, Advanced Excel)
  • Fluent English (written and spoken)
  • Good communication skills (written and spoken)
  • Strong level of business understanding
  • Prior experience with quality assurance and document control processes
  • Strong leadership mindset

If you decide to participate in this recruitment, the administrator of your data will be JTI Polska sp.z o.o. with headquarters in Stary Gostków. Your data will be processed only to support the recruitment process in which you participate. Detailed information on the processing of your data and your rights can be found here.

For our Client, an international Investment Fund, we are currently searching for Candidates for the position of Senior Finance Assistant.

You Will Be Responsible For
  • Assisting the finance department with accounts payable, clerical functions, and general office assistance
  • In charge of reconciling/processing and payment request of expense reports, travel invoices, and corporate credit card statements (including related backup)
  • Processing of payments related to invoices for the company, and will process funding requests for the various business verticals
  • Establishing relationships with vendors to be the main point of contact for invoice submission and will field and process emergency payment requests
  • Performing basic accounting administrative tasks and daily data entry and miscellaneous projects as assigned


Requirements
  • Possess a Master's Degree
  • 6 months to one year of related experience and/or training, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • To succeed in this role, you should have a solid understanding of basic bookkeeping and accounting principles and proven ability to calculate, post and manage accounting figures
  • You should also be a self-motivated and detail-oriented individual
  • Good knowledge of spreadsheet and word processing software is a pre-requisite and experience with an SAP system would be advantageous.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

Do you want to join our new Global Business Service Centre in Warsaw and provide quality services to Alcon entities and be responsible for executing the maintenance of master data used at Alcon as a Finance Master Data Senior Specialist with global responsibility?

Do you have a background in R2R end-to-end process, ensuring its quality and effectiveness? The role makes certain that data validation, data entry, data quality, reporting and analysis are in place and managed in accordance with defined data standards and operating procedures. This includes ensuring all necessary master data is available, accurate and compliant and providing regular and timely reporting to support Alcon to enable improved performance, compliance and cost reduction.

Here at Alcon we are passionate about improving patients’ lives allowing them to see brilliantly and we would love you to be part of the team making this happen!

KPI’s

 Delivery of quality master data management and productivity targets
 Data Quality: R2R finance related data objects accuracy
 Professional and positive attitude towards change and continuous improvement
 No unsatisfactory audit rating and timely execution of action plans
 Customer satisfaction of service delivery and process specific KPIs in accordance with agreed SLAs

Minimum Requirements

 2-4 years of relevant experience, with good functional exposure to R2R processes from a finance master data management perspective. O2C experience is a plus
 Master data concept knowledge and master data application set up
 Experience managing SAP master data objects: GL accounts, Cost Centers, Profit Centers, Cost Elements, Hierarchies
 SAP knowledge: experience in SAP ECC and Business Warehouse (BI)
 Experience with SAP MDG is desired
 Conceptual thinking and ability to align specific functional requirements with the overall MDM strategy
 Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a multi-national organization
 Previous experience within financial shared service centers desirable
 Previous experience working in projects to drive performance improvements
 Good people skills

whole_unnormalized_body:
Date: Mar 27, 2020

At Ericsson, you can be a game changer! Because working here isn’t just a deal. It’s a big deal. This means that you get to leverage our 140+ years of experience and the expertise of more than 95,000 diverse colleagues worldwide. As part of our team, you will help solve some of society´s most complicated challenges, enabling you to be ‘the person that did that.’ We’ve never had a greater opportunity to drive change; setting the bar for technology to be inclusive and accessible; empowering an intelligent, sustainable, and connected world.

Are you in? We are now looking for a DevOps Architect, who will support DevOps transformation project.

Responsibilities
  • Design of Continuous Integration/Delivery pipelines in Jenkins for microservices
  • Support for Jenkins tuning and troubleshooting
  • Automate deployment using Ansible
  • Cooperate with DevOps Evangelist in defining principles and guidelines
  • Cooperate with DevOps Transformation Leader to optimize support model and processes
  • Modernization of existing application - designing migration from Virtual Machine(s) to containerized (Docker) version or native cloud
  • Knowledge sharing about DevOps with development teams
  • Promoting release automation in development teams to decrease software delivery time of new features
  • Support for configuration and customization of Observability tools
  • Documentation of DevOps aspects


Key Qualifications
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in software development, including 2 years in DevOps methodology
  • Expert proficiency in Continuous Integration tools (Jenkins)
  • Intermediate experience with container orchestration tools (Kubernetes)
  • Deep knowledge of GIT (Bitbucket) tool and GitFlow approach
  • Knowledge of processes: Configuration Management, Release Management
  • Basic knowledge of Cloud Computing solutions (IBM, Azure)
  • Basic knowledge of build tools (MSBuild, Gradle)
  • Experience with Containers technology (Docker)
  • Experience with Static Code Analysis tools (SonarQube)
  • Knowledge of scripting languages (Bash, PowerShell)
  • Knowledge of Agile Scrum methodology

Nice To Have
  • Certifications in any of the above mentioned technical areas will be an advantage
  • Experience with working in international teams in various time zones

What Do We Offer
  • Stable employment on the basis of an employment contract,
  • Work based on developing the latest solutions in the area of mobile technology,
  • Clearly defined career paths, trainings,
  • Rich benefits package (private medical care for employee and his family, life insurance, Ok System, MultiSport, lunch voucher),
  • Work in an international environment based on cooperation,
  • Home office, flexible working hours, laptop and mobile phone,
  • Work-life balance.

We’re JTI, Japan Tobacco International and we believe in freedom. We think that the possibilities are limitless when you’re free to choose. In fact, we’ve spent the last 20 years innovating, creating new and better products for our consumers to choose from. It’s how we’ve grown to be present in 130 countries.

But our business isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen for our business.

That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It’s why 9 out of 10 would recommend us to a friend. And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, six years running.

So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.

Learn more jti.com

whole_unnormalized_body:
At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Janssen is a pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson. Please visit www.janssen.com for more information.

Multichannel Advisor

Location: Warsaw

Contract: Full time, Temporary contract

The Responsibilities & The Impact YOU Will Have
  • Co-creation and implementation of multichannel marketing strategy in dedicated therapeutic area; close cooperation with marketing & medical teams,
  • Cooperation with external agencies (eDetailing, online webinar, recordings)
  • Enabling team to use latest digital/ multichannel techniques for obtaining valuable insights
  • Acting as subject matter expert on Multichannel towards assigned projects (digital project management & analytics, marketing automation, video production)
  • Suggesting the right communications channels/activities to engage specific target groups, acting upon specific behavioral objectives
  • Supervising and consulting on best practices and effectiveness of automated marketing campaigns combining several channels across the organization
  • Developing partnerships with right 3rd parties to increase brands footprint on the web to extend the reach to our resources and content

Qualifications

We would love to hear from YOU, if you have:
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in Digital Marketing in pharmaceutical area is preferred
  • Education: University / Bachelor Degree or Equivalent, preferably in a relevant business-related discipline (marketing, e-marketing, technology, economy)
  • Experience in marketing automation, digital marketing campaigns, content marketing
  • Knowledge of HTML and graphics editor programs might be advantage
  • Flexibility, fast adaptation, openness and pro-activity
  • Strong communicational and planning skills oriented towards delivering business results
  • Excellent command of Polish and English both written and spoken

This Is What Awaits YOU At J&J
  • An opportunity to be part of a global market leader.
  • A dynamic and inspiring working environment.
  • Many opportunities to work on challenging projects and assignments.
  • Possibilities for further personal as well as professional development.
  • Many employees benefits.
