job_description_details.Industry: Hospital & Health Care Medical Device Pharmaceuticals

whole_unnormalized_body:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.

CUSTOMER SERVICE ASSOCIATE

Position Title: Customer Service Associate

Position Level: P1-P2

Reports to: Commercial Finance & Order to Cash Manager

Position Type: Full time

Leading Candidate: No

Purpose: Customer Service Associate is responsible for working directly with customers to accept and place orders in ERP, coordinate order fulfillment including issuing documentation necessary for order delivery to and acceptance by customers. In addition, this position will be responsible to support the management and control of the end-to-end Export business.

Location: Elanco Poland in Warsaw, Poland.

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables
  • Process all manual orders received through phone, fax & email, ensuring priority for urgent orders, ensuring a positive customer experience
  • Generate and distribute invoices and other relevant documentation necessary for order deliveryto and acceptance by cutomers
  • Monitor and resolve all sales orders & sales interface issues (outbound)
  • Review key metrics & communicate to stakeholders to ensure KPIs are being met
  • Support global/regional O2C projects with influence on accurate, efficient & compliant order processing
  • Support the overall O2C Customer Service team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members and training of new team members
  • Be seen as a “go-to” information resource for O2C Customer Service processing and related queries
  • Be seen as a “go-to” information resource for O2C Export Supply Chain queries, including understanding and applying the basics of export business (tenders, ICC, Incoterms, bid and performance bonds, Letters of Credit, etc.)
  • Manage the day-to-day Export operational environment from timely and accurate order placement, fulfillment, collections, payment applications, returns, disputes, adjustments, etc.
  • Review key metrics & communicate to stakeholders to ensure KPIs are being met
  • Support global/regional O2C projects with influence on accurate, efficient & compliant export business operations
  • Support the overall O2C Supply Chain Management Export team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members and training of new team members
  • Skills & Capabilities
  • Ability to handle complexity and utilize analytical skills, with attention to detail
  • Ability to proactively & effectively analyze & resolve problems
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables
  • Able to respond flexibly and empathetically to customer needs, managing their expectations effectively
  • Ability to work in global team environment and communicate effectively with both internal business partners of all levels & disciplines as well as external LSP/CMO team members
  • Demonstrate a strong compliance oriented mindset & help to build a strong compliance culture
  • Familiarize with all applicable process documentation & training materials to ensure you operate in a fully compliant manner
  • Operational awareness of all applicable Sox & Operational controls for your area
  • Actively work with the core team members, internal customers/business partners, and LSP team members to build effective working relationships
  • Demonstrate excellence in all interactions with our GBS internal customers & business partners
  • Focus on measuring & improving our customer’s experience with the GBS
  • Build and maintain a strong knowledge of Elanco's product lines within the market
  • Demonstrate a strong Continuous Improvement oriented approach & help to build a strong Continuous Improvement culture
  • Actively work with the core team members & Global O2C team to drive improvements for processes
  • Ability to work in high volume/fast paced environment

Requirements
  • 2-3 year experience in O2C or Finance function (with knowledge of supply chain management export business), preferably with knowledge of credit management & customer service and experience in identifying and delivering process change
  • Degree in Business and/or Accounting (or equivalent work experience)
  • Experience with SAP O2C Module, Business Warehouse, Business Objects, MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

Company Overview

Elanco is a global animal health company that develops products and knowledge services to prevent and treat disease in food animals and pets in more than 90 countries. With a 64-year heritage, we rigorously innovate to improve the health of animals and benefit our customers, while fostering an inclusive, cause-driven culture for more than 5,800 employees. At Elanco, we are driven by our vision of food and companionship enriching life – all to advance the health of animals, people and the planet. Learn more at www.elanco.com .

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

Continuous Improvement Expert
  • Międzynarodowa firma produkcyjna
  • Możliwość pracy w jednym z dwóch zakładów w woj. mazowieckim
    • About Our Client
    Naszym klientem jest międzynarodowa firma produkcyjna z branży przetwórstwa tworzyw sztucznych. Organizacja należy do międzynarodowej grupy w skład której wchodzi niespełna 200 fabryk na całym świecie. Zakład produkcyjny zlokalizowany jest na północ od Warszawy.

    Job Description
    • Prowadzenie projektu zmieniającego kulturę organizacyjną z zakresu Lean Manufacturing,
    • Prowadzenie i koordynacja projektów doskonalących oraz Kaizen,
    • Wsparcie innych działów we wdrażaniu nowych narzędzi i projektów,
    • Utrzymanie efektów osiągniętych przy projektach optymalizujących,
    • Wprowadzenie zasad 5S i zapewnienie ich przestrzegania,
    • Zarządzanie procesem zgłaszania i wykorzystywania dobrych praktyk w zakładzie
    The Successful Applicant
    • Wykształcenie wyższe techniczne
    • Minimum roczne doświadczenie zdobyte w pracy na podobnym stanowisku w środowisku produkcyjnym
    • Teoretyczna oraz praktyczna znajomość narzędzi Lean Management (np. 5S, WCM, TPM, Kaizen, 6 Sigma)
    • Średnio-zaawansowana znajomość języka angielskiego
    • Doświadczenie w prowadzeniu projektów związanych z optymalizacją procesów produkcyjnych
    • Umiejętność zarządzania procesami, umiejętność analitycznego myślenia
    • Umiejętność samodzielnej pracy pod presją czasu
    • Komunikatywność, umiejętność pracy w grupie

    What's On Offer
    • Wynagrodzenie adekwatne do zdobytego doświadczenia zawodowego
    • Opieka medyczna, ubezpieczenie zdrowotne, karta sportowa, system bonusowy, wczasy pod gruszą
    • Duże możliwości rozwoju w ramach pionowych struktur w Polsce lub na świecie
    Contact: Jakub Swiderski
    Quote job ref: 36119

whole_unnormalized_body:
Business Operation Assistant will be responsible for daily operation for Huawei Mobile Services in Europe. The person will be assisting operation manager to improve product performance. The ideal candidate should have a strong responsibility and a good understanding of mobile services. He/She will work as an assistant of the Business Operation team, focusing on user acquisition, retention and data operation. Additionally the ideal candidate should be familiar with local market, because together with operation manager he/she will bring the "Wow Way" experience to every customer.


Key Responsibilities: 


  • Supporting the Business Operation Manager with the business operation activities to drive user growth and achieve business target. 
  • Establishing relationships with the local service providers and top industry partners to aggregate rich, high-quality local content and services.
  • Supporting our service partners for day to day operations.
  • Assisting operation manger to organize campaigns and events (online/offline) for the service promotions in the European markets.
  • Leveraging data and insights to understand our customers and funnel in depth, identify business opportunities.
  • Collaborating with HQ product teams, enhance the user experience and support optimizing business performance.


Skills & Experience – Required:


  • Good understanding of Mobile user consumption trends, needs, and expectations.
  • Familiar with European culture, EU mobile market, and local developer companies, services, and products.
  • Experience with Data Analytics, excellent analytical skills will be a plus.
  • Highly motivated with the ability to thrive in a fluid, demanding and fast-paced environment.
  • Native in Chinese, fluent in English and Polish.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


We offer:

 

  • Growth opportunities in a unique worldwide company.
  • Work in a multicultural, modern environment.
  • Modern office located in a convenient location.
  • Additional non-wage benefits: private medical care, sports card, online benefits platform, employee discounts for Huawei devices, free company parking lot and all necessary tools needed to perform your daily duties.
  • Attractive motivational bonus system.
  • Various team building activities and employee integration events.


Location

This is a fulltime contract position for one year at our Headquarter based in Horizon Plaza Warsaw, Poland


Notice: Applicants must be eligible to work in Poland, Huawei is not able to sponsor any work permit applications. 


Positions may be filled on a full-time employee basis in Poland.

Jeżeli chcecie Państwo, przesłać CV, aby wasze dane były wykorzystane w tym i kolejnych procesach rekrutacyjnych , prosimy o zamieszczenie klauzuli zgody. „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych przez Personnel and Media Solutions, Piaseczno ul. Julianowska 35 dla potrzeb niezbędnych do realizacji tego oraz przyszłych procesów rekrutacji w związku z rozpoczęciem obowiązywania z dniem 25 maja 2018 r. Rozporządzenia Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady Unii Europejskiej 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych. Wyrażam zgodę na udostępnienie moich danych osobowych podmiotom współpracującym w celu realizacji procesów rekrutacyjnych, również po zakończeniu rekrutacji w celu przedstawiania kolejnych propozycji zatrudnienia, Poinformowano mnie o prawie wglądu do własnych danych osobowych. Powyższe dane podaję dobrowolnie”

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Staffing & Recruiting Financial Services

whole_unnormalized_body:
Country Poland

Location Warszawa

Function Information & Digital Technology

Level Experienced Professional

Grade G36

Job Type Permanent

Contractual Legal Entity BAT Polska Trading Spzoo (PL12)

Application Deadline 15.04.2020

British American Tobacco (BAT) is one of the World’s leading consumer goods companies, with brands sold around the globe. Our vision is to “Transform Tobacco” and our industry, so - during 2019 - we are setting up a new Tech Hub in Poland to support and drive our digital transformation. This is the start of the journey and we are looking for team player who is passionate about change and ready to support us in making digital part of our DNA.

PURPOSE STATEMENT

British American Tobacco is developing New Categories of products, aiming to provide a range of high quality, potentially reduced risk products as alternatives to traditional tobacco. Expanding into New Categories requires a different setup of Product Lifecycle Management processes and supporting systems.

Part of IDT Marketing team, this role is responsible for understanding the Product Lifecycle Management processes, objectives and business requirements and identify business technology and/or process opportunities. To work with functional and IDT managers to develop, implement and maintain solutions which deliver business value within agreed timelines and budget.

TYPICAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
  • Work across the various business functions that play in the PLM landscape (e.g. R&D, Product Development, Supply Chain, Quality, Marketing) to establish and maintain a balanced and integrated PLM systems landscape
  • Establishing the contribution that technology can make to business objectives using a range of techniques such as eliciting & documenting requirements with stakeholders, conducting feasibility studies, producing business models, preparing business cases, usability requirements analysis and usability evaluation
  • Identifying and obtaining agreement on the requirements / features which will be most beneficial to the business
  • Check and validate that business process is enabled and supported in most efficient and effective way, maintaining integrity of architecture, in line with business requirements (functional and non-functional), group architecture, IT policies, standards and procedures
  • Providing input to and/or assist in
    • ensuring compliance with agreed best practices
    • preparing budget proposals, resourcing plans and project plans
    • creation and maintenance of IT strategies
  • Identifying and raising issues impacting the execution of strategic / operational / project plans
  • Understanding the overall Enterprise Architecture and assess degree of conformance of existing and new business processes
  • Overseeing implementation of solutions - checking against the initial requirements

CORE RELATIONSHIPS
  • Business Partners and IDT Managers collaborate on the provision of professional BA services in line with agreed priorities of the business.
  • IDT functional managers / Project Managers collaborate in the execution of planning and analysis services and delivery of required outputs
  • Process Experts provide solutions advice and improvements to jointly produce value cases
  • Design Authority collaborate with peers to form an efficient and value adding Design Authority
  • Enterprise Architects understand overall enterprise architecture and collaborate to ensure conformance of to the architecture.
  • Solution Architects collaborate on the selection and development of solutions.
  • Solution Delivery collaborate to ensure solutions meet the business requirements.
  • Planning support the development of IDT plans and budgets.


Skills, Knowledge, Experience
  • Deep expertise around Product Lifecycle Management in FMCG or Pharma industries
  • Experience in a Global SAP Template and leading-edge PLM systems is highly desirable
  • Ability to build excellent working relationships and influence key stakeholders from multiple functions
  • Experience of leading, influencing and operating in a complex geographical/ functional matrix organization
  • Proactive approach and ability to make efficient and value-based Design Solution decisions
  • Understanding of the issues associated with the business operating model of a global organisation
  • Robust team work demonstrated both within and outside the IT function
  • Clarity and understanding of strategic thinking on key decisions

British American Tobacco is one of the world’s leading multinational companies, with brands sold in over 200 markets, made in 44 factories in 42 countries.

We are proud that we are consistently among the top 5 companies on the London Stock Exchange.

Our portfolio includes our world-famous Global Drive Brands - Dunhill, Kent, Lucky Strike, Pall Mall and Rothmans - along with many other leading international brands, such as Vogue, Peter Stuyvesant and State Express 555.

Alongside our traditional tobacco business, we are also developing products that offer consumers potentially less risky alternatives to regular cigarettes. Our Next Generation Products are already leading the way in the Industry of vapour and tobacco heating devices. We continue to develop a solid portfolio of consumer solutions which already include well known global brands like Vype, glo and Voke.

Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Our clients rely on our knowledge, experience, and aptitude for problem-solving to optimize strategies across their organizations. Our ability to leverage and manipulate big data, coupled with our in-depth understanding of pharma industry and healthcare system, puts us in a unique position to deliver high-quality insights that address a variety of client needs.

We are currently looking for Interns to join our Consulting Team.

As An Intern With IQVIA Consulting Team, The Candidate Will Be Involved, Under Supervision, In Development And Delivery Of Consulting Projects By
  • conducting desk research to a specific brief using internal and external sources
  • performing quantitative analyses to aid development of recommendations
  • supporting project team for the preparation, execution and follow up of client workshops
  • taking responsibility for creating sections of reports, translations, presentations and other client deliverables
  • proactively developing knowledge of the healthcare industry and consulting methodologies

Desired Skills And Experience
  • Being in your penultimate year of a degree, or in your final year of study in Economics, Management or Engineering with strong record of academic achievement
  • Ability to analyze complex data, draw conclusions and succinctly summarize recommendations
  • Excellent Microsoft Office Skills: strong skills in working with Excel spreadsheets and creating presentations with Power Point (knowledge of VBA is an asset)
  • Proficiency in English
  • Strong communication, analytical and problem solving skills
  • Good planning, time-management and organisational skills
  • Ability to work in a team
  • Interest in lifescience/pharmaceutical world!
We offer
  • A 12-week paid summer internship program
  • Opportunity to participate in international projects for top pharmaceutical companies
  • A challenging internship within an internationally recognized and growing organization
  • Opportunity to join the team as a Junior Analyst after the internship

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Job ID: R1123795

Are you willing to take on a new challenge in a fast-changing environment? Do you want to be a part of cross-functional team working together in order to ensure great business results?

As Demand Planner You Will
  • Create short-term and long-term sales forecasts based on market and historic data analysis for Poland&Baltic HUB
  • Coordinate demand planning in close cooperation with business development, sales, supply planning and controlling international teams
  • Challenge and consolidate the promotions and launches forecasts projected by the business
  • Constantly work on demand planning process and tools improvement

If You
  • Have at least 2 years of experience in demand planning
  • Enjoy working in a fast-paced and complex environment
  • Have a can-do attitude and business oriented approach
  • Have a very good command of English and Polish (both written and spoken
  • Have good analytical skills and ability to work well under time pressure
  • Are a very communicative and enjoy working in a team
Moreover, you are:
  • You. You’re real. And you’re true to yourself. We cherish and celebrate diversity so you’ll feel right at home whoever you are.
  • Entrepreneurial. Every single day, you spot opportunities to shake things up and change the world for the better.
  • Adventurous. You’ll embrace challenges and change with fire in your belly and a great big smile on your face.
  • Only human. You’ll screw up sometimes but you have no fear of failure because you’re smart enough to learn from mistakes.
  • One of the gang. Even if you’re Superman or Wonder Woman, you recognise that teams are the real heroes. And so do we.

We Offer
  • Friendly and dynamic work atmosphere in a team engaged in sports and CSR activities
  • Plenty of opportunities to grow (also cross-divisionally and functionally)
  • Rich e-learning package
  • Dedicated Buddy from day one!
  • Wide benefits package including: sports card, private health care, life insurance, pension package and internal boutique with a discount
  • Amazing&Sustainable office in the heart of Warsaw

We are open for candidates with disabilities.

At Too Good To Go, we dream of a planet with no food waste.

Imagine if there was something we could all change today that would reduce global warming by 8%. That’s how much food waste contributes to the climate crisis.

We’re on a mission to change this!

Our app connecting businesses with unsold food, and consumers willing to buy at a discounted rate has grown since 2016 to become the biggest in Europe, with over 20 Million users, and more than 32 million meals saved.

Your mission

We are looking for an experienced, dedicated and self-driven Head of Key Accounts with a passion for tackling food waste. You will report to the Country Manager and will be pivotal in driving acquisition and development of key partnerships with hotels, restaurant chains, and supermarkets.

You will lead a small team focusing on growing and scaling Key Accounts at speed. This is a great challenge for a hungry and driven professional who can build, lead and nurture an enthusiastic Key Accounts team in a fast-paced environment without losing sight of our mission. The role will be part of an international Key Accounts team where best practices and learnings will be shared across borders.

Role Description

You will continuously develop our partnerships with Key Accounts on the Polish market, as well as provide leadership, structures, and support to the Key Accounts team as it grows.
  • Develop partnerships Identify Key Accounts, lead the meeting presenting the app, develop the application in their stores.
  • Inspire & Empower Champion a high-performance sales culture within the team to support our mission and business objectives.
  • Develop the team Using your in-depth knowledge and experience of different sales and negotiation methodologies, you will ensure the team fulfills their potential and constantly train, coach, mentor and support for peak performance.
  • Strategy and market mapping Analyze the market to identify geographic and segment opportunities for growth and build the plan for optimum results.
  • Structure and Optimize Identify key performance drivers and set up the right team structures and processes for exponential growth.
  • Leadership and Management Work with the management team on the broader plans for the Polish business including stakeholder reporting.


What We Have To Offer
  • A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change.
  • The experience of being part of an international company with 500 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 15 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support!
  • Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
  • An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
  • A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.


Requirements
  • You can identify opportunities to go after in the market and have experience with CRM and sales tools.
  • You have excellent sales skills and are able to build partnerships with Key Accounts. You are able to lead negotiations and create and deliver high impact pitches. You possess excellent commercial acumen.
  • You are a strong leader and can manage a team by setting targets, motivation and continuous development of skills.
  • You are data-oriented and work with KPIs to guide actions, also being able to track success.
  • You have full professional proficiency in Polish and English.
  • You are process-focused, continuously documenting and improving processes, sharing learnings with the global team; you are highly organized to develop client implementation plans.
  • You have a true passion for sustainability - you understand the urgency of action for the planet.


How To Apply
  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Dla naszego klienta do projektu związanego z Administracją Rządową poszukuję Testera oprogramowania 


Lokalizacja: Warszawa

Stawka : do 650 zł netto + VAT/dzień/ B2B 


 Wymagania: 

  • znajomość Jmeter lub Windows Server/Dynamics 
  • 1 rok doświadczenia na podobnym stanowisku 
  • Znajomość języka zapytań SQL 
  • Podstawowa znajomość notacji analitycznej (UML, BPMN) 
  • Podstawowa znajomość technologii WebServices/REST 
  • Podstawowa znajomość systemów operacyjnych Linux (znajomość poleceń shellowych)


Mile widziane: 

  • Znajomość PostgreSQL, serwera aplikacyjnego JBOSS lub Glassfish 
  • Znajomość narzędzi do testów automatycznych: Selenium, SoapUI, CodeUI

Join us and be one who empowers billions! That’s incredible reach. When you combine that with your own inspiration, plus the freedom and support to make your ideas happen, you can make a huge impact on how people work and live all over the world.

As an Account Delivery Executive (ADE) you will be the strategic partner for both the commercial account team and the customer that brings Microsoft's own professional services teams to deliver and support digital transformation solutions for our customers. As the Microsoft’s commercial business evolves from selling and building individual products to becoming the strategic digital transformation platform and partner of choice, you will lead Microsoft Services teams in the delivery, support and active use of those solutions, and be a key part of our customer's success.

Responsibilities

A career as an Account Delivery Executive (ADE) at Microsoft will give you the opportunity to join a talented and dedicated team in pursuit of an ambitious goal.

Reach

You’ll partner and collaborate with multiple teams across disciplines, organizations and geographies, as you help bring Microsoft’s latest technologies and products together into real live solutions for customers.

Freedom

As you partner with other teams to help sell, deliver and support our solutions, you’ll find opportunities to enhance your skills and talents, explore your interests, and grow your career.

Inspiration

Be on the leading edge of helping our customers reinvent what it means to do business. Watch the impact of how you bring Microsoft Services teams together to deliver and support innovative solutions to our largest customers. You’ll have the reach, freedom and inspiration to have lasting impact and make a difference.

As An ADE, Key Responsibilities Include
  • Understand your customers’ business priorities and strategies
  • Drive Business Development activities
  • Expand strategic customer relationships to drive larger impact for the customer
  • Identify opportunities and support the sales team through the sales process
  • Partner with other roles to ensure overall customer success and consumption of our cloud services
  • Oversee the delivery of professional services teams as they implement and support Microsoft based solutions
  • Be the primary contact to your customer for any Microsoft Services being delivered to our customes

Qualifications

Someone with the following skills and experience would be a great candidate for an Account Delivery Executive (ADE) at Microsoft
  • Executive/Business engagement skills
  • Account Portfolio Management
  • Business Development
  • Building Customer/Partner Relationships
  • Industry Expertise
  • Years Experience: 8+ primarily in a client-facing role
  • Bachelor’s Degree (B.S./B.A.) in Computer Science, Business Management, or equivalent

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Corporate HR - Payroll Manager - Associate



Key responsibilities:



  



The Payroll Manager will be responsible for: 



  • Managing the Poland payroll team

  • Coordinating payroll for all of the employees of the company and liaising with the outsourced provider.

  • Interact closely with Payroll vendors to ensure timely and accurate service delivery

  • Maintain key relationships with a number of key stakeholders in the business as well as providers

  • Collating all of the payroll data and ensuring that all calculations are correct

  • Constantly review and update internal processes to ensure the smooth running of the payroll Administering calculation  a range of benefits as well as the pension scheme.

  • Ensure timely and accurate administration of employee garnishments, insurances and taxes, ensuring proper withholding and remittance to appropriate agencies and authorities

  • Manage employee and HR inquiries related to timekeeping, leaves and other payroll items.

  • Lead in process training to develop the team and create effective back ups 

  • Identify risks and ensure appropriate controls are in place

  • Stay abreast of changes in social security, employment and tax laws that impact payroll and benefits

  • Liaising with Expat payroll team to ensure accurate treatment of expatriate compensation and benefits

  • Ensure compliance with all internal/external regulations and requirements

  • Leading any payroll projects that are undertaken

 




Requirements:




  • Graduate / Postgraduate with  at least 5+ years of working experience in Payroll functional area  

  • people management experience

  • Strong knowledge of end-to-end Payroll processes, Tax and Employment Laws and Payroll Accounting  for Poland1

  • Strong ability in data management for analysis and reconciliation processes

  • Advanced Excel skills and knowledge of standard data mining and reporting packages

  • Ability to handle highly confidential/sensitive data information

  • Strong organisation skills and ability to effectively prioritize

  • Be a self-motivated and result-oriented individual with an ability and experience to manage, motivate and lead teams of skilled staff consistently, while taking equitable and fair decisions in leadership  

  • Very strong calculation / analytical skills  

  • Excellent organization & time management skills. Should exercise good judgment in prioritizing deliverables for oneself and team  

  • Ability to make sound business decisions and exercise good judgment skills with understanding of when to escalate issues

  • Ability to develop strong partnerships HR colleagues

  • High attention to detail

  • Ability to work under pressure and work within tight deadlines

  • Strong communication skills

  • Must be flexible and adaptable to changes in procedures, processes, systems, etc.

  • Fluency in English and Polish

  • Have strong customer focus (internal employee)   

  • Vendor management experience

 

About J.P. Morgan Chase & Co: 




J.P. Morgan serves one of the largest client franchises in the world. Our clients include corporations, institutional investors, hedge funds, governments and affluent individuals in more than 100 countries. J.P. Morgan is part of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.1 trillion.  The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management, and private equity. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase serves millions of clients and consumers under its JPMorgan and Chase, and WaMu brands. 




J.P. Morgan offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package. J.P. Morgan is an Equal Opportunity Employer

 




To be considered for this role, you may be required to complete the video interview powered By HireVue.




 

The hiring manager for this job opening would be willing to have a conversation about flexibility.  This could range from ad hoc flexibility in a full time position, to a more formal Flexible Work Arrangement.

We are looking for an ICT Trainer. Deadline: 06.04.2020


DUTIES:

  • Organizing and delivering of adequate all level and all type of ICT trainings by various means and methods (including direct classes, hands-on workshops, on-the-job trainings, video tutorials);
  • Acting as architect of the training programme who understands the business needs;
  • Analyzing training needs, identifying existing gaps in skills and competencies, addressing them by sourcing of adequate training;
  • Populating, managing, up keeping and enlarging of the database of training materials;
  • Ensuring that feedback and lessons learned from delivered training are taken on board, in order to continuously improve the products;
  • Actively participating in the development, roll out and change of applications in order to improve the experience to end users;
  • Supporting business processes and contribution by delivering related training to maximize effectiveness;
  • Participation in procurements of ICT training services and courses, guiding contractors in scope of trainings and training materials for ICT solutions;
  • Providing technical writer services to projects and software developments;
  • Develop training strategy and deliverables for future systems not yet developed;
  • Performing other duties on request of Head of Unit.


THE INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY UNIT

The Information and Communication Technology Unit (ICT) operates as a centre of expertise and support for the development of existing and new ICT systems and ICT components of Frontex entities including Task Forces. It ensures that corporate ICT systems are designed, developed and maintained with efficiency and consistency according to Frontex strategic priorities. The Unit plays a crucial role in designing IT systems and services ensuring their implementation and compliance with Frontex ICT strategy going beyond the day-today needs of the Agency. The scope of the Unit responsibilities is intertwined with operational priorities adopted under Integrated Border Management strategy. While ICT projects are developed internally by business entities where ICT business partners are deployed, the Unit centralises the management and development of all ICT capacities of the Agency to ensure the alignment of projects to strategic policies, guidelines and principles as highlighted by the ICT strategy.

The Unit is responsible for the development, maintenance and support of the Agency’s ICT infrastructure, as well as the IT services and products. The ICT Unit provides and organises the first, second and third lines of support to all Frontex ICT systems, monitors them and seeks to improve the quality, reliability and efficiency of the service delivered. Furthermore, it manages ICT-related contracts for the purpose of maximising financial and operational performance and minimising risk. Finally, it ensures a high availability of the ICT services and applications in line with the business needs. It is responsible for maintaining a high level of security throughout all the Agency’s ICT systems, for monitoring them and constantly improving security solutions as new threats appear.

Profile:

The Transfer Pricing Analyst drives improvements and initiatives in the area of operational transfer pricing.

This position focuses on developing, implementing and ensuring adherence to internal processes in two main areas:

  • transfer pricing documentation,
  • monitoring of the correct implementation of transfer pricing policies.  


Responsibilities:
  • Preparing local transfer pricing documentation and act as central liaison with local AkzoNobel offices and Regional Accounting Centers to streamline the collection of transfer pricing data.
  • Contributing to the further development and implementation of automated tooling.
  • Supporting internal process for annual central and local transfer pricing documentation for the group.
  • Setting up a consistent transfer pricing framework on a global basis to enable efficient prioritization and scoping of local transfer pricing documentation.
  • Supporting business with financial analysis (segmentation) of inter-company transactions to substantiate transfer pricing policies applied.
  • Supporting company entities with transfer pricing tax audits.


Job Requirements:

  • 2 years of relevant experience in transfer pricing as a tax consultant or as an in-house financial specialist familiar with operational transfer pricing.
  • Bachelor degree in Tax, Finance or Accounting area.
  • Fluent English level.


Perks & Benefits:

  • Fresh Fruits.
  • Team Building Events.
  • Learning Cafeteria (incl. Percipio).
  • Recognition.
  • CSR Initiatives.
  • Gift Cards
  • Luxmed.
  • MultiSport.
  • Additional Insurance.

position: International Benefits and Pension Program Manager
whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

International Benefits and Pension Program Manager
Amazon strives to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover virtually anything they want to buy online. By giving customers more of what they want - low prices, vast selection, and convenience - Amazon continues to grow and evolve as a world-class e-commerce platform. Amazon's evolution from Web site to e-commerce partner to development platform is driven by the spirit of innovation that is part of the company's DNA. The world's brightest technology minds come to Amazon to research and develop technology that improves the lives of shoppers and sellers around the world.

Amazon is seeking an experienced Benefits and Pension Support Specialist to join our Global Benefits Support Specialist Team within the Human Resources organization. This role will partner extensively with internal stakeholders and external partners to develop and execute against a multi-year roadmap for benefit administration support across Amazon’s EMEA region. As an individual contributor, strong project management skills are critical to this role, as well as proven abilities to help design and implement tools/processes and/or data collection mechanisms and generate reporting. The ideal candidate will be able to work independently, will be innovative, an effective communicator, have a desire to participate in change, and appreciate a dynamic environment with rapidly changing priorities. We are seeking someone with a demonstrated history of successfully owning and managing large, complex problems and engaging with cross-functional teams, and numerous stakeholders, directly and through influence.

Core Responsibilities
Project Management: Responsible for transition of existing and launch of new benefits and pension administration processes/programs across EMEA. Standardizing processes across EMEA based on local plans, regulations and requirements; aligning recommended processes with IT solutions (for example, Benefits tool); and facilitating approval from stakeholders. Responsible for supporting cyclical benefits and pension events and activities, such as enrolments, renewals, reporting and reconciliation.

Continuous Improvement: Own overall service quality at process level. Define and monitor benefit and pension administration critical to quality (CTQs) metrics, perform root cause analysis on defects and implement remediation; own continuous improvement strategy.

Customer Service: Manage employee escalations, exceptions and appeals and provide advice and monitor resolution on full range of benefit and pension related topics.

Vendor and Audit Management: Manage outside vendors performing benefit administration services for Amazon. Certify periodic audits. Work closely with a local HR team, payroll, HR Shared Services, providers and vendors ensuring that the benefits administration is delivered consistently, and in line with contract/legal requirements.

Flexible Location: Czech Republic, Poland, Slovakia, Romania


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, HR or related field
  • 6+ years of relevant project and program management experience
  • Fluent in English
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve program success through influence and partnership from design to delivering of initiatives
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills with ability to interface with all levels of the organization and demonstrated ability to influence decision makers
  • Deep understanding and experience in delivering high levels of customer service
  • Highly organized, able to prioritize and work under pressure on a number of projects/initiatives at the same time in a rapidly growing environment
  • Strong data analysis skills; the ability to extract and synthesize data in order to make data-backed business decisions
  • Ability to develop ad-hoc reporting to meet specific business needs and inquiries
  • Successful record of building operational processes and procedures, continuously improving programs and efficiencies
Periodic Global business travel may be required.

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience managing large-scale employee benefit or pension administration programs, associated vendor management, and program development and delivery
  • Exceptional analytical skills, including proven abilities in process development and data management, financial accounting, reporting, auditing and reconciliations, and strengths in reporting and communicating data and trends to business leaders

Company - AMZN Dev Cntr Poland sp. z.o.o

HR Specialist will be in charge of the administration part of systems to support the employee life cycle from hire to retire.

As English-speaking Specialist, you will provide administrative support for the Netherlands, covering employee life cycle changes from new hires and transfers to promotions and terminations.

From a team member, we expect to deliver an excellent customer experience as well as identify opportunities to improve Akzo Nobel HR support service.


Responsibilities
  • Executing the administrative activities related to employee life cycle changes (i.e. administering new hires, transfers, promotions, terminations, organizational changes and data management).
  • Creating employment contracts, letters and memos according to business requests.
  • Updating the employee records and keeping all relevant systems and (third) parties up to date.
  • Providing expertise in global and local policies and procedures.
  • Providing expert support to the Contact Center to resolve cases/queries within agreed SLAs.
  • Referring to complex cases or exceptions to Centers of Expertise and communicate effectively with the Contact Center or requestor as appropriate.
  • Spotting opportunities for improvement of processes and systems via input to the team lead.


Job requirements

  • Minimum 2 years of relevant working experience (preferably in SSC or BPO structure).
  • Bachelors/Master’s degree (preferably in HR).
  • Adequate expertise knowledge in HR related issues and the ability to interpret and apply the HR policies and procedures.
  • Fluent level of English language, both written and verbally is required (using daily).
  • Ability to communicate effectively with internal clients.
  • Excellent organizational skills, able to plan, set priorities and work under time pressure to meet deadlines.
  • Capability of working in a fast-paced, dynamic and multicultural environment.

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. • Job type* – head of research group
  • Discipline* – biochemistry, molecular biology, pharmacology, genetics
  • Hours* – full time
  • Duration* – max. period of contract: 31 Dec 2023
    • About Us
    • Foundation of Polish Science* – the largest non-governmental organisation supporting science in Poland, under its project: International Research Agendas (IRAP), funded with European Regional Development Fund, seeks candidates for a position of Group Leaders at International Centre for Translational Eye Research ICTER) – led in Warsaw by prof. Maciej Wojtkowski and prof. Kris Palczewski.
    The *International Center for Translational Eye Research* (ICTER) – a multi-investigator center for eye research as related to imaging and biochemical techniques to support advances in understanding the etiology and treatment and human blinding diseases. Further information on the research priorities and current expertise of our Center can be found at . The positions are generously supported for 3 years, including PI’s staff (post docs, PhD students and a lab coordinator).

    Job Summary

    The applicants are expected to establish an independent research program related to the eye and with an emphasis in the fields of *biochemistry, molecular biology, pharmacology and genetics*. The center aims to create a synergistic approach between these disciplines and will take on important questions in vision research. The program will leverage outstanding existing resources at the Polish Academy of Sciences and University College London. International Scientific Committee of the Centre includes top leaders in European vision research. Successful Candidates will be expected to supervise his/her research group and to mentor graduate students, post-doctoral fellows and technical and administrative staff.

    Key Responsibilities Include
    • Establishing new research group,
    • Setting research programme,
    • Managing and carrying out research,
    • Assigning tasks to team members and creating a research schedule,
    • Applying for additional funding.
    We Offer
    • Full-time employment contract,
    • Opportunity to work in an innovative scientific environment,
    • International cooperation with experienced researchers,
    • Competitive salary (salary and rank will be commensurate with experience),
    • Administrative support, including assistance in recruiting technicians, PhD and post-doc, scientists for your group,
    • Access to well-staffed core facilities,
    • Start-up package and funds allocated to running your group, including equipment purchases and other related expenditures.
    Required Qualifications

    # Ph.D. degree,
    # Documented work experience in eye research,
    # Strong publication record,
    # Proven experience in leveraging best practices from research community,
    # Working knowledge of biochemistry of eye / or molecular biology / or pharmacology,
    # Ability to work in a team and manage projects and people,
    # Proficiency in English, both spoken and written,
    # Demonstrated leadership.

    Application Details

    Please submit the following required documents:

    # CV,
    # Cover letter,
    # Short research proposal (up to 5 pages),
    # Copy of PhD Diploma or equivalent,
    # Name and contact information for 3-5 referees

    to click apply . *Kindly specify in the application topic: Recruitment no. MCBO 3/2020.*

    Application deadline: *15 June 2020*

    Successful candidates fulfilling the main eligibility criteria and qualifications will be invited for an interview (which will most likely take place in *September 2020*). The competition results shall be announced by the end of 2020.

    The International Centre for Translational Eye Research (Institute of Physical Chemistry PAS) is committed to employment equality (esp. European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers) and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates fulfilling the requirements specified in this announcement.

    The controller of your personal data is the International Centre for Translational Eye Research with its registered office in Warsaw, NIP: 1080023333 (the "ICTER"). ICTER will process your data for the purpose of carrying out scientific and research activities, providing services and contact with ICTER, on the basis of a contract (in connection with the performance of the contract or in order to take action on your request before the contract is concluded – Article 6, paragraph 1, letter b) of GDPR), the legitimate interest of ICTER (Article 6, paragraph 1, letter f) of the GDPR) and legal provisions (Article 6, paragraph 1, letter c) of the GDPR) - depending on the circumstances.

    You have the right to: request access to your data, receive a copy of it; rectify (correct) it; delete it; limit its processing; transfer it; lodge a complaint to the supervisory body; withdraw your consent for processing at any time (withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of the processing carried out prior to its withdrawal) or to lodge an objection to data processing. More information is available on the Institute's website.

    This project has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under grant agreement No 857533 and from the International Research Agendas Programme of the Foundation for Polish Science co-financed by the European Union under the European Regional Development Fund.

What you will be doing:

  • Create detailed test cases in close collaboration with subject matter experts
  • Conduct software tests
  • Support the testing manager in identifying risks and developing strategies for risk minimization
  • Independently manage day-to-day testing activities and report to the testing manager
  • Identify, analyze, determine, and track defects
  • Maintain test cases in a test case database
  • Support the preparation and review of project findings
  • Support the creation of business requirements, functional specifications as well as user documentation

 

What you bring:

  • Good command of English, German is a plus
  • Qualification in Information Technology, as a banking specialist or other relevant background
  • 3 - 5 years of professional experience in test projects, ideally in the banking sector
  • Knowledge of testing methods, testing procedures, and testing tools
  • Preferably ISTQB Certified Tester – Foundation Level Certification
  • Solution-driven and quality-oriented work ethic with focus on innovation, creativity and results
  • Team player with excellent communication skills within the organization as well as with customers
  • High level of organizational and analytical skills as well as entrepreneurial thinking


What we offer:

  • Full package of additional benefits like multisport, private healthcare, holiday allowance, pension plan, lunch pass, chillout room, shower facilities etc.
  • A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
  • A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team
  • The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services

whole_unnormalized_body:
Citi Poland

Markets & Securities Services Department is a global unit responsible for all securities account and fund accounting services. Join one of our teams to have a unique opportunity to progress your career with one of the largest financial services institutions in the world.

We are currently hiring for various positions: Asset Servicing Analyst, Trade Processing Analyst, Fund Accounting Analyst and Risk Operations Analyst.

We are looking for individuals who are genuinely interested in Finance and willing to develop further in this area. The successful candidates will demonstrate relevant experience and ability to resolve problems by identifying and selecting solutions. They will have good grasp the concept of capital markets.

Would you like to contribute to our mission of enabling Growth and Progress? Then, your place is here!

Operations

The main scope of responsibilities include:
  • Routine operational tasks focused on administering defined procedures, analyses and report preparation, and resolving problems that require investigation or research
  • Booking / verification of transactions made for investment funds accounts
  • Performing multiple transactions of moderate complexity
  • Reconciling and processing positions related to Corporate Action events
  • Contact with market participants to ensure all relevant information are reflected in Citi systems
  • The timely resolution of all stock exceptions following reconciliation


Fund Accounting
  • Calculation and verification of the Net Asset Value (NAV) of Citi Clients’ funds in line with the fund prospectus
  • Ensuring all financial instruments are processed correctly
  • Reviewing stock and cash reconciliations to ensure the exceptions noted have no NAV impact and items cleared are treated
  • Analyzing cause and suggest enhancements for recurring exceptions through review of reconciliations and analysis of NAVs
  • Monitoring and review of the activity taking place within the fund including the verification of security trading, security valuations, corporate action events, income and expense accruals, derivative positions, and reconciliation of accounting records to the custodian

What would You get in return?
  • Full time job contract
  • International working environment at the office
  • Sponsorship of globally recognized certificates in financial industry (Institute of Banking, Chartered Institute for Securities & Investment)
  • A chance to develop your own career across a number of diverse, growing functions (both locally and abroad)
  • Working as part of a team of professionals with vast knowledge of the financial environment
  • Possibility to work on either day or afternoon shifts,
  • Availability of remote work
  • Access to unlimited number of training
  • A number of other financial and non-financial benefits (Medicover, MultiSport, private pension plan, life insurance etc.)

What do you need to become our Financial Operations Analyst?

Qualifications
  • Around 1-2 years of experience in accounting, finance, or business-related area
  • Knowledge of multiple types of investment instruments and/or knowledge of accounting
  • ACCA certificate - nice to have
  • Advanced level of English (min. B2)
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, Access- is desired)
  • Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
  • The ability to learn quickly and willingness to acquire new skills


Education
  • Bachelor’s/University degree would be a great advantage
  • Studying for ACCA, ACA or CIMA will be an asset

For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.

Citi Poland

Markets & Securities Services Department is a global unit responsible for all securities account and fund accounting services. Join one of our teams to have a unique opportunity to progress your career with one of the largest financial services institutions in the world.

We are currently hiring for various positions: Asset Servicing Analyst, Trade Processing Analyst, Fund Accounting Analyst and Risk Operations Analyst.

We are looking for individuals who are genuinely interested in Finance and willing to develop further in this area. The successful candidates will demonstrate relevant experience and ability to resolve problems by identifying and selecting solutions. They will have good grasp the concept of capital markets.

Would you like to contribute to our mission of enabling Growth and Progress? Then, your place is here!

  • Routine operational tasks focused on administering defined procedures, analyses and report preparation, and resolving problems that require investigation or research

  • Performing multiple transactions of moderate complexity
  • Reconciling and processing positions related to Corporate Action events
  • Contact with market participants to ensure all relevant information are reflected in Citi systems

  • International working environment at the office
  • Sponsorship of globally recognized certificates in financial industry (Institute of Banking, Chartered Institute for Securities & Investment)
  • A chance to develop your own career across a number of diverse, growing functions (both locally and abroad)

  • ACCA certificate - nice to have
  • Advanced level of English (min. B2)
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, Access- is desired)
  • Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
  • The ability to learn quickly and willingness to acquire new skills


Education
  • Bachelor’s/University degree would be a great advantage
  • Studying for ACCA, ACA or CIMA will be an asset

For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.

NEW PRODUCT DELIVERY SENIOR PLANNER

We’re Coty, a global leader in beauty. We’re World #1 in Fragrance, World #2 in Professional Hair Care and World #3 in Color Cosmetics. Our iconic portfolio of more than 77 brands are sold in over 150 countries around the world. We believe in beauty with a purpose and brands that inspire, no matter where they are in the world.

THE ROLE

We are currently looking for a New Product Delivery Senior Planner to join our Warsaw Planning Hub in a city center. You will be part of multifunctional, young and dynamic team of Project Managers and Coordinators passionate and energized to deliver new products for our customers and consumers. You will be driving the multifunctional Planning Hub team in evaluation and execution of various initiatives end-to-end having Global teams and markets as main stakeholders.

What You'll Be Doing
  • Assessing Feasibility, project risks, building projects execution plans and coordinating their execution within Warsaw Planning hub
  • Driving the resolution of supply chain constraints to guarantee delivery of new products on time and in full and within expected cost
  • Representing the Planning Hub to the Global and Regional multi-functional Project team
  • Owning regular Supply Planning interface with other functions and leadership team, driving discipline in the defined supply network(s) of the Project
  • Optimizing internal and external business processes and tools, growing capability of Planning Hub multi-functional teams in Project planning & delivery.

What You'll Bring
  • Min 2 years of experience in the areas of Supply Chain Planning, New Products Development & Implementation and/or Project Management
  • Understanding of inter-dependencies within Manufacturing, Planning, Quality Assurance, R&D and Commercial planning
  • Leadership and influencing skills, experience in participating or leading cross functional teams
  • Experience in Demand or Supply planning discipline will be an asset
  • Strong English verbal/written communication skills
  • Ability to integrate information from a variety of sources, strong Excel skills
  • Knowledge of MS Project, SAP and JDA will be an advantage

What We Offer

This is a unique opportunity to get the knowledge of supply chain end-to-end, work within a truly multifunctional team on challenging projects and initiatives. Within this role you will be able to make a valuable impact for our customers and consumers by working on delivery of new products and technologies. It is a great position to shape your project management and supply chain skills.

Benefits
  • sport card, private medical care, private health insurance, lunch card, travelcard reimbursement, massages in the office, discounts on Coty products, extra day of holiday for birthday, CIGNA support and more!

Dla naszego Klienta, firmy z branży nowoczesnych technologii i gospodarki odpadami, poszukujemy Kandydatów na stanowisko: Manager ds. Technicznych. 

Osoba zatrudniona na tym stanowisku będzie zarządzała technicznymi aspektami innowacyjnego projektu związanego z segregacją odpadów. W zakresie jej obowiązków będzie: implementowanie tego inteligentnego rozwiązania na terenie całego kraju; zarządzanie kilkunastoosobowym zespołem elektroników i programistów; kontakt z zagranicznymi dostawcami i poszukiwanie nowych źródeł zakupu potrzebnych komponentów; wsparcie techniczne procesu produkcyjnego (produkcja seryjna) oraz zarządzanie budżetem projektu.


Od Kandydatów oczekujemy doświadczenia w zarządzaniu zespołem oraz wiedzy z obszaru elektroniki, mile widziana będzie podstawowa wiedza z zakresu metrologii i mechaniki. Poszukujemy Kandydatów ze znajomością specyfiki produkcji seryjnej. Dodatkowym atutem będzie wcześniejsze doświadczenie w branży elektronicznej lub telekomunikacyjnej. Szukamy Kandydatów o rozwiniętej świadomości biznesowej i zorientowanych na cel oraz cechujących się innowacyjnością i kreatywnością. Wymogiem koniecznym są wysoko rozwinięte umiejętności analityczne i komunikatywne, a także otwartość na podróże służbowe i elastyczność.

Nasz Klient oferuje zatrudnienie w oparciu o umowę o pracę lub kontrakt B2B, kartę multisport, opiekę medyczną, samochód służbowy, możliwość udziału w wyjątkowym projekcie i kreowania innowacyjnego rozwiązania dotyczącego segregacji odpadów.

Wkrótce zostanie rozpoczęta rekrutacja.
Złóż CV już dziś!!!!
Agencja Pracy Tymczasowej GRH Polska (16998)
Oferta Pracy Tymczasowej
Miejsce pracy: Francja

Z Nami Zyskujesz
  • Umowa o pracę tymczasową z delegowaniem do Francji,
  • Stałe godziny pracy + możliwość nadgodzin,
  • Wynagrodzenie na konto do 10-go dnia miesiąca,
  • Brak planów zjazdowych – urlop wedle potrzeby,
  • Darmowe zakwaterowanie na terenie Francji: bardzo blisko miejsca pracy,
  • Składki ZUS opłacane od średniej krajowej,
  • Zwrot kosztów za badania lekarskie.
Jedyne Czego Oczekujemy
  • Doświadczenie (mile widziane na terenie Francji),
  • Chęci do pracy,
  • Znajomość języka francuskiego będzie dodatkowym atutem.
Wyślij nam swoje cv lub zadzwoń po szczegóły
Gabriela : +48 518 673 665

Jeśli Posiadasz
  • tytuł lekarza specjalisty bądź jesteś lekarzem w trakcie specjalizacji – po 2. roku specjalizacji
  • prawo wykonywania zawodu
  • umiejętność obsługi komputera


Oferujemy
  • zatrudnienie w oparciu o UZ bądź KG – sam wybierasz
  • elastyczne godziny pracy
  • wsparcie edukacyjne - dofinansowanie do udziału w konferencjach medycznych, dostęp do platformy informacji medycznej ze wszystkich specjalizacji

Job Description

Job Description Senior Tester - Agile/SAFe ☎️Remote Interviews

Z ponad 77 000 specjalistami, CGI Group inc. jest piątą co do wielkości niezależną firmą zajmującą się wdrożeniami projektów informatycznych, obsługującą ponad 4500 klientów na całym świecie, ze swoich globalnych biur i centrów usług w obu Amerykach, Europie oraz w regionie Azji i Pacyfiku.

Do zespołu działającego w branży telco poszukujemy doświadczonego Testera z doświadczeniem w metodykach zwinnych. Będziesz współtworzyć zasady nowego procesu wytwórczego opartego w oparciu o Agile/SAFe. Gwarantujemy prace z najnowszymi technologiami w dobrej i przyjemnej atmosferze.

Główne Zadania

  • Koordynacja testów
  • Definiowanie zakresu i zadań testerskich w procesie AGILE,
  • Określanie wymagań testerskich w organizacji,
  • Ułożenie pracy testerów wewnątrz obszaru testów,

    • Główne Oczekiwania

  • Kilkuletnie doświadczenie (5+) w testowaniu w metodyce AGILE, ze wskazaniem na rozwiązanie SAFe.
  • Bardzo dobra umiejętność zarządzania zadaniami w metodyce AGILE.
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość narzędzi wspierających pracę w projekcie: MS Office (w tym Excel), MS Project, JIRA, ALM
  • Bardzo dobre umiejętności analityczne
  • Zdolności interpersonalne (komunikatywność) oraz umiejętności pracy w zespole
  • Bardzo dobra organizacja pracy, samodzielność, odpowiedzialność, dokładność.
  • Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie komunikatywnym (w mowie i piśmie).
  • Doświadczenie w projektach w organizacjach o złożonej strukturze, preferowane doświadczenie w branży telco.

    • Naszym Konsultantom Oferujemy

  • Umowa o pracę
  • Opieka zdrowotna / Medicover Maxima
  • Plan zakupu akcji (SPP) dofinansowany przez CGI
  • Multisport Plus i program Oxygen
  • Profit Participation Plan – dzielimy się zyskami
  • Premiowany program poleceń, standardowo 6k PLN
  • Praca Twórcza
  • Brown Bagi, hackathony i dzielenie się wiedzą
  • Prezenty okolicznościowe i świętowanie rocznic
  • Program wsparcia pracowników i dodatkowe ubezpieczenie w podróży

    • Your future duties and responsibilities

    Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

    Zbuduj z nami swoja karierę!

    Prowadzenie biznesu nigdy nie było bardziej pasjonujące niż w dzisiejszych czasach. Żyjemy w erze transformacji cyfrowej. Digitalizacja przyśpiesza i zmienia nasz świat z dnia na dzień. CGI jest w samym centrum tych zmian, towarzyszy i wspiera Klientów a pracownikom oferuje najbardziej rozwijające projekty i oferuje wyjątkowe możliwości rozwoju.

    Nasz sukces w CGI wynika z autentycznego zaangażowania naszych ekspertów i całej kadry. Jesteśmy zespołem. Stawiamy na dzielenie się: wyzwaniami i sukcesami, które są nieodłączną częścią naszej firmy. Wspólnie dzielimy się zyskiem, ściśle związanym z pewnym wzrostem CGI. Wszyscy zyskujemy dzięki wartości, którą wspólnie stworzyliśmy.

    Zapraszamy Cię do współtworzenia CGI – firmy będącej w czołówce największych, niezależnych firm świadczących usługi technologiczne i doradcze na świecie.

    Więcej o CGI na www.cgi.com. Zapraszamy do zapoznania się z nami!

    Rekomendacje kandydatów ze strony firm rekrutacyjnych uprzednio nie zaproszonych do współpracy z CGI nie będą rozpatrywane.

    CGI jest pracodawcą oferującym równe szanse.

    Senior Tester - Agile/SAFe ☎️Remote Interviews

    Position Description
    Z ponad 77 000 specjalistami, CGI Group inc. jest piątą co do wielkości niezależną firmą zajmującą się wdrożeniami projektów informatycznych, obsługującą ponad 4500 klientów na całym świecie, ze swoich globalnych biur i centrów usług w obu Amerykach, Europie oraz w regionie Azji i Pacyfiku.

    Do zespołu działającego w branży telco poszukujemy doświadczonego Testera z doświadczeniem w metodykach zwinnych. Będziesz współtworzyć zasady nowego procesu wytwórczego opartego w oparciu o Agile/SAFe. Gwarantujemy prace z najnowszymi technologiami w dobrej i przyjemnej atmosferze.

    Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

    Build your career with us.

    It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

    At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

    Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

    Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

    No unsolicited agency referrals please.

    CGI is an equal opportunity employer.

    Skills
    • Agile Testing
    • Test Management

  • Premiowany program poleceń, standardowo 6k PLN
  • Praca Twórcza
  • Brown Bagi, hackathony i dzielenie się wiedzą
  • Prezenty okolicznościowe i świętowanie rocznic
  • Program wsparcia pracowników i dodatkowe ubezpieczenie w podróży

    • Your future duties and responsibilities

    Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

    Zbuduj z nami swoja karierę!

    Prowadzenie biznesu nigdy nie było bardziej pasjonujące niż w dzisiejszych czasach. Żyjemy w erze transformacji cyfrowej. Digitalizacja przyśpiesza i zmienia nasz świat z dnia na dzień. CGI jest w samym centrum tych zmian, towarzyszy i wspiera Klientów a pracownikom oferuje najbardziej rozwijające projekty i oferuje wyjątkowe możliwości rozwoju.

    Nasz sukces w CGI wynika z autentycznego zaangażowania naszych ekspertów i całej kadry. Jesteśmy zespołem. Stawiamy na dzielenie się: wyzwaniami i sukcesami, które są nieodłączną częścią naszej firmy. Wspólnie dzielimy się zyskiem, ściśle związanym z pewnym wzrostem CGI. Wszyscy zyskujemy dzięki wartości, którą wspólnie stworzyliśmy.

    Zapraszamy Cię do współtworzenia CGI – firmy będącej w czołówce największych, niezależnych firm świadczących usługi technologiczne i doradcze na świecie.

    Więcej o CGI na www.cgi.com. Zapraszamy do zapoznania się z nami!

    Rekomendacje kandydatów ze strony firm rekrutacyjnych uprzednio nie zaproszonych do współpracy z CGI nie będą rozpatrywane.

    CGI jest pracodawcą oferującym równe szanse.

    Senior Tester - Agile/SAFe ☎️Remote Interviews

    Position Description
    Z ponad 77 000 specjalistami, CGI Group inc. jest piątą co do wielkości niezależną firmą zajmującą się wdrożeniami projektów informatycznych, obsługującą ponad 4500 klientów na całym świecie, ze swoich globalnych biur i centrów usług w obu Amerykach, Europie oraz w regionie Azji i Pacyfiku.

    Do zespołu działającego w branży telco poszukujemy doświadczonego Testera z doświadczeniem w metodykach zwinnych. Będziesz współtworzyć zasady nowego procesu wytwórczego opartego w oparciu o Agile/SAFe. Gwarantujemy prace z najnowszymi technologiami w dobrej i przyjemnej atmosferze.

    Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

    Build your career with us.

    It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

    At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

    Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

    Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

    No unsolicited agency referrals please.

    CGI is an equal opportunity employer.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

Job Description

Application Specialist is responsible for maintaining and supervising high transaction volume Java Enterprise Edition applications designed and developed by Syncron. The everyday routine includes handling customer cases reported and managed through the case management tool and providing pro-active supervision for the Syncron applications. The nature of the customer cases can be very broad, from a simple application functionality question to a complex technical or business inquiry requiring thorough understanding of both the application logic and the customer business in order to resolve it.

Application Specialist reports to a local team leader and is a part of the global support responsibility.

Responsibilities
  • Timely resolution of customer cases.
  • Ensuring proper communication with the customers through the Syncron case management tool and other communication channels.
  • Cooperation with the programmers (R&D) to suggest improvements, report bugs and channel feedback from the customers.
  • Executing technical supervision to ensure proper functioning of Syncron applications in the customer production installations.
  • Being involved in customization development or business consulting (depending on your background).

Requirements
  • Excellent English skills.
  • Effective customer skills, including oral and written communication.
  • Experience in IT. Good SQL and relational database skills (preferably Oracle and/or PostgreSQL).
  • Practical experience with Linux operating system, log files analysis and information retrieval
  • Being located in Warsaw or nearby (we cannot offer remote work but we can offer relocation package).

Nice To Have
  • Practical knowledge of XML and related technologies (XPath, XSLT, etc.)
  • Experience with tools such as Docker, Jenkins and history of working with AWS hosted applications
  • Knowledge of Java Enteprise Edition solutions or other objective programming language
  • Efficient reading of Java source code and experience with bug-fixing.
  • Practical experience in Eclipse or a similar development platform
  • Experience with version control systems (CVS, git), data transfer protocols (FTP/sFTP), WebSphere MQ will be a plus.

As data controller of your personal data, we are required to provide you with several information to foster your data privacy rights. Please read them here.
