  • Pracę w wygodnym i komfortowym biurze
  • Możliwość rozwoju w międzynarodowych strukturach firmy

ABOUT THE ROLE


Technical Architects, as a part of the international Technical Architecture Team at ERGO Global IT Architecture unit, design and assess ERGO standards and reference architecture in the context of running ERGO projects by supporting development teams in solutions analysis, implementation and documentation.

As Technical Architect you will be involved from the earliest stage to scope ideas and propose tech solutions, assist in the project planning, design the solutions and supervise the implementations until go-live and hand-over to operations. You will take over the leadership in your area of specialization e.g. for architecture designs, implementations and migrations. You will be consulting members of the Architecture Team as well as developers, designers and engineers on architecture/technology-relevant topics. Part of the role is also to guarantee that security, compliance and legal boundaries provided by ERGO and related to the insurance sector are respected.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Defining the target architecture in your area of specialization
  • Assessing “as-is” architectures, analyzing gaps, auditing compliance within the Technical Architecture standards/ERGO reference architecture and deriving roadmaps towards the target
  • Participating in the definition of ERGO standards and reference architectures in related areas – including the design and delivery of practical proof-of-concepts and solution templates
  • Performing reviews and coordinating architecture activities on ongoing projects in your area of specialization including introduction/evaluation of specific technologies
  • Supporting in design, implementation and further development of best of breed solutions in your area of specialization
  • Assisting with requirements analyses, high- and low-level design documentation if needed
  • Supporting ERGO holistically by developing strategies for evolution exiting solutions to the new modern ones/introducing new services in your area of specialization
  • Defining and providing training/knowledge transfer for members of the Architecture Team, project teams and developers regarding technical architecture, solutions, technology and patterns


REQUIREMENTS


  • 5+ years of working experience in Technology and IT, ideally with a specialization in Technical Architecture and integration topics in software and/or infrastructure development
  • You have a massive working experience in one of the areas of specialization we are looking for
  • You have strong analytical and design skills
  • You are good at modelling, graphical representations and abstractions using architecture modelling techniques and languages like TOGAF, ArchiMate, BPMN, UML or others
  • You are familiar with agile approaches of digital product development including cloud/on-premise/hybrid models
  • You have experience in deployment and runtime technologies like containerization run by OpenShift/Kubernetes
  • You have experience in providing (technical) architecture artefacts in IT projects
  • You have knowledge of modern architecture approaches, microservices, cloud-based architectures and distributed systems
  • You have strong planning and coordination skills
  • You have strong presentation and communication skills in English (German is welcome)
  • You are good at selling your ideas and results of architectural approaches
  • You have a real passion for development and a demonstrated appetite for continual learning
  • Community contributions (publishing/speaking on business and technical ideas) are a plus


AREAS OF SPECIALIZATION


  • Application Integration including design, implementation and review of ERGO Integration Reference Architecture and integration solutions in projects on the application level
  • Infrastructure Integration including design, implementation and review of ERGO Integration Reference Architecture and integration solutions in projects on the infrastructure level
  • Data Center & Cloud including design and implementation of data centers in the cloud/on-premise/hybrid scenarios as well as Infrastructure-, Platform- and Software-as-a-Service- migrations in a global environment
  • Network including design, implementation and review of ERGO Global Network Architecture as well as network solutions in the cloud/on-premise/hybrid scenarios in a global environment
  • Communication & Collaboration including design, implementation and review of ERGO Communication and Collaboration Target Architecture as well as communication and collaboration solutions in a global environment

WHY IS IT WORTH WORKING WITH US?


  • Being a part of the international Architecture Team

  • English language conversations on a daily basis

  • Participation in various interesting projects, often with a global reach

  • High level of job autonomy and continuous development

  • Easy access to necessary training

  • Knowledge sharing culture and close cooperation with experts

  • Modern office space in the centre of Warsaw

  • Multiple employee benefits (private medical care, MultiSport card, life insurance, common breakfasts on Tuesdays, financial bonus - 13th-month salary)

Job Description

The role purpose is to: Support Service Delivery in all Mobility technical topics,provide guidance in supporting the O365 and AirWatch Mobile Device Management (MDM) integration, Ensures Mobility services are restored as quickly as possible when impacted and adverse impacts on operations due to incidents in IT environment are minimize,Operates IT services, systems and applications as directed, Monitors all events that occur in the enterprise IT environment to allow normal operations and to detect and escalate exception conditions. ensure that Configuration Items (any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver an IT Service) are identified, accounted, reported, verified and audited.

Responsibilities

Provide system administration of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and Mobile Device management (MDM) solutions
Support, maintain and troubleshoot Air watch systems for the enterprise
Support the design and implementation of simple MDM solutions
Deliver IT services, systems and applications to the business integrated for use with Mobility solutions
Define an end-to-end Mobility provisioning process facilitating automation wherever possible
Ensure adherence to quality standards as defined by the IT Organization
Ensure appropriate response to audit / ISRM assessment findings and recommendations
Perform patch management and image management activities for Enterprise
Ensure standard build/image
Ensure accurate provisioning and metering of services
Provide early feedback to development team on release issues
Ensure that an up-to-date asset inventory for all Mobility technology assets is maintained and only authorized components are used
Accountable to ensure adherence with Security and Compliance policies and procedures within Technical Operations service scope
Coordinate all Mobility configuration management database changes which directly or indirectly impact production services
Ensure addition, modification or removal of any IT asset in a standard and controlled manner
Ensure that Mobility Configuration Interfaces (Cis) are identified, accounted, reported, verified and audited

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor degree in relevant area
English Fluency
Customer satisfaction approach
Adherence to service SLAs
Accuracy of asset inventory

Obecnie do naszego biura w Warszawie poszukujemy osoby na stanowisko
Customer Activation Manager

O pracy
Na tym stanowisku będziesz odpowiedzialny za
  • Tworzenie i realizację kalendarzy aktywacyjnych dla wybranej grupy klientów zorganizowanych we współpracy z KAM,
  • Współpracę z zespołem marketingu w zakresie kreowania i wdrażania aktywacji instore spójnych ze strategią i komunikacją marki,
  • Analizę i ocenę skuteczności prowadzonych akcji,
  • Regularne wizyty u klientów, w ramach których będziesz przygotowywać i prezentować wspólnie z KAM wizję kategorii, rozwoju marki, selling story dla nowości, relaunchy etc.
  • Reprezentowanie działu Sprzedaży i Aktywacji w grupach projektowych,
  • Uczestnictwo w pracach zespołów cross-funkcjonalnych, współpracę z agencjami zewnętrznymi,
  • Zarządzanie budżetem.

    • O Tobie
    Jeżeli chcesz odnieść sukces w tej roli, niezbędne są takie kompetencje, jak
  • Min. 2 letnie doświadczenie w podobnej roli w branży FMCG (Trade Marketing, Sales, Business Development),
  • Umiejętności prezentowania i wystąpień publicznych,
  • Innowacyjność i pomysłowość,
  • Proaktywność w działaniu, zorientowanie na szukanie rozwiązań i skuteczne działanie, a także wielozadaniowość i umiejętność pracy pod presją czasu,
  • Łatwość odnajdywania się w pracy w dynamicznym, zróżnicowanym środowisku,
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego (praca w środowisku międzynarodowym, codzienna komunikacja),
  • Mile widziane doświadczenie w uczestniczeniu w projektach cross-funkcjonalnych.

    • O nas
    Jeśli marzysz o pracy w dynamicznej, międzynarodowej i różnorodnej organizacji, którą wyróżniają
  • ważna misja ,,poprzez żywność niesiemy zdrowie tak wielu ludziom, jako to możliwe”, którą realizujemy w praktyce
  • znane oraz lubiane marki z kategorii produktów istotnych dla prawidłowego żywienia produkty mleczne oraz pochodzenia roślinnego (Danone), woda i napoje (Żywiec Zdrój) żywność dla niemowląt i małych dzieci oraz żywienie medyczne (Nutricia),
  • a przede wszystkim ludzie z pasją, którzy realizują ciekawe i ambitne projekty w atmosferze wzajemnej współpracy,
    • to DANONE jest dla Ciebie.
    Na tym stanowisku dołączysz do zespołu
    Żywiec Zdrój, lidera na polskim rynku wody butelkowej, który w swoim portfolio oferuje wody niegazowane i gazowane (Żywiec Zdrój, Dobrowianka) oraz napoje na bazie wody (takie jak Żywiec Zdrój Soczysty, Żywiec Zdrój Z nutą).

    Oferujemy
  • Pracę w firmie o unikalnej kulturze organizacyjnej, będącej liderem na rynku w swoich kategoriach,
  • Stały rozwój zawodowy i osobisty poprzez m.in. współpracę z ekspertami w swoich dziedzinach, swobodę w działaniu, ciekawe i innowacyjne projekty,
  • Możliwość rozwoju kompetencji w atmosferze konstruktywnej informacji zwrotnej, w organizacji wspierającej pracowników w ciągłym rozwoju,
  • Atrakcyjny pakiet benefitów.

    • Co dalej
    Jeżeli podoba Ci się nasza propozycja, a Twoje doświadczenie i kompetencje wpisują się w nasze oczekiwania, prześlij nam swoje CV.
    Zaaplikuj przez przycisk „Aplikuj!”.
    Życzymy powodzenia w procesie rekrutacji. Uprzejmie informujemy, że skontaktujemy się z wybranymi kandydatami.

    Administratorem Twoich danych osobowych udostępnionych w profilu oraz w dokumentach składanych w ramach rekrutacji jest Żywiec-Zdrój S.A. z siedzibą w Cięcinie (ul. Św. Katarzyny 187, 34-350 Węgierska Górka).

job_description_details.Industry: Consumer Goods Food & Beverages Food Production

whole_unnormalized_body:
Dla naszego Klienta, międzynarodowej firmy usługowej poszukujemy osób na stanowisko Specjalisty ds. kadr i płac.

Do Twoich Zadań Należeć Będzie
  • Sporządzanie i prowadzenie dokumentacji płacowej dla pracowników obsługiwanych klientów,
  • Rozliczanie wynagrodzeń i świadczeń oraz przygotowywanie list płac dla pracowników i zleceniobiorców,
  • Sporządzanie deklaracji PIT, PFRON, ZUS,
  • Obsługa systemu kadrowo-płacowego oraz programu Płatnik,
  • Sporządzanie raportów kadrowo-płacowych i innych zlecanych przez przełożonego,
  • Współpraca z zespołem kadrowo-płacowym


Oferujemy
  • Zatrudnienie na podstawie umowy o pracę,
  • Pracę w doświadczonym zespole, obsługującym duże i średnie podmioty z kapitałem zagranicznym, możliwość zdobycia doświadczenia w międzynarodowym środowisku,
  • Stałe godziny pracy,
  • Korzystną lokalizację - Warszawa Centrum,
  • Realny wpływ na ścieżkę kariery oraz szansę rozwoju i awansu,
  • Pakiet medyczny i karta Multisport,
  • Udział w szkoleniach i kursach językowych.


U Kandydatów Zwracamy Uwagę Na
  • Minimum rok doświadczenia w pracy na podobnym stanowisku (mile widziane doświadczenie w pracy w biurze rachunkowym),
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie dobrym
  • Znajomość systemu Enova lub Symfonia
  • Bardzo dobrą znajomość przepisów prawa pracy,
  • Bardzo dobrą organizację pracy,
  • Dokładność, szczegółowość, odpowiedzialność i zaangażowanie w codzienne obowiązki,
  • Łatwość w nawiązywaniu kontaktów i nastawienie na współpracę

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Financial Services

position: Team Leader w Zespole Customer Service
whole_unnormalized_body:
Masz marzenie? Znalazłeś się we właściwym miejscu!
Oriflame to firma, która zaczęła od marzenia, aby pomóc ludziom zmienić ich życie na lepsze - spełnić ich marzenia. Inspirujemy się marzeniami i dążymy do tego, aby stały się rzeczywistością.

Zainspirowani marzeniami o pięknie
Pokochasz naszą szeroką gamę produktów do pielęgnacji urody łączących w sobie wszystko co najlepsze z natury, nauki i trendów - stworzonych w Szwecji.

Zainspirowani marzeniami o sukcesie
Oferujemy możliwość rozwinięcia w pełni Twojego potencjału, współpracy z zespołem pasjonatów i realizacji własnej wizji sukcesu.

Zainspirowani marzeniami o zmianie
Bądź dumny z pracy w firmie, która pomogła milionom ludzi na całym świecie wyglądać świetnie, zarabiać i bawić się - od prawie 50 lat!

Czujesz się zainspirowany?

Team Leader w Zespole Customer Service


Zakres Obowiązków

Udział w kampaniach przychodzących i wychodzących, w obsłudze telefonów, maili i czatów
Generowanie i analiza niezbędnych raportów
Przygotowywanie skryptów rozmów przy współpracy z innymi działami firmy
Bieżące wsparcie merytoryczne Konsultantów oraz weryfikowanie poziomu realizacji zadań
Wsparcie zespołu w realizacji codziennych zadań oraz wyznaczonych celów
Monitorowanie wyników pracy podległego Zespołu
Administrowanie harmonogramem wykonywania zadań przez Konsultantów
Proponowanie własnych rozwiązań mających na celu poprawę efektywności
Proponowanie i udział we wdrażaniu zmian systemowych i procesowych
Ocena jakości pracy na podstawie przyjętych standardów i przekazywanie Konsultantom informacji zwrotnej
Motywowanie Zespołu oraz stałe dążenie do podnoszenia wyników na poziomie jakościowym i ilościowym

Poszukujemy Osoby, Która

Posiada doświadczenie w zarządzaniu Zespołem obsługi klienta/Call Center (min. 1 rok)
Posiada doświadczenie w pracy na celach jakościowych i ilościowych (cele i KPI)
Jest zorientowana na zapewnienie wysokiej jakości standardów obsługi klienta
Zna system do zarządzania pracą Call Center
Posiada dobrze rozwinięte umiejętności interpersonalne oraz umiejętność budowania zaangażowania w Zespole
Jest nastawienie na realizację celów i jest odpowiedzialna za powierzone zadania
Posiada umiejętności analityczne
Posługuje się językiem angielskim w stopniu umożliwiającym swobodną komunikację oraz korespondencję pisemną

Co oferujemy?
Umowę o pracę - stabilne zatrudnienie w firmie o ugruntowanej pozycji rynkowej
Pracę w środowisku sprzyjającym rozwojowi zawodowemu i osobistemu (elastyczne godziny pracy)
Opiekę medyczną
Program sportowy
Pakiet kafeteryjny
Ubezpieczenie na życie
Deputat kosmetyczny

Czy ta oferta jest dla Ciebie?
Jesteś pozytywnie nastawiony na pracę w zespole, a współpraca z ludźmi sprawia Ci przyjemność? Jeśli tak, nie zastanawiaj się i już teraz prześlij nam swoje CV korzystając z formularza aplikacyjnego.

Site Management Services (SMS) performs high level of facility management and administrative support across Warsaw Site.

Requirements
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills as demonstrated by the ability to work effectively with others at all levels of the organization and externally
  • Demonstrated ability to work successfully in a team environment
  • Ability to exercise considerable discretion, tact and diplomacy
  • Demonstrated abilities to take the initiative to respond to rapidly changing priorities
  • Demonstrates a can-do approach and willingness to learn new skills
  • Administrative experience is an advantage
  • Good knowledge of spoken and written English

Next Steps - Apply today!

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience - it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law. AstraZeneca only employs individuals with the right to work in the country/ies where the role is advertised.

whole_unnormalized_body:

  • Utrzymanie środowiska chmurowego
Uprzejmie informujemy, że odpowiemy tylko na wybrane aplikacje.

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Internet

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Background/context

Citi Commercial Bank is dedicated to serving SME (Small & Medium Enterprise) and MME (Mid-Market Enterprise) customers with international focus. We are present in Czech Republic, Romania, Hungary, Russia, Poland, Turkey and Middle East as well as in UK, Germany, Nordics and other Western Europe countries through our International Desk.

Citi’s Commercial Bank embodies our unique purpose as the global bank of choice for trade-oriented, mid-sized companies who see us as trusted thought partners that bring simplicity in an increasingly complex world, client-centric solutions for long-term growth and pave the way for them to reach across borders and achieve their global vision.

The Client Onboarding Specialist plays an important role by acting as a Single Point of Contact for our UK Desk and CSG clients supporting and managing them through the onboarding process as well as working closely with our key internal partners.

An excellent opportunity to join the Onboarding team supporting our Commercial Subs Group and UK Desk clients covering 17 Western Europe branches working with clients and coverage partners globally.
The team manages a high volume of low, medium & high complexity deals; consequently the successful candidate will be required to manage multiple client deals simultaneously. Therefore, organizational skills and the ability to work in a focused manner under pressure are very important.

Key Responsibilities
  • Act as the lead business representative throughout the management of a Client on-boarding journey that is reliable, repeatable and fast; enhancing both Client and Relationship Manager Experience.
  • Manage the Client onboarding experience, expectations and communications, ensuring transparency throughout the entire onboarding process both internally and externally;
  • Be the driving force for improvements;
  • The Client Onboarding Specialist is required to take complete ownership for the coordination of the deals. This requires them to effectively navigate the organization & leverage appropriate resources & internal stakeholders in order to execute and complete deals.
  • Accurately report deal status, escalating effectively for “on hold” & slow moving deals
  • Ensure strict adherence to defined quality standards & practices outlined in “best practices” collateral. Consistently achieve “excellent” rating in scheduled quality reviews.
  • Effectively manage client relationships and ultimately act as trusted advisor. Enhanced client satisfaction should be reflected in positive client survey scores
  • Attention to detail and comfort dealing with completing administrative work associated with deal management
  • Continuously initiate & drive process enhancements
  • Effective workload management/prioritization to increase capacity/productivity within the Onboarding team.
  • Complete all mandatory & personal development training as stipulated by controls officer & Manager.
  • Ensure 100% effective Controls results & support all audit protocols as appropriate.
  • Project Manage low, medium and high complexity deals for multiple clients including top tier/platinum clients
  • Oversee and coordinate all onboarding activities; being Single Point of Contact for clients and coverage partners
  • Ensure that the clients are able to activate accounts and trained in the tools for Citi’s channel services;
  • Ensure that all onboarding cases are logged and tracked in the CCB Onboarding Dashboard
  • Laying foundations for accurate and timely reporting and trend analysis
  • Ensure accurate and timely tracking and improvement of end to end Turn Around Time (TAT)
  • Ensure adherence to standards/KPI’s and ensure pristine control environment maintained at all times
  • Handle ad-hoc reporting in relation to Customers, Internal and/or regulatory requirements
  • Meet the highest quality standards in delivery and communication with clients
  • Manage the onboarding process to the Global onboarding common operating model (COM) and assist the team in implementing Onboarding related projects
  • Observe highest standards of customer service and business ethics.
  • Ensure Global and local compliance with all appropriate regulations, controls, banking and data privacy standards;
  • Observe demands of corporate policy and Bank Regulations of internal control and standards of legislation. Ensure taking appropriate measures for elimination of possible defects and violations, identified by internal or external auditors;

Qualifications
  • At least 2-3 years’ experience in Customer Service and account opening processes in financial services (Client facing and Commercial Banking related experience an advantage);
  • Proven track record of managing client relationships and delivering high quality customer service;
  • Educated to degree level or equivalent;
  • Strong work ethic – willingness to take a “hands on” approach to ensuring all elements of the deal are delivered as specified
  • Results orientation – evidence of proactively driving deals to conclusion
  • Demonstrated strong negotiation, problem-solving and decision-making skills;
  • In depth knowledge of the Client Onboarding process (AC Opening/KYC);
  • Applications (Word, Excel, Access, Powerpoint) with very strong computer/technical skills;
  • Strong interpersonal, communication, influencing and presentation skills;
  • Superior investigative and analytical skills;
  • Client Focused – ability to deliver superior customer service;
  • Proven record of process improvements;
  • KYC/Implementation/AO experience would be of advantage for this role;
  • Project management background would be beneficial
  • Corporate Treasury and Cash Management knowledge

We Offer
  • Opportunity to work with various Citi teams and Products;
  • A chance to deepen the product knowledge and market awareness;
  • Exposure to complex and fact paced challenging environment;
  • Exposure to Trade, Lending, FX and Cash Management products;

    • Grade :All Job Level - All Job FunctionsAll Job Level - All Job Functions - PL


    • Time Type



    • Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
    Minority/Female/Veteran/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.

    Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity CLICK HERE.

    To view the EEO Policy Statement CLICK HERE.

position: Associate Director Site Management and Monitoring
whole_unnormalized_body:
At AstraZeneca we are guided in our work by a strong set of values, and we're resetting expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. By truly following the science, we pioneer new methods, new thinking and bring unexpected teams together. From scientists to sales, lab techs to legal, we're on a mission to turn ideas into life-changing medicines that transform lives. We need great people who share our passion for science and have the drive and determination to meet the unmet needs of patients around the world. If you're swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you're our kind of person.



The Associate Director SMM (ADSMM) is accountable for delivering the committed part of all clinical interventional studies under their supervision according to agreed resources, budget and timelines complying with AZ Procedural Documents, international guidelines such as ICH-GCP as well as relevant local regulations. The ADSMM is responsible for line managing dedicated group(s) of staff and responsible for planning and utilization of staff resources, assigned budget, objective setting and performance follow-up. It is also expected that the ADSMM may contribute to regional/global work tasks as delegated. As assigned, the ADSMM is accountable for ensuring that study sites are identified, site qualifications performed, set up, initiated, monitored, closed and documentation archived.



Typical accountabilities

  • Leadership of dedicated group, building the team spirit, developing team style and behaviour.
  • Ensures adequate resources for the studies assigned and that the workload of direct reports is adequate.
  • Development and performance management of direct reports - ensures that direct reports have development and training plans, according to IDP process.
  • Coaches the direct reports on a regular basis, and plans/organises coaching with external providers if needed.
  • Prepares salary and bonus proposals for direct reports based on their performance in close collaboration with responsible CH/CD SMM and local HRBP.
  • Contributes to high quality feasibility work - oversees successful delivery of SMM study delivery country level targets to plan, with speed and quality; ensures that study activities at country level comply with local policies and code of ethics.
  • Ensures all systems are continuously updated - ensures completeness and timeliness of the eTMF to maintain it "Inspection Ready".
  • Assists CH/CD SMM or Local Study Managers/teams in forecasting study timelines, resources, recruitment, study materials and drugs.
  • Provides direction to LSM/teams on major study commitments including resolving any key issues identified.
  • Reviews SQV reports of direct reports in line with AZ SOPs
  • Performs accompanied site visits according to local QC Plan, supporting ongoing coaching and development.



Requirements

  • Bachelors degree in related discipline, preferably in life science, or equivalent qualification - good medical knowledge and ability to learn.
  • Line management experience and proven project management experience; excellent team building skills also in cross-functional teams.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Development Operations (CRA / Sr. CRA / LSM) or other related fields - excellent understanding of the Study Drug Handling Process and the Data Management Process.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills - organisational, analytical, influencing, negotiation and interviewing skills
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills, verbal and written.
  • Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English.
  • Ability to look for and champion more efficient and effective methods/processes of delivering quality clinical trials with reduced budget and in less time, good ability to learn and to adapt to work with IT systems.
  • Ability to work in an environment of remote collaborators, good intercultural awareness
  • Integrity and high ethical standards.
  • Ability for national and international travel.

W Cyclad współpracujemy z najlepszymi międzynarodowymi firmami technologicznymi, aby zwiększyć ich potencjał w dostarczaniu wyjątkowych, nowoczesnych rozwiązań, które kształtują świat przyszłości. Obecnie, dla naszego Partnera, lidera na rynku ubezpieczeń komunikacyjnych, poszukujemy specjalistów na stanowisko Administratora ds. Sieci i Bezpieczeństwa

Administrator ds. Sieci i Bezpieczeństwa

Informacje o Projekcie
  • Branża: ubezpieczeniowa
  • Lokalizacja: Warszawa (Mokotów)
  • Wynagrodzenie: w trakcie ustalania
  • Czas trwania projektu: stała współpraca

Obowiązki
  • Administracja urządzeniami sieciowymi Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, IPS Firepower, Catalyst 3650/3850, Catalyst 6800, Cisco WLC
  • Administracja systemami zarządzania Cisco ISE, Prime Infrastructure
  • Diagnozowanie i rozwiązywanie problemów z obszaru działania sieci
  • Udział opracowywaniu i wdrażaniu strategii rozwoju sieci
  • Udział w projektach wewnętrznych

Wymagania
  • Wykształcenie wyższe o profilu informatycznym lub pokrewnym
  • Wiedza na poziomie Cisco CCNP lub wyższym
  • Znajomość protokołów routingu dynamicznego (OSPF, BGP)
  • Umiejętność zarządzania przełącznikami i routerami Cisco
  • Umiejętność zarządzania firewallami Cisco, IPS oraz firewallami aplikacyjnymi
  • Znajomość technologii VXLAN, EVPN
  • Znajomość Cisco ISE
  • Znajomość zasad projektowania i działania sieci
  • Znajomość zagadnień z zakresu bezpieczeństwa sieci
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie pozwalającym swobodne komunikowanie się

Mile Widziane
  • Umiejętność zarządzania proxy Forcepoint
  • Znajomość systemów monitoringu Nagios i Solarwinds

Oferujemy
  • Współpracę w oparciu o umowę o pracę (lub B2B)
  • Świadczenia dodatkowe: opiekę medyczną, możliwość skorzystania z zajęć sportowych (siłownia, fitness, basen) przystąpienia do grupowego ubezpieczenia na życie, liczne akcje na rzecz naszych pracowników, programy dla rodziny
  • Pełne wprowadzenie do obowiązków - przekażemy Ci naszą wiedzę oraz doświadczenie, abyś mógł/a komfortowo rozpocząć pracę
  • Niepowtarzalną atmosferę: bezpośredni kontakt, pozytywne podejście, wzajemny szacunek

  • Znajomość zasad projektowania i działania sieci
  • Znajomość zagadnień z zakresu bezpieczeństwa sieci
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie pozwalającym swobodne komunikowanie się

Mile Widziane
  • Umiejętność zarządzania proxy Forcepoint
  • Znajomość systemów monitoringu Nagios i Solarwinds

Oferujemy
  • Współpracę w oparciu o umowę o pracę (lub B2B)
  • Świadczenia dodatkowe: opiekę medyczną, możliwość skorzystania z zajęć sportowych (siłownia, fitness, basen) przystąpienia do grupowego ubezpieczenia na życie, liczne akcje na rzecz naszych pracowników, programy dla rodziny
  • Pełne wprowadzenie do obowiązków - przekażemy Ci naszą wiedzę oraz doświadczenie, abyś mógł/a komfortowo rozpocząć pracę
  • Niepowtarzalną atmosferę: bezpośredni kontakt, pozytywne podejście, wzajemny szacunek

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Staffing & Recruiting Management Consulting

whole_unnormalized_body:
We are looking for an Administrative Assistant for our Corporate Solutions Operations business line.

About JLL

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

Role Purpose

The role will be part of a JLL team working closely with one of our most dynamic & fast-growing Client from the online retail industry. The Client’s EMEA Real Estate and Facilities (GREF) team provides real estate transaction expertise, capital investment program management and facility maintenance and operation across multiple countries. GREF partners with suppliers to ensure quality, innovation and scalability with Client’s business and utilizes customer driven feedback to continuously improve and exceed employee expectations.

The person working in this role will be part of the EGREFO (EMEA Global Real Estate & Facilities Operations) team. EGREFO are an EMEA-wide operations team, whose scope includes encompassing tools, policies, standard operating processes and program management, and centralize the critical data in efficient user-friendly document repositories. We ensure the client’s culture is maintained in EMEA GREF corporate offices, and that client’s expectations are clear, concise and implemented by vendors and our IFM (Integrated Facilities Management) team.

Duties of the role include providing support to the Program Managers, assisting with general needs, managing administrative activities, as well as project communications, documentation, reports and contracts, checking documents for accuracy and compliance within GREF’s standards and procedures. The team member will be tasked to maintain accurate records, and manage document filing system for all operational and financial transactions for easy reference and retrieval; efficient document management including file closures, archiving and monitoring. Other tasks include organizing team meetings, coordinating communication and driving team collaboration.

What This Job Involves
  • Provide a full range of moderate to complex clerical duties
  • Liaise with executive and senior administrative assistants to handle requests and queries
  • Assisting with all aspects of administrative management, directory maintenance, logistics, equipment and storage
  • Coordinate between vendors/contractors, solving and supporting issues
  • Manage administrative and supporting processes across selected business areas
  • Support in coordinating operational developments, managing timelines & tracking action items
  • Scheduling and coordinating meetings, events and other similar activities
  • Preparing reports, business mailing, agendas and presentations, typically using Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Performing multifaceted general office support
  • Proof reading documents for accuracy
  • Provide sound contributions to knowledge networks and communities of practice
  • Take action items and support team to deliver against committed timelines
  • Act as support to Program Managers to support delivery of agreed projects
Sounds like you? To apply you need to have-
  • High School degree at minimal; additional qualification as an Administrative assistant or Secretary
  • Proven experience working in a fast-paced dynamic team
  • Highly autonomous and requiring minimal supervision, with natural bias for action
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
  • Good understanding of and respect for cultural differences and the capacity to work effectively in a multicultural environment
  • Teamwork and collaboration skills, with experience in working with virtual teams being a benefit
  • Fluent ability to read, write, speak English
  • Superior verbal and written communications and interpersonal skills to converse with a diverse group of customers at all levels in the organization, as well as external customers
  • Experience in Real Estate, Architecture, Design, Space or Portfolio management is a benefit
  • Understanding of real estate operations will be a benefit
  • Problem-solving and critical thinking skills
  • Basic analytical skills, ability to draw conclusions on data
  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize work
  • Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge of office management systems and procedures, office equipment
  • Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS PowerPoint)

What You Can Expect From Us
  • You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
  • Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay.
  • Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...
Apply today at jll.com/careers.

JLL Privacy Notice

Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.

For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .

For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .

Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

Company Description

null Job Description

Poszukujemy Stażystów, Którzy
  • Są zainteresowani komputerami, nowymi technologiami, sieciami komputerowymi, urządzeniami mobilnymi.
  • Są otwarci, komunikatywni, potrafią słuchać i jasno formułować myśli.
  • Potrafią myśleć analitycznie i aktywnie szukać rozwiązań problemów.
  • Szybko przyswajają nowe informację.
  • Lubią pracę w grupie.
Na czym będzie polegał Twój staż?
  • Będziesz miał/a okazje poznać specyfikę pracy zespołu Wsparcia IT (który często jest pierwszym zespołem, w którym młody człowiek rozpoczyna przygodę w IT w organizacji).
  • Będzie realizował/a zadania zarówno Service Desku jak i Onsite Supportu, co pozwoli Ci po pierwsze zrozumieć różnice w specyfice pracy pomiędzy tymi zespołami, a po drugie poznać specyficzne dla tych stanowisk.
  • Będziesz nadawał/a oraz odbierał/a uprawnienia do systemów wewnętrznych pracownikom Allegro.
  • Będziesz współpracował/a z serwisami zewnętrznymi przy usuwaniu awarii sprzętu komputerowego.
  • Będziesz publikował/a artykuły w zespołowej bazie wiedzy.
  • Wraz z zespołem będziesz udzielał/a informacji i porad na temat specyfikacji i kompatybilności sprzętu, działania oprogramowania, wykorzystania standardowych narzędzi do współpracy.
Dlaczego warto pracować z nami?
  • IT Support to zespół młodych, ambitnych i zmotywowanych specjalistów, którzy są pierwszą linią wsparcia dla pracowników Allegro we wszystkich sprawach związanych z biurowym IT.
  • Praca w IT Support to szansa na poznanie firmy "od podszewki" - na co dzień współpracujemy z praktycznie każdym obszarem firmy.
  • Pracujemy w zgranym zespole w 5 różnych lokalizacjach, na co dzień wykorzystujemy nowoczesne narzędzia i technologie (SCCM, MIM, Jamf, AirWatch, Slack, Google Suite).
  • Wspieramy najnowszy sprzęt - w tym również bardzo dużą maszyn Apple - co daje możliwość zdobycia unikalnych umiejętności.
  • Automatyzację mamy już we krwi - wyzwania i zdobywanie nowych umięjętności stawiamy daleko przed "klikologią".
  • Będąc częścią zespołu mając realny wpływ na to jak wygląda nasza praca - narzędzia i procedury jakimi posługujemy się na co dzień, ale również praca setek ludzi, którzy korzystają z naszych usług tworząc produkt jakim jest Allegro.

Ze Swojej Strony Oferujemy
  • Startupową kulturę pracy i stabilność dojrzałej organizacji
  • Nowoczesne biuro i narzędzia pracy
  • Nieformalną atmosferę pracy w profesjonalnym zespole
Wyślij swoje CV i rozpocznij staż!

job_description_details.Industry: Marketing & Advertising Management Consulting Financial Services

position: Field Sales Representative, Public Sector, Google Cloud
whole_unnormalized_body:
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Warsaw, Poland; Bucharest, Romania; Prague, Czechia

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Technology related sales or business development experience at a B2B software company.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience building strategic business partnerships with enterprise customers.
  • Experience selling infrastructure software, databases, analytical tools, applications software, or cloud solutions.
  • Experience working with and managing partners in complex implementation projects including global system integrators and packaged software vendors.
  • Demonstrated success with large complex commercial and legal negotiations, working with procurement, legal and business teams.
  • Ability to work with sales engineers and customer’s technical leads to inventory existing software estate, define migration plans, and build business cases for migrations.


About The Job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Field Sales Representative, you will be working with our Public Sector accounts. You’ll leverage existing relationships with C-level executives, develop new relationships and act as a trusted business partner to deeply understand their unique company challenges and goals. You will promote the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. Using your passion for Google products, you will help spread the magic of Google to organizations around the world.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

Responsibilities
  • Build and deepen executive relationships with public sector customers. Influence long-term strategic direction and serve as a business partner.
  • Negotiate and manage entire cycle, often presenting to C-level executives in public sector customers.
  • Lead account strategy in generating and developing business growth opportunities, working collaboratively with Customer Engineers and Google Partners in order to optimize business results in territory and open up opportunities with large public sector customers.
  • Understand each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans and business drivers, technology strategy and competitive landscape.
  • Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.

At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.

Purpose: The incumbent in this p osition will be responsible for performing global credit management processes & enforcing credit policies.

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables
  • Process Expertise & Business Partnership
  • Be seen as a reliable O2C AR credit management point of contact
  • Effectively analyse all customer financial statements, payment trends & financial ratios to recommend credit limits to the affiliate process owner
  • Analyse account discrepancies to ensure the customer account is enabled for payment
  • Perform the monthly Aged Debt review for your affiliate including the underlying analysis & the overall presentation & follow ups for the review
  • Prepare Quarterly Credit Committee data for Global Treasury and Affiliates CFO’s.
  • Execute Sales Order credit release in a compliant & timely manner on a daily basis
  • Prepare key metrics & communicate to a supervisor
  • Support local /regional O2C projects with influence on excellent credit management
  • Support the overall O2C AR team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members and training of new team members
  • Skills & Capabilities
  • Ability to handle complexity with support and utilize analytical skills, with attention to detail
  • Ability to effectively analyse problems in search for the best resolution
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables
  • Ability to respond flexibly and empathetically to customer needs, managing their expectations effectively
  • Ability to work in global team environment and communicate effectively with both internal business partners & disciplines as well as external Business Process Outsourced team members
  • Demonstrate a strong compliance oriented mindset & help to build a strong compliance culture
  • Familiarise with all applicable process documentation & training materials to ensure you operate in a fully compliant manner
  • Ensure ownership for all applicable SO x & Operational controls for your area
  • Actively work with the core team members, internal customers/business partners, and LSP team members to build effective working relationships
  • Demonstrate excellence in all interactions with our internal customers & business partners
  • Focus on measuring & improving our internal customer’s experience
  • Demonstrate a strong Continuous Improvement oriented approach & help to build a strong Continuous Improvement culture
  • Actively work with the core team members & Global O2C team to drive improvements for processes

Requirements

 Minimum Requirements:
  • Degree in Business and/or Accounting (or equivalent work experience)
  • 3 years’ experience in O2C or Finance function in SSC/BPO environment , preferably with knowledge of credit management & customer service and experience in identifying and delivering process change
  • Experience with SAP O2C Module
  • Experience in Business Warehouse or Business Objects
  • MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Fluency in English & additional foreign language will be the plus

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

QA PROJECT MANAGER

WARSAW

10.000 – 12.000 PLN GROSS

We Offer

 A full-time job based on permanent contract and social package

 An opportunity to gain experience and develop skills within the gripping industry of video games

 Highly international and multicultural environment

 A challenging role with much space for your own initiatives

 Friendly and open work atmosphere

Responsibilities

 Assume full operational ownership of assigned clients

 Manage QA Project Leads and Senior QA Technicians working with assigned clients and their games

 Identify and prepare valuable metrics/KPIs and drive continuous improvement accordingly

 Prepare and deliver quotes and cost estimates for return business for assigned accounts

 Anticipate, research and propose purchases of testing tools and equipment relevant to assigned clients and projects

 Identify improvements and escalate issues related to internal or external test strategy and processes

to senior QA management

 Prepare and deliver weekly budget reports

 Proactively understand and communicate staffing and resourcing requirements

 Provide status updates and escalate issues that affect client satisfaction to the Business

Development team

 Review and optimize Test Design efforts to meet client requirements and drive continuous

improvement

 Performing Line management and staff appraisals

 Take appropriate action based on trends identified in ESAT Surveys

Requirements

Make a difference about how games are received by testing them before their release.
Eliminate truncations, incorrect grammar and register used in your favorite games.
Help us improve and influence games.

Check the titles that none of your friends have ever played before-from Indie to full-fledged AAA games from well-known publishers.

Your Quests
  • Game translation evaluation and proofreading, cultural correctness validation;
  • Error reporting (in English) and improvement suggestions;

Your Skill Tree Items Unlocked
  • Native level of at least one language: Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Bulgaria, Chinese Traditional and/or Simplified, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English UK, English US, Finnish, French, French Canadian, German, Greek, Hebrew, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Malay, Mexican Spanish, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Slovak, Spanish, Swedish, Tamil, Thai, Turkish, Ukrainian, Vietnamese;

As a Game Tester, you can unlock the following power-ups:
  • Gaining experience in a stable, global company with a solid market position;
  • Competitive salary with the development opportunities in our company structure;
  • Informal working atmosphere with no dress code - you can be yourself 😊;

  • Contract of a mandate.
Extra Boosts

  • You are ready to test on-site in the Warsaw office - remote work is not possible ;
  • You can work in Poland - we do not sponsor Visa or a work permit for this role.
We kindly inform that Lionbridge reserves the right to contact only selected candidates.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Zastanawiasz się jak możesz rozwinąć drzemiący w Tobie potencjał? Chcesz poznać jeden z obszarów Księgowości, mieć realny wpływ na usprawnianie procesu księgowego? Jeżeli na powyższe pytania odpowiedziałeś/aś tak - dołącz do Naszego zespołu CBS Finanse!

Obecnie do naszego biura w Warszawie poszukujemy osoby na stanowisko

AP Junior Accountant

O PRACY

Jako Młodszy/a Księgowy/a będziesz uczestniczył/a w działaniach związanych z zamykaniem miesiąca oraz raportowaniem dla spółek Grupy Danone (Navision), wspierał/a procesy księgowania faktur zakupowych oraz udzielał/a odpowiedzi dostawcom i klientom wewnętrznym (w języku angielskim).

Chcesz mieć wpływ na zmiany? Świetnie! Jednym z Twoich obowiązków będzie przetwarzanie faktur dostawców i rozwiązywanie potencjalnych rozbieżności poprzez bezpośredni kontakt z klientami.

O TOBIE

Doskonale sprawdzisz się w tej roli jeśli

  • jesteś absolwentem/absolwentką na kierunku Finanse i Rachunkowość lub pokrewnych;
  • masz pierwsze doświadczenie w obszarze Intercompany/Fixed Assets/GL;
  • posiadasz podstawową znajomość procesu P2P;
  • dobrze posługujesz się Excel'em (podstawowe formuły, filtry);
  • cechuje Cię odpowiedzialność, dokładność oraz przywiązujesz dużą wagę do jakości i poprawności danych;
  • jesteś osobą komunikatywną, lubiącą pracę w zespole;
  • lubisz poznawać nowe obszary, szybko i łatwo przyswajasz nowe informacje;
  • swobodnie posługujesz sie językiem angielskim w mowie i piśmie.

Twoim atutem będzie wiedza z zakresu księgowości i obsługi systemów

  • podstawowa znajomość systemu ERP;
  • podstawowa znajomość planu kont.

O NAS

CBS - Centrum Usług Biznesowych

Centrum Usług Biznesowych (CBS) skupia cztery różne funkcje biznesu - HR, IT, Finanse oraz Sekretariat Generalny (komunikację, relacje zewnętrzne i regulacje prawne). Wspierają one codzienną pracę poszczególnych spółek DANONE w Polsce oraz, w zależności od funkcji, w krajach nordyckich, bałtyckich i Europy Środkowo-Wschodniej.

CBS Finance

CBS Finance jednostka zajmująca się kompleksowym wsparciem finansowo - księgowym wszystkich współek z Grupy DANONE (CBUs) w obszarze kontroli finansowej (Księga Główna, raportowanie finansowe, rozliczenia między spółkami (intercompany), środki trwałe oraz księgowość materiałowa), należności oraz kontrola kredytowa, zobowiązania, treasury, podatki oraz kontrola wewnętrzna.

OFERUJEMY

  • Zatrudnienie na podstawie umowy o pracę na czas określony (1,5 roku);
  • Benefity takie jak ubezpieczenie na życie, prywatny pakiet medyczny, kartę Multisport;
  • Szansę rozwoju i zdobycia doświadczenia w organizacji o unikalnej, otwartej i przyjaznej kulturze organizacyjnej;
  • Współpracę w międzynarodowym środowisku, z różnorodnymi działami Naszej organizacji;
  • Rozwój w oparciu o wsparcie doświadczonych managerów i specjalistów.

CO DALEJ?

Po kliknięciu w „Aplikuj” założysz swój profil w systemie rekrutacyjnym poprzez dodanie CV. Zapoznamy się z Twoim profilem, a następnie z wybranymi kandydatami umówimy się na pierwszą, telefoniczną rozmowę rekrutacyjną. Kolejnym etapem jest rozmowa w formie video - spotkanie z przełożonym. Proces rekrutacyjny będzie prowadzony zdalnie.

Administratorem Twoich danych osobowych udostępnionych w profilu oraz w dokumentach składanych w ramach rekrutacji jest Danone Sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Warszawie (ul. Redutowa 9/23, 01-103 Warszawa).

whole_unnormalized_body:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook is seeking a strong sales and marketing professional to help build and sell Facebook’s advertising solutions. This role will establish and expand relationships with new clients, and continue to cultivate and grow relationships with strategic clients. With proven understanding of both online and traditional media, this role will align with an Account Manager and counterparts within the Sales organization, to develop industry-specific marketing relationships and drive revenue by negotiating and optimizing complex opportunities with strategic clients. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in selling cross-network marketing solutions to multichannel advertisers. Having experience managing both brand and performance based campaigns, expertise in brand and performance based advertising products, and ability to leverage data and analytics to improve performance for digital campaigns is required. Client Partners must have strong consultative sales and analytical skills; thrive in a collaborative and innovative environment, and have a passion for Facebook. Success in this position will require a proven ability to reach and influence executive level customers, ecosystem partners (PMD's and Agencies), close new business, and provide holistic marketing solutions.

Responsibilities
  • Serve as an industry thought leader in social media and digital advertising in order to drive vertical and client success leveraging Facebook’s ongoing product and technology developments
  • Develop and actively manage short and long term account plans based on client brand and direct response marketing objectives
  • Accurately and effectively manage sales pipeline in order to prioritize business opportunities and resources
  • Develop and broaden high-level collaborative relationships, including understanding and identifying contacts that manage multiple budget, (brand, DR etc.) and close large deals with up to 20 major customers
  • Create and present needs-based solutions and high quality answers to RFPs
  • Reach and exceed sales quotas while contributing to overall vertical and team goals
  • Create and deliver consultative sales presentations using industry knowledge, market trends, and Facebook marketing solutions
  • Exhibit executive presence and confidence in presenting Facebook on the market, industry, C-suite executives & beyond
  • Partner with other vertical teams on structuring and executing operational and strategic initiatives - developing work plans, synthesizing market related data, leading analysis and defining the overall business approach
  • Methodic coordination & communication across the various entities (PMD, agency, direct client teams)
Minimum Qualification
  • Marketing, Brand Advertising, Direct Response, Media Sales and/or Online Advertising experience
  • Proven track record of successfully reaching and exceeding sales revenue goals through consultative sell
  • Fluency in English and native/professional proficiency in Czech

Preferred Qualification
  • Experience in a fast-paced startup, eCommerce, sales, and/or online advertising environment strongly preferred

Advances in digitalization, data and advance analytics are changing industries at pace with the pharma industry showing signs of movement


The Digital Health Market will grow exponentially over the next 3 years, with new applications in digital showing in phase 3 studies significant benefits for patients including overall survival in Cancer


AstraZeneca would like to leap frog in this area and has prioritized digital in R&D as a critical strategic area of focus by 2025, as part of the overall company strategy.

Digital Health R&D’s ambition is to transform healthcare, powered by digital, science and collaborations to deliver the healthcare outcomes and experience that patients care about the most.


The Digital Health R&D journey incorporates 3 key stages:

  • Stage 1 – foundational, reimagine how we work, by maximizing the use of digital, data and analytics transform processes within R&D to gain significant benefits on speed of the portfolio (goal 9 months acceleration) productivity (goal -20% reduction in cost per patient per year) quality at source, patient experience and probability of success.
  • Stage 2 – advanced, redefine clinical trials and digital health to improve overall patient experiences and outcomes, example redefining patient populations, remote clinical trials, patient apps to reduce/manage adverse events and improve patient outcomes (OS), using data from EHMr and RWE instead of control arms, and through PROs and continuous patient monitoring, creating new end points enabling studies in earlier stages of disease (ctDNA changes) prolonging significantly patients’ lives
  • Stage 3 – future-readiness, reimagine healthcare, examples, AZ as a healthcare provider beyond medicines for certain indications (example: Breast Cancer, proving monitoring, predictive analytics and therapies for improved outcomes)


This role will be responsible for planning, analysing and mapping a wide range of activities, related to current and future process improvements driven from Digital Health R&D. You will work with the Digital Health R&D Product Management community, cross-functional Subject Matter Experts and Process Owners to develop the future process driven by the activities of Digital Health R&D, which form an important component of our overall Implementation Plans. You are a recognised expert within own field and often the first point of contact for specialist process queries.


Typical Accountabilities

  • Partner with the Digital Health R&D Product Management community, who have overall responsibility for the products and services being delivered to define, develop, document and describe the future processes
  • Using standard process mapping tools, templates and methodology, map future Digital Health R&D processes, including provisional view of information flow
  • Engage with Digital Health R&D teams, customers, Subject Matter Experts, Development Operations and Operational Exercise and IT (Architects and Domain Business Analysts) to ensure the future process captures diverse requirements
  • Coordinate with the current Process Owners and Subject Matter Experts across the business to understand how the current processes will be impacted by Digital Health R&D work packages
  • Propose the staged evolution of the current to the future process, aligned with the rollout plans of the new Digital Health R&D solutions
  • Collaborate with the Digital Health R&D Change and Capability Team and with other Process Leads (e.g., Regulatory, Safety, Dev Ops, OE etc) to deliver the joint accountability of a having a single integrated process
  • Coordinate across Digital Health R&D with training partners from the Digital Health R&D workstream on training needs analysis and requirements and provide process-related content to support the production of new training materials
  • Acts as a source of knowledge in one or more areas of Digital Health R&D, defining and communicating current and future business improvement needs and opportunities
  • Maintains the process and technology for identifying and tracking continuous improvement initiatives
  • Prioritises business improvement issues and delivers own business improvement findings and recommendations to a cross-functional team
  • Enables cross-functional sharing of business improvement ideas by ensuring adequate systems and processes for recording data in a centrally accessible manner


Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Essential

  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline
  • Significant experience in process definition and documentation
  • Strong understanding of R&D Business and associated current processes
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills to drive alignment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as proven negotiation, collaboration and interpersonal leadership skills
  • Capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction, and altering priorities
  • Conceptual, analytical and strategic thinking
  • Customer focus -- dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers
  • Strong bias for action and results
  • Knowledge and experience with internal and external suppliers and solutions
  • Excellent business acumen with sensitivity to environment
  • Integrity and trust -- unwavering commitment to "doing the right thing"


Desirable

  • Advanced degree within field
  • Professional certification
  • Agile Project Management experience
  • Experience working in a global organization where stakeholders and project team members are geographically dispersed.

As a team member of the Record To Report structure, you will have an opportunity to build new finance processes from a scratch by taking part in transition in different European countries and not only.


What you can learn:

  • how to build a Center of Excellence,
  • cooperate as an expert in an international environment,
  • drive various improvement projects and develop within the internal structure — horizontal and vertical (FP&A, Consolidation & Reporting, people management).


Responsibilities:

  • Cooperating with other Analysts, Accounting Controllers and GBS in terms of accounting subjects, transaction processing and performance.
