We are looking for an ICT Trainer. Deadline: 06.04.2020


DUTIES:

  • Organizing and delivering of adequate all level and all type of ICT trainings by various means and methods (including direct classes, hands-on workshops, on-the-job trainings, video tutorials);
  • Acting as architect of the training programme who understands the business needs;
  • Analyzing training needs, identifying existing gaps in skills and competencies, addressing them by sourcing of adequate training;
  • Populating, managing, up keeping and enlarging of the database of training materials;
  • Ensuring that feedback and lessons learned from delivered training are taken on board, in order to continuously improve the products;
  • Actively participating in the development, roll out and change of applications in order to improve the experience to end users;
  • Supporting business processes and contribution by delivering related training to maximize effectiveness;
  • Participation in procurements of ICT training services and courses, guiding contractors in scope of trainings and training materials for ICT solutions;
  • Providing technical writer services to projects and software developments;
  • Develop training strategy and deliverables for future systems not yet developed;
  • Performing other duties on request of Head of Unit.


THE INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY UNIT

The Information and Communication Technology Unit (ICT) operates as a centre of expertise and support for the development of existing and new ICT systems and ICT components of Frontex entities including Task Forces. It ensures that corporate ICT systems are designed, developed and maintained with efficiency and consistency according to Frontex strategic priorities. The Unit plays a crucial role in designing IT systems and services ensuring their implementation and compliance with Frontex ICT strategy going beyond the day-today needs of the Agency. The scope of the Unit responsibilities is intertwined with operational priorities adopted under Integrated Border Management strategy. While ICT projects are developed internally by business entities where ICT business partners are deployed, the Unit centralises the management and development of all ICT capacities of the Agency to ensure the alignment of projects to strategic policies, guidelines and principles as highlighted by the ICT strategy.

The Unit is responsible for the development, maintenance and support of the Agency’s ICT infrastructure, as well as the IT services and products. The ICT Unit provides and organises the first, second and third lines of support to all Frontex ICT systems, monitors them and seeks to improve the quality, reliability and efficiency of the service delivered. Furthermore, it manages ICT-related contracts for the purpose of maximising financial and operational performance and minimising risk. Finally, it ensures a high availability of the ICT services and applications in line with the business needs. It is responsible for maintaining a high level of security throughout all the Agency’s ICT systems, for monitoring them and constantly improving security solutions as new threats appear.

J.P. Morgan - Firmwide Regulatory Reporting & Analysis




We are the first global, centralized, scalable and sustainable reporting and analytics team in the Finance organization. We focus on Data Integrity and Report Preparation for the US Federal Government & Securities Exchange Commission. In addition, FRRA drives broader strategic initiatives across external reporting including accountability, quality assurance, process improvement and development of target technology solutions.




 WHAT WE OFFER
 
If you want to make an impact with your work while being supported by smart and motivated colleagues, come find your next opportunity with us. Thanks to our global reach, we can help you get where you want to go. Here, you’ll feel welcomed and valued. You’ll be a part of an extraordinary inclusive culture that draws on and develops the best talent. 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

  • Preparation of quarterly financial statements (i.e., balance sheet) and regulatory reports in support of U.S. Federal Reserve Board (FRB) and Securities Exchange Commission (SEC) filing requirements (10-K/10-Q, FR Y-9C, Call Report, and others).
  • Collaborate across geographies with multiple stakeholders to source and deliver information as per the requirements
  • Collectively package, review and deliver final results to Report / Schedule Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and ultimately deliver data to external regulators.
  • Partner with Internal Report / Schedule / Business SMEs to produce and capture variance commentary as necessary.
  • Identify and track control breaks, data quality issues and reporting errors through the reporting cycle; oversee escalation and end-to-end resolution.
  • Ensure data integrity by adhering to internal control policies and procedures. Also, ensure robust control checks for all deliverables.
  • Review and apply regulatory guidance via analysis and interpretation of data.
  • Perform ad-hoc reports and analysis, as required.
  • Support User Acceptance
    Testing, as required.




 

 

 

 

 

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

  • College degree in Finance or similar field; CA/CFA/CPA/MBA a plus

  • 1-3 years of relevant experience
  • Regulatory / financial reporting background recommended
  • Strong banking product knowledge
  • Knowledge of US GAAP advantageous

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: 

 

  • Fluent in English
  • Strong accounting skills and aptitude to work with numbers
  • Logical thinker with strong analytical skills
  • roficient in MS Office applications (MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; able to interact with senior business partners independently
  • Candidate should be flexible with extended hours during quarter-end reporting cycle
  • Outstanding relationship management, interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proactive, strategic thinker
  • Tenacity to resolve issues and conflicts
  • Financial experience including budgeting, forecasting, modeling, interpreting results, and identifying drivers and trends a plus
  • Process oriented with a strong control mind-set.

 

VALUED QUALITIES:

 

  • High energy and enthusiasm; pro-active self-starter

  • Judgment and integrity

  • Self-motivated, comfortable working independently in a dynamic and challenging environment

  • Able to prioritize and multi-task while partnering with multiple stakeholders in a matrix environment.

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, offering solutions to the world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions in more than 100 countries. We have a sophisticated local market presence in Europe, Middle East and Africa which is complemented by staff around the world who support our growth and serve our clients 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. We are excited to expand our team in Poland and we’re looking for collaborative, innovative and dedicated individuals to join us in our new corporate centre in Warsaw. Bring us your expertise and you’ll be part of a global community, working with people around the world and with a company that’s committed to investing in you and making a success of this key new location for our business.

Date: Mar 27, 2020

At Ericsson, you can be a game changer! Because working here isn’t just a deal. It’s a big deal. This means that you get to leverage our 140+ years of experience and the expertise of more than 95,000 diverse colleagues worldwide. As part of our team, you will help solve some of society´s most complicated challenges, enabling you to be ‘the person that did that.’ We’ve never had a greater opportunity to drive change; setting the bar for technology to be inclusive and accessible; empowering an intelligent, sustainable, and connected world.

Are you in? We are now looking for a DevOps Architect, who will support DevOps transformation project.

Responsibilities
  • Design of Continuous Integration/Delivery pipelines in Jenkins for microservices
  • Support for Jenkins tuning and troubleshooting
  • Automate deployment using Ansible
  • Cooperate with DevOps Evangelist in defining principles and guidelines
  • Cooperate with DevOps Transformation Leader to optimize support model and processes
  • Modernization of existing application - designing migration from Virtual Machine(s) to containerized (Docker) version or native cloud
  • Knowledge sharing about DevOps with development teams
  • Promoting release automation in development teams to decrease software delivery time of new features
  • Support for configuration and customization of Observability tools
  • Documentation of DevOps aspects


Key Qualifications
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in software development, including 2 years in DevOps methodology
  • Expert proficiency in Continuous Integration tools (Jenkins)
  • Intermediate experience with container orchestration tools (Kubernetes)
  • Deep knowledge of GIT (Bitbucket) tool and GitFlow approach
  • Knowledge of processes: Configuration Management, Release Management
  • Basic knowledge of Cloud Computing solutions (IBM, Azure)
  • Basic knowledge of build tools (MSBuild, Gradle)
  • Experience with Containers technology (Docker)
  • Experience with Static Code Analysis tools (SonarQube)
  • Knowledge of scripting languages (Bash, PowerShell)
  • Knowledge of Agile Scrum methodology

Nice To Have
  • Certifications in any of the above mentioned technical areas will be an advantage
  • Experience with working in international teams in various time zones

What Do We Offer
  • Stable employment on the basis of an employment contract,
  • Work based on developing the latest solutions in the area of mobile technology,
  • Clearly defined career paths, trainings,
  • Rich benefits package (private medical care for employee and his family, life insurance, Ok System, MultiSport, lunch voucher),
  • Work in an international environment based on cooperation,
  • Home office, flexible working hours, laptop and mobile phone,
  • Work-life balance.

FP&A Reporting Team Lead will combine two functions: a Manager of a team (of up to 10 people) and an Expert with practical tools development task.


Together with the team will contribute to implementing standardized and automated global harmonized finance reporting as well as support financial/analytical reporting requirements.


Responsibilities:
  • Leading the daily activities of the Commercial/ISC Reporting team (Reports and BI Development stream): defining, creating, developing, and delivering the set of reports and dashboards agreed with the business.
  • Leading the set-up, stabilization, and further improvement of the FP&A Reporting Team.
  • Leading the process of the team’s growth, while keeping delivering towards business based on the agreements made earlier.
  • Defining and keeping an up-to-date set of skills/knowledge required for the team, address workforce planning needs and timely address new hiring requirements.
  • Monitoring and assessing the performance of the team members in achieving the goals formulated.

About 50% of your time would be dedicated to hands-on activities:

  • Establishing a strong collaboration with Information Management, experts on Master Data, SAP experts, Finance.
  • Delivering for the set of reports/dashboards that should become available to the end-users based on the roadmap/planning.
  • Following the roadmap of the reports/BI/SAP Analytics Cloud developments and constantly monitoring and reporting on the status of the progress.
  • Monitoring and assessing the standards applied for reports/dashboards development.
  • Monitoring the delivery of services vs. the standard level agreement and progress of the development/maintenance activities vs. the workload/budget.

Implementing the vision for standardized and automated global harmonized:

  • Acting as a service provider towards Finance/Business.
  • Keeping delivery scope within the agreed constraints (time/scope/budget).

Securing the periodic creation, delivering of harmonized reporting and maintenance against the agreed timelines, quality service levels and within agreed budgets.

  • Setting up an efficient support team environment to process and handle requests from business and end-users.


Job Requirements:

  • Management experience with 5+ years within finance management reporting areas.
  • Experience in hiring a team and delivering a strong, knowledgeable and successful team.
  • Master degree in Finance, ICT or Business (i.e. MBA) or equivalent.
  • Strategic and tactical thinking with strong business analytical skills.
  • Ability to analyze and assimilate data for critical business decisions in a timely manner while managing multiple priorities simultaneously.
  • Ability to communicate effectively across all layers in the organization, within a matrix environment.
  • Highly preferred: previous experience in setting up and managing a reporting center or equivalent departments with a global finance scope to deliver significant improvement in efficiency in the reporting processes.
  • Demonstrated success in managing complex projects with proven capability of analyzing complex processes and issues resulting in an efficient and successful resolution.


Perks & Benefits:

  • Fresh Fruits.
  • Team Building Events.
  • Learning Cafeteria (incl. Percipio).
  • Recognition.
  • CSR Initiatives.
  • Gift Cards
  • Luxmed.
  • MultiSport.
  • Additional Insurance.


In the ongoing period, we absolutely must take care of our employees, candidates, and society.

 

While implementing recommendations to counteract the coronavirus pandemic - we stayed at home, and we are asking you to do the same.

 

We want to assure you that this will not have any impact on the current and future recruitment processes in our company.

 

Almost nothing will change except for the form of our meetings. We will talk online, not in person. Thankfully, modern technology allows us to carry out a full-fledged recruitment process without compromising anyone's health.

 

So if you were wondering whether to apply, you already know – apply

Company Description

As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description And Responsibilities

This year we are launching our FinTech Future Leaders initiative! A brand new two-year graduate programme with structured rotations across the breadth of our business. You’ll develop skills your consulting and sales skills, experience how we develop and market products, and create strategies to promote Visa’s trailblazing technologies to our clients.

We Offer Four Distinct Rotations

  • Account management and consulting
  • Marketing and strategy
  • Product development
  • Technology immersion

    • To help you succeed, we’ll provide a full training curricular delivered over across a mix of classroom based and digital learning experiences. We’ll progress your business acumen, and support the development of soft skills in networking, executive presence and personal brand. You’ll receive meaningful exposure to senior leaders and social events with your fellow graduates. Our goal is to unleash your full potential with the world of opportunity Visa can offer at your fingertips.

    Qualifications

    Visa Europe is home to a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. Are campaign YOUniqueness, Accepted Everywhere is all about allowing our graduates to unleash the talent and potential that is uniquely their own. We’re looking for the next generation of change-agents – dreamers and creatives - who are fascinated by new technology and want to be empowered to change the way business is done.

    Therefore, Our Requirements Are Few
    • Current university student graduating in 2020 or who graduated in 2019, ready to start full-time work in Autumn 2020
    • Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s degree
    • Must speak Polish fluenty
    • Strong appetite for learning about technology and customers
    • Passionate about what you do and fired up about the opportunity to change the way the world pays
    • Creative with a unique point of view and perspective
    • Possess a high level of professionalism and leadership skills to build business relationships, trust and respect with business partners and suppliers
    • Strong team player, self-motivated and the ability to work independently at coordinating cross functional activities, obtain buy-in and elevate issues appropriately
    Please submit application in English

    Additional Information

    Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Traffic Specialist (retargeting) (Warszawa, 3348508)
Numer referencyjny: KCH/001/jobs.pl

Jako Traffic Specialist Będziesz
  • tworzyć i optymalizować kampanie reklamowe Google Ads i Facebook,
  • odpowiadać za jakość techniczną i zgodność materiałów reklamowych potrzebnych do realizacji nadchodzących kampanii online
  • mieć wpływ na ofertę reklamy digital na platformie marketingowej
  • analizować i raportować efekty kampanii reklamowych,
  • testować funkcjonalności Adservera oraz wdrażać nowe rozwiązania,
  • rozwiązywać fascynujące zagadki techniczne kodów reklamowych z globalnym działem IT,
  • analizować i identyfikować obszarów do ulepszenia danych, procesów i narzędzi.

Aplikuj Do Nas, Jeśli
  • posiadasz minimum roczne doświadczenie zawodowe w dziale traffic po stronie wydawcy, domu mediowego lub agencji interaktywnej,
  • znasz narzędzia takie jak: Adobe Analytics (Omniture), Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Firebase, Google Play Console, Google Tag Manager w zakresie implementacji i raportowania, Excel,
  • znasz HTML i Javascript,
  • Twoją mocną stroną są umiejętności analityczne, organizacyjne oraz efektywne zarządzanie czasem pracy,
  • jesteś osobą skrupulatną i dokładną,
  • wyróżnia Cię komunikatywność, samodzielność oraz umiejętności rozwiązywania problemów,
  • posiadasz bardzo dobrą znajomość języka angielskiego.

Oferujemy
  • Udział w jednym z najciekawszych projektów branży online zarówno w Polsce jak i w skali globalnej
  • Atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie
  • Możliwość zdobycia doświadczenia w obszarze reklamy internetowej
  • Samodzielne stanowisko z możliwością rozwoju w kierunku roli Team Leadera
  • Ciągły rozwój zawodowy oraz możliwość podnoszenia kwalifikacji, dostęp do bogatej oferty szkoleń kompetencyjnych
  • Przyjazną atmosferę pracy

Prosimy o dopisanie następującej klauzuli: „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie podanych przeze mnie danych osobowych zawartych w aplikacji dla potrzeb niezbędnych do realizacji procesu rekrutacji zgodnie z Rozporządzeniem Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (RODO). Jednocześnie oświadczam, iż zapoznałem się informacjami administratora o przetwarzaniu danych oraz z prawami jakie przysługują mi na mocy powyższego Rozporządzenia."

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Staffing & Recruiting Financial Services

whole_unnormalized_body:
Oriflame is now looking for a Global Supply Planning Senior Manager to further strengthen our Global Planning team based in Warsaw.

Key area of focus for your role is assuring exceptional customer satisfaction, high service levels and healthy stock levels, considering optimal total supply chain cost and highest quality work standards. You will be responsible for driving value with continuous improvements of planning business processes. You will own all Distribution/Supply Planning business processes and lead change with experimenting and innovative approach. Being member of Global Planning Management, you will assure strategic alignment of initiatives and projects in Global Planning portfolio and maximize their contribution to Oriflame growth drivers. Your role will be also to act as a center on knowledge, assuring best practice sharing between Global Planning and other departments. You need to act as mentor and role model to Global Planning team members, embracing Oriflame values every day.

Your Responsibilities
  • Responsible for team management, ensuring all required tools, knowledge and proper budget and time allocation are available for all team members to work with highest standards. Ensuring permanent staffing and leading succession planning process.
  • Providing regular feedback and coaching, acting as a mentor to the team. Motivating the team and creating environment of continuous improvement. Driving development plans and IPM process.
  • Being face of Global Supply Chain in contacts with Global and Regional departments, reinforcing customer-oriented and Supply Chain conscious approach across the organization.
  • Keep track of service and inventory KPIs, ensure high customer satisfaction scores, embrace role of OFR and OTIF KPI Coordinators.
  • Shaping collaboration with Regional Operations and Commercial functions, as well as Global Commercial Division departments, defining standards, escalation paths and communication process, supporting creation of long-term plans for product availability improvement and supply chain development.
  • Driving communication within Global Planning team, aiming to set clear priorites for availability and service risk situations. Decision making over prioritization.
  • Providing inputs to Management and global and regional stakeholders on critical availability situations and escalating severe risks, supporting with overseeing comprehensive mitigation plans creation.
  • Providing inputs to Global Supply Chain strategy and Global Planning plans, creating vision for the team, translated into team targets and lower level individual goals.
  • Acting as owner of Global Distribution/Supply Planning Processes, ensuring all are up to date and aligned with other functions processes where required.
  • Drive innovation and be a natural change agent within Global Supply Chain and Global Commercial Division functions. Manage change initiatives/projects.
  • Actively supporting creation and animation of Global Supply Chain Centres of Excellence with focus on Digital Supply Chain initiatives.
In the role of Senior Manager in Global Planning, you will be playing an important role within Global Supply Chain. To be successful in this role you will need to possess people leadership skills, strong customer focus mindset and being keen on driving improvements. You need to be able to mix operational mindset with strategic vision. As a person, you get motivated by team members’ accomplishments and seeing people grow, you are keen on mentoring. The work environment is fast moving and entrepreneurial. Constant change is common state, plans are frequently adjusted, and you need to be flexible, adopt quickly and make on point decisions in critical situations. You need to know business needs and sense the momentum, while realizing Oriflame strategy with your actions. You need to understand Oriflame strategy and be able to translate it into good business decisions and ambitious team goals. You have to manage change process effectively and inspire people to change and grow. You must be resistant to pressure and be able to drive though discussions. You need to take quick actions when necessary and represent your team on cross-functional forum. With your positive mind-set, you always see the bright aspects of a situation and bounce back quickly from eventual setbacks. You enjoy this role if you like working with people, mentoring and changes and challenges do not intimidate you.

Qualification & Experience
  • Educational degree: Graduate degree in Supply Chain or similar
  • Minimum of 5 years experience in a Supply Chain or associated area, ideally within FMCG, planning funcions are preferable - People Management experience is required (2-3 years)
  • Leading cross-funcional collaboration experience is required
  • Experience in Project Management is an advantage
  • Proven motivational skills
  • Excellent leadership and communication skills
  • Process orientated with a strong team approach
  • Passionate for constant improvement and strategy development
  • Fluency in English is a must
  • Experience with JDA or other DRP/MRP software is an advantage
What we offer?

Working at Oriflame means working in a global company defined by a dynamic culture, meaningful work and professional growth; this is what we offer our employees. As an employer we demand a lot of our people, but we also empower them to live up to their challenges, to have an entrepreneurial spirit and to deliver on our brand promise. And, importantly, we recognize their efforts and reward their achievements.

What Is More
  • Modern office with positive energy
  • Work in a modern beauty company with an entrepreneurial spirit
  • Job in a fast pace organization with colleagues from all over the world
  • Free health care
  • Cafeteria system
  • Life insurance program
  • Oriflame products – we want our employees to be our best ambassadors
  • Unlimited access to our wellness products – keep your body healthy with us
Is this the perfect match for you?

Please apply as soon as possible via the link below and attach your CV in English. We screen the applications continuously.

position: Citi Private Bank Investment Operations Analyst
whole_unnormalized_body:
Citi Private Bank is one of the largest private banking businesses in the world, provides professional wealth management services for 26,000 clients globally, including a third of the world’s billionaires, operating in 60 offices in more than 30 countries.

Citi Private Bank offers unmatched global reach, coupled with a full range of portfolio management and investment advisory services, an array of structured lending and banking services, as well as expertise from Citi's Markets and Banking division.

Citi Private Bank Investment Operations Analyst is the intermediate level position within EMEA Private Bank Investment Operations, which provides operational support to Private Bank Investment Business covering products like: Traditional Investments, Mutual and Alternative Investment Funds, Equities, Fixed income, Foreign exchange, Derivatives and Structured products.

The overall objective of this role is to process and monitor execution, settlement of transactions, maintain the records on client accounts, assess, analyze and/or evaluate processes and data as well as reference data management such as securities creation/maintenance and asset pricing function.

Job Responsibilities Include
  • Processing, verification and record keeping for investment products based on the provided documentation/instruction
  • Support Investment Operations in daily activities
  • Investigating discrepancies and ensuring strong internal controls
  • Identifying inconsistencies in the process and mitigating risks in a timely and efficient manner
  • Maintaining communication and relations with internal and external key stakeholders from multiple locations
  • Contributing to the completion and maintenance of procedures and SLA
  • Participation and coordination of the UAT test for new systems / products or functionalities
  • Contributing to business goals
  • Being responsible for a variety of complex tasks

If You Are a Motivated, Dedicated Person Who
  • Has Bachelor’s Degree/University degree or equivalent professional experience in Business, Accounting, or Finance
  • Understands Investment Products and Financial Markets
  • Has a very good command of English
  • Has the ability to learn quickly and is willing to acquire new skills
  • Has strong Microsoft Excel skills, beneficial with VBA experience
  • Is a Team Player
  • Is able to work in a fast-paced environment
If you match our profile, don’t hesitate to apply. Let’s work together to develop a career for you in Citi.

We Offer
  • Stable employment on the basis of full-time job contract
  • Opportunity for professional development with access to unlimited number of various trainings
  • Excellent global career growth opportunities
  • Attractive benefits package (Medicover, Multisport, private pension plan, life insurance etc.)
  • Possibility to work remotely
  • Supportive and friendly team mates and managers
  • International and multicultural work environment with opportunity to use English every day
  • Prestigious office location in center of Warsaw (next to Rondo Daszyńskiego)

    • Grade :All Job Level - All Job FunctionsAll Job Level - All Job Functions - PL


    • Time Type

position: International Benefits and Pension Program Manager
whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

International Benefits and Pension Program Manager
Amazon strives to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover virtually anything they want to buy online. By giving customers more of what they want - low prices, vast selection, and convenience - Amazon continues to grow and evolve as a world-class e-commerce platform. Amazon's evolution from Web site to e-commerce partner to development platform is driven by the spirit of innovation that is part of the company's DNA. The world's brightest technology minds come to Amazon to research and develop technology that improves the lives of shoppers and sellers around the world.

Amazon is seeking an experienced Benefits and Pension Support Specialist to join our Global Benefits Support Specialist Team within the Human Resources organization. This role will partner extensively with internal stakeholders and external partners to develop and execute against a multi-year roadmap for benefit administration support across Amazon’s EMEA region. As an individual contributor, strong project management skills are critical to this role, as well as proven abilities to help design and implement tools/processes and/or data collection mechanisms and generate reporting. The ideal candidate will be able to work independently, will be innovative, an effective communicator, have a desire to participate in change, and appreciate a dynamic environment with rapidly changing priorities. We are seeking someone with a demonstrated history of successfully owning and managing large, complex problems and engaging with cross-functional teams, and numerous stakeholders, directly and through influence.

Core Responsibilities
Project Management: Responsible for transition of existing and launch of new benefits and pension administration processes/programs across EMEA. Standardizing processes across EMEA based on local plans, regulations and requirements; aligning recommended processes with IT solutions (for example, Benefits tool); and facilitating approval from stakeholders. Responsible for supporting cyclical benefits and pension events and activities, such as enrolments, renewals, reporting and reconciliation.

Continuous Improvement: Own overall service quality at process level. Define and monitor benefit and pension administration critical to quality (CTQs) metrics, perform root cause analysis on defects and implement remediation; own continuous improvement strategy.

Customer Service: Manage employee escalations, exceptions and appeals and provide advice and monitor resolution on full range of benefit and pension related topics.

Vendor and Audit Management: Manage outside vendors performing benefit administration services for Amazon. Certify periodic audits. Work closely with a local HR team, payroll, HR Shared Services, providers and vendors ensuring that the benefits administration is delivered consistently, and in line with contract/legal requirements.

Flexible Location: Czech Republic, Poland, Slovakia, Romania


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, HR or related field
  • 6+ years of relevant project and program management experience
  • Fluent in English
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve program success through influence and partnership from design to delivering of initiatives
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills with ability to interface with all levels of the organization and demonstrated ability to influence decision makers
  • Deep understanding and experience in delivering high levels of customer service
  • Highly organized, able to prioritize and work under pressure on a number of projects/initiatives at the same time in a rapidly growing environment
  • Strong data analysis skills; the ability to extract and synthesize data in order to make data-backed business decisions
  • Ability to develop ad-hoc reporting to meet specific business needs and inquiries
  • Successful record of building operational processes and procedures, continuously improving programs and efficiencies
Periodic Global business travel may be required.

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience managing large-scale employee benefit or pension administration programs, associated vendor management, and program development and delivery
  • Exceptional analytical skills, including proven abilities in process development and data management, financial accounting, reporting, auditing and reconciliations, and strengths in reporting and communicating data and trends to business leaders

Company - AMZN Dev Cntr Poland sp. z.o.o
Job ID: A1108129

position: Global Security Manager – Europe and Africa GLOBAL SECURITY CONSULTANT – Europe and Africa
whole_unnormalized_body:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.

GLOBAL SECURITY CONSULTANT – Europe and Africa

Position Title: Global Security Manager – Europe and Africa

Position Level: P4

Position Number: TBD

Reports to: Director, Global Security

Position Type: Full time

Leading Candidate: No

Travel: 40%

Purpose: The primary function of this position is to perform various activities supporting the Global Security Department’s mission. The leader in this position will be responsible for assisting in the development, execution, and maintenance of the security strategy for Latin America. This role will be strategic and operational in providing security relative to the physical security of employees and the protection of brand, product, and assets. The position will be responsible for site security assessments, general investigations, work place violence issues, crisis planning and mitigation response strategies, product protection investigations, site security operations for employees and affiliates, and other global focus areas as needed for Europe and Africa.

Location: Elanco Solutions Center Warsaw, Poland

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables
  • Performs site security assessments, risk assessments, supports employee and affiliate meetings, conducts investigations, assists with meeting planning security, provides executive security, creates travel advisories, protects assets and delivers other security functions as needed across Europe and Africa region.
  • This role supports regional business offices and staff to ensure the security of staff, assets and operations across the region. The role is engaged in the development and management of security measures supporting new and existing Elanco facilities.
  • Assist with development and deployment of security policies, procedures, standards, and training.
  • Designs and maintains Access Control, CCTV surveillance systems, and deploys state of the art technology solutions and innovative security management techniques to safeguard the Europe and Africa assets.
  • Daily monitoring and analysis of security bulletins, reports, and news media concerning global political crisis issues to include terrorism that could affect Elanco Europe and Africa operations or personnel.
  • Serves as the primary resource to company management on matters affecting the security of affiliates and the protection of physical assets, personnel, facilities, operations, and brand equity in Europe and Africa. Serves as the intermediary between Global Security HQ and the field.
  • Identifies significant security risks, designs and implements strategies and programs to prevent and reduce loss of the organization's assets.
  • Coordinates and implements site security, operations and activities to ensure protection of executives, managers, employees, physical assets, intellectual properties and information assets, while ensuring optimal use of personnel and equipment.
  • Provides Ex Pat security planning as necessary.
  • Establish and maintain productive relationships with internal partners in Human Resources; Legal; Facilities Management; Health, Safety and Environment, Ethics and Compliance; and others
  • Provides investigative support and expertise to the Europe and Africa business specifically HR, Legal, and Facilities Management, Ethics and Compliance, and Health, Safety, and Environment. Provides investigative support for product diversion and anti-counterfeit investigations.
  • Establish and maintain effective liaison with law enforcement, U.S. and foreign government agencies concerning executive security. Establish contacts with other security professionals and professional organizations.
  • Provide support as a member of emergency and crisis management teams for emergencies during normal business hours and after hours for sites within Europe and Africa.
  • Develops a consensus position within an organization climate of diverse operational activities and often-conflicting regulations imposed by agencies and countries with regulatory jurisdiction.
  • Proven ability to be agile and make time critical risk based decisions with minimal information and oversight.
  • Requires a motivated, independent, well organized, security professional who takes initiative as the sole security resource in region.
  • This role will need to create and continue key relationships within region (VP, Senior VP of Region and Country General Managers) and with in-country leadership (Site Leadership)
  • Affect change via relational influence of local leaders and serve as key security contact and adviser for region.

Requirements

 Minimum Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s Degree or Professional Degree in an area of study relevant to this position
  • Minimum of 8 years federal, state, or local law enforcement experience or minimum of 10 years international security experience in private or public service sector.
  • Professional certification preferred
  • Candidate must read, write, and speak fluent English. Fluent or conversational in German preferred.
  • Proven analytical, problem solving, and collaborative communication skills
  • Ability to work across cultures and across diverse management styles
  • Ability to travel internationally and extensively within Europe and Africa. Previous experience traveling in Europe and Africa in a professional capacity preferred
  • Ability to lead and conduct complicated investigations with the ability to collect and analyze data from multiple sources, formulate well-founded conclusions, and present valid recommendations in a clear and concise manner
  • Ability to work in highly collaborative environment
  • Must be innovative and independent, able to manage a workload in a high performing environment
  • Ability to work outside of normal daytime work hours if needed
  • On call status is required of all security positions to be available and respond to urgent and emergency events
Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

Dane dotyczące wymagań

 Opis wymagań: Wymagane wykształcenie zasadnicze zawodowe oraz 5 letnie doswiadczenie zawodowe.Introligator poligraficzny [Zgłoszenia: biuro@druknr1.pl, 575 436 525]

Wykształcenie: konieczne zasadnicze zawodowe-

Dane Pracodawcy

 Nazwa Pracodawcy: DRUKARNIA NR 1 PRZEDSIĘBIORSTWO PAŃSTWOWE

NIP Pracodawcy: 5250010189

Adres siedziby: 02-521 Warszawa, ul.Rakowiecka 37, dzielnica: Mokotów

Adres wykonywania pracy: 03-016 Warszawa, ul.Ciupagi 1, dzielnica: Białołęka

Dane Kontaktowe

 Adres do kontaktu: 03-016 Warszawa, ul.Ciupagi 1

Preferowana Forma Kontaktu
  • Telefon kontaktowy: 796 115 665

  • e-mail: biuro@druknr1.pl
    •

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Relevant experience (e.g., technical writing, product documentation, or online publishing).
  • Experience with writing technical customer-facing materials.
  • Experience with source code written in Java, C++, Python and/or JavaScript.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience working in teams committing code and working with version control.
  • Working technical knowledge of a cloud technology platform.
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity, support multiple projects, and meet deadlines in a fluid environment.


About The Job

Technical writers communicate complex information clearly, concisely and accurately, and without relying on jargon. As a technical writer, your role involves tasks such as writing conceptual overviews and procedures, reading and writing example code, or updating help center queries and FAQs. Technical writers play a big part at Google. They are a key link between engineers, marketing associates, developer advocates, as well as all the external users and developers, tying together many vital but disparate parts of the Google ecosystem.

Technical Writers take complex information and communicate it clearly, concisely and accurately without relying on technical or corporate jargon. With a unique cross-functional perspective, our team of Technical Writers are the key link between our engineers, marketing associates, developer advocates, and external developers who build apps with Google Cloud.

As a Technical Writer, you juggle a variety of responsibilities, including managing and leading documentation projects, testing and reviewing features and code, updating API reference documentation, and creating new developer guides that teach developers how to use Compute Engine.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

Responsibilities
  • Write technical documentation for our external developer audience, such as API references and developer guides.
  • Design and organize documentation sets for new APIs and developer products.
  • Edit, clarify, and proofread documents written by others, and coach non-writers on ways to improve their writing skills.
  • Supplement developer documentation for Cloud APIs and Cloud products with relevant sample codes.
  • Work with a global team of engineers, product teams, and other technical writers. Support and grow the technical writing team in Poland.

At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

Investment Associate /Senior Associate
  • Well know real estate developer
  • Financial Modeling, ROI, DCF, cash flow, support in business decissions
    • About Our Client
    For an our Client, fast growing real estate company, well known brand on the market, currently because of development we are looking for Investment Associate / Senior Associate based in Warsaw who will direct support all stages in finding, analyzing and making all models for buy or sell process of properties.

    Job Description
    • Execution - provide support to Real Estate Investment Team to ensure timely and efficient execution of transactions,
    • Analysis of investment proposals, preparation of the underwriting model and any other materials as per the request of the particular Client
    • Provide accurate financial models, complex cash flow modeling, for both asset & corporate deals, and running scenario & sensitivity analyses,
    • Support the new investment approval process at all stages
    • Prepare of documents including investment memorandums, presentations and project teasers,
    • Prepare investment proposals and briefs, marketing documents for transactions such as pitch books, investor reports, and bespoke investors presentations,
    • Support the divestment process at all stages,
    • Prepare historical performance models,
    • Work closely with the Asset Management Department, the Finance Department and the Research Department when preparing investment proposals and internal documents,
    • Direct cooperation with CFO,
    The Successful Applicant
    • Master degree (or equivalent) in Economics, Finance or Investment Management,
    • Previous experience in the real estate industry (BIG4 - corporate finance, transaction advisory) or PE Funds, buy side or sell side experience,
    • 3-4 years of relevant work experience, independency
    • Experience in financial modeling is a must
    • Strong analytical skills
    • Very good oral and written communication skills in English
    • Strong organizational, time management, communication and multi-tasking skills
    • Excellent MS Excel- very importnat, MS Word and MS PowerPoint
    • Ability to work independently
    • Ability to interact with senior executives
    • Business-driven personality
    • Attention to detail

    What's On Offer
    • Performance-based financial remuneration (attractive base salary according to experience and market conditions) based on b2b contract
    • An interesting job in a dynamic environment in very fast growing company
    • Extensive space for personal development
    • Exposure to senior level executives
    • Wide exposure to real estate investment management
    Contact: Michal Opiola

whole_unnormalized_body:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook is seeking a strong sales and marketing professional to help build and sell Facebook’s advertising solutions. This role will establish and expand relationships with new clients, and continue to cultivate and grow relationships with strategic clients. With proven understanding of both online and traditional media, this role will align with an Account Manager and counterparts within the Sales organization, to develop industry-specific marketing relationships and drive revenue by negotiating and optimizing complex opportunities with strategic clients. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in selling cross-network marketing solutions to multichannel advertisers. Having experience managing both brand and performance based campaigns, expertise in brand and performance based advertising products, and ability to leverage data and analytics to improve performance for digital campaigns is required. Client Partners must have strong consultative sales and analytical skills; thrive in a collaborative and innovative environment, and have a passion for Facebook. Success in this position will require a proven ability to reach and influence executive level customers, ecosystem partners (PMD's and Agencies), close new business, and provide holistic marketing solutions.

Responsibilities
  • Serve as an industry thought leader in social media and digital advertising in order to drive vertical and client success leveraging Facebook’s ongoing product and technology developments
  • Develop and actively manage short and long term account plans based on client brand and direct response marketing objectives
  • Accurately and effectively manage sales pipeline in order to prioritize business opportunities and resources
  • Develop and broaden high-level collaborative relationships, including understanding and identifying contacts that manage multiple budget, (brand, DR etc.) and close large deals with up to 20 major customers
  • Create and present needs-based solutions and high quality answers to RFPs
  • Reach and exceed sales quotas while contributing to overall vertical and team goals
  • Create and deliver consultative sales presentations using industry knowledge, market trends, and Facebook marketing solutions
  • Exhibit executive presence and confidence in presenting Facebook on the market, industry, C-suite executives & beyond
  • Partner with other vertical teams on structuring and executing operational and strategic initiatives - developing work plans, synthesizing market related data, leading analysis and defining the overall business approach
  • Methodic coordination & communication across the various entities (PMD, agency, direct client teams)
Minimum Qualification
  • Marketing, Brand Advertising, Direct Response, Media Sales and/or Online Advertising experience
  • Proven track record of successfully reaching and exceeding sales revenue goals through consultative sell
  • Fluency in English and native/professional proficiency in Czech

Preferred Qualification
  • Experience in a fast-paced startup, eCommerce, sales, and/or online advertising environment strongly preferred

You'll:

You'll succeed because…

…you love working with data and using it to influence decisions. You:

  • have experience in leading performance/search campaigns

You'll love it because…

…you'll get to make an impact like never before. You'll be responsible for your own projects - we can't wait to listen to your ideas. The products you help us get out there will make people's lives better. Our iconic brands will provide an incredible platform for you. And our dynamic, ownership-driven culture will help bring the very best out of you, every day.

RB is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.

JTI Poland is part of Japan Tobacco International, a leading international tobacco company. We operate in 130 countries, employ over 45,000 people worldwide and our product portfolio includes world-renowned brands such as Camel, LD, Winston and Logic, available on the Polish market.

In Poland, we employ over 2,300 employees and we are the 3rd player in the tobacco industry. Since the beginning of JTI’s operations in Poland in 2007, we have been the fastest growing tobacco company our market share has more than quadrupled and our production volume has grown more than 10 times.

But our business, isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen for our business. That’s why since 11 years JTI is one of the Top Employers in Poland, in 2020 being ranked number one for the second year in a row.

HR Administration Specialist

This is great opportunity to be a part exciting project and drive transformation in the Company to ensure that internal customers around the world a getting the Best-in-class level of service.

Our offer includes

  • A competitive pay (together with annual bonus) and an attractive benefits package including medical care, Multisport card, life insurance, pension plan
  • Ambitious goal to set up new Global Business Center
  • Complex environment of working with multiple stakeholders, professional support and possibility to share knowledge and best practices
  • On-going development opportunities in a multinational environment that will inspire you to grow professionally and personally
  • Wide variety of projects and tasks, ambitious goals and independence in achieving them
  • Dynamic and innovative spirit with a constant quest to do things better
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Modern office in a convenient location

Main areas of responsibility

  • Preparing necessary documents for employees, i.e. new hires package, employment contracts, work certificates, appendix etc.

  • Supports ad hoc projects and task as needed
  • Close working relationship with HR BP from the region

  • Systematic and efficient time management, used to work for a deadline
  • Ability to independently handle tasks and assignments
  • Effective communications skills
  • Fluent written and spoken English. Knowledge of additional languages is beneficial

Key Responsibilities:


  • Support the team in gathering, processing and consolidation of data (budget, agreement, verification).
  • Assure accurate and timely reporting of financial and operational performance.
  • Assist analyzing performance across areas, preparing inter-company benchmarking.
  • Manage budgeting process within required scope and timeline.
  • Support the team in continuous improvement of reporting and analysis by streamlining weekly processes and ensuring that the analysis meet the requirements of the business.


Skills & Experience – Required:

Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

For our Warsaw office, we are currently searching for a responsible and communicative

Receptionist

Responsibilites
  • directing and filtering calls
  • dealing with visitors - Issuing and collecting passes
  • handling of incoming and outgoing post
  • liaising with couriers
  • stationary Orders
  • travel arrangements
  • greeting, escorting and managing visitors
  • booking and coordinating meeting rooms
  • the ability to carry out admin duties, such as photocopying, filing, typing, etc.
  • assisting the Office Manager when required;
  • other duties as instructed

Requirements
  • Master’s/Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent)
  • highly developed organizational skills
  • being a good team player;
  • IT literate i.e. MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel
  • good knowledge of English
  • attention to detail
  • previous experience in marketing department will be an asset
  • experience of working in a busy reception area
  • to be punctual & reliable
  • ability to communicate efficiently
  • ability to effectively multi-task
  • ability to be flexible and to provide cover at short notice
  • ability to meet deadlines

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Coty is one of the world’s largest beauty companies with a purpose to celebrate and liberate the diversity of consumers’ beauty. With our strong entrepreneurial heritage we created an iconic portfolio of leading beauty brands, which made Coty a global leader in fragrance, strong number two in professional salon hair color & styling, and number three in color cosmetics.

We are currently recruiting for the position: Brand Manager EE

Responsibilities
  • Close cooperation with the central team and markets in the region on the implementation and adaptation of the global brand strategy
  • Sharing recommendations for new product developments to central team based on market knowledge and trend analysis
  • Monitoring of competition in terms of prices, new products launches, consumer and commercial promotions and media activities
  • Active cooperation with global team, EE marketing department authority and local agencies in the process of adaptation and creation of brand communication
  • Management of brand portfolio on local market and undertake assortment optimization activities
  • Management of P&L and media budget on local market

Requirements
  • 2-3 years of professional experience working independently o dedicated projects in the FMCG industry
  • Professional experience on international/ regional position is an advantage (coordination of work of several markets)
  • High analytical skills with focus on sharing recommendations
  • Proven experience in project planning
  • Highly developed interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong goal and team work orientation
  • Very good command of English language (both, in speaking and writing)
  • Very good and practical knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Power Point, Word)

Benefits
  • Life Insurance
  • Medical Care
  • Multisport Card
  • 1 additional day of holidays each year for birthday
  • 5 years in Coty - additional 5 days of holidays every year
  • Summer working hours and shorter working days on Friday
  • Home office
  • Quarterly package of Coty novelties products
  • Intercompany sales of Coty products
  • Fruits in the office

  • Fluent English;
  • Experience in people and process management;
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft's tools and Azure DevOps (PowerBi would be a strong asset);
  • Role Expertise;
  • Knowledge of software development;
  • Business acumen.


We Offer
  • Full-time employment contract;
  • Employee benefits package (including private medical insurance, sport card, holiday allowance, day off on your birthday, access to training platform);
  • Professional development opportunities in a multi-cultural environment - Lionbridge has offices in over 20 countries and many of these offices work collaboratively on projects, exposing our employees to a wide range of cultures and work styles;
  • Ability to cope with latest technologies;
  • Brand new office near city rail, car and bike parking;
  • Work in a creative team and friendly environment.


We kindly inform that Lionbridge reserves right to contact only selected candidates.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Aim Of The Role

Coordinate work within a dedicated account or group of accounts. Manage resource allocation, ensure timely delivery and quality of the final product.

Responsibilities
  • Accountable for managing the Testers (recruitment, induction, task allocation, performance management, etc.);
  • Direct contact with customer stakeholders;
  • Analyzing and estimating efforts for quotes;
  • Analyzing handoffs for completeness;
  • Query and schedule management;
  • Managing outsourcing;
  • Creating project instructions and checklist;
  • Keeping Technical related account documentation up to date;
  • Tracking project progress and keeping necessary stakeholders informed;
  • Accountability for Quality and On Time Delivery of the project;
  • The Test Lead must exercise discretion and independent judgement when providing analysis, estimates and services to the client;
  • Performing other tasks which are crucial for projects to run properly according to instructions of the director; in particular timely performance of duties defined for other positions.


Requirements
  • College degree or similar in relevant field, technical skills with knowledge of relevant tools/technologies;

whole_unnormalized_body:
Traffic Specialist (retargeting) (Warszawa, 3349500)
Numer referencyjny: KCH/001/jobs.pl

Jako Traffic Specialist Będziesz
  • tworzyć i optymalizować kampanie reklamowe Google Ads i Facebook,
  • odpowiadać za jakość techniczną i zgodność materiałów reklamowych potrzebnych do realizacji nadchodzących kampanii online
  • mieć wpływ na ofertę reklamy digital na platformie marketingowej
  • analizować i raportować efekty kampanii reklamowych,
  • testować funkcjonalności Adservera oraz wdrażać nowe rozwiązania,
  • rozwiązywać fascynujące zagadki techniczne kodów reklamowych z globalnym działem IT,
  • analizować i identyfikować obszarów do ulepszenia danych, procesów i narzędzi.

Aplikuj Do Nas, Jeśli
  • posiadasz minimum roczne doświadczenie zawodowe w dziale traffic po stronie wydawcy, domu mediowego lub agencji interaktywnej,
  • znasz narzędzia takie jak: Adobe Analytics (Omniture), Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Firebase, Google Play Console, Google Tag Manager w zakresie implementacji i raportowania, Excel,
  • znasz HTML i Javascript,
  • Twoją mocną stroną są umiejętności analityczne, organizacyjne oraz efektywne zarządzanie czasem pracy,
  • jesteś osobą skrupulatną i dokładną,
  • wyróżnia Cię komunikatywność, samodzielność oraz umiejętności rozwiązywania problemów,
  • posiadasz bardzo dobrą znajomość języka angielskiego.

Oferujemy
  • Udział w jednym z najciekawszych projektów branży online zarówno w Polsce jak i w skali globalnej
  • Atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie
  • Możliwość zdobycia doświadczenia w obszarze reklamy internetowej
  • Samodzielne stanowisko z możliwością rozwoju w kierunku roli Team Leadera
  • Ciągły rozwój zawodowy oraz możliwość podnoszenia kwalifikacji, dostęp do bogatej oferty szkoleń kompetencyjnych
  • Przyjazną atmosferę pracy

Prosimy o dopisanie następującej klauzuli: „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie podanych przeze mnie danych osobowych zawartych w aplikacji dla potrzeb niezbędnych do realizacji procesu rekrutacji zgodnie z Rozporządzeniem Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (RODO). Jednocześnie oświadczam, iż zapoznałem się informacjami administratora o przetwarzaniu danych oraz z prawami jakie przysługują mi na mocy powyższego Rozporządzenia."

position: CIB F&BM Global Program Management EMEA - International Regulatory
whole_unnormalized_body:
J.P. Morgan Poland Services sp. z o.o.

CIB F&BM Global Program Management EMEA - International Regulatory – Data Provisioning Business Analyst – Associate

Job Description

Outline of Role

Purpose: CIB Data Provisioning Business Analyst role within International Regulatory Projects, working as part of a team carrying out data and coverage analysis on attributions of financial products across Global Regulatory Reporting Platforms for new Mandatory and Business driven projects and providing support to Global CIB stakeholders in relation to data sourcing activities

Priorities & Key Outputs
  • Documentation and delivery of Comprehensive attribution analysis results and presenting this to stakeholders across multiple project deliverables
  • Conducting gap analysis and partnering with stakeholders to deliver risk adverse client solutions
  • Carry out ad hoc investigations for financial data related queries from multiple stakeholder
  • Documentation, User Acceptance Testing and implementation for project and release management activities
  • Providing review and sign off of project business analysis requirements
  • Big Data reconciliation using Tableau and generation of summary report for presentation to stakeholders
  • Timely escalation of issues and risks to the Project Manager ensuring robust risk mitigation strategies
  • Participate in meetings ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones, following proper escalation paths and managing customer relationships


Relationships
  • Develop excellent working relationship with technology teams
  • Develop excellent working relationships with the business and all stakeholders


Technical Skills & Knowledge
  • Good knowledge and understanding of Financial products: Loans, Deposit, Commitment, Cash
  • Good knowledge and understanding of Reference data: Fixed Income securities, Equities and Derivatives, interest rates, pricing, currency, country, regulatory, client and account data
  • A detailed understanding of the End to End Project Life Cycle including documentation, testing and implementation
  • Accounting background (beneficial but not essential)
  • Excellent verbal and written skills, and the ability to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Good analytical skills and able to perform detailed data and coverage analysis
  • Some level of SQL database knowledge
  • Strong skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
  • Business analysis skills
  • Collaborating with business users and technology partners at all levels.


Experience Must Include
  • Experience as Business Analyst in related financial domains
  • Good understanding of the Project Lifecycle
  • Experience of Agile methodology
  • Ability to work as a team player and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.


Competencies
  • Demonstrates Initiative
  • Self motivating
  • Negotiation skills
  • Ability to articulate risks versus rewards surrounding project dynamics
  • Clear and concise written / oral communication skills
  • Deadline focussed
  • Cooperation and Teamwork
  • Judgement – Analyse problems skilfully, uses logic to reach solutions
  • Maintain High Standards in Quality of Work
  • Supports Diversity


Qualifications

By experience

Degree preferred

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, offering solutions to the world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions in more than 100 countries. We have a sophisticated local market presence in Europe, Middle East and Africa which is complemented by staff around the world who support our growth and serve our clients 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. We are excited to expand our team in Poland and we’re looking for collaborative, innovative and dedicated individuals to join us in our new corporate centre in Warsaw. Bring us your expertise and you’ll be part of a global community, working with people around the world and with a company that’s committed to investing in you and making a success of this key new location for our business.

To be considered for this role, you may be required to complete the video interview powered By HireVue.

Corporate & Investment Bank

The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package. JPMorgan Chase & Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.

At AstraZeneca we are guided in our work by a strong set of values, and we're resetting expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. By truly following the science, we pioneer new methods, new thinking and bring unexpected teams together. From scientists to sales, lab techs to legal, we're on a mission to turn ideas into life-changing medicines that transform lives. We need great people who share our passion for science and have the drive and determination to meet the unmet needs of patients around the world. If you're swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you're our kind of person.

The Associate Data Management Leader is an entry level/training role in Clinical Data Management. Under the direction of an experienced Clinical Data Manager, ADML provides support as directed in the execution DM deliverables for a study during study start-up, study conduct and study close-out.

Typical Accountabilities

Under careful directions of an experienced Global Data Management Leader, duties include training and practicing in the following areas:
  • Identifying and resolving issues related to DM deliverables by developing solutions
  • Become knowledgeable about AZ and industry DM processes and standards, based on industry best practices
  • Support activities against established DM timelines to ensure all DM Deliverables are delivered on time with the highest degree of quality for assigned studies under the guidance of an experience CRDM
  • Works with vendors on query management under the guidance of an experience CRDM

Requirements
  • Minimum of a BS in life science or computer science degree
  • Entry level of Clinical Research Data Management experience in the Biotech/Pharma/CRO industry
  • Willingness to learn GCP, GCDMP and regulatory requirements as they relate to data management systems and activities
  • Ability to work under direction and close supervision in a global team environment
  • Good written and verbal communication skills - in English as well
  • Good problem and conflict solving skills; high attention to detail and accuracy; good organizational and analytical skills
  • Knowledge of clinical and pharmaceutical drug development process and database structures, data standards (CDISC) and practices as they apply to CRF design, database development, data handling and reporting
  • Some knowledge of clinical data system design/development/validation and system interoperability

whole_unnormalized_body:
Informacje o Projekcie
  • Branża: Certyfikacje
  • Rodzaj projektu: obsługa klienta
  • Lokalizacja: Warszawa/Wola
  • Harmonogram pracy: praca od poniedziałku do piątku (8h - elastyczne godziny pracy)
  • Wymagany język angielski C1
  • Wynagrodzenie: 7000-8000 pln brutto

Client Planning Advisor

Zakres Projektu
  • Kontakt z klientami wewnętrznymi i zewnętrznymi
  • Budowanie relacji z klientami i współpracownikami
  • Wsparcie planu strategicznego firmy
  • Osiąganie i przekraczanie określonych wskaźników KPI
  • Priorytetyzacja zadań
  • Optymalizacja rozwiązań

Wymagania Dotyczące Kompetencji
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość Excela
  • Biegła znajomość języka angielskiego (C1)

position: Centralized Monitoring Analyst (programming in R experience)
whole_unnormalized_body:
The Centralized Monitoring Analyst (CMA) provides studies with Centralized Monitoring service in order to enable Risk-Based Monitoring, ensure data quality and protect patient's rights

The Analyst will execute the centralized monitoring service for assigned studies using his programming skills. The Analyst will work based on monitoring plan engaging Therapy Area Leads when needed.



The Analyst will ensure that risk indicators to be monitored by centralized monitoring according to monitoring plan are correctly set up in centralized monitoring systems. Additionally throughout the duration of a study the analyst will be assessing the logical correctness of the monitoring action requests delivered to study monitors, study level information delivered to the study team and other information recipients. Additionally, ad-hoc report creation and data analysis throughout the study

is expected.

Candidate Focus & Challenge

  • Study-specific set-up of the centralized monitoring system based on monitoring plan in cooperation with the Therapyarea Lead including:
    • Cross-study reporting to Clinical Operations Leadership
    • Study level reporting to Project Teams and Study teams
    • Country level reporting to Local study Teams
    • Monitoring action requests and alerts to Monitors
  • Maintenance of the study-specific centralized monitoring system including regular checks of logical correctness of reports and actions requests
  • Change control of the centralized monitoring system
  • Communication with monitors and report recipients including training sessions and troubleshooting, follow-up of execution of assigned actions
  • Creation of ad-hoc reports including interpretation and translation of user requests into technical considerations
  • Review of data to reveal potential problems and reporting of unusual data patterns to Therapy Area Lead
  • Communication with the CM Technology Expert (CMTE) regarding system performance and improvement



Qualifications

  • Knowledge and experience in R programming is essential
  • Scientific background is advantage
  • BSc Degree or equivalent in the life sciences , technology or related discipline
  • Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of Clinical Operations technology and standards, Clinical Data Management, Monitoring practices and regulations
  • Knowledge of Risk-Based Monitoring (RBM) methodology and tools, industry trends, and role and place of
  • CM within RBM will be an advantage
  • Solid computer skills are necessary (e.g. advanced excel)
  • Previous experience from RBM and CM is an advantage
  • Good knowledge of clinical trial monitoring and Study Team processes
  • Good knowledge of clinical and pharmaceutical Drug Development Process
  • Strong focus on delivery with high quality
  • Cultural Awareness: Is aware of and sensitive to cultural differences and their impact on communication, expectations and performance.
  • Experience working internationally
  • Good spoken and written English
