whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

At Amazon, it is believed that every day is still day one.
A day to take a first step. A day to look forwards to new challenges. And today is that day for you. It's your day to be part of something great. A day to make your ideas come to life. And your day to join a company that redefines itself every day. That's the energy and passion behind Amazon. Amazon strives to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, exceptionally talented, bright and driven people are needed. Amazon is one of the most recognizable brand names in the world and distributes millions of products each year to its loyal customers.

Amazon’s overall mission is simple: to be the place where customers can find, discover and buy anything online. Whatever customers want, means to deliver it will be found. With your help, Amazon will continue to enable people to discover new worlds.
This is your chance to make history.

Client Support Services group is looking for IT Support Engineer in Warsaw to join our team.

Responsibilities
  • To provide a 1st / 2nd and 3rd line support service that ensures all IT equipment and infrastructure is running to its optimum performance and that all departmental KPIs and SLAs are met. Escalating where required. Whether it be a single end user or an IT peer the role requires the individual to support and solve all issues – no job is too big or small.
  • To draft, support, audit and move the bar with regards to standards and the corresponding documentation. Helping define processes and measures to ensure their success.
  • Project Management including acting as a single point of contact for projects, to provide technical support/input to site and team projects and initiatives. Including prioritization of workloads for both local and remote teams to ensure project delivery.
  • To act as a point of contact for contractors or external suppliers and clearly communicate technical issues and Amazon standards.
  • To audit, support and execute change management requests as required (which does include out of hours work).
  • Interact with suppliers, request quotes and purchase equipment in accordance with policies, budgets and operational demand; including all aspects of procurement and inventory management.
  • To carry out ad-hoc requests as and when required.
  • Contribute to the on call schedule for cases with critical impact.
Requirements

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

This position requires 3+ years of hands-on PC hardware, software and O/S support experience (including installation, configuration and troubleshooting) with exposure to a wide variety of products, issues and customer types. You will be the main point of contact for individuals reporting or highlighting issues with systems or equipment, with hands-on experience supporting all levels of IT infrastructure as well as Windows, Linux/Unix and Macintosh platforms.

Language Requirements

Excellent English and Polish skills

Qualifications
  • Excellent customer facing skills.
  • Strong analytical skills with demonstrated problem solving ability.
  • Previous experience in which high levels of initiative, judgment, and tact have been demonstrated.
  • In addition, you will need a proven ability to operate in extreme high pressure situations, successfully handle multiple competing priorities and possess a high level of discipline while displaying a high degree of flexibility and professionalism.
  • Must be willing to work in a fast paced and growing European and global environment where some travel maybe required.
  • Ability to develop clear, concise documentation.
  • Experience in procurement, inventory and asset management of IT equipment as well as managing the IT life cycle.
  • Superior technical aptitude, written and oral communications skills and experience and the ability to deal effectively with people at different levels and in different situations.
  • Hardware knowledge / experience - support and repair.
Technical Qualifications

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • An advanced understanding of technical issues, both hardware and software, for infrastructure (servers, networking, telephony) and end user equipment.
  • Holds an understanding of core internet technologies - DHCP, DNS, TCP/IP, mail transport/s.
  • Active Directory and Windows Server administration. Windows 7 system support.
  • Linux/Unix system support and ability to write simple scripts in some administrative language.
  • Apple Mac OSX support.
  • Support of office/productivity software including Microsoft Office
  • Mobile device support such as BlackBerry, iPhone and/or Android
  • Video conferencing setup and troubleshooting.
  • VPN client support.
  • A broad understanding of networking technologies both wired and wireless. Port level troubleshooting of Cisco switches and data cabling knowledge.
  • A good understanding of VoIP technologies
  • Ability to understand and execute change management activities
  • Ability to liaise with vendors for all steps of the procurement process.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.

COMMERCIAL FINANCE &

ORDER TO CASH (O2C) MANAGER

Position Title: Commercial Finance & Order to Cash (O2C) Manager

Position Level: P2-P3

Reports to: CEERTMEA CFO

Position Type: Full time

Leading Candidate: No

Purpose: Commercial Finance & Order to Cash (O2C) Manager’s key objectives are to build and manage commercial finance and order to cash organization for Elanco entities in Poland and Hungary. The manager will be leading a team of five people based in the above-mentioned countries. The team will be supporting local and export sales across CEE cluster with the scope, including but not limited to, contract, pricing, rebate, credit and trade finance management as well as full order to cash scope from order acceptance through cash collection and application. The manager will need to develop objectives & metrics, development & training plans for the team, formulate procedures and ensure timely implementation and compliance with applicable policies, procedures, rules and regulations The Manager will partner with external customers and business counterparts to ensure high quality, sustainable and compliant operation of integrated Commercial Finance and O2C team.

Location: Elanco Poland in Warsaw, Poland.

Commercial Finance Scope

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables:
  • Customer on/off boarding process aligned with relevant functions processes (Quality, Legal, Ethic and Compliance)
  • Managing commercial contracts with customer including but not limited to pricing, rebate, free of charge strategies development, documentation and implementing in ERP system insuring appropriate controllership and compliance
  • Serve as the domestic and export hub interface and pricing & commercial consultant to the Field Offices in helping develop and implement alternative pricing strategies coordinating the evaluation of local/regional commercial conditions change requests
  • Participate and coordinate new commercial agreements or changes to existing ones, monitor commercial conditions and ensure alignment to contractual obligations
  • Manage working capital, optimize credit risk, develop cash collection, strategies, manage bad debt and inventory reserves
  • Manage the relationship with insurances, brokers, banks, financial, institutions and other industry associations
  • Manage Trade finance operations (LCs, bank guarantees, etc…)
  • Order to Cash scope:
  • Manage Customer Service team in an efficient manner to ensure compliance with relevant policies, procedures, systems, and financial controls
  • Responsible for Customer Service strategy: order taking, validation, and entry, check credit availability, coordinate order fulfilment, perform billing, manage customer enquiries, manage returns, manage collections, process charge backs
  • Ensure process governance including regular reporting and analysis to key stakeholders – communicates with stakeholders on a regular basis to discuss operational issues, key metrics
  • Act as the point of escalation to resolve Customer Service issues in a timely manner and ensures all queries are dealt with correctly and efficiently
  • Support General Accounting’s month‑end/year‑end closing procedures including general ledger reconciliations and accruals, Sarbanes‑Oxley (SOX) compliance and financial audits
  • Oversee the creation of management reports and reconciliation tasks associated with O2C processes
  • Establish strong collaboration and relationships with business counterparts, customers, Global Process Owners (GPO), and other partners of the ESC organization
  • Identify and implement process change improvements (in coordination with the O2C GPO)
  • Ensures processes and policies are being followed by performing routine reviews and audits of the teams as they provide services to customers
  • Executes the governance process to evaluate and implement localization / customization
  • Monitors and reports relevant Service Level Agreements (SLA) and process Key Performance Indicators (KPI) to ensure the health of the service delivery operations
  • Supports internal and external auditors during audits and other data inquiries
  • Understands system architecture, including ERP, add-ons, enablers, and interfaces
  • Coordinates and support system implementations and testing with transactional resources
  • Essential job functions:
  • Lead a well functioning Commercial Finance and O2C team
  • Clearly assign responsibility for tasks and decisions
  • Set clear objectives and measure
  • Monitor process, progress, and results
  • Design feedback loops into work.
  • Ensure an efficient information flow with business partners including local affiliates, plant sites, treasury, area management and other stakeholders
  • Ensure compliance to SoX, and established GMP and financial policies & procedures
  • Ensure a good execution and implementation of customers’ contractual agreements
  • Continuous update or improvement of “knowledge management” capabilities and tools
  • Perform effective credit management of respective area, through regular review of all customer accounts, including financial statements and reports determining creditworthiness, recommendation of changes to credit lines to accommodate business goals and new product introduction
  • Ensure customer focus through regular customers and affiliates’ visits, and monthly monitoring of Customer Experience KPIs.
  • Define and drive action to improve Customer Experience continuously
  • Liaise with involved parties and stakeholders to ensure effective business focus and challenging environment; maintain high standards of processes/ data quality and accuracy
  • Establish effective ongoing monitoring tools and processes, participate or lead projects (Six Sigma, other business required specific projects) to enhance efficiency of the team/processes
  • Develop new methods and report statistics for evaluating the financial condition of customers through benchmarking industry/country changes
  • Develop and maintain appropriate governance structure around pricing and commercial terms
  • Provide Field Offices assistance and support in negotiating pricing and related commercial terms
  • Liaise with banks and financial institutions to support the Trade Finance operations
  • Coordinate and implement onboarding and exiting customers
  • Review and approve pricing business cases
  • Improve the rebate system and manage rebate agreements
  • Skills & Capabilities
  • Knowledge and understanding Commercial Finance and Order to Cash functions with a minimum of three year experience in a similar role in a shared service organization
  • Operational awareness of all applicable US SoX & operational controls for the area and ability to demonstrate a strong compliance oriented mindset
  • Process efficiency and Continuous improvement mindset
  • Excellent understanding of the critical success factors for high quality and sustainable Commercial Finance and O2C operation
  • Actively work with core team members, internal customers/business partners, and distribution team members to build effective working relationships

Requirements
  • Lean/Six Sigma exposure or equivalent desired
  • University degree (Bachelors or equivalent)
  • At least 5 years of experience in a shared services / GBS environment
  • Minimum 3 years of management and people development experience held in O2C department
  • Ability to work in global team environment and communicate effectively with both internal business partners of all levels & disciplines as well as external team members
  • Strong leadership and collaboration skills with ability to build effective relationships and influence peers and key stakeholders.
  • Ability to proactively & effectively resolve people, process and technology problems
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables
  • Able to respond flexibly to customer needs, effectively managing expectations
  • Attentive to details to ensure compliance and accurate reporting.
  • Experience of working to tight deadlines and analyzing multiple entities.
  • Flexibility in adapting to a non-routine and fast-paced environment.
  • Strong SAP knowledge
  • SAP implementation experience is a plus
  • Proficient in MS Office tools, ServiceNow, and Concur
  • Proficient in English is mandatory; multi-lingual is a plus, but not required
    Travel:
  • Up to 20% for project work and client/customer interaction


Company Overview

Elanco is a global animal health company that develops products and knowledge services to prevent and treat disease in food animals and pets in more than 90 countries. With a 64-year heritage, we rigorously innovate to improve the health of animals and benefit our customers, while fostering an inclusive, cause-driven culture for more than 5,800 employees. At Elanco, we are driven by our vision of food and companionship enriching life – all to advance the health of animals, people and the planet. Learn more at www.elanco.com .

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

Consumer Insight Specialist
  • Udział w badaniach konsumenckich
  • Planowanie i analizowanie danych
    • About Our Client
    Naszym klientem jest firma z branży FMCG.

    Job Description
    • Wsparcie zespołu w prowadzeniu dokumentacji projektów badawczych (formalności związane z zamówieniami i umowami, archiwizacja raportów);
    • Przygotowywanie analiz ad-hoc dotyczących trendów rynkowych, konkurentów i ankiet wewnętrznych na podstawie ankiet internetowych (tj. MonkeySurvey);
    • Aktywne zaangażowanie w przygotowywanie analiz ad-hoc makroekonomicznych i lokalnych sytuacji rynkowych w oparciu o różne źródła informacji (tj. GUS, Euromonitor, NBP) i dedykowane bieżące badania;
    • Pomoc w przeprowadzaniu projektów badawczych ad hoc zleconych agencjom badawczym (testy produktów, cen, reklam, zadowolenia konsumentów, badań eksploracyjnych, badań segmentacyjnych itp.) lub firm konsultingowych;
    • Identyfikacja potrzeb konsumentów poprzez analizę wyników badań, przygotowywanie podsumowań, zestawienie z wyników badań;
    • Wsparcie w przygotowywaniu warsztatów, wdrażaniu testów rynkowych, przełożenie spostrzeżeń konsumenckich na praktyczne rekomendacje dla marketingu i innych kluczowych interesariuszy firmy.
    The Successful Applicant
    • Wykształcenie wyższe (preferowane psychologia, socjologia lub dziedzina pokrewna);
    • Udokumentowane doświadczenie w ilościowych i jakościowych badaniach rynku i badaniach konsumenckich w zarządzaniu projektami i / lub analizie danych rynkowych;
    • Doświadczenie zdobyte w roli Customer Insights po stronie klienta w branży FMCG lub handlu detalicznym / spożywczym, a także w agencji badawczej;
    • Rozwinięte umiejętności analityczne;
    • Umiejętność przedstawiania wyników badań w przystępny sposób i dostarczania przekonującego punktu widzenia;
    • Bardzo dobra znajomość MS Excel i Power Point;
    • Biegła znajomość języka angielskiego (w mowie i piśmie);
    • Umiejętności zarządzania projektami;
    • Nastawienie na wyniki i umiejętność pracy w napiętych terminach;
    • Umiejętność pracy w dynamicznym środowisku;
    • Umiejętność pracy w zespole;
    • Silne umiejętności interpersonalne i pozytywne nastawienie.

    What's On Offer
    • umowa o pracę;
    • atrakcyjny pakiet benefitów;
    • możliwość rozwoju w międzynarodowym środowisku.
    Contact: Kamila Szczepanik

We are looking for a Junior Analyst for our Estate Management business line.

About JLL

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

Role Purpose-

Our Estate Management team helps clients optimise their portfolio performance at each phase of the property life cycle.

What This Job Involves-
  • Report to Team Leader & Associates of Estate Management team.
  • Support the team in the day-to-day delivery of all Estates Management matters.
  • Preparing monthly /quarterly client reports.
  • Ensure smooth transition of new properties into management.
  • Assist in identifying asset and portfolio enhancement opportunities.
  • Managing recharges including utilities and insurance.
  • Dealing with applications for consent.
  • Trackers – updating property management system and monthly trackers.
Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity. Sound like you? To apply you need to be / have-
  • Fluent written and spoken English – Polish & other language a plus.
  • Knowledge of real estate leases and obligations a plus.
  • Very good MS Office skills, especially Excel and Outlook.
  • Creative thinking and ability to work under time pressure.
  • Good analytical skills, attention to details and organization skills.
  • Good communication skills, conflict-resolution & negotiation skills
  • Willingness to take on new challenges, responsibilities, and assignments.
What you can expect from us-

You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay.
Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

Join us as a BI Developer

  • Take on a new challenge in a cutting-edge team, in which you’ll contribute to the analysis of complex bank, franchise or function data to identify business issues and opportunities
  • We’ll look to you to utilise Business Intelligence tools to drive essence from large portions of data to support managing the bank’s financials
  • This is a hands-on role in which you'll hone your data analysis expertise and gain valuable experience in a dynamic area of our business

What you'll do

As a BI Developer, you'll play a key role in supporting the delivery of high-quality business solutions. You’ll be performing data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis, alongside developing and performing standard queries to ensure data quality and identify data inconsistencies and missing data.

Day-to-day, you’ll also be:

  • Using the BI tools, including OBIEE, QlikView and SAS, to deliver and develop various MI
  • Contributing to the automation of a large portfolio of processes in order to improve quality and efficiency of the MI
  • Collecting, profiling and mapping appropriate data to use in new or existing solutions as well as for ongoing data activities
  • Identifying and documenting data migration paths and processes, standardising data naming, data definitions and modelling
  • Helping to interpret customer needs and turning them into functional or data requirements and process models

The skills you'll need

We’re looking for someone with experience of using data analysis tools and delivering data analysis in a technology or IT function. Additionally, you'll need to have experience of using BI tools such as OBIEE, IBM Cognos, Qlikview, SAP BusinessObjects BI or similar, coupled with solid working knowledge of SQL and an understanding of Big Data.

We’ll also look for:

  • An in-depth understanding of the interrelationships of data and multiple data domains
  • Strong communication skills in English
  • A background in delivering research based on qualitative and quantitative data across a range of subjects
  • Excellent influencing and relationship building skills

Join us as a BI Developer

  • Take on a new challenge in a cutting-edge team, in which you’ll contribute to the analysis of complex bank, franchise or function data to identify business issues and opportunities
  • We’ll look to you to utilise Business Intelligence tools to drive essence from large portions of data to support managing the bank’s financials
  • This is a hands-on role in which you'll hone your data analysis expertise and gain valuable experience in a dynamic area of our business

What you'll do

As a BI Developer, you'll play a key role in supporting the delivery of high-quality business solutions. You’ll be performing data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis, alongside developing and performing standard queries to ensure data quality and identify data inconsistencies and missing data.

Day-to-day, you’ll also be:

  • Using the BI tools, including OBIEE, QlikView and SAS, to deliver and develop various MI
  • Contributing to the automation of a large portfolio of processes in order to improve quality and efficiency of the MI
  • Collecting, profiling and mapping appropriate data to use in new or existing solutions as well as for ongoing data activities
  • Identifying and documenting data migration paths and processes, standardising data naming, data definitions and modelling
  • Helping to interpret customer needs and turning them into functional or data requirements and process models

The skills you'll need

We’re looking for someone with experience of using data analysis tools and delivering data analysis in a technology or IT function. Additionally, you'll need to have experience of using BI tools such as OBIEE, IBM Cognos, Qlikview, SAP BusinessObjects BI or similar, coupled with solid working knowledge of SQL and an understanding of Big Data.

We’ll also look for:

  • An in-depth understanding of the interrelationships of data and multiple data domains
  • Strong communication skills in English
  • A background in delivering research based on qualitative and quantitative data across a range of subjects
  • Excellent influencing and relationship building skills

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical or engineering field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in direct client sales/management.
  • Sales and relationship management experience with a technology or Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) platform.
  • Ability to speak and write in English and Polish fluently and idiomatically.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience building and cultivating lasting relationships with accounts.
  • Understanding of Big Data landscape and Business Intelligence technologies, as well as knowledge of how various cloud technologies (PaaS and IaaS) work together to drive deeper technology adoption within the existing large account base.
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to engage with both developer audiences as well as C-level IT and business leaders.


About The Job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Field Sales Representative, you'll advocate the Cloud Platform as enabling technology for business innovation. You'll introduce Google Cloud Platform to our customers and accounts, drive awareness in the developer and startup community, and leverage and build the Google Cloud Platform partner ecosystem. In addition, handling complex customer and stakeholder relationships comes naturally to you.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.

Responsibilities
  • Engage with prospect organizations to position Google Cloud Platform solutions through strategic value based solution proposals, references and analyst data.
  • Work with wider Google Ads and Google Cloud account teams to develop and drive pipeline, providing additional guidance. Work with Google Cloud Platform partners to develop campaigns.
  • Serve as the primary customer contact during bid submission, pilot test, legal review and procurement. Keep records of customer interactions and provide quarterly projections.
  • Build a pipeline of customers within selected verticals.
  • Leverage Google Sales Engineering and Marketing resources, and provide input on current collateral materials and ideas on how to improve them.

At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

The Agency Solutions Manager is a strategic and enthusiastic solution-driver who puts Facebook customers at the core of everything they do. They have a passion for advertising and believe the future of marketing is identity-based, data-driven and grounded in measurable business results. With proven, hands-on understanding of both online and traditional media and the Russia agency ecosystem, the ASM is responsible for partnering with agencies to develop industry-specific relationships, to constantly increase agencies’ FB products and solution capability level, construct approaches to scale the outreach of local partners, and use data and analytics to drive informed decisioning and solution adoption. Success in this position requires strong consultative and analytical skills, a focus on providing excellent service, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment delivering against tight deadlines.

Responsibilities
  • Build and manage relationships with key agencies and enablers in Russia (media, creative, measurement and automation technology)
  • Serve as external product consultant educating agencies on product solutions and best practices, and ultimately grow existing business partnerships. Provide extensive training to agencies, both on Facebook solutions as well as on our consultative selling approach
  • Be the second line of defence, help agencies become unstuck in high-stakes pitch situations, campaign set-up and when driving performance
  • Establish trust with agency stakeholders and help our partners establish trust with clients, leading to an increased focus on Facebook
  • Drive product adoption and local, relevant to Russia, publishable success stories
  • Develop strong connections with internal expert teams (creative, marketing, measurement, product-marketing, solutions engineering) as well as with other emerging markets regions. Set up internal learning agendas and foster exchange of best practices on an ongoing and process optimized basis
  • In partnership with Agency Partner, identify, create, and implement marketing solutions grounded on achieving measurable business results for our partners
  • Collaborate with FB client teams to work hand-in-hand in developing Facebook solution adoption and market ecosystem capability level
  • Analyse data and insights to inform and guide strategy of the emerging markets region
  • Influence product innovation based on agencies’ and client needs and feedback
  • Formulate and champion actionable recommendations based on agency learnings, feedback to the internal teams aimed at improving solution, offering and overall experience
Minimum Qualification
  • Advanced written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate solutions
  • Experience working directly with marketing, media and/or consulting companies
  • Hands-on Russian market experience
  • Fluency in English and native/professional proficiency in Russian
  • Extensive experience as a Facebook user and familiarity with Facebook’s ad products preferred
  • Experience aligning solutions and measurement to client business objectives
  • Experience planning, delivering, and executing media, measurement, and creative strategy
  • Experience presenting to external stakeholders at a variety of levels
  • Strong project management abilities, with experience completing projects with minimal direction with high attention to detail
  • Experience providing insights and campaign optimisations/recommendations
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships with internal and external partners
  • Experience leading and managing initiatives autonomously and with a high degree of accountability
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Demonstrated experience analysing data sets and delivering actionable insights
  • Ability to guide adoption of products/solutions
  • Demonstrated ability to influence internal and external stakeholders - anticipating challenges and objections, providing solutions and guidance with support

Preferred Qualification
  • Demonstrated media agency experience
  • Knowledge of SQL, relational databases, and/or statistical packages such as R, SAS, SPSS
  • Emerging markets experience
  • Experience as an owner of a product or business line, in a start-up context or as an entrepreneur

Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

IQVIA is looking for talented and passionate applicants at the Analyst level to join our Consulting team in Warsaw.

As an Analyst you will be involved in the development and delivery of multiple management consulting projects for our pharmaceutical clients.

Our clients rely on our knowledge, experience, and aptitude for problem-solving to optimize strategies across their organizations. Our ability to leverage and manipulate big data, coupled with our in-depth understanding of pharma industry and healthcare system, puts us in a unique position to deliver high-quality insights that address a variety of client needs.

Main Responsibilities
  • Performing strategic analyses as a member of Consulting Services team;
  • Preparing quantitative and qualitative analyses of the pharmaceutical sector and its major contributors;
  • Participating in preparation of strategic recommendations based on conducted analyses;
  • Partnership with client’s stakeholders to identify their needs, finding most suitable analytical solutions and providing recommendations;
  • Creating sections of reports, presentations and other client deliverables;
  • Proactively developing knowledge of the healthcare industry and IQVIA proprietary data sources, attending trainings and collaborating with an international team.

Desired Qualifications And Experience
  • Ability to analyze complex data, draw conclusions and succinctly summarize recommendations;
  • MSc degree preferably in Economics, Mathematical statistics or Computer Science;
  • Experience in consulting or pharmaceutical company preferred;
  • Excellent Microsoft Office Skills: strong skills in working with Excel spreadsheets and creating presentations with Power Point;
  • Proficiency in English;
  • An interest and knowledge in two of the following areas: finance, marketing, statistics, pharmaceutical;
  • Problem-solving skills;
  • Experience with international projects will be a plus.
We offer
  • Career development from an Analyst to a Consultant role
  • Attractive salary and benefits
  • Participating in international projects for top pharmaceutical companies
  • Various local and international trainings

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

  • Local social media execution plans development on the basis of annual/project strategy.
  • Development and execution of creative ideas for social media channels.
  • Daily content calendar management and planning.
  • Cooperation with graphic and content designers in order to secure consistent and comprehensive communication plans; responsibility for social media guidelines’ execution.
  • Responsibility for moderation team.
  • Creation and execution of social media paid plans, responsibility for achieving marketing communication KPIs.
  • Close cooperation with the PR team to secure proper communication angels.
  • Close cooperation with the KOLs specialist to develop consistent communication plans.

  • Knowledge of creative development process.
  • Knowledge of social media listening tools.
  • Knowledge of social media environment, especially Facebook, Instagram and Youtube; not only paid but also organic.
  • Working with moderators in the past.
  • Open mind, thinking out-of-the box.

Lubisz grać w Minecrafta? Masz nietuzinkowe pomysły na ulepszenie gry? Pasjonują cię mechanizmy Redstone? Dołącz do zespołu testowego w Lionbridge Game Services!

Tester Gier - Minecraft

Warszawa

Czy przeszkadza Ci, że grając w swoje ulubione produkcje, nieustannie natykasz się na denerwujące błędy?

Czy widziałeś speedrunnerów wykorzystujących niedopatrzenia twórców gier, by ukończyć je w zaledwie kilka minut?

Czy chciałbyś zajrzeć za kulisy produkcji gier i poznać cały proces ich tworzenia od prototypu do finalnej wersji?

Czy chciałbyś mieć bezpośredni wpływ na jakość gier, stabilność ich działania i rozwiązania techniczne? Testuj najnowsze wersje Minecrafta jeszcze przed ich wydaniem na rynek.

Z Nami Możesz
  • Zamienić swoje hobby w karierę;
  • Poznać ludzi, którzy myślą tak jak Ty;
  • Pracować z najbardziej rozpoznawalnymi markami na rynku;
  • Współtworzyć niesamowitą atmosferę pracy wśród pasjonatów gier z całego świata;
  • Testować gry przy użyciu najnowszych technologii.


Jakie Zadania Będą Na Ciebie Czekać
  • Wykrywanie błędów w grach - od tych oczywistych, do wymagających wytężenia zmysłów i umysłu do maksimum;
  • Tworzenie raportów w języku angielskim;
  • Dostarczanie informacji zwrotnych dla twórców gier i proponowanie sposobów poprawy jakości i grywalności;
  • Współpraca z zespołem testerów;
  • Aktualizacja przypadków testowych.


Jakich Umiejętności i Kompetencji Poszukujemy
  • Pasji do gier, najlepiej z doświadczeniem na różnych platformach - konsolach, PC, telefonach i urządzeniach przenośnych;
  • Ogólnej znajomości mechaniki Minecrafta, z naciskiem na Redstone;
  • Znajomości języka angielskiego na poziomie minimum B2 - bardzo dobra komunikacja w języku pisanym i mówionym;
  • Spostrzegawczości i analitycznego podejścia do rozwiązywania problemów;
  • Doświadczenie w testowaniu jest mile widziane, ale nie jest wymogiem.


Decydując się na ścieżkę rozwoju testera gier możesz:
  • Współpracować w zespole pasjonatów Minecrafta oraz bezpośrednio z twórcami gry;
  • Mieć możliwość głębokiego poznania procesu tworzenia i testowania gier;
  • Zyskać dostęp do najnowszych rozwiązań technologicznych;
  • Cieszyć się współpracą w kreatywnym zespole i miłej atmosferze, w otoczeniu osób o podobnych zainteresowaniach, uczestniszyć w imprezach projektowych, turniejach i wyjściach firmowych.


Uprzejmie informujemy, że Lionbridge zastrzega sobie prawo do kontaktu tylko z wybranymi kandydatami.

  • Spostrzegawczości i analitycznego podejścia do rozwiązywania problemów;
  • Doświadczenie w testowaniu jest mile widziane, ale nie jest wymogiem.


Decydując się na ścieżkę rozwoju testera gier możesz:
  • Współpracować w zespole pasjonatów Minecrafta oraz bezpośrednio z twórcami gry;
  • Mieć możliwość głębokiego poznania procesu tworzenia i testowania gier;
  • Zyskać dostęp do najnowszych rozwiązań technologicznych;
  • Cieszyć się współpracą w kreatywnym zespole i miłej atmosferze, w otoczeniu osób o podobnych zainteresowaniach, uczestniszyć w imprezach projektowych, turniejach i wyjściach firmowych.


Uprzejmie informujemy, że Lionbridge zastrzega sobie prawo do kontaktu tylko z wybranymi kandydatami.

Job Description

The role purpose is to: Support Service Delivery in all Mobility technical topics,provide guidance in supporting the O365 and AirWatch Mobile Device Management (MDM) integration, Ensures Mobility services are restored as quickly as possible when impacted and adverse impacts on operations due to incidents in IT environment are minimize,Operates IT services, systems and applications as directed, Monitors all events that occur in the enterprise IT environment to allow normal operations and to detect and escalate exception conditions. ensure that Configuration Items (any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver an IT Service) are identified, accounted, reported, verified and audited.

Responsibilities

Provide system administration of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and Mobile Device management (MDM) solutions
Support, maintain and troubleshoot Air watch systems for the enterprise
Support the design and implementation of simple MDM solutions
Deliver IT services, systems and applications to the business integrated for use with Mobility solutions
Define an end-to-end Mobility provisioning process facilitating automation wherever possible
Ensure adherence to quality standards as defined by the IT Organization
Ensure appropriate response to audit / ISRM assessment findings and recommendations
Perform patch management and image management activities for Enterprise
Ensure standard build/image
Ensure accurate provisioning and metering of services
Provide early feedback to development team on release issues
Ensure that an up-to-date asset inventory for all Mobility technology assets is maintained and only authorized components are used
Accountable to ensure adherence with Security and Compliance policies and procedures within Technical Operations service scope
Coordinate all Mobility configuration management database changes which directly or indirectly impact production services
Ensure addition, modification or removal of any IT asset in a standard and controlled manner
Ensure that Mobility Configuration Interfaces (Cis) are identified, accounted, reported, verified and audited

Poszukujemy kilku mocnych Scrum Masterów do projektów realizowanych na rzecz naszego klienta z branży biofarmaceutycznej. Osoba na danym stanowisku będzie podejmowała także tematy z zakresu delivery na poziomie zespołu.
Oferujemy udział w długich i stabilnych projektach z możliwością pracy 100% zdalnej już od samego początku.
Istnieje możliwość pracy na pół lub na cały etat.

- mile widziany certyfikat PSM, AgilePM

The Client Onboard Analyst 1 is a trainee professional role. Requires a good knowledge of the range of processes, procedures and systems to be used in carrying out assigned tasks and a basic understanding of the underlying concepts and principles upon which the job is based. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Makes evaluative judgements based on the analysis of factual information. They are expected to resolve problems by identifying and selecting solutions through the application of acquired technical experience and will be guided by precedents. Must be able to exchange information in a concise and logical way as well as be sensitive to audience diversity. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own job.

Responsibilities
  • Processes client’s requests related to system set up including signatories’ updates and documentation lodgment.
  • Co-operates with internal partners to perform systems maintenance based on documentation related to account opening and maintenance processes.
  • Provides response to client and internal inquiries.
  • Prepares documentation for archiving .
  • Applies appropriate bank’s regulations while processing the requests.
  • Remains up to date with the current procedures, internal rules, external regulations, and follows the changes in the aforementioned documents.
  • Documents operation procedure updates.
  • Processes clients’ instructions ensuring the highest accuracy and effectiveness (ensuring deadlines are adhered to).
  • Verification and authorization of data entered in the systems.
  • Ensures all queries are dealt with in an efficient and timely manner.
  • Escalates urgent / risk issues through the appropriate escalation channels.
  • Co-operates with and supports other teams/employees upon supervisor’s instruction, including possibility of movement to another team and/or process.
  • Performs other crucial tasks instructed by supervisors, e.g. participation in trainings, projects, conference calls, systems’ testing.
  • Ensures high levels of client satisfaction through strong product, process and client knowledge. Identifies and suggests process improvements.
  • Assists in the implementation of validated process improvements.
  • Understands procedures and controls for operational processes. Supports Manager with quality assurance process. Understands procedures and controls for operational processes. Performs within departmental procedures and compliance standards in order to minimize losses.
  • Responsible for coordination of projects around internal processes. Participates in user acceptance test of new systems.
  • Effective execution of day-to-day responsibilities, as well as execution of any other work instructed by supervisor related to this function.
  • Daily deliverable of routine and defined tasks, while developing knowledge of the broader context in which work is being performed.
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications
  • Previous experience in financial services preferred.
  • Knowledge of bank products in the scope of opening and maintaining of bank accounts Customer communication experience (internal/external). Knowledge on the field of finances and banking.
  • Flexibility, team spirit, loyalty. High attention to detail. Good PC skills (Excel, Word). Fluent in both written and spoken English. Be able to work under pressure and to meet deadlines. Proficient knowledge of English (written and spoken).

Education
  • Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

What We Offer
  • Competitive salary
  • Social benefits (e.g. private healthcare care, Benefit System, life insurance)
  • Working in a friendly, dynamic and multinational environment
  • Opportunity to have an influence on the way you perform your tasks - our teams are constantly looking for new and better ways and we encourage all improvement idea

    • Grade :All Job Level - All Job FunctionsAll Job Level - All Job Functions - PL

We are currently looking for a Category Manager (Real Estate, Facility Management and Professional Services) to strengthen our Global Indirect Procurement team.

As the member of the Global Indirect Procurement organization you will be responsible for collaborating with the relevant stakeholders and ensuring that procurement of both services and indirect materials are purchased in an efficient, professional and cost effective manner in order to create and sustain a competitive advantage, thereby contributing to Oriflame profitability.

Your Responsibilities
  • Developing and executing strategic and tactical plans for the given spend category in alignment with key business stakeholders to create value and deliver cost reduction objectives
  • Lead or manage competitive RFx, contractual agreements and negotiation processes across different business entities
  • Support Procurement Director in developing Source-To-Pay and category governance models to improve highly integrated ways of working with key business units across multiple geographic regions
  • Effectively communicate the impact of procurement decisions to senior management
  • Being accountable for integration and standardization of procurement processes, policies and best practices into the Organization - effectively educate internal teammates and external customers on growth opportunities
  • Lead, effectively manage cost reduction and continuous improvement initiatives, while maintaining supply reliability and delivery of the required project plan
  • Consolidate business and procurement requirements, exploit regional and global potential synergies to increase global spend coverage
  • Act as an advocate for Procurement throughout the business, building open and challenging relationships with key stakeholders, ensuring business alignment for excellent execution
  • Identify and lead the development of strategic business relationship with critical suppliers
  • Conduct supply market research to provide category intelligence and benchmarks on industry dynamics, trends and best practices
Who we are looking for?
  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree with a Business, Finance, Logistics or Engineering focus
  • Professional experience with min. 5 yrs in Indirect Procurement and/or extended Supply Chain environment with solid expertise in Real Estate, Professional Services (experience in Facility Management and relevant certification eg. CIPS) will be an advantage)
  • Have a successful track record in delivering YoY savings and non-cash related benefits
  • Exceptional communicator, both written and verbal with conflict resolution skills
  • Commercial and business acumen in delivering of consistent and sustainable best value purchasing and supply to achieve cost reductions targets, while maintaining supply reliability and delivery of the required objectives
  • Strong negotiator with solid Stakeholder management skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Being passionate about creating exceptional customer experience by collaborating with cross-functional and cross-regional teams
  • Accomplished in Change and Project management with strong ownership, influencing and people management skills
  • High degree of problem solving and decision-making ability
  • Ability to operate in diverse cultural and geographic environments and adhere to highest ethical standards
  • Fluent in English (Russian will be an advantage)
    • What we offer?
    Working at Oriflame means working in a global company defined by a dynamic culture, meaningful work and professional growth; this is what we offer our employees. As an employer we demand a lot of our people, but we also empower them to live up to their challenges, to have an entrepreneurial spirit and to deliver on our brand promise. And, importantly, we recognize their efforts and reward their achievements.

    What Is More
    • Modern office with positive energy
    • Work in a modern beauty company with an entrepreneurial spirit
    • Job in a fast pace organization with colleagues from all over the world
    • Free health care
    • Cafeteria system
    • Life insurance program
    • Oriflame products – we want our employees to be our best ambassadors
    • Unlimited access to our wellness products – keep your body healthy with us
    Is this the perfect match for you?

    Please apply as soon as possible via the link below and attach your CV in English. We screen the applications continuously.

    Job title: Global Category Manager - Real Estate, Facility Management and Professional Services
    Reports to: Director Global Indirect Procurement
    Employment type: Full time employment contract
    Preferred starting date: ASAP
    Location: Warsaw office, Wołoska 22
    Application deadline: 19/04/2020

This is an exciting opportunity to join ICON

As a global provider of drug development solutions, our work is serious business. But that doesn't mean you can't have fun while you do it. With our vision to be the partner of choice in drug development, we hire only the best and brightest in the industry. Are you one of them?

As a member of the Study Start Up Team, you will play an integral role in making sure that physicians at our research sites are prepared to start the trial of investigational, new pharmaceutical and biological products for clinical trials at their local practices.

The Role
  • To review and negotiate clinical site investigator contracts and budgets.
  • Stay connected with Investigative sites, sponsors and internal personnel regarding the status of contracts and contract-related documents
  • Prepare and coordinate preparation of contractual documents and correspondence
  • Facilitate the indemnification process between the study sponsor and the site.
OR
  • Perform regulatory document for initial submission and maintenance e.g. amendments, periodic updates and safety letters.
  • Prepare, review, submit and QC submissions to ethics, regulatory and other authorities to obtain clinical trial authorizations and approvals.
  • Develop and finalize Country Specific SIS/ ICFs.
  • Collect critical documents for IP release
  • Mentor / train new and junior personnel in SSU.
  • Part of Regulatory Intelligence SME Team responsible for Poland.

What You Need
  • A bachelor's degree or related experience is preferred
  • SSU experience is desirable.
  • Experience in a clinical research environment with specific experience in study submissions or contracts review and budget negotiation or in related field such as where submissions or contract or legal document review is a primary part of you role.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Procurement Lean Practitioner, Productivity & Portfolio / S&OPEX



Job Description:

At AstraZeneca we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the upmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our people's exceptional skills with those of people from all over the globe and we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. Procurement is a function of approximately 450 highly skilled professionals globally that touches on all parts of the AstraZeneca business from the identification of new drug targets through to the supply of our medicines to patients. Procurement actively leads the sourcing of over $9BN of goods and services needed every year by AZ, building relationships with reputable suppliers.

In AstraZeneca Procurement, we have a strong and long-term ambition to drive a Lean transformation and embed mature Lean ways of working - identifying what to do, how to do it, who should do it and when it should be done. All of which will improve both Lean maturity and Business Performance.

As part of our ongoing commitment to Lean, a new opportunity has arisen in the Strategy & Operational Excellence Team which is responsible for driving performance, risk & compliance, commercial strategy, portfolio & productivity and people & supplier performance globally across the procurement function.



Job Brief:

Working closely with the Lean Expert for Procurement you will support the deployment of Lean process improvement across the Procurement network. You will partner with Procurement Leaders and their teams to execute performance improvement activities using lean methodologies across the Procurement Function. Utilizing various Lean tools and techniques you will diagnose, analyse and improve Procurement processes. You will coach Procurement teams and demonstrate the hands-on application of development of Lean tools and methodologies to improve processes. In this role, you will promote a culture of continuous improvement utilizing process improvement principles and challenging the status quo. You will lead deep process analysis through value stream mapping to measure stagnation of processes and information and lead kaizen to improve process performance.



Responsibilities to include:

  • Process mapping of priority processes across Procurement driving to task level and identifying the areas for improvement
  • Building tactical implementation plans for process improvement and monitoring of delivery against the plan
  • You will ensure Lean Implementation processes and practices from start to finish are understood and applied in an effective and efficient manner
  • You will drive a continuous improvement and consistency in process improvement implementation and ensure that you leverage and incorporate internal & external best practice



Key Requirements:

  • In depth understanding of multi-location business challenges and how process improvement principles support and drive continuous improvements
  • Expertise in End to End delivery of Project Management and process improvement
  • Demonstrable coaching, training and mentoring of process improvement
  • Track record of delivering business impact and sustained change and demonstrated understanding and application of change management principles
  • Good facilitation and workshop delivery skills
  • Great communication and experience of working with Global teams
  • Expertise in the application of analytical problem-solving methodology
  • Ability to work with teams and individually in a highly dynamic and exciting environment

Company Description

null Job Description

Poszukujemy Stażystów, Którzy
  • Potrafią analizować dane z różnych źródeł oraz pracować w kilku systemach jednocześnie.
  • Posiadają zdolności komunikacyjne i lubią kontakt z Klientem.
  • Są osobami otwartymi i pełnymi energii.
Na czym będzie polegał Twój staż?
  • Wesprzesz dział w administracyjnych zadaniach.
  • Będziesz analizował/a dane i wyciągał/a z nich wnioski.
  • Wraz z zespołem będziesz planował/a akcje sprzedażowe.
  • Będziesz analizował/a asortyment i ceny konkurencji.
  • Zajmiesz się komunikacją z działami wspierającymi działania Commerce.
Dlaczego warto pracować z nami?
  • Współtworzymy plany marketingowe z dużymi Markami.
  • Ustalamy i wdrażamy strategię sprzedażową dla kategorii.
  • Poprzez stronę główną Allegro docieramy do 14 milionów Klientów dziennie.
  • Tworzymy platformę e-commerce dla ponad 200 tys. małych, średnich i dużych polskich firm handlowych.
  • Dla około 80% internautów jesteśmy pierwszym wyborem zakupów w sieci.
  • Nieustannie towarzyszy nam zmiana. Postrzegamy ją jako szansę i możliwość realnego wpływu na Allegro.

Ze Swojej Strony Oferujemy
  • Startupową kulturę pracy i stabilność dojrzałej organizacji.
  • Nowoczesne biuro i narzędzia pracy.
  • Nieformalną atmosferę pracy w profesjonalnym zespole.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

You will be managing aspects of output in your area: people management, metrics, productivity targets, and process improvements. The extent of your duties will include:

Maintain health and safety standards within your area and promote a positive health and safety culture on site.

Lead, manage and mentor a large and diverse team of associates in a specified department within a very fast-paced and high-volume environment. Take responsibility for all HR related activities within the team, including Employee Relations and Time Recording activities.

The result is a learning environment that’s quite unlike any other. During the course of your graduate programme, you’ll have the chance to work alongside experienced leaders, giving you a unique insight into our business and the skills you need to excel within it.


Basic Qualifications

We want to hire the world’s brightest minds, and offer them an environment in which they can relentlessly improve the experience for our customers.

You will be able demonstrate strong leadership ability and excellent communications skills across all levels within a diverse culture.

You will be results driven with analytical capability, with the ability to innovate and simplify current process and practices.

You should have strong decision making skills, that use sound reasoning and when required use consultation to achieve consensus.

You will be willing to work to flexible schedules / shifts (including nights) and commit the time required to get the job done.

We are looking for forward-thinkers who take a continuously proactive approach and create a culture of creativity within the workplace.

A recent bachelors or masters degree, ideally in Logistics, Business, Management, Operations - or any Engineering discipline (Graduation date 2018, 2019 or 2020)

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Polish and English


Preferred Qualifications

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

All offers are conditional on references and a successful background screening check. This check will include previous employment verification, qualification verification (if relevant) and a basic criminal check. Further details of this policy and procedure will be sent to you along with your conditional offer.

    • Współpraca z zewnętrznymi partnerami wspierającymi rekomendacje dotyczące cen

    • Wcześniejsze doświadczenie zawodowe w zakresie finansów, marketingu lub cen
    • Biegła znajomość MS Excel

    • Doskonałe umiejętności interpersonalne z możliwością efektywnej interakcji na różnych grupach funkcyjnych i poziomach hierarchicznych
    • Dobre umiejętności komunikacyjne, proaktywne podejście, nastawienie do działania
    • Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego

    What's On Offer

    • Możliwość zdobycia doświadczenia i rozwoju kariery w dynamicznie rozwijającej się globalnej firmie

    • Atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie oraz pakiet socjalny

We are looking for a Senior Finance Analyst, FP&A for our EMEA Finance business line.

About JLL

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

What this job involves-
  • Coordination of month-end closing activities (incl. liaising with general ledger team for standing journals, accruals / prepayments reviews, preparation of non-recurring journals)
  • Coordination of intercompany cross-charges (incl. validation of amounts and supporting documentation, preparation of accounting journals and back-ups, liaising with counter parties regarding mismatches)
  • Responding to queries and solving problems related to accounting issues (incl. account reconciliations, ensuring alignment with internal policies / guidelines)
  • Participation in Year End closing (incl. Transfer Pricing validations, PSA reviews)
  • Participation in monthly reporting of actual results (incl. variance analysis & identification of main performance drivers, preparation of management reports for business lines)
  • Partnering with business stakeholders to support them in understanding cost variances. Coordination with FP&A team on the consolidated financials’ review and analysis of actuals vs budget/forecast
  • Contribution to annual/quarterly planning and forecasting processes (incl. maintenance / preparation of input templates, upload of input data to reporting system)
  • Preparation / analysis of direct and indirect overhead costs
  • Take ownership for timeliness and quality of the processes (incl. coordination of review meetings, follow-ups)
Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity.

Sound like you? To apply you need to be / have-
  • Advanced in Excel, strong analytical / numerical skills
  • Fundamental understanding of accounting principles (started CIMA/ACCA qualification is a plus)
  • Strong written and spoken English
  • Very good written and verbal communication skills
  • About 3 years + of experience in a multinational environment desirable
  • Comfortable working with senior management and external parties
  • A self-starter with the ability to work to tight deadlines
  • Organized and flexible with ability to work under time pressure
What you can expect from us-

You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay.

Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

JLL is an Equal Opportunities Employer and encourages applications from

 JLL Privacy Notice

Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.

For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .

For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .

Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

IQVIA is looking for talented and passionate applicants at the Consultant level to join our Consulting team in Warsaw.

As a Consultant you will be involved in the development and delivery of multiple management consulting projects for our pharmaceutical clients.

Our clients rely on our knowledge, experience, and aptitude for problem-solving to optimize strategies across their organizations. Our ability to leverage and manipulate big data, coupled with our in-depth understanding of pharma industry and healthcare system, puts us in a unique position to deliver high-quality insights that address a variety of client needs.

Main Responsibilities
  • Performing quantitative and qualitative analyses to identify and address specific client issues;
  • Develop and present complete client deliverables within known/identified frameworks and methodologies
  • Supporting identification and development of new business opportunities addressing potential
  • Proactively enhancing knowledge about pharma market and client needs and trends on the pharma market
  • Proactively develops knowledge of consulting methodologies and the life sciences market through the delivery of consulting engagements and participation in formal and informal learning opportunities
  • Participating in formal and informal learning opportunities and actively contributing towards knowledge sharing;

Desired Qualifications And Experience
  • Ability to analyze complex data, draw conclusions and succinctly summarize recommendations;
  • MSc degree preferably in Economics, Mathematical statistics or Computer Science;
  • Experience in consulting or pharmaceutical company preferred;
  • Excellent Microsoft Office Skills: strong skills in working with Excel spreadsheets and creating presentations with Power Point;
  • Proficiency in English;
  • Knowledge of consulting methodology, tools and techniques is a nice to have
  • Problem-solving skills;
  • Experience with international projects will be a plus.
We offer
  • Career development opportunities in consulting and other business lines
  • Attractive salary and benefits
  • Company car
  • Participating in international projects for top pharmaceutical companies
  • Various local and international trainings
  • Work in team of consultants with vast experience in top tier consulting firms

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Job ID: R1118045

Jeśli Posiadasz
  • tytuł specjalisty lekarza bądź jesteś lekarzem w trakcie specjalizacji – po 3. roku specjalizacji
  • prawo wykonywania zawodu
  • umiejętność obsługi komputera


Oferujemy
  • zatrudnienie w oparciu o UZ bądź KG – sam wybierasz
  • elastyczne godziny pracy
  • wsparcie edukacyjne - dofinansowanie do udziału w konferencjach medycznych, dostęp do platformy informacji medycznej ze wszystkich specjalizacji
  • benefity abonamentowe – pakiet sportowy „OK system”, prywatna opieka medyczna dla Ciebie i Twojej rodziny (przy zatrudnieniu powyżej 40h miesięcznie)
  • benefity jednorazowe i oferty rabatowe – m.in. bilety do kina, kody zakupowe, zniżki do sieci handlowych oraz sklepów internetowych
  • pracę według międzynarodowych procedur i standardów medycznych związanych z opieką nad Pacjentem
  • dobrą organizację pracy (wsparcie recepcji, pielęgniarek, kadry zarządzającej)


Twoje Zadania
  • opieka nad Pacjentem
  • dbałość o wysokie standardy medyczne w placówce

Jeśli powyższa oferta wydaje Ci się interesująca pozostaw nam swój kontakt (CV nie jest wymagane). Zadzwonimy w celu doprecyzowania szczegółów.

Devire is an international recruitment company, established in London in 1987. For 30 years we have been working with leading employers on the European market, executing comprehensive recruitment projects. Besides recruitment, we offer the following services: IT Outsourcing, Temporary Work and HR Solutions. Our offices are located in Warsaw, Wroclaw, Poznan and Katowice as well as Munich and Frankfurt. We are a part of Devonshire Investment Group.

Our Client is a prestigious SSC company established in the USA and operating internationally. Currently looking to fill in the position of: Payroll Specialist

Your Role
  • Ensure accurate and timely payment of EMEA region employees
  • Manage payroll data and matters regarding payroll processing and reporting
  • Collaborate with other company areas (e.g. HR Teams, Finance & Treasury)
  • Respond to employees’ inquiries
  • Contribute to building a stimulating and innovative environment
  • Implement the key principles of LEAN methodologies
  • Handle ad hoc projects


Ideal Candidate Possesses
  • 2/3 years of payroll experience across EMEA countries
  • Strong communication skills in English
  • Fluency in another European language will be an asset
  • Analytical approach
  • Ability to multitask
  • Excellent work organization
  • Problem solving skills


We Offer
  • The opportunity to professionally develop in a well-known international company
  • A set of benefits, including: lunch vouchers, bank holidays & weekends off, the possibility to occasionally work from home, Christmas vouchers, pension, flexible working hours
  • Contract of employment
  • Attractive salary

job_description_details.Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Financial Services

whole_unnormalized_body:
As a team member of the Record To Report structure, you will have an opportunity to build new finance processes from a scratch by taking part in transition in different European countries and not only.


What you can learn:

  • how to build a Center of Excellence,
  • cooperate as an expert in an international environment,
  • drive various improvement projects and develop within the internal structure — horizontal and vertical (FP&A, Consolidation & Reporting, people management).


Responsibilities:
  • Supporting an accurate and timely way for the monthly, quarterly, hard-close and year-end-financial closing for the entities in the region.
  • Cooperating with other Analysts, Accounting Controllers and GBS in terms of accounting subjects, transaction processing and performance.
  • Supporting Regional Lead in ad-hoc activities.
  • Supporting consolidation of legal entity statements and local statutory reporting.
  • Monitoring IFRS and webFEM compliance with policies and treatments.
  • Reviewing P&L and BS from an accounting perspective in ERP / HFM (during the month / as per the agreed BS review cycle).
  • Completing A-forms.


Candidate profile:

  • Accounting professional with at least 1 year of experience in accounting or reporting.
  • Bachelor Degree (preferably in Finance or Accounting).
  • Adequate expertise knowledge in financial accounting (IFRS, accounting processes).
  • Understanding on the tax, VAT, tax declarations, statistical reporting to the tax authorities etc.
  • Understanding of Consolidation systems, preferably HFM.
  • Advanced user of Microsoft Excel.
  • Fluent English.


Perks & Benefits:

  • Fresh Fruits.
  • Team Building Events.
  • Learning Cafeteria (incl. Percipio).
  • Recognition.
  • CSR Initiatives.
  • Gift Cards
  • Luxmed.
  • MultiSport.
  • Additional Insurance.


In the ongoing period, we absolutely must take care of our employees, candidates, and society.

 

While implementing recommendations to counteract the coronavirus pandemic - we stayed at home, and we are asking you to do the same.

 

We want to assure you that this will not have any impact on the current and future recruitment processes in our company.

 

Almost nothing will change except for the form of our meetings. We will talk online, not in person. Thankfully, modern technology allows us to carry out a full-fledged recruitment process without compromising anyone's health.

 

So if you were wondering whether to apply, you already know – apply

Jeśli grasz w gry i interesuje Cię jak się je tworzy, a także jesteś na bieżąco z nowinkami w branży - szukamy właśnie Ciebie!

Wystarczy pasja i chęć nauki, a nasi specjaliści nauczą Cię krok po kroku jak zostać profesjonalnym testerem.
Zamień swoje hobby w karierę i dołącz do projektu funkcjonalnego testowania edytora gier.

Zakres Czynności
  • Wykrywanie i raportowanie błędów testowanego produktu;
  • Dokładne opisywanie znalezionych błędów w języku angielskim;
  • Dostarczanie informacji zwrotnej w celu poprawy jakości oraz użyteczności produktu;
  • Aktywna współpraca z zespołem testerów;
  • Tworzenie i aktualizacja przypadków testowych.


Wymagania
  • Znajomość mechaniki działania oprogramowania oraz gier komputerowych;
  • Z najomość języka angielskiego na poziomie minimum B2;
  • Komunikatywność i umiejętność udzielenia informacji zwrotnej;
  • Analityczne podejście do rozwiązywania problemów;
  • Samodzielność, kreatywność i nieszablonowe podejście.


Mile Widziane
  • Praktyczna znajomość silników i edytorów gier (np. CryEngine, Unreal Engine, Unity);
  • Doświadczenie w testowaniu oprogramowania lub gier komputerowych;
  • Znajomość JIRA.


Oferujemy
  • Szansę na rozwój w stabilnej, globalnej firmie o ugruntowanej pozycji na rynku;
  • Możliwość zdobycia doświadczenia w pracy z oprogramowaniem do tworzenia gier - poznaj podstawy pisania skryptów, animacji, grafiki czy projektowania AI;
  • Okazję do zapoznania się ze wszystkimi nowoczesnymi platformami oraz systemami operacyjnymi;
  • Współpracę w doświadczonym, utalentowanym zespole - ucz się od najlepszych robiąc pierwsze kroki w branży gamedev;
  • Przyjazną i luźną atmosferę (automaty do gier na terenie biura, turnieje, imprezy projektowe, wyjścia firmowe);
  • Umowę zlecenie.

Uprzejmie informujemy, że Lionbridge zastrzega sobie prawo do kontaktu tylko z wybranymi kandydatami.

W Cyclad współpracujemy z najlepszymi międzynarodowymi firmami technologicznymi, aby zwiększyć ich potencjał w dostarczaniu wyjątkowych, nowoczesnych rozwiązań, które kształtują świat przyszłości. Obecnie, dla naszego Partnera, lidera na rynku ubezpieczeń komunikacyjnych, poszukujemy specjalistów na stanowisko Administratora ds. Sieci i Bezpieczeństwa

Administrator ds. Sieci i Bezpieczeństwa

Informacje o Projekcie
  • Branża: ubezpieczeniowa
  • Lokalizacja: Warszawa (Mokotów)
  • Wynagrodzenie: w trakcie ustalania
  • Czas trwania projektu: stała współpraca

Obowiązki
  • Administracja urządzeniami sieciowymi Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, IPS Firepower, Catalyst 3650/3850, Catalyst 6800, Cisco WLC
  • Administracja systemami zarządzania Cisco ISE, Prime Infrastructure
  • Diagnozowanie i rozwiązywanie problemów z obszaru działania sieci
  • Udział opracowywaniu i wdrażaniu strategii rozwoju sieci
  • Udział w projektach wewnętrznych

Wymagania
  • Wykształcenie wyższe o profilu informatycznym lub pokrewnym
  • Wiedza na poziomie Cisco CCNP lub wyższym
  • Znajomość protokołów routingu dynamicznego (OSPF, BGP)
  • Umiejętność zarządzania przełącznikami i routerami Cisco
  • Umiejętność zarządzania firewallami Cisco, IPS oraz firewallami aplikacyjnymi
  • Znajomość technologii VXLAN, EVPN
  • Znajomość Cisco ISE
  • Znajomość zasad projektowania i działania sieci
  • Znajomość zagadnień z zakresu bezpieczeństwa sieci
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie pozwalającym swobodne komunikowanie się

Mile Widziane
  • Umiejętność zarządzania proxy Forcepoint
  • Znajomość systemów monitoringu Nagios i Solarwinds

Oferujemy
  • Współpracę w oparciu o umowę o pracę (lub B2B)
  • Świadczenia dodatkowe: opiekę medyczną, możliwość skorzystania z zajęć sportowych (siłownia, fitness, basen) przystąpienia do grupowego ubezpieczenia na życie, liczne akcje na rzecz naszych pracowników, programy dla rodziny
  • Pełne wprowadzenie do obowiązków - przekażemy Ci naszą wiedzę oraz doświadczenie, abyś mógł/a komfortowo rozpocząć pracę
  • Niepowtarzalną atmosferę: bezpośredni kontakt, pozytywne podejście, wzajemny szacunek
