whole_unnormalized_body:
Join us as a Product Controller

  • Hone your accounting skills and advance your career as you undertake complex financial and accounting issues
  • You’ll identify improvements in processes to obtain efficiencies and improve key controls
  • This is an opportunity to enhance your skillset while opening doors for career progression

What you'll do

As Product Controller, you’ll support the wider team in achieving objectives, project and process improvement initiatives, and collaborate with management in the review and challenge of team outputs. You’ll manage the daily calculation and reporting of P&L or balance sheet statements and other financial reportingfor respective trading desks, including reconciliation, analytical review, driver analysis, and you'll work proactively with all internal and external stakeholders to resolve any issues around the process performed.

Through the course of your work, you’ll:

  • Support with the resolution of all non-standard queries around processes performed
  • Identify improvements in processes to obtain efficiencies and improve key controls
  • Ensure sign-off of daily and monthly P&Ls by traders
  • Establish and maintain excellent relations with internal and external stakeholders, and work proactively with them to resolve any issue around the process performed
  • Complete daily, weekly, monthly and ad-hoc reporting and analysis, covering mainly revenue but also balance sheet

The skills you'll need

To succeed in this role, you’ll need experience in a finance or banking environment, and you'll hold a degree in finance, banking or economy or an equivalent qualification, along with a good understanding of financial markets, including products, valuation and risk across asset classes.

You’ll ideally have technical skills relating to VBA and SQL, and you’ll also be working towards, or qualified, with CFA, ACCA or CIMA.

We’ll also look to you to bring:

  • Good accounting skills with experience gained in the financial services sector
  • An understanding of the front to back setup within investment banking, including systems, processes and functions
  • The ability to identify and resolve issues with minimum supervision and prioritise workloads in a pressured environment
  • Excellent communication skills, including good English skills, both written and verbal
  • The ability to build strong business relationships in a changing and fast paced environment, and work well as a team to meet objectives

Our client is one of the biggests TSL (Transport, Shipping, Logistics) worldwide company, with with more than 140 years of logistics experience, with about 2000 locations around the world and more than 76 000 employees wordwide. For main IT Department, based in South Warsaw, we are currently looking for:

Requirements
  • At least 4 years of experience on similar position
  • Certified Tester Foundation Level Test Analyst (ISTQB)
  • Study to university degree level of computer science, information systems or a comparable education
  • Knowledge about test and test automation tools (e.g. Jira, Silk4J)
  • Profound basis knowledge in the software development of Java based applications
  • Analytical skills and a solution oriented attitude
  • Fluent language skills in English
  • Knowledge of business processes in the logistics industry or a comparable business oriented IT requirements

We Offer
  • Attractive salary
  • Work in a dynamically developing company, which is a global leader in the transport and logistic sector
  • Various challenges at work
  • Great atmosphere
  • Subsidies to private health care, sport cards and group insurance

Responsibilities
  • Execute, interpret and record test cases in accordance with project test plans
  • Review requirements and specifications, and define test conditions
  • Design test cases and test scripts under own direction, mapping back to pre-determined criteria, recording and reporting outcomes
  • Analyze and report test activities and results
  • Identify and report issues and risks associated with own work
  • Prepare test environments incl. test data
  • Provide advice to the Test Manager and other stakeholders regarding feasibility of technical testing tasks
We kindly inform you that we will only respond to selected applications.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Associate Consultant, Consulting Services, Poland

Overview

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Consulting Services is the world’s leading, specialised advisor on critical business issues in the life sciences. We are the strategy arm of IQVIA, a leading provider of information, services and technology for the healthcare industry in 100+ countries around the world. Our Consulting Services team offer end-to-end management consulting in key issues areas that include: business unit, therapy area, brand strategy, portfolio strategy, launch strategy, pricing & market access, and commercial model design and optimisation.

Individuals joining us are assured of a rewarding career in life sciences consulting, replete with opportunities to address diverse and challenging client problems, travel on cross-geography projects, interact with senior client leaders and gain exposure to a truly multicultural and collaborative work environment.

Role & Responsibilities

As an Associate Consultant your analytical, inter-personal, creative thinking, business management and leadership skills will be called upon from day one. You will help create change in the world of Life Sciences, every project will be different but a sample of the accomplishments you can expect are:
  • Conducting primary and secondary research and performing quantitative and qualitative analysis to identify key client issues, translating the data into meaningful insights and communicating recommendations to key decision makers
  • Leveraging business experience and acumen in identifying strategic alternatives to client questions
  • Working in a team of like-minded professionals to create reports, presentations, workshops with client employees, management teams and other stakeholders, under the guidance our “the best on the business” team leaders
  • Developing broad knowledge of related consulting methodologies and pharmaceutical market through the delivery of consulting engagements and participation in formal and informal learning opportunities
  • Working independently and as part of a team, with responsibility for supervising junior team members
  • Assisting development and writing of proposals with senior support
  • Attending, supporting and presenting at client meetings
  • Contributing to learning, development and recruiting
To reward you for your hard work you will have the chance to travel globally, establish influential connections, receive world-class training, unparalleled career-development and of course, financial- which is second to none!

About You

Candidates interested in joining as an Associate Consultant should have:
  • An undergraduate/master’s degree in life sciences, economics/business, and 2/3 years’ experience in the healthcare/pharmaceutical industry OR an academic PhD degree with commercial experience in the healthcare industry
  • Demonstrable analytical, interpretative and problem-solving skills
  • Well-developed written and verbal communication skills including presentations, meeting and workshop facilitation, business and report writing
  • Strong capability in juggling priorities to meet deadlines while retaining consistently high quality outcomes
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with others in and across the organization to accomplish team goals

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Associate Consultant, Consulting Services, Poland

Overview

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Consulting Services is the world’s leading, specialised advisor on critical business issues in the life sciences. We are the strategy arm of IQVIA, a leading provider of information, services and technology for the healthcare industry in 100+ countries around the world. Our Consulting Services team offer end-to-end management consulting in key issues areas that include: business unit, therapy area, brand strategy, portfolio strategy, launch strategy, pricing & market access, and commercial model design and optimisation.

Individuals joining us are assured of a rewarding career in life sciences consulting, replete with opportunities to address diverse and challenging client problems, travel on cross-geography projects, interact with senior client leaders and gain exposure to a truly multicultural and collaborative work environment.

Role & Responsibilities

As an Associate Consultant your analytical, inter-personal, creative thinking, business management and leadership skills will be called upon from day one. You will help create change in the world of Life Sciences, every project will be different but a sample of the accomplishments you can expect are:
  • Conducting primary and secondary research and performing quantitative and qualitative analysis to identify key client issues, translating the data into meaningful insights and communicating recommendations to key decision makers
  • Leveraging business experience and acumen in identifying strategic alternatives to client questions

position: O2C Senior Analyst Export Customer Service
whole_unnormalized_body:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.

Purpose: The incumbent in this position will be responsible to support the management and control of the end to end Export business to ensure supply to distributers and our customers is maintained at the highest level.

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables

Process Expertise & Business Partnership
  • Be seen as a “go-to” information resource for O2C Export Supply Chain queries, including understanding and applying the basics of export business (tenders, ICC, Incoterms, bid and performance bonds, Letters of Credit, etc)
  • Efectively manage the day to day Export operational environment from timely and accurate order placement, fulfillment, collections, payment applications, returns, disputes, adjustments, etc.
  • Review key metrics & communicate to stakeholders to ensure KPIs are being met
  • Support global/regional O2C projects with influence on accurate, efficient & compliant export business operations
  • Support the overall O2C Supply Chain Management Export team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members and training of new team members

Skills & Capabilities
  • Ability to handle complexity and utilize analytical skills, with attention to detail
  • Ability to proactively & effectively analyse & resolve problems
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables
  • Focus on measuring & improving our customer’s experience
  • Ability to respond flexibly and empathetically to customer needs, managing their expectations effectively
  • Demonstrate excellence in all interactions with our internal customers & business partners
  • Actively work and communicate effectively with both internal and external business partners of all levels & disciplines: with the core team members, internal customers/business partners, and external LSP/CMO team members to build effective working relationships
  • Ability to work in high volume/fast paced environment
  • Demonstrate a strong compliance oriented mindset & help to build a strong compliance culture
  • Familiarise with all applicable process documentation & training materials to ensure you operate in a fully compliant manner
  • Operational awareness of all applicable Sox & Operational controls for your area
  • Build and maintain a strong knowledge of Elanco product lines within the market
  • Demonstrate a strong Continuous Improvement oriented approach & help to build a strong Continuous Improvement culture
  • Actively work with the core team members & Global O2C team to drive improvements for processes

Requirements
  • University degree (or equivalent work experience)
  • 5 years’ experience in O2C function with knowledge of supply chain management export business and experience in identifying and delivering process change
  • Good track record of performance
  • Fluency in English is a must
  • Fluency in other language will be an asset
  • Experience with SAP O2C Module
  • Interaction Client Phone system
  • Experience in Business Warehouse or Business Objects, MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet?

The role of RTR Analyst is to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the month end closing and related General Accounting activities throughout the NA region. This requires strict adherence to company policies while working closely with the local affiliates.

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables

Process Expertise and Business Partnership
  • Be seen as a "go-to" information resource for all GA related queries with full ownership for the month end close and reconciliation process
  • Work closely with local affiliate finance to understand current activities at the affiliate and ensure these are properly reflected in the financial statements. This includes preparing accounting entries as well as reviewing locally prepared accounting entries to ensure completion and accuracy of entries as well as appropriateness of backup
  • Develop and manage monthly trial balance package for the North American region, including fluctuation analyses
  • Ensure adherence to the standard month/quarter/year-end timelines
  • Prepare and review account reconciliations in accordance with internal reconciliation methodology
  • Prepare monthly financial reporting packages along with local statutory financial statements
  • Support global/regional GA projects
  • Support the overall GA team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members and training of new team members
  • Demonstrate excellence in all interactions with GBS internal customers and business partners
  • Focus on measuring and improving the internal customer’s experience with the GBS
  • Build and maintain a strong knowledge of your affiliate’s business
  • Provide active support (back-up) to RTR Master Data Administrator


Process Governance
  • Demonstrate a strong Continuous Improvement oriented approach & help to build a strong Continuous Improvement culture
  • Actively work with the core team members and internal IT groups to identify improvements for processes
  • Report end-to-end process metrics and KPIs to measure service levels, operational effectiveness, process health, and process compliance


Controls
  • Ensure prioritization and encourage a culture of compliance to SOx and other internal controls requirements
  • Ensure ownership for all applicable SOx & Operational controls related to General Accounting
  • Integrate controls into process documentation and training materials
  • Assists auditors (internal & external) by preparing requested data and providing explanation of supporting materials and procedures


Requirements

 Minimum Requirements:
  • University Degree in Business and/or Accounting (or equivalent work experience)
  • 2-3 years of experience in RTR or Finance function in SSC/BPO environment, preferably with in-depth knowledge of general accounting processes in a multinational environment as well as US GAAP/IFRS technical accounting
  • Proven analytical, problem solving, and communication skills
  • Proven control orientation based on prior operational business roles
  • Ability to respond flexibly to customer needs, effectively managing expectations
  • Ability to work across cultures and across diverse management styles
  • Ability to handle complexity and utilize analytical skills, with attention to detail
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables while demonstrating full ownership & accountability
  • Ability to work in global team environment and communicate effectively with both internal business partners of all levels & disciplines, especially affiliate Project Managers outside of Finance
  • Fluency in English language
  • Experience with SAP


Additional Skills / Preferences
  • CPA, CIMA, ACCA, Chartered Accountant or equivalent

whole_unnormalized_body:
The Business Analyst is an intermediate level position responsible for the overall business planning & analysis, as well as administrative activities of Anti Money Laudering department. The BP&A Analyst is expected to assist in activities such as the tracking of business financials, managing employee headcount or coordination of other administrative needs. May work on ad hoc projects as requested.

Responsibilities
  • Partner with business managers and finance team to forecast monthly headcount and expenses of the department,
  • Track and report productivity savings and investments across various AML initiatives globally,
  • Consolidate bi-weekly Resource Justification submission requests for resources globally
  • Submit approval/disapproval of funds requests for budget reports and analyze monthly department reports to maintain expenditure controls
  • Examine budget estimates for completeness, accuracy, and conformance with procedures , regulations and business needs
  • Provide advice and technical assistance with cost analysis, fiscal allocation, and budget preparation
  • Assist in the preparation and presentation of financial information for inclusion in management / client packs.
  • Assist with real estate analytics and reporting
  • Review data for accuracy and create required reporting to manage the data

Qualifications
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience
  • Advanced Excel expertise including demonstrated capabilities with pivot tables, VLOOKUP’s, and formulas
  • Experience with databases and information management
  • Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills

Education
  • Bachelor’s Degree/University degree or equivalent experience

The Global Study Associate Manager (GSAM) works cross-functionally with internal and external partners to deliver delegated aspects of the clinical study in accordance with Global Study Leader (GSL) in delegated aspects of clinical study execution.

Typical Accountabilities
  • In partnership with AZ enablement team, other AZ clinical experts and external service providers, the GSAM provides oversight to ensure study delivery;
  • Leads/contributes to the preparation of delegated study documents (e.g. Informed Consent Form, master Clinical Study Agreement etc), and external service provider related documents (specifications, study specific procedures, descriptions, presentations etc.);
  • Maintains and facilitates interactions with internal functions including but not limited to Enablement, Data Management, Procurement, Regulatory, Patient Safety and Quality Assurance, and external functions including the CROs and other external service providers to ensure an efficient study delivery to time, costs and quality objectives;
  • Contributes to the planning and conduct of internal and external meetings (e.g. Investigators'/Monitors' meeting);
  • Ensures the supply of Investigational product and study materials by liaising with Clinical Supply Chain or external service providers as appropriate;
  • Proactively contributes to risk and issue identification, development of mitigation and/or action plans for identified risks and issues;
  • Ensures that all study documents in scope of GSAM's responsibilities are complete and verified for quality in Trial Master File;
  • Supports Global Study Leader (GSL) with budget management, such as external service provider invoice reconciliation;
  • Adheres to global clinical processes, procedural documents, applicable Quality & Compliance manual documents and international guidelines such as ICH/GCP to ensure study is inspection ready at all times;
  • Supports Global Study Leaders (GSL) in project management as per agreed delegation;
  • For outsourced studies, supports Global Study Leader (GSL) in management of the CRO Project Manager to ensure study delivery according to agreed timelines, budget and quality standards, while ensuring that the appropriate level of oversight of the CRO is maintained and documented throughout the lifecycle of the study;
  • Take on assignments on non-drug project work in process improvements and/or leading improvement projects as discussed and agreed upon with their manager.

Requirements
  • University degree (or equivalent), preferably in medical or biological sciences or discipline associated with clinical research;
  • Relevant experience from within the pharmaceutical industry or similar organization or academic experience, preferably of at least 3 years;
  • Knowledge of clinical development / drug development process in various phases of development and therapy areas;
  • Excellent knowledge of international guidelines ICH/GCP;
  • Excellent communication and relationship building skills, including external service provider management skills;
  • Good project management skills;
  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate as well as work independently;
  • Demonstrated leadership skills;
  • Computer proficiency, advanced computer skills in day-to-day tasks;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication in English.

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience - it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Senior Reward Insights Specialist

Business focussed analysts working in Global Reward Data & Analytics Team based in Regional Human Resources (HR) Centre.

Critical requirements include a knowledge and experience in C & B, excellent analytical capability, an eye for detail, a curiosity for knowledge, the ability to translate technical analysis into useful, business focussed insights as well as strong communication skills.

As a member of the broader Reward community, position utilise our suite of core enabling HR technology to execute a range of compensation activities, working closely with the global compensation team and reward partners. You will continuously identify and implement process and technology improvements to our way of working in HR and our interactions with partners.

Overall our team's objective is to design and deliver a leading-edge reward strategy supported by policies and practices to achieve AZ's bold ambition.



Focus & Challenge:

  • Team Accountabilities:
    • To work as part of the team to establish the C & B team as a renowned Centre of Expertise (CoE), through delivering consistently high quality data, data management and analytical insight.
    • To understand the various needs of the business, as identified globally, regionally and locally, and how these needs are met through provision of compensation and benefits.
  • Analytical & Reporting Accountabilities:
    • Deliver high quality job analysis and evaluation, pay benchmarking, analysis of C & B surveys and annual salary budgeting data.
    • Report on country adherence to global compensation and benefit requirements, identifying exceptions and training requirements. Work with the Reward Partners to monitor alignment with global requirements.
    • Support the annual rewarding performance cycle (e.g. annual salary review, position to market analysis), for instance the provision of standard reporting suites for senior leadership teams.
    • Through the analysis of data (e.g. job market trends, legislative requirements) identify trends and issues.
    • Review and develop global reporting on all C & B activities (for example base pay changes, recognition, allowance usage).
    • Provide analytical support in respect of Global compensation and benefit plans, including assessing problems, escalating complex queries, and resolving and communicating routine queries.
  • Administrative / Support Accountabilities
    • Provide specialist project based administrative support when required, for instance deliver quality, detailed plans to underpin the continuous improvement of all standard cyclical planning activity.
    • Document and manage up all Business Unit processes to enable effective, fast adoption of the global salary benchmarking tool across countries.
    • Deliver documents, presentation materials and releases and distributes to required stakeholders.
    • Plan, organise, and schedule own workload so that all activities are completed accurately and on time.
    • Provide the underpinning support required for ongoing job evaluation requirements and execution of the job catalogue, as well as across the broader Global Reward team.



Candidate Knowledge, Skills & Experience:

  • Data Handling / Analysis:
    • Able to think analytically and effectively, solve problems using creative solutions.
    • Demonstrated ability to manage competing tasks efficiently and prioritise workload within a matrixed team environment.
    • Comfortable handling large quantities of data and producing insights with a keen attention to detail and focus on data accuracy with potential to develop a structured way to deal with unusual challenges and issues.
    • Proven ability to work with confidential data.
    • Expert user of excel / database management.
  • Compensation & Benefit Knowledge & Experience

Senior Reward Insights Specialist

Business focussed analysts working in Global Reward Data & Analytics Team based in Regional Human Resources (HR) Centre.

Critical requirements include a knowledge and experience in C & B, excellent analytical capability, an eye for detail, a curiosity for knowledge, the ability to translate technical analysis into useful, business focussed insights as well as strong communication skills.

As a member of the broader Reward community, position utilise our suite of core enabling HR technology to execute a range of compensation activities, working closely with the global compensation team and reward partners. You will continuously identify and implement process and technology improvements to our way of working in HR and our interactions with partners.

Overall our team's objective is to design and deliver a leading-edge reward strategy supported by policies and practices to achieve AZ's bold ambition.



Focus & Challenge:

  • Team Accountabilities:
    • To work as part of the team to establish the C & B team as a renowned Centre of Expertise (CoE), through delivering consistently high quality data, data management and analytical insight.
    • To understand the various needs of the business, as identified globally, regionally and locally, and how these needs are met through provision of compensation and benefits.
  • Analytical & Reporting Accountabilities:
    • Deliver high quality job analysis and evaluation, pay benchmarking, analysis of C & B surveys and annual salary budgeting data.
    • Report on country adherence to global compensation and benefit requirements, identifying exceptions and training requirements. Work with the Reward Partners to monitor alignment with global requirements.
    • Support the annual rewarding performance cycle (e.g. annual salary review, position to market analysis), for instance the provision of standard reporting suites for senior leadership teams.
    • Through the analysis of data (e.g. job market trends, legislative requirements) identify trends and issues.
    • Review and develop global reporting on all C & B activities (for example base pay changes, recognition, allowance usage).
    • Provide analytical support in respect of Global compensation and benefit plans, including assessing problems, escalating complex queries, and resolving and communicating routine queries.
  • Administrative / Support Accountabilities
    • Provide specialist project based administrative support when required, for instance deliver quality, detailed plans to underpin the continuous improvement of all standard cyclical planning activity.
    • Document and manage up all Business Unit processes to enable effective, fast adoption of the global salary benchmarking tool across countries.
    • Deliver documents, presentation materials and releases and distributes to required stakeholders.
    • Plan, organise, and schedule own workload so that all activities are completed accurately and on time.
    • Provide the underpinning support required for ongoing job evaluation requirements and execution of the job catalogue, as well as across the broader Global Reward team.



Candidate Knowledge, Skills & Experience:

  • Data Handling / Analysis:
    • Able to think analytically and effectively, solve problems using creative solutions.
    • Demonstrated ability to manage competing tasks efficiently and prioritise workload within a matrixed team environment.
    • Comfortable handling large quantities of data and producing insights with a keen attention to detail and focus on data accuracy with potential to develop a structured way to deal with unusual challenges and issues.
    • Proven ability to work with confidential data.
    • Expert user of excel / database management.
  • Compensation & Benefit Knowledge & Experience
    • Prior experience in running cyclical compensation processes with a continuous improvement mindset.
    • Has an awareness of compensation practices across different regions and the impact on use of compensation data.
    • Good understanding of market data and grading / job evaluation methodologies.
    • Experience of using salary surveys - submitting data, extracting and analysing data.
    • Experienced in the use of a variety of job evaluation tools.
  • HR Services Knowledge & Experience
    • Services minded with a "can do attitude" - dedicated to providing good service with a customer focus to develop an understanding of the external compensation and benefit environment, building a network of fellow professionals to extend your knowledge of practices across the market.
  • Other
    • Degree Educated or equivalent; further education desirable.
    • Experience in Microsoft applications.
    • Well-developed communication, organisation and interpersonal skills.
    • Enjoys working as part of a lively and hard-working team, performing together to meet deadlines.
    • Able to communicate fluently in English, both written and spoken.
    • Has a growth mindset for personal development.

position: US Middle Office Junior Transaction Controller
whole_unnormalized_body:
Join us as a US Middle Office Junior Transaction Controller

  • Join a team of skilled analysts and hone your experience and knowledge of trade booking and validation
  • You’ll be managing and resolving queries from clients and other back office and technology teams
  • You'll be working with a trading desk located in the United States, so we'll need you to operate in a shift pattern from 14:00 - 23:00

What you'll do

As a US Middle Office Junior Transaction Controller, you’ll be working on the trade capture in risk management and settlement systems. You’ll perform trade integrity checks and curve related controls impacting risk and ledger profit and loss. Additionally, you’ll resolve queries from traders around their trade bookings and risk positions.

You’ll also be

  • Validating trades booked by the front office daily control reports preparation, investigation and resolution of breaks
  • Maintaining high levels of accuracy and completeness with all the results and resolving any issues around the processes performed
  • Making sure that process documentation is updated and identifying any improvements
  • Resolving queries regarding derivatives as IRS, CS-B-MTM, swaptions, caps, floors and forward starting options

The skills you'll need

We’re looking for someone with experience of working with complex trade booking and validation. You’ll have product knowledge of interest rate swaps, basis swaps and cross currency swaps. And you’ll have excellent communication skills.

In addition, you’ll need:

  • Knowledge of loan, deposit, forward rate agreement, foreign exchange and overnight index swaps
  • A high level of analytical skills with good attention to detail
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills, specifically in Excel

Wymagania

TeamQuest to wyspecjalizowana agencja rekrutacyjna z ponad 10-letnim dorobkiem, współpracująca z ponad 500 firmami i realizująca nawet najtrudniejsze projekty rekrutacyjne z branży IT.Jesteśmy niewielkim kilkunastoosobowym zespołem, niemniej dzięki posiadanym kompetencjom, automatyzacji części procesów, wsparciu kolegów, bazie kontaktów, jesteśmy w stanie prowadzić ogromną ilość procesów rekrutacyjnych (często ponad 200). Obecnie poszukujemy do naszego zespołu:

Doceniamy
  • Zaangażowanie - fakt pracujemy w zespołach, niemniej ich siłą jest siła nas wszystkich,
  • Motywację - jak wyżej :)
  • Chęć rozwoju - branża IT jest jedną z najszybciej rozwijających się dlatego dużo wagi dokładamy do rozwoju naszych Konsultantów (głównie przez wewnętrzne szkolenia),
  • Grę zespołową - dążymy do wspólnego celu, niemniej każdy odpowiada za własne projekty,
  • Podejście "can-do" - zawsze szukamy nowych rozwiązań,
  • Pewność siebie - ok, z początku możesz nie czuć się pewnie, ale jak tylko nauczysz się zagadnień branżowych będziesz w stanie spokojnie porozmawiać z większością specjalistów IT,
  • Otwartość na komunikację z różnymi osobami - na co dzień będziesz miał styczność z liczbą grupą rozmówców.
Dodatkowe Atuty
  • Samodzielna realizacja projektów rekrutacyjnych,
  • Doświadczenie w rekrutacji w branży IT,
  • Doświadczenie we współpracy z Klientem biznesowym,
  • Znajomość technologii IT
Oferujemy
  • Pracę z bardzo doświadczonymi Konsultantami IT
  • Wiedzę, którą chętnie przekażemy,
  • Solidną podstawę + prowizje za realizację projektów rekrutacyjnych,
  • Autorski system do zarządzania rekrutacją pozwalający na szybkie wyszukanie pasujących kandydatów z bazy ponad 40 000 CV - dzięki temu szybko realizujemy projekty dla Klientów i zarabiamy prowizję :),
  • Wsparcie Team Leader'a,
  • Okres wdrożenia byś miał czas na naukę zagadnień związanych z naszą branżą,
  • Jasno sprecyzowaną ścieżkę rozwoju i kilka opcji wyboru (np. Konsultant 360, Team Leader, Senior Konsultant, Pre-sales Konsultant, etc.),
  • Biuro zlokalizowane w centrum Warszawy blisko stacji metra "Rondo Daszyńskiego',
  • Duże biurko i wygodny fotel,
  • Szybki laptop + dodatkowy monitor 22'-24",
  • Okazjonalną pracę zdalną,
  • Elastyczne godziny pracy (8:00-18:00),
  • 2 wewnętrzne szkolenia tygodniowo,
  • Co miesięczne wyjścia służbowe (Prezes płaci :) ), ostatnio byliśmy na strzelnicy, paintball'u i gokartach (zdjęcia możesz zobaczyć na FB),
  • Świetną atmosferę - jesteśmy na prawdę zgranym zespołem i wzajemnie sobie pomagamy - wszyscy jesteśmy też "na ty',
  • Podwyżki :)
Obowiązki
  • Realizacja projektów rekrutacyjnych po okresie wdrożenia,
  • Bieżąca obsługa Klienta (w początkowym etapie za tę kwestię odpowiada Twój Team Leader),
  • Analiza i weryfikacja profili kandydatów pod kątem wymagań Klienta zebranych przez Team Leader'a (jako Senior Konsultant sam będziesz już wiedział jak to zrobić:) ),
  • Prowadzenie rozmów kwalifikacyjnych z wybranymi Kandydatami (telefonicznie, mailowo, spotkania),
  • Dbanie o prawidłowy przebieg informacji na każdym etapie procesu rekrutacyjnego (od zainteresowania kandydata ofertą do początku jego pracy w firmie Klienta).
Dodatkowo
  • Mamy własny system do zarządzania rekrutacją zawierający w sobie bazę ponad 40 000 CV kandydatów z branży IT połączony z wyszukiwarką kandydatów np. przez technologię czy konkretne narzędzia IT - bardzo nam to przyspiesza pracę :)
Uprzejmie informujemy, że odpowiemy tylko na wybrane aplikacje.
TeamQuest został wpisany do rejestru podmiotów prowadzących agencje zatrudnienia przez Marszałka Województwa Mazowieckiego pod numerem 11118.

whole_unnormalized_body:
International Export Manager
  • Doświadczenie w eksporcie
  • Doświadczenie w pracy w obszarze HORECA
    • About Our Client
    Klient z wieloletnim doświadczeniem z branży napojowej w związku z rozwojem działalności rekrtuje w swoje szeregi nowego członka zespołu sprzedażowego i oczekuje od niego dalszego rozwijania biznesu poza granicami Polski. Założeniem na nowo-obsadzone stanowisko jest rozwój eksportu w branży HoReCa poza rynek polski oraz internacjonalna współpraca z innymi działami przy wdrażaniu strategii sprzedażowych.

    Job Description
    • Planowanie strategii rozwoju sprzedaży na rynkach zagranicznych,
    • Identyfikowanie potencjału i nawiązywanie relacji z nowymi klientami,
    • Realizacja planów rozwoju w kanale exportowym,
    • Monitorowanie sprzedaży oraz analiza działań konkurencji,
    • Udział w budowaniu wizerunku marek na rynkach zagranicznych,
    • Zarządzanie podległym 2-osobowym zespołem.
    The Successful Applicant
    • Min. 5-letnie doświadczenie w exporcie w branży FMCG,
    • Preferowane doświadczenie w kanale HoReCa,
    • Łatwość nawiązywania i utrzymywania kontaktów,
    • Zdolności negocjacyjne,
    • Biegła znajomość języka angielskiego (znajomość innych języków obcych będzie dodatkowym atutem),
    • Gotowość do wyjazdów służbowych (Europa),
    • Wysoki poziom samodzielności i odpowiedzialności w pracy,
    • Wysokie zdolności analityczne.

    What's On Offer
    • Atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie oraz system bonusowy,
    • Prywatną opiekę medyczną,
    • Ubezpieczenie na życie,
    • Multisport,
    • Samochód służbowy.
    Contact: Zuzanna Karas-Salume

The Remedial Management Officer is a developing professional role. Individual supports remedial managers in developing and implementing workout (recovery) strategies that are intended to either minimize the risks or maximize returns on commercial transactions originated by Commercial Bank office for the purpose of restructuring, stabilizing, or exiting the directly managed accounts. The remedial officer directly supports remedial managers in analytical space, including reserves calculations. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Daily cooperation with Polish court-related entities and external law firms is also contained within hereby book of work.


Key Responsibilities:

  •  Effective cooperation with court-related entities (bailiffs, trustees etc.) regarding collection portfolio
  • Dealing with internal and external counsel strategically and on a cost effective basis
  • Supporting remedial managers’ analytics including but not limited to forecasting and reserve calculations
  • Automating relevant remedial processes
  • Preparing metrics and reporting criteria for loan performance including local regulatory, internal and external requirements such as FAS 114
  • Preparing valuation and restructuring analysis for stressed and distressed assets and situations, including the determination of write-off, reserve and risk of loss amounts that directly impact the P&L of the firm
  • Working closely with other colleagues (Seniors and Senior Credit Officer-level transactors) to remain coordinated on the restructuring/valuation process and situations
  • Evaluating and processing data, historical information and “KYC”
  • Handling local regulatory asks as well as cooperating with relevant internal control functions
  • Timely and pro-active cooperation with key partners within the organization incl. Business, Risk, Operations, Legal, Finance


Competencies:

  • Sound understanding of credit risk management tools and techniques
  • Solid knowledge of collection related processes in Poland
  • Excellent analytical skills including relevant calculation tools is a must
  • Strong ability to communicate and influence in a cross functional environment in settings that could involve conflicting priorities and timetables
  • Self-starter 


Qualifications:

  • Very good command of English
  • Bachelor’s degree with 3+ years of commercial banking experience with an emphasis on credit analysis
  • Experienced in collection processes for commercial customers
  • Strong communication skills with ability to synthesize the argument in a logical and rational manner
  • Ability to work well under pressure and multi-task
  • Very good computer skills – MS Office incl. Excel, Access


As an employer we offer:

  • Professional development experience through work in one of the top international banking institutions
  • Work in a team expert openly sharing their knowledge
  • Participation in challenging projects
  • Rich social package (such as: medical care, fitness card, life insurance, pension plan)

 

The role of Remedial Management Officer is located at Bank Handlowy S.A. in Warsaw:

https://www.citi.com/Careers/policies/pdf/BankHandlowyPolandPrivacyNotice.pdf

Join us as a Financial Planning & Analysis Cost Analyst

  • We’ll look to you to provide flexible world class financial insight and decision support across a range of franchise initiatives
  • You’ll be supporting the team to work with business-wide stakeholders to identify best practices and provide input to the implementation of common methodologies, tools and techniques
  • This is an opportunity to gain valuable exposure as you develop and maintain professional effective relationships with customers, stakeholders and colleagues at all levels

What you'll do

As a Financial Planning & Analysis Cost Analystt, you’ll be actively supporting business partners and senior business partners with the provision of timely, reliable, and insightful financial support that will drive senior and executive financial and commercial discussions. You’ll be supporting with the delivery of finance initiatives and projects, drawing actionable business insights from financials, and developing and matching solutions to meet business needs.

You’ll be complying with the business-wide governance framework, as well as influencing cost management decisions through the provision of commercial and financial expertise. And you’ll be making sure the customers’ needs and requirements are taken care of.

Day-to-day, you’ll be:

  • Supporting with regular reporting on balance sheets and profit and loss, as well as budgeting and forecasting
  • Providing commentary to explain data movements and the outlook for the future periods, along with revenue forecasts
  • Delivering relevant, consistent, timely and business focused MI
  • Providing support for the extended team and colleagues locally, and liaising with various parts of the business to build and maintain a strong network of contacts across the wider area
  • Providing input to strategic business initiatives

The skills you'll need

To succeed in this role, you’ll need experience in a business analytical environment as well as financial services experience. Along with a relevant qualification in accountancy or equivalent experience in a comparable field, you’ll need an appetite for detail and delivery orientation, and an enquiring nature and skillset.

Additionally, you’ll need a problem solving and analytical skillset, and stakeholder management skills, including the ability to build and influence relationships.

You’ll also demonstrate:

  • Good commercial awareness and business acumen
  • The ability to communicate complex financial information in a concise, non-technical manner
  • Planning and organisational capabilities, with the ability to work in a flexible environment
  • Knowledge of budgeting, forecasting and modelling
  • Advanced experience in Microsoft Office applications

The purpose of the GBS Data Assurance team is to ensure that master, reference and transactional data within the Finance function is fit for purpose. The Finance Data Specialist role is responsible for providing technical data services including issue resolution, analysis, monitoring and reporting.

Typical Accountabilities

  • Investigate, analyse and determine resolution for reported and discovered data issues
  • Perform data quality profiling
  • Produce ad hoc data quality reports
  • Use existing data quality reports in conjunction with direct analysis to perform regular monitoring of data quality
  • Proactively perform data analysis to identify flaws, and propose additions to data standards, controls and data quality reports
  • Provide support to projects and initiatives making strategic data changes
  • Support process improvement analysts to identify causes of data issues
  • Contribute to improvements in standards, processes, controls and documentation
  • Contribute to the development of the data assurance playbook
  • Work with advanced analytics teams to develop new ways to proactively monitor data quality


Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience required for the role:


Essential:

  • Background in data analysis and issue investigation in a complex data and system environment
  • Experience of working with financial data and systems, preferably SAP FICO
  • Experience in the maintenance and use of common financial data (e.g. costs centres, profit centres, chart of accounts)
  • Experience in querying data using SQL
  • Good understanding of financial reporting and/or planning
  • Good understanding of data quality and data management principles
  • Proficient in Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Proactive, analytical and investigative mindset
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Good written and verbal communication skills


Desirable:

  • Accounting background
  • Experience of working in a complex global organisation
  • Pharmaceutical business awareness/business domain knowledge
  • Experience using data quality profiling and monitoring tools
  • Experience in the use of manufacturing data within finance (e.g. product costing)

Job Description

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS INTERNSHIP

Location: Warsaw

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Our clients rely on our knowledge, experience, and aptitude for problem-solving to optimize strategies across their organizations. Our ability to leverage and manipulate big data, coupled with our in-depth understanding of pharma industry and healthcare system, puts us in a unique position to deliver high-quality insights that address a variety of client needs.

We are currently looking for interns to join our Regional Delivery HUB within Technology Solutions area.

As An Intern With IQVIA Technology Solutions Team, The Candidate Will Be Involved, Under Supervision, In Development And Delivery Of Implementation Projects By
  • Contribute to one or more projects according to assignments under supervision
  • Implement solutions within Nexxus MI platform or OCE Sales platform
  • Participate in every project phase, starting from requirements analysis through implementation and tests till delivery and early support
  • Whenever necessary, cooperation with other departments to assure best quality

Desired Skills And Experience
  • Knowledge and academic experience with SQL
  • Experience with source control systems
  • Practical knowledge of any programming language
  • Practical knowledge of JavaScript/C#/HTML/CSS will be an advantage
  • Alternatively, practical knowledge of SalesForce.com will be an advantage
  • Open and problem-solving mind
  • Good communication skills in English
We offer
  • A 3-month internship program
  • Opportunity to participate in international projects for top pharmaceutical companies
  • A challenging internship within an internationally recognized and growing organization
  • Opportunity to join the team as a Junior Analyst after the internship

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Job ID: R1124314

We are looking for a Senior Portfolio Analyst for our Portfolio Management Services department.

About JLL-

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

Role purpose-

The objective of this role is to deliver, on a regular basis, key real estate report to a strategic client, out of JLL’s Centre of Excellence in Warsaw. The role also assumes ongoing assurance of high quality of data maintained in source applications feeding the report.

What This Job Involves-
  • Responsibility for recurring delivery of client’s strategic real estate report
  • Acting as a single point of contact for any queries related to report’s content, reporting logic, data sources, etc.
  • Ability to understand reported data – their structure and business reality standing behind them
  • Ability to identify inconsistencies, data gaps, errors in reporting logic, etc.
  • Ability to efficiently and fully independently use source applications from which data are fed into the report (appropriate training will be granted)
  • Assurance of data quality and consistency across applications
  • Ongoing cooperation with Business Intelligence – basic understanding of data architecture is required (appropriate training will be granted)
  • Ongoing communication with client’s real estate team (including regional real estate leadership) – data requests, clarification of issues, provision of ad hoc reports, etc.
  • During report production phase- assurance of consistent communication and information flows both internally and externally and coordination of all internal activities related to data stored in source applications
  • Personal management of JLL application dedicated to store client’s real estate strategic data – responsibility for app’s proper functioning, upgrades, good quality of data stored in it
  • Development of processes and practices aiming to improve the integration of reported data
  • Building client’s trust through driving excellent service delivery and ability to responding to client’s needs
  • Development and maintenance of good understanding of client’s real estate objectives

Sound like you? To apply you need to be / have-
  • Degree holder, ideally with experience in client service delivery
  • Very good communication skills and strong interpersonal skills, allowing to develop fruitful working relationships both externally and internally
  • Ability to think analytically
  • Ability to adapt and perform under pressure (short deadlines)
  • Very good knowledge of MS Office
  • Solutions-oriented mindset
  • Very good organizational skills
  • Excellence in English is a must
  • Exposure and experience in dealing with multinational corporate organisations
Experience in real estate will be a strong asset – particularly corporate real estate aspects of multinational companies

What You Can Expect From Us-

You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay.

Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

JLL is an Equal Opportunities Employer and encourages applications from all sections of the community .

JLL Privacy Notice

Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.

For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .

For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .

Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at Accommodation.Reques@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables
  • Process, Governance, Stakeholder Management
    • Creates payment proposals based on the payment calendar and ensures payment is released within specified timelines
    • Reconciles initial payment proposal, rectifies disputes, takes necessary approvals prior to the final run
    • Conducts payment proposal reconciliation, fund analysis and availability
    • Processes expense reimbursements in accordance with internal control standards, policies and procedures
    • Coordinates with the Treasury department to ensure availability of funds
    • Obtains the required approvals for payments as per company policy and procedures
    • Coordinates with various departments and maintains records for account payables
    • Validates Accounting information during system upgrade and interface maintenance
    • Coordinates with General Accounting on US Escheatment requirements for bank checks
    • Adheres to process governance including regular reporting and analysis of key metrics
    • Supports General Accounting’s month‑end/year‑end closing procedures including general ledger reconciliations and accruals, Sarbanes‑Oxley (SOX) compliance and financial audits
    • Supports and implements process change improvements and system upgrades/updates
    • Supports the Global Sourcing team in supplier identificiation, analysis, and maintenance
    • Executes the governance process to evaluate and implement localization / customization
  • Skills & Capabilities
  • Understanding of AP disbursement practices with up to one year experience in a similar role in Finance understanding
  • Experience in the Purchase to Pay processes
  • Knowledge of SAP
  • Actively work with core team members, internal customers/business partners, and distribution team members to build effective working relationships

Requirements

 Minimum Requirements:
  • University degree required (Bachelors or equivalent)
  • 1-2 years’ experience in PTP or Finance function in SSC/BPO environment
  • Ability to work in global team environment and communicate effectively with both internal business partners of all levels & disciplines as well as external team members
  • Ability to proactively & effectively resolve process problems
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables
  • Able to respond flexibly to customer needs, effectively managing expectations
  • Konwledge of MS Office tools, ServiceNow, SAP, and Ariba Procurement
  • Proficient in English is mandatory; multi-lingual is a plus
Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

Game Tester with Czech Warsaw

WARSAW

We do not require experience!

40 PLN / H gross

What You Are Going To Do

Make sure that the game is free from any spelling or grammatical errors in CZECH language

Review the tone and style of the text

Ensure that translation is accurate and free from any terminology inconsistencies

YOU Should Know

Czech min C1

English min B2

Please send your CV in English to email: jobs@personnelandmedia.com

with the note GAME TESTER – Czech

Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:

In accordance with art. 6 (1) a. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. whole_unnormalized_body:
W Cyclad współpracujemy z najlepszymi międzynarodowymi firmami technologicznymi, aby zwiększyć ich potencjał w dostarczaniu wyjątkowych, nowoczesnych rozwiązań, które kształtują świat przyszłości. Obecnie, dla naszego Partnera, lidera na rynku ubezpieczeń komunikacyjnych, poszukujemy specjalistów na stanowisko Administratora ds. Sieci i Bezpieczeństwa

Administrator ds. Sieci i Bezpieczeństwa

Informacje o Projekcie
  • Branża: ubezpieczeniowa
  • Lokalizacja: Warszawa (Mokotów)
  • Wynagrodzenie: w trakcie ustalania
  • Czas trwania projektu: stała współpraca

Obowiązki
  • Administracja urządzeniami sieciowymi Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, IPS Firepower, Catalyst 3650/3850, Catalyst 6800, Cisco WLC
  • Administracja systemami zarządzania Cisco ISE, Prime Infrastructure
  • Diagnozowanie i rozwiązywanie problemów z obszaru działania sieci
  • Udział opracowywaniu i wdrażaniu strategii rozwoju sieci
  • Udział w projektach wewnętrznych

Wymagania
  • Wykształcenie wyższe o profilu informatycznym lub pokrewnym
  • Wiedza na poziomie Cisco CCNP lub wyższym
  • Znajomość protokołów routingu dynamicznego (OSPF, BGP)
  • Umiejętność zarządzania przełącznikami i routerami Cisco
  • Umiejętność zarządzania firewallami Cisco, IPS oraz firewallami aplikacyjnymi
  • Znajomość technologii VXLAN, EVPN
  • Znajomość Cisco ISE
  • Znajomość zasad projektowania i działania sieci
  • Znajomość zagadnień z zakresu bezpieczeństwa sieci
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie pozwalającym swobodne komunikowanie się

Mile Widziane
  • Umiejętność zarządzania proxy Forcepoint
  • Znajomość systemów monitoringu Nagios i Solarwinds

Oferujemy
  • Współpracę w oparciu o umowę o pracę (lub B2B)
  • Świadczenia dodatkowe: opiekę medyczną, możliwość skorzystania z zajęć sportowych (siłownia, fitness, basen) przystąpienia do grupowego ubezpieczenia na życie, liczne akcje na rzecz naszych pracowników, programy dla rodziny
  • Pełne wprowadzenie do obowiązków - przekażemy Ci naszą wiedzę oraz doświadczenie, abyś mógł/a komfortowo rozpocząć pracę
  • Niepowtarzalną atmosferę: bezpośredni kontakt, pozytywne podejście, wzajemny szacunek

Nr ref.: 8197/MD

Misją Connectis jest rozwój ludzi i firm poprzez budowanie zespołów Developerów dziś oraz inwestowanie w Liderów jutra. Connectis_ to ponad 20 lat doświadczenia w branży, 350 Specjalistów IT i tysiące zrealizowanych projektów.

Opis stanowiska

Dostarczanie wysokiej jakości analiz oraz wsparcie w realizacji celów biznesowych

Analiza potencjalnych usprawnień, automatyzacji procesowych

Przygotowanie systemu KPI/mierników jakości i ilości pracy

Analiza różnic procesowo-narzędziowych w systemach

Wymagania

Doświadczenie w obszarze związanym ze wsparciem sprzedaży w branży ubezpieczeniowej

Doświadczenie w tworzeniu dokumentacji przekładającej potrzeby biznesowe na wymagania systemowe (specyfikacja wymagań, przypadki uzycia, przypadki testowe)

Doświadczenie w mapowaniu i opisywaniu procesów biznesowych

Oferujemy

Proces rekrutacji przeprowadzany zdalnie

Perspektywę długofalowej współpracy

2000 zł za każde polecenie Specjalisty do naszych projektów

Meetupy technologiczne, imprezy, spotkania integracyjne

Indywidualna opieka po stronie Connectis_

Biuro w Warszawie

Benefity

Komputer

Konferencje

Pakiet medyczny

Pakiet sport

whole_unnormalized_body:
Company Description

null Job Description

Na czym polegać będzie Twoja praca?
  • Będziesz współodpowiedzialny za analizowanie, budowanie oraz wdrażanie startegii rozwoju produktów contentowych
  • Będziesz zarządzał/współpracował przy kluczowych projektach firmy z udziałem wielu interesariuszy
  • Będziesz miał realny wpływ w podejmowaniu decyzji biznesowych i rekomendowaniu nowych rozwiązań
  • Twoje zadania polegać będą na umiejętnym przekładaniu celów biznesowych na konkretne zadania
  • Będziesz współpracować z zespołami marketingu, Smart, technologii, obsługi klienta (CEX), Legal, Commerce, w celu optymalizacji rozwiązań oraz budowania wszechstronnej wiedzy o dostępnych narzędziach i możliwościach ich wykorzystania

Dlaczego miał(a)byś z nami pracować?
  • Poprzez stronę główną Allegro docieramy do 14 milionów klientów dziennie
  • Allegro to ponad 50 milionów wizyt organicznych miesięcznie
  • Do przeanalizowania mamy przeszło 100 mln backlinków z ponad 60K domen
  • Mamy zaindeksowanych ponad 110 milionów stron w Google
  • Operujemy prawie na 20K kategorii produktowych i setkach tysięcy słów kluczowych
  • Działamy w skali, której trudno szukać gdzie indziej w Polsce
  • Lubimy automatyzować procesy
  • Angażujemy się zarówno w projekty IT jak i marketingowe
  • Będziesz mieć możliwość bezpośredniego wpływu na kształtowanie Allegro
  • Nieustannie towarzyszy nam zmiana. Postrzegamy ją jako szansę i możliwość realnego wpływu na Allegro

Ze Swojej Strony Oferujemy
  • Startupową kulturę pracy i stabilność dojrzałej organizacji
  • Możliwość kreowania czegoś nowego co będzie miało wpływ na kilka milionów użytkowników Allegro
  • Nowoczesne biuro i narzędzia pracy
  • Nieformalną atmosferę pracy w profesjonalnym zespole
  • Bogaty pakiet świadczeń pozapłacowych w systemie kafeteryjnym – Ty decydujesz z czego korzystasz
  • Zajęcia angielskiego opłacane przez nas

Szukamy Osób, Które
  • Posiadają minimum 3-letnie doświadczenie w zakresie content marketingu i prowadzenia projektów, mile widziana branża e-commerce
  • Potrafią współpracować z wieloma interesariuszami w złożonych projektach
  • Posiadają doświadczenie we współpracy z agencjami zewnętrznymi (interaktywnymi, marketingowymi, public relations), z łatwością budując z nimi relacje
  • Bardzo dobrze znają rynek e-commerce i platformę Allegro
  • Doskonale poruszają się w zagadnieniach takich jak: content marketing, digital marketing, SEO, performance marketing, content automation, personalizacja, prowadzenie projektów specjalnych
  • Posiadają wysoko rozwinięte zdolności analityczne i organizacyjne (praca z danymi)
  • Cechują się logicznym myśleniem i umiejętnością wyciągania wniosków
  • Cechują ich ponadprzeciętne zdolności komunikacyjne i lubią kontakt z Klientem
  • Posiadają zdolność samodzielnego podejmowania decyzji w dynamicznym i szybko zmieniającym się środowisku
  • Potrafią łączyć wiele wątków jednocześnie
  • Są otwarte, pełne energii i lubią wyzwania
Wyślij nam swoje CV i dołącz do Allegro!

Qualifications

null

Additional Information

null

job_description_details.Industry: Marketing & Advertising Management Consulting Financial Services

whole_unnormalized_body:
Head of Continuous Improvement EMEA
  • Responsibility for simplification of processes in the region
  • Market-leading international organization
    • About Our Client

    Our client is a large international organization, a leader in their market segment. They have well-established presence in Poland with business units dedicated to the local market and the have also built a shared services center to service the EMEA region in Poland.

    We are currently recruiting a Head of Continuous Europe whose primary responsibility will be to simplify processes within the organization, accelerate the continuous improvement culture and support digitization and automation

    Job Description
    • Align stakeholders including senior leaders in Europe and within the Services Center in Poland
    • Drive simplification process workshops and monitor action plans
    • Act as an enabler - drive change with a focus on improving user experience
    • Question the status quo and the way things are done to see how improvements can be introduced
    • Cooperate with CI leaders in various process areas; liaise with digital, IT, PMO teams and others
    • Support regional audit, drive regional compliance action plans
    • Animate the Continuous Improvement network and enhance the CI culture through trainings
    • Be a strong promoter of team improvement ideas and achievements
    • Lead by example to deploy a CI culture, with can do attitude, sense of ownership

    The Successful Applicant
    • This role requires a strong background in managing operational teams within a Shared Services / BPO organization - the Regional CI lead should him or herself be a practitioner rather than someone with experience in only a CI focused role
    • A demonstrated ability to optimize and simplify processes and a drive towards continuous improvement is crucial
    • Experience in a role with a lot of interaction with senior stakeholders across the region is necessary to ensure adequate stakeholder management and alignment
    • Fluency in English is a must
    • Educated up to university degree level


    What's On Offer
    • Possibility to develop in a leading organization
    • Competitive package

    Contact: Agnieszka Kulikowska
    Quote job ref: 36729

    • Question the status quo and the way things are done to see how improvements can be introduced
    • Cooperate with CI leaders in various process areas; liaise with digital, IT, PMO teams and others
    • Support regional audit, drive regional compliance action plans
    • Animate the Continuous Improvement network and enhance the CI culture through trainings
    • Be a strong promoter of team improvement ideas and achievements
    • Lead by example to deploy a CI culture, with can do attitude, sense of ownership

    The Successful Applicant
    • This role requires a strong background in managing operational teams within a Shared Services / BPO organization - the Regional CI lead should him or herself be a practitioner rather than someone with experience in only a CI focused role
    • A demonstrated ability to optimize and simplify processes and a drive towards continuous improvement is crucial
    • Experience in a role with a lot of interaction with senior stakeholders across the region is necessary to ensure adequate stakeholder management and alignment
    • Fluency in English is a must
    • Educated up to university degree level


    What's On Offer
    • Possibility to develop in a leading organization
    • Competitive package

    Contact: Agnieszka Kulikowska

Team Description

As part of the People team you will be responsible for the global HR routines and daily cooperation with Finance team. We have a truly international team spread across 13 countries! The challenge is to have, at the same time, flexible and accurate processes that allow the company to grow fast with consistency.

You will also help us to take our people data to a new level, while ensuring that the employee' information are always accurate. Additionally you will help Finance team in processing documents like invoices, keeping them up to date with Polish law regulations andresolve accounts payable issues.

The SumUp innovation environment is also present in our routine. That means new challenges everyday to deliver the best experience for our employees.

What You’ll Do

You’ll support Payroll Team by
  • Preparing and maintaining employee contracts/employee files
  • Taking care of company/policy/legal compliance in terms of the respective country labor legislation
  • Working with the local and global HR teams to support people operations
  • Providing the necessary data and support for payroll processing
  • Coordinating employee benefits, compensation, and travel expenses
  • Coordinating implementation of global HR processes on a local level
  • Identifying areas for process improvements
You’ll support Finance Team by
  • Processing and reviewing local invoices in accordance with company procedures
  • Verifying appropriate approvals of invoices, investigate, resolve accounts payable issues
  • Assisting Finance team in Sofia with cases related to Polish taxes (VAT), corporate income tax and trade law
  • Providing necessary data for the Finance team in Sofia
You’ll be great for this position if
  • You have experience working in HR administration, accounting or payroll management, preferably as HR Generalist or similar
  • You have knowledge and experience in Polish regulations related to the Labour Law, social insurance, taxes, etc.
  • You speak fluent Polish and English
  • You are passionate about helping people in payroll and accounting area :)
  • You are self-driven, open-minded individual with a high energy level and ability to multitask
Why you should join Shoplo eCommerce by SumUp
  • You’ll become a part of one of the world’s most exciting FinTech startup, on a mission to take over the world!
  • And join local, Polish squad Shoplo - think globally, work locally!
  • You will receive a package of benefits - private medical insurance, Multisport card (co-financed), English classes, monthly integrations, weekly breakfasts, and other events
  • We have a great atmosphere! We are a group of friends from different backgrounds who work effectively on the same goal
  • We offer flexible working hours & the possibility to work remotely when needed
  • You will always find snacks, fruits and good coffee in our kitchen

whole_unnormalized_body:
The Global Study Leader (GSL) is responsible for leading a cross-functional study team (core and extended) and for providing the team with direction and guidance to enable successful study delivery. The GSL is the main liaison between the study team and the Clinical Program Team (CPT) starting with study handover through to close-out and archiving. The GSL is accountable to the CPT for the delivery of a study according to agreed upon timelines, budget and quality standards by ensuring an effective partnership and teamwork within study team and/or external partners.

Typical Accountabilities
  • Lead and coordinate a cross-functional study team of experts to ensure the clinical study progress as planned driving achievement of milestones according to timelines, budget and quality standards;
  • Lead and facilitate communication across all functions and provide guidance and support to the core and extended study team members as needed and in accordance with study-specific communication plan;
  • For outsourced studies, be the primary AZ point of contact for the CRO Project Manager to ensure study delivery according to agreed upon timelines, budget and quality standards, while ensuring that the appropriate level of oversight of the CRO is maintained and documented throughout the lifecycle of the study;
  • Provide input and hold accountability for the development of essential study level documents (i.e. Clinical Study Protocol (CSP) through to Clinical Study Report (CSR));
  • Ensure all external service providers engaged at the study level are performing to contracted goals and timelines/budget and that adequate oversight is documented;
  • Develop and maintain relevant study plans including required input into study level quality and risk management planning ensuring that the risk response strategies and issue escalation pathways are clear to the entire study team;
  • Oversee study level performance against agreed upon plans, milestones and key performance indicators by using company tracking systems and project timelines (e.g. SPP, data flow metrics dashboard, CTMS or eTMF dashboard) and communicate any risks to timelines and/or quality to CPT, along with proposed mitigations;
  • Identify and report quality issues that have occurred within the study and collaborate with all functions as necessary to overcome barriers and achieve milestones; proactively communicate findings and corrective action plans (CAPAs) to relevant stakeholders;
  • Oversee Trial Master File (TMF) completion in accordance with relevant AZ SOPs, including ensuring the TMF plan and Expected Document List (EDL) are in place and that QC activities are performed on an ongoing basis to ensure TMF completeness at all times;
  • Ensure timely compliance with company-wide governance controls (e.g. Delegation of Authority, Sunshine Act, ACCORD attestations, Clinical Trial Transparency);
  • The GSL is responsible for study budget re-forecasting following initial budget estimate provided by the CPT and accountable for study budget management through the study lifecycle and for providing budget progress reports to the CPT including any financial risks and mitigation plans;
  • Ensure studies are inspection-ready at all times, according to ICH-GCP and AZ SOP and relevant policies/guidelines;
  • Provide regular feedback on individual performance to the study team members and their line managers to support their professional development;
  • Work on non-drug project work such as SMO representative in process improvements and/or leading improvement projects as discussed and agreed upon with their manager.

Requirements
  • University degree (or equivalent), preferably in medical or biological sciences or discipline associated with clinical research. Advanced degree is preferred;
  • At least 6 years of relevant clinical experience in the pharmaceutical industry, or a similar organization (e.g. CRO) including 2 years' project management experience (PMP certification is desirable but not mandatory). Experience on a global level is desirable'
  • Deep understanding of clinical operations and study management processes, along with experience with the clinical/drug development process in various phases of development and therapy areas;
  • Extensive knowledge of clinical research regulatory requirements and demonstrated abilities in clinical study management processes and clinical/drug development;
  • Strong abilities in cross-functional team leadership, driving personal and team accountabilities, working collaboratively, critical thinking, decision-making, and influencing;
  • Strong abilities in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with internal and external co-workers and stakeholders, along with strong conflict management skills.

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience - it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.
